text: the rectosigmoid colon and bladder are unremarkable.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy or free fluid noted.within the left anterior abdominal wall muscles, there is a 5.9 x 6.1 cm fat-density lesion, consistent with a lipoma (3:36).

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.there are small bilateral fat-containing bochdalek type hernias.the spleen appears normal.there is an unchanged left adrenal mass measuring 15 x 18 mm.the right adrenal gland appears normal.at the head/neck junction of the pancreas is a 10 mm low-density lesion, which appears little changed.numerous coarse calcifications are present throughout the pancreas, one of which appears to be in the vicinity of the pancreatic duct, but there is no pancreatic ductal dilation.the gallbladder and liver appear within normal limits.kidneys enhance, and excrete contrast symmetrically without suspicious masses or hydronephrosis.hypodensities in the inferior and superior poles of the left kidney are likely cysts (300b:43, 41).incidental note is made of a retroaortic left renal vein.the abdominal aorta has mild atherosclerotic calcifications but is otherwise normal in caliber.the stomach and abdominal loops of bowel appear normal.no free air or free fluid is present.scattered non-pathologically enlarged retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes are present.
summary: new fat-containing midline paraumbilical hernia.improved appearance of loculated air in the midline laparotomy scar.it may represent residual packing material; correlate clinically.no intra-abdominal or intrapelvic fluid collections.no evidence for enterocutaneous fistula.rounded fatty lesion in the right mid deep pelvis may be an area of fat necrosis related to prior pelvic surgery.stable cystic lesion in the head-neck junction of the pancreas.stable left adrenal gland lesion, indeterminate.both can be further evaluated by mri, similar to the recommendation on ___ examination.

text: a 1.6 x 1.3 cm nonocclusive thrombus within the portal vein (image 2:25) extends to and within the tips metallic stent.the spleen is enlarged, measuring up to 14.1 cm in anteroposterior dimension.a small-to-moderate amount of free fluid layers around the liver and in morison's pouch.upper abdominal and gastroesophageal varices are evident (for example image 2:13).the adrenal glands and kidneys demonstrate no focal lesions.no hydronephrosis is present.
summary: loculated peritoneal fluid collections with extensive peritoneal enhancement, consistent with peritonitis.multifocal moderate-to-severe small and large bowel wall thickening, especially at the rectum and ascending colon.findings are consistent with multifocal enteritis and colitis.subtotal right common femoral deep venous thrombosis.subtotal portal venous thrombosis extending into the tips stent.evidence of portal hypertension, including splenomegaly, gastroesophageal varices, and rectal varices.post-surgical changes with right lower quadrant loop ileostomy.bilateral l5 spondylolysis.

text: the pelvic bowel, bladder and prostate are unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes or free fluid.the osseous structures reveal degenerative changes of the spine.
summary: multiple abnormalities of the pancreas, with calcifications in the head, hypodense lesion within the body and contour abnormality in the tail.while these findings could be due to chronic pancreatitis with a pseudocyst in the body of the pancreas, a pancreatic neoplasm cannot be excluded on this non contrast enhanced study.since the patient cannot receive a contrast enhanced ct due to his elevated creatinine a follow- up mri is recommended.bilateral nephrolithiasis, with right-sided hydronephrosis.these findings were called to dr.___ on ___ at 12:00 pm.

text: a small amount of low-attenuation fluid is present within the pelvic cul-de-sac.again noted is a right uvj calculus measuring approximately 7 mm (series 2, image 112).the urinary bladder wall appears slightly thickened as before.the prostate is enlarged measuring 5.1 cm in trv dimension.the seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon appear normal.a left iliac chaing nodal conglomerate has slightly increased in size measuring 3.9 x 3.3 cm compared to 2.3 x 3.2 cm previously.there is general anasarca within the subcutaneous soft tissues.no suspicious osteolytic or sclerotic lesions are seen on bone windows.there are moderate degenerative changes in the lower thoracic spine.
summary: unchanged 7 mm right uvj calculus.no evidence for hydronephrosis to explain the patient's symptoms.slight increase in size of several axillary, mesenteric and pelvic nodal masses consistent with progression of disease.stable appearance of pulmonary nodules, hepatic lesions, and splenic lesions.interval worsening of mild perihepatic and perisplenic ascites.

text: there is no free fluid.unchanged sigmoid colon and distal descending colon diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.unchanged fibroid uterus with calcified fibroids.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy, no pelvic hernias.the urinary bladder is empty.
summary: no change compared to ___ with right lower quadrant parastomal fluid collection, unchanged in size.unchanged position of the pigtail catheter with likely only some of the sideholes draining.

text: the area previously described as showing wall thickening is better distended on the current study.no overt cecal/ascending colonic wall thickening is identified.there are questionable areas of transverse and sigmoid colonic, wall thickening, but only where the bowel is underdistended.there is also mild rectal wall thickening.there is no free fluid in the pelvis or pathological inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.note is made of asymmetrical or anterior bladder wall thickening, which could be due in part to underdistension.there is no inguinal hematoma.prostate gland is normal in size.no lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are identified.there is redemonstration of height loss of the t12 vertebral body.there is no change in the degree of thecal sac narrowing.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage or inguinal hematoma.previously questioned area of colonic wall thickening not as well appreciated on this study, with better distention in that area.multiple additional areas of questionable wall thickening are present in the sigmoid and transverse colon, and rectum, which could also be due to underdistension, but colitis cannot be excluded.asymmetrical bladder wall thickening anteriorly.correlate with history of hematuria.cystoscopy would be the next step in assessment, if indicated clinically.ivc filter present.no change in low-density hepatic lesions, and small bilateral pleural effusions with associated bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.

text: mild atelectasis is present at the lung bases.the liver is unremarkable.several small gallstones are present within the gallbladder.the pancreas is unremarkable.there is polysplenism.multiple calcifications are present within the kidneys and are not significantly changed from prior study of ___.there is amorphous soft tissue density with multiple bubbles of gas seen in the anterior abdomen immediately below the incision track.high contrast material is also seen outside of the bowel lumen just to the left of midline in the anterior abdomen, which is concerning for oral contrast extravasation.there is extensive fat stranding in this area.these findings are highly concerning for bowel perforation.no drainable fluid collections are present.
summary: findings consistent with bowel perforation with free air and extravasated oral contrast.no drainable fluid collections.cholelithiasis.diverticulosis.abnormal renal calcifications, unchanged from ___.these results were communicated to dr.___ at 7:30 p.m.on ___.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, intrapelvic bowel loops, urinary bladder are unremarkable.prostatic calcifications are noted.there is no pathologic pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is no intrapelvic free fluid.there is evidence of mild soft tissue stranding and subcutaneous edema in the pelvic soft tissues.
summary: no evidence of recurrent lymphadenopathy.unchanged appearance of three right lung pulmonary nodules and bilateral calcified granuloma.interval resolution of the subcapsular left renal hematoma with evidence of left perinephric fat stranding.

text: large amount of ascitic fluid is demonstrated within the pelvis.several diverticula are seen within the sigmoid colon without evidence of diverticulitis.a foley catheter is seen within the bladder, which is collapsed.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is noted.
summary: diffuse circumferential bowel wall thickening involving predominantly the transverse colon.while bowel wall thickening is a commonly recognized finding in cirrhosis, other causes of colitis should be excluded on a clinical basis.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.cirrhotic liver with ascites and varices.choledocholithiasis.sigmoid diverticulosis.dfddp

text: there is a large amount of intraperitoneal free air.the liver, spleen, adrenals, kidneys, gallbladder, pancreas are unremarkable.there is no mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.
summary: perirectal and peri-iliac colections,possibly abscessed as noted above.large pneumoperitoneum.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 12:30 p.m.on ___.

text: the lung bases are clear with no pulmonary nodules.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.the percutaneous gallbladder drain and biliary stent terminating within the duodenum are unchanged in position.there has been interval placement of a percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage catheter which enters the previously placed metallic biliary stent and terminates within the duodenum.the ill-defined soft tissue mass in the region of the porta hepatis remains unchanged.there is associated severe narrowing of the main portal vein with complete occlusion or obliteration of the left portal vein.subtle areas of hypodensity within the liver surrounding the ill-defined mass are likely due to differences in perfusion from compressed vascular structures.a small amount pneumobilia is present.an area of soft tissue density is seen adjacent to the right anterior abdominal wall at the level of the mid abdomen (2:29) and is much more prominent today than on the prior study.this soft tissue structure demonstrates persistent mild enhancement on the 15-minute delayed images and may represent extension of the fundus of the very collapsed gallbladder.other considerations include lymph nodes or peritoneal carcincomatosis.an area of hypodensity within the spleen has decreased considerably, now measuring 11 x 14 mm, likely representing a site of prior infarct.the adrenal glands, kidneys, pancreas, stomach, and intra-abdominal loops of bowel are within normal limits.multiple enlarged lymph nodes are seen retroperitoneally, the largest of which measures 12 mm in the short axis diameter, slightly enlarged since the prior study.multiple small mesenteric lymph nodes are seen, none of which meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.mesenteric stranding seen is not significantly changed since the prior study and is most likely related to prior treatment.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: unchanged appearance of the infiltrating ill-defined mass in the area of the porta hepatis.continued significant narrowing of the main portal vein and obliteration/total occlusion of the left portal vein.increased prominence of soft tissue density abutting the peritoneum along the right anterior abdominal wall, which could represent the fundus of an extremely collapsed gallbladder, though other considerations include lymph nodes or metastatic peritoneal involvement.increasing size of retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: some atelectasis is noted at the lung bases.calcification is present in the mitral annulus.
summary: marked decrease in now small perigraft fluid collection.resolved left hydronephrosis.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureters, rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is a moderate amount of fluid noted within the pelvis.a penile implant is unchanged from prior.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified.there is an endograft that connects the iliac arteries.the patient is post-occlusion of the left iliac artery with femoral bypass seen in the anterior abdominal wall.distally, the left femoral artery is reconstituted by the bypass graft.the pelvic portions of the large and small bowel are unremarkable.the visualization of the bowel is limited by lack of oral contrast.bone windows demonstrate severe degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine.there is anterolisthesis of l4 over l5.there is at least moderately severe canal stenosis at the l4/5 and l5/s1 levels.there are no suspicious bony lesions.
summary: very limited study demonstarting unchanged aaa measuring 4.7 cm in its greatest dimension.there is no definite evidence of aaa rupture; however, the patient's ascites is new and though apparently "simple" (given the patient's very low hematocrit), may represent hemoperitoneum.liver edge scalloping suggestive of cirrhosis, with evidence of anasarca.stable hypodense lesions within the kidneys.stable bilateral adrenal adenomas.stable post femoral-femoral bypass, with chronic thrombosis of the left common iliac artery.

text: the rectum and sigmoid are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.the uterus is unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy.there is aneurysmal dilation of the left common iliac artery measuring 1.8 cm.degenerative changes are seen throughout the thoracic and lumbar spine.severe facet arthropathy are seen at the l4 and l5 levels.soft tissues are unremarkable.coronal and sagittal reformatted images confirm the above findings.
summary: unchanged appearance of extensive type b intramural hematoma from the subclavian artery origin to the upper abdominal aorta.the associated posterior penetrating ulcer at the diaphragmatic hiatus is stable.no new dissection.findings suggestive of congestive failure/volume overload with bilateral pleural effusions and septal thickening.four-cm infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.mild aneurysmal dilation of the left common iliac artery.dense coronary vascular calcifications.

text: subsegmental atelectasis is evident in the dependent portions of the bilateral lower lungs.no pleural effusion identified.incompletely visualized heart appears normal in size.focal fat deposition is noted along the falciform ligament (4b:223).no concerning liver lesions visualized.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.gallbladder, pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.the bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the bilateral kidneys excrete contrast symmetrically.a 2-cm simple cyst is noted in the interpolar region of the right kidney.nonobstructing renal calculi identified on the left with the largest in the lower pole measuring 8 mm (2:34).no hydronephrosis or hydroureter identified.nonspeciic perinephric fat stranding evident bilaterally.the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.the stomach and small bowel are normal.diverticula are evident in the descending colon; many of which appear hyperdense on both unenhanced and enhanced images, consistent with calcified content.no evidence of active extravasation; no evidence of recent hemorrhage.atherosclerotic calcifications are present throughout the abdominal vessels with areas of soft plaque ulceration noted(4a:62, 4a:57).the ostia of the celiac, superior mesenteric, inferior mesenteric, and bilateral double renal arteries are widely patent.the hepatic veins, right, left, and main portal veins and their major tributaries are normal.incidental note is made of a left-sided inferior vena cava crossing at the level of the left renal vein.a right femoral venous catheter is identified.no lymphadenopathy identified.no free air or fluid noted in the abdomen or pelvis.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are identified.mild degenerative changes are noted throughout the lumbar spine.no superficial soft tissue abnormality is evident.
summary: no source of gi bleed identified.left descending colonic diverticulosis without diverticulitis.extensive atherosclerotic disease with areas of soft plaque ulceration in the abdominal aorta.no aneurysmal change or dissection.incidental note of a left sided inferior vena cava.left nephrolithiasis.

text: again noted within the lung bases are multiple pulmonary nodules and atelectasis within the bases of the lungs.the lungs are better characterized on the ct chest performed one day prior to this examination.there are calcifications in the coronary arteries and the aorta.
summary: abnormally enhancing, heterogeneous, vascular, fluid-filled mass measuring 4 cm in its largest dimension located in the endometrium of the uterus that is very concerning for neoplasia.although a polyp or a fibroid is in the differential an endometrial neoplasm is much more likely considering the grossly abnormal appearance of the mass.

text: in the pelvis, to the right, is a new large dense 7 x 9.7 cm collection displacing the bladder leftward.no evidence of arterial extravasation.a foley catheter is in place.the bladder is decompressed.
summary: new 7 x 9.7cm pelvic extraperitoneal hematoma.no evidence of active extravasation.mass effect from the hematoma displacing the bladder leftward.no evidence for bladder rupture.no evidence for bowel injury.

text: sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.the urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable in appearance.no pelvic lymphadenopathy.no pelvic free fluid.
summary: 2.3-cm pulmonary nodule at the resection margin, new since the prior study, concerning for local recurrence.multiple new left lung nodules concerning for more distant spread.multiple sclerotic bony lesions concerning for metastases.stable right breast nodule, in correlation with clinical exam and/or mammography.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: there are mild areas of atelectasis within the lung bases, unchanged.no pleural effusions at the lung bases.there are punctate areas of calcification within the liver and spleen, which could represent prior granulomatous disease.there is extensive vascular calcification.there are no identified focal hepatic lesions on this noncontrast ct.the gallbladder, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.both kidneys are small and contain small hypodensities, likely representing cysts.the ureters are unremarkable.there is likely no change in the bulky retroperitoneal or periportal lymphadenopathy.there is a small amount of free-fluid within the abdomen.this is unchanged.no free-air within the abdomen.there are areas of unopacified small bowel, but the remainder of the bowel is unchanged in appearance.
summary: no new focal process within the abdomen or pelvis.unchanged bulky periportal and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: the opacity seen in the right lower lobe has not significantly changed since ___.there has been resolution of the bilateral pleural effusions.in the left lower lobe, there are linear opacities that may either represent atelectasis or scarring.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.no focal liver lesions identified.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.the dystrophic calcification at the upper pole of the left kidney is unchanged and likely represents sequelae of prior infection.the cyst in the interpolar region of the left kidney is unchanged.a smaller cyst in the lower pole of the left kidney is unchanged.another small hypodense lesion in the lower pole measures 8 mm and is also unchanged.the right kidney is unremarkable.the ureters and bladder are unremarkable.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.the stomach is unremarkable.there is some residual dilatation at the anastomotic site in the small bowel but decreased surrounding stranding compared to prior study.otherwise, the small bowel is unremarkable.there is significant sigmoid and descending colon diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.there is also diverticulosis in the transverse colon.the appendix is not well visualized.the rectum is unremarkable.there is no free fluid.there is no free air.there are no hernias identified.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric or pelvic lymphadenopathy.the bones demonstrate no suspicious osseous lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: descending thoracic aorta aneurysm is minimally increased in size, now measuring 7.8 x 5.1 cm compared to prior study when it measured 7.4 x 5.1 cm.two smaller outpouchings in the descending thoracic and infra-renal aorta are unchanged.the left common iliac artery is ecstatic and measures 1.9 cm, not significantly changed.extensive atherosclerosis and mural thrombus throughout the aorta.left renal cysts are unchanged.dilatation of small bowel in the anastomotic region is unchanged.decreased stranding surrounding this area of bowel.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there is trace free fluid in the pelvis and no pelvic adenopathy.
summary: mesenteric stranding and fluid within the ventral hernia is concerning for early ischemia.no significant change in right-sided pleural thickening with persistent asymmetric right lower lobe septal thickening, the latter of which may be due to lymphangitic spread of tumor or drug toxicity.asymmetric thickening of the musculature and subcutaneous tissues of the right lower chest wall/upper abdomen.extension of pleural disease into the adjacent wall cannot be excluded.enhancing 1.2 x 1.2 cm lesion within the musculature posterior to the right twelfth rib concerning for metastasis.cholelithiasis.findings were discussed with dr.___ on ___ at 1:20 p.m.

text: atelectasis with a small effusion is seen in the visualized right lower lung.this is a limited evaluation of the abdomen and pelvis without iv contrast.skin staples are seen over the central abdomen projecting superiorly and laterally.there is generalized anasarca.there is no evidence for an abdominal or pelvic bleed.there is a subcapsular fluid collection seen adjacent to the medial aspect of the liver measuring up to 11 x 16 x 4 cm.this measures fluid density and contains some foci of air.this likely represents another bile collection.air within this collection likely is due to communication with the biliary tree.however, superinfection cannot be excluded.at the inferior aspect of the liver, there is a small collection being drained by a pigtail catheter.a hepatic arterial stent and biliary stent are seen.there is splenomegaly.no contour deforming lesion can be seen within the visualized pancreas.the kidneys are hyperdense,likely due to residual contrast from the hepatic venogram performed one day prior.this reflects poor kidney functioning as suggested in the patient's reported history.no contour-deforming lesions are seen within the adrenal glands.there is intra-abdominal ascites with multiple collections, the largest of which is a pelvic collection just posterior to the uterus measuring approximately 9 x 3 cm measuring slightly higher than simple fluid.evaluation of the uterus is limited without iv contrast.two high-density clips are seen adjacent to the uterus, which may be due to prior ligation of the fallopian tubes.the bladder is collapsed and contains contrast from the prior venogram.evaluation of the bowel is limited without contrast, however, there are no dilated loops to suggest an obstruction.mild calcified atherosclerotic plaque is seen within the aorta.no lytic or blastic lesions are seen within the visualized bones.
summary: large subcapsular liver collection that is likely not being drained by the pigtail catheter in place at the inferior aspect of the liver.air within this collection likely is due to communication with the biliary tree.however, superinfection cannot be excluded.generalized anasarca with intra-abdominal ascites and multiple collections identified, the largest of which is in the pelvis, as described above.no evidence for intra-abdominal or pelvic bleed to explain the patient's recent drop in hematocrit.

text: there are large bilateral pleural effusions.there is adjacent atelectasis at the lung bases.the heart is enlarged.evaluation of the solid organs is limited by the lack of intravenous contrast.there is diffuse ascites.the liver, pancreas, and adrenals are normal.there has been prior cholecystectomy.there are multiple renal stones bilaterally, the largest measuring 5mm in the lower pole of the right kidney, without evidence of hydronephrosis.there is an umbilical hernia with bowel wall in direct continuity with the abdominal wall, which could be prone to injury.the remainder of the small and large bowel is normal.there are some rounded areas of high attenuation within ascending and descending colon, which may represent tablets ingested by the patient.
summary: limited study without oral or intravenous contrast.sensitivity for detecting abscess or bowel ischemia is markedly diminished.umbilical hernia is seen containing non-obstructed bowel loops.multiple bilateral non-obstructing renal stones without evidence of hydronephrosis.cardiomegaly and bilateral pleural effusions.ascites.diffuse atherosclerotic disease.

text: no focal lesions are seen in the liver.there is perihepatic free fluid.the gallbladder is normal.periportal edema is noted.the pancreas demonstrates fatty atrophy.the spleen and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric enhancement without hydronephrosis.there are two large left renal cysts, the largest measuring at the inferior pole.no suspicious enhancing renal masses.the visualized bowel is unremarkable.there is diastasis of the anterior abdominal wall.there are multiple enlarged periportal peripancreatic lymph nodes, the largest measuring up to 9 mm in short axis diameter (sequence 6, image #25).
summary: findings suggestive of pulmonary edema, with associated interlobular septal thickening, cardiomegaly and bilateral pleural effusions.additional small focal areas of patchy airspace disease could represent pneumonia, including aspiration.ascites.scoliosis and degenerative changes of the spine.

text: an orogastric tube terminates in the stomach.compared to the most recent prior ct, pleural effusions have increased somewhat.these are small-to-moderate on the right, and small on the left.coronary artery calcifications are extensive.there is no pericardial effusion.again noted is a suspicious nodule in the right middle lobe without change.patchy lower lobe opacities, greater on the right than left, can probably be attributed to atelectasis with interval improvement.hypervascular liver lesions are not apparent on this non-contrast examination although two subcentimeter hypodense lesions, too small to characterize, within the right lobe appear unchanged.the gallbladder is mildly distended.again noted is a mass in the pancreatic tail.a few small pancreatic calcifications may be post-inflammatory.the spleen and adrenal glands appear unchanged.two simple cysts are present within the right kidney.a small calcification on the lower pole of the left kidney of 5 mm may be due to a stone or perhaps less likely a vascular calcification.there is persistent patchy contrast enhancement of each kidney, which suggests renal insufficiency.fluid is present within the rectum as well as the ascending and transverse portions of the colon.contents are hyperdense (up to 63 hounsfield units) which could be seen with hemorrhagic fluid, seen within the cecum and beyond, although a recent administration of water-soluble oral contrast could also explain the finding if applicable.mild sigmoid diverticulosis is present.the small bowel is unremarkable.
summary: hyperdense fluid within the colon; unless water-soluble contrast has been administered recently or other hyperdense material, this appearance could be seen with blood products, seen in the cecum and beyond, although this does not necessarily localize a source; correlation with stool sample is suggested as well as recent history or medicationa and contrast administration, if any.persistent nephrograms worrisome for sequelae of renal insufficiency.extensive vascular calcifications.similar but less well-characterized findings suggesting metastatic malignancy.mild sigmoid diverticulosis.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, and prostate gland are unremarkable in this noncontrast study.there is equivocal wall thickening within the transverse colon in the presence of suboptimal bowel prep.there is no evidence of abnormal dilation within the large or small bowel.there is no evidence of abscess within the abdomen or pelvis.there is extensive fat stranding and increased attenuation within the soft tissues consistent with anasarca.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.

text: bronchiectatic changes are present at the left lung base.patchy areas of atelectasis are appreciated at both lung bases.a small focus of calcification is present within the liver, most consistent with prior granulomatous disease.the liver is otherwise unremarkable.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.no retroperitoneal fluid collections are identified.calcifications are seen within the abdominal aorta, iliac arteries, and splenic artery.residual contrast is seen in the bowel from prior study.the stomach, small bowel, and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.

text: artifacts from the patient's bilateral hip replacements obscures detail.there is a large presacral mass spanning 8.7 x 7.3 cm in greatest axial dimensions, not significantly changed from the prior study.the differential diagnosis as previously described.the bladder is distended with urine.the visualized portion of the sigmoid is unremarkable.the prostate is not well evaluated.asymmetry and strandings/hematoma within the subcutaneous fat of the left thigh span several centimeters from superior to inferior.the hematoma is approximately 16 mm in depth, and spans the anterolateral third of the left thigh.the area is most amenable to direct inspection.

text: a foley is present within the bladder as well as a small amount of air consistent with recent manipulation.note is also made of a small focus of air in the right common femoral vein likely due to recent manipulation as well.the distal ureters, rectum, sigmoid, prostate, ........are otherwise unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymph adenopathy.there is no free fluid.

text: abdomen: again seen are subpleural lipomatous changes in the lungs bilaterally.mild dependent atelectasis bilaterally.mild coronary artery calcifications.otherwise the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver enhances homogeneously without focal liver lesions.the gallbladder is surgically absent.there is mild fatty infiltration of the pancreas, otherwise the pancreas is unremarkable.the spleen is normal.a lesion in left adrenal gland has increased in size compared to ___, may represent hemorrhage however given its growth, suggest mr ___ ___ whether it enhances.the right adrenal gland is normal.there is a 1.3 cm cyst of the posterior upper pole of the right kidney, unchanged.the 1.7 cm exophytic cyst in the lower pole posteriorly of the left kidney is unchanged.the left nephrostomy tube ends in the left kidney just medial to the cortex and likely within a calyx.compared to prior study it has been slightly pulled out though the pigtail is probably still suitably positioned.there is no hydronephrosis.there is minimal fluid adjacent to the left kidney however this is unchanged compared to ___.there are no areas of non-enhancing cortex.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.the colon demonstrates sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.the thoracic cord is unremarkable.the appendix is normal.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.pelvis: the prostate remains enlarged and lobulated, perhaps locally involving the rectum.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is a small right fat containing inguinal hernia.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.small umbilical fat containing hernia.there aorta is normal in caliber.there is mild aortic scattered calcifications.there are moderate degenerative changes of the lumbar spine with disc space narrowing and osteophytes at l2-3 and l3-4 of for l5.no acute abnormality in the bones.
summary: left nephrostomy tube ends in a calyx, slightly pulled back compared to prior study when it was in the left renal pelvis/left proximal ureter.no hydronephrosis.no evidence of pyelonephritis.unchanged bilateral renal cysts.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.moderate djd of lumbar spine.lesion in left adrenal gland has increased in size compared to ___, may represent hemorrhage however given its growth, suggest mr ___ ___ whether it enhances.lobulated prostate may be locally involving the anterior rectal wall, but poorly delineated using ct imaging.

text: there is a 4.5 x 3.3 cm hematoma located in the deep right pelvis without evidence of active extravasation.a foley is present within the collapsed bladder.the rectum and sigmoid are unremarkable.the patient appears to be status post a hysterectomy.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

text: there is no free fluid or free air.a foley catheter is contained within the bladder and there is gas within the bladder.there are no inflammatory changes in the lower abdomen.there is no evidence of mesenteric or bowel hematoma.the distal ureters are unremarkable.there is no adenopathy.there is a small amount of stranding in the right buttock deep subcutaeous fat, probable a minor contusion.examination of the bone reveals no findings suspicious for fracture in the lumbar spine or elsewhere.

text: moderate bilateral pleural effusions are increased in size compared to prior ct from ___.there is associated mild bilateral lower lobe compressive atelectasis.the patient is status post orthotopic liver transplantation.no focal liver lesions are seen.there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.the portal vein is patent.the patient is status post splenectomy, with splenules seen in the resection bed.the pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.the patient is status post right hemicolectomy and end ileostomy, unchanged in appearance, including a small, non-obstructing parastomal hernia.the stomach, small bowel, and remaining portion of the colon are otherwise grossly normal.as before, there is a large tubular-shaped rim-enhancing fluid and air-containing collection extending from the right infrahepatic region toward the lower mid abdomen, overall not significantly changed in size, except at its most superior extent where its maximal thickness measures 5.3 cm, compared to 4.3 cm previously (2:19).a percutaneous catheter entering the lower left paramedian abdomen ends within the infrahepatic portion of the collection, not significantly changed in position.within the left upper abdominal quadrant, there is a small rim-enhancing fluid collection measuring 3.3 x 2.0 cm, not significantly changed in size (2:10).there is extensive retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymphadenopathy measuring up to 10 cm in the region of the celiac axis and 12 mm in the left para-aortic region, not significantly changed.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber and its main branches are patent.scattered aortic calcifications are seen.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.
summary: no definite interval change in size of the abdominal/perihepatic abscess, except at its most superior extent where this collection may be minimally increased in thickness.unchanged small fluid collection in the left upper abdominal quadrant.increased moderate bilateral pleural effusions.

text: the included portions of the lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis and small pleural effusions.within the abdomen, a hypodensity in segment ii of the liver is too small to characterize, however, unchanged (2:20).there is likely vicarious excretion of contrast into the gallbladder, which appears otherwise unremarkable.the spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands appear normal.the right kidney contains a small hypodensity, too small to characterize, however, most likely a simple cyst.the left kidney appears normal.a previously seen hematoma is significantly decreased in size on the current examination measuring up to 9.8 x 7.7 cm in transverse dimensions, previously 12.2 x 13.8 cm.the contents are heterogeneous, as before, compatible with organizing hematoma.there is some enhancement of the rim.there is increased scattered free fluid throughout the abdomen and pelvis.loops of small and large bowel are normal in size and caliber.there is a foley catheter within the bladder.no free air is seen.scattered retroperitoneal lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.in the posterior subcutaneous tissues overlying spinal hardware, there is a fluid collection measuring up to 9.5 x 3.2 cm in transverse dimensions (2:47) x 20 cm craniocaudally (602b:43).the fluid appears homogeneous and may represent a postoperative seroma, slightly increased in size from the prior examination.additionally in the anterior abdominal subcutaneous tissues, there is a fluid collection which is decreased in size measuring 7.4 x 1.1 cm in transverse dimensions (2:73) x approximately 5 cm craniocaudally (602b:46).there is an ivc filter in standard position with thrombus within it.the patient is status post posterior and partly anterior fusion of l2 through s1.the appearance is similar to the prior examination.

text: ct abdomen: there is mild bibasilar atelectasis.the previously seen small left-sided pleural effusion has since resolved.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and liver are within normal limits.the gallbladder is quite distended but otherwise normal in appearance.a small amount of enhancing pancreatic parenchyma remains of the body and tail, unchanged in appearance since the prior study.a large rim-enhancing pseudocyst persists along the anterior aspect of the remaining pancreas and extends inferiorly along the right and left paracolic gutters.a percutaneous pigtail catheter remains in place within the pseudocyst on the left.there has been slight interval decrease in size of the pseudocyst, the largest pocket now measuring 10.1 cm x 3.8 cm in the axial view, previously 11.4 cm x 4.4 cm.however, the patient again demonstrates partial obstruction at the proximal descending colon in the same location as seen on the ___ study.the proximal segments of the colon are again markedly distended and contain fluid, measuring up to 7.7 cm in diameter.small bowel loops are also well distended, measuring up to 3.9 cm in diameter.the splenic vein is markedly attenuated with the full course not completely visualized.the main portal vein and superior mesenteric vein remain patent.there is no free fluid or free air.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions and significant atelectasis of the right lower lobe (which is homogeneously enhancing, and infection is less likely).the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there is a surgical drain within the gallbladder fossa.extending superiorly from the drain and into the liver is a 3.4 x 1.9 cm area of very low density, with an appearance consistent with surgicel or surgical packing.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation.a biliary stent is in place extending from the left hepatic duct through the common bile duct and terminating within the duodenum.there is no evidence of biloma or abscess.the spleen and adrenal glands are normal.there is a large amount of oral contrast within the stomach; however, no evidence of obstruction.there is moderately extensive stranding around the pancreas, suggestive of pancreatitis.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.small bowel loops are normal.there is a large amount of contrast and stool within the ascending colon.midline surgical staples and scattered foci of subcutaneous emphysema are consistent with recent postoperative state.there is no significant ascites.multiple small mesenteric nodes are likely reactive.there is severe levoscoliosis of the lumbar spine.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: status post cholecystectomy with no evidence of biloma or abscess.surgical packing in the gallbladder fossa extending into the liver.common bile duct stent in place extending from the left biliary tree into the duodenum.mild peripancreatic stranding suggestive of pancreatitis.large amount of fecal material/fluid within the ascending colon.small bilateral pleural effusions and significant atelectasis of the right lower lobe.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 1 pm on ___ and dr.___ ___ at 7 p.m.on ___.

text: mild hypoventilatory changes within the lung bases again demonstrated.no concerning nodules or effusion.no pericardial effusion is present.no focal mass lesions are detected within the liver.focal fatty infiltration in the region of the falciform ligament again demonstrated.the gallbladder is normal in appearance without wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the spleen again demonstrates heterogeneous perfusion most striking in the periphery in which multiple microinfarctions may represent a possible etiology.diffuse fatty infiltration of the pancreas without focal lesion.the abdominal aorta demonstrates irregular plaque with interval absence of crescentic plaque previously demonstrated on prior study status post thrombectomy by vascular surgery.no free air is detected within the abdomen.no wall thickening or surrounding stranding involving the large or small bowel to suggest acute colitis.stranding and small amount of fluid/hematoma anterior to the right psoas musculature demonstrates mild decrease since prior study and is presumed postoperative.
summary: no acute inflammatory processes within the abdomen are detected to suggest acute colitis.large air distended sigmoid colon without wall thickening or concerning mesenteric stranding.interval decrease in mural thrombus within the abdominal aorta status post thrombectomy.residual hematoma/stranding along the anterior right psoas musculature, likely relating to prior surgical intervention.

text: ct of the thorax.imaging of the mid and lower thorax demonstrate postsurgical changes from prior esophagectomy.there is a small amount of intrapleural air in the anterior left pleural space and on the right in the interlobar septa.two mediastinal and two right intrapleural drains are noted.there is dependent atelectasis.residual barium in the neoesophagus is likely from esophogram on ___.the visualized airways are patent to the segmental level.there are atherosclerotic calcifications in the lad.the heart and pericardium are otherwise unremarkable.
summary: subcutaneous air and possible extravasation of contrast through jejunostomy tube in the deep subcutaneous tissue of the left lateral aspect of the abdominal wall.extensive surrounding soft tissue edema and fat stranding.no intraabdominal fluid collection or free air.residual barium in neoesophagus without evidence of extravasation.expected small amount of free air in the pleural spaces and interlobar septa.coronary artery disease.the case was discussed by dr.___ ___ with dr.___ ___ by phone at 1:48 p.m.on ___.mjmgb

text: the bladder and rectum are unremarkable.the prostate is surgically absent.bilateral enlarged pelvic nodes are seen in the external iliac chain measuring 19 x 16 mm on the left (2:106), from 15 x 9 mm, and 29 x 13mm on the right (2:107) from 22 x 17mm.no inguinal adenopathy is seen.
summary: status post prostatectomy with interval increase in size of bilateral external iliac and left paraaortic nodes as above, which are concerning for disease progression.

text: brachytherapy seeds are noted in the prostate gland.the rectum, seminal vesicles, urinary bladder, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no free intraperitoneal pelvic fluid.
summary: massive left retroperitoneal hematoma extends from the spleen down to the left groin.two small hyperdense foci within the hematoma raise the possibility of slow bleeding.splenic infarcts.two subcentimeter low-density lesions of the right kidney may represent cysts but could be infarcts.no prior study available to compare.16-mm cystic lesion of the tail of the pancreas could represent cystic neoplasm.small bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis of the dependent lower lobes.multiphase mr of the abdomen is suggested to evaluate the pancreatic, splenic, and renal lesions once the patient's acute problems have resolved.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 2:00 p.m.on ___.

text: some atelectasis is noted at the lung bases.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.
summary: no definite abdominopelvic injury, although evaluation is limited without intravenous contrast.

text: the lung bases are clear.there are no pleural effusions.there is fatty infiltration of the liver.the spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, and adrenal glands are grossly normal on this noncontrast study.the stomach, small and large bowel loops are unremarkable.evaluation of the kidneys is limited as this is a noncontrast study.there is no perinephric fat stranding or proximal ureteral dilatation .there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.no significant retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy identified.
summary: no fluid collections or free air identified.no dilated loops of bowel identified.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.fatty infiltarion of the liver.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable.the patient is status post hysterectomy.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: trace pericholecystic fluid.no definitive evidence of cholecystitis.if this is of clinical concern, an ultrasound can be performed for further evaluation.small pericardial effusion.bilateral small pleural effusions.

text: prostate and urinary bladder appear unremarkable.colon displays mild diverticulosis, but no evidence of acute diverticulitis.no pathologically enlarged inguinal lymph nodes are identified.however, prominent external iliac node measuring 12 mm in short axis has increased in size from prior exam when it was approximately 7 mm in short axis (2:119).additional left external iliac nodes have also slightly increased in size, for example more inferior node has increased from 8 mm to 10.5 mm in short axis (2:122).
summary: severe fatty infiltration of the liver.near-complete resolution of previously identified paraceliac lymph node with stable posterior mediastinal lymph node, but increased left external iliac lymphadenopathy as described above.unchanged induration of the mesentery (___ mesentery).stable appearance of fat-containing umbilical hernia in this patient noted to be status post ventral hernia repair.

text: the prostate, seminal vesicles are unremarkable.the rectum contains a rectal tube.the urinary bladder is notable for a small amount of gas, and there is no foley catheter.this finding should be correlated to previous catheterization.there is a tiny fat-containing umbilical hernia which is unremarkable and unchanged.there is no pelvic sidewall or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: air- and fluid-filled loops of colon and small bowel, consistent with that described on previous radiographs representing ileus.increased pericardial effusion.this finding should be clinically correlated for possible clinical signs of tamponade physiology.small left pleural effusion, increased from the previous study.small amount of gas in the urinary bladder, a finding which should be correlated to history of previous foley catheterization.cholelithiasis.coronary arterial calcification.results discussed on the telephone with dr.___ ___ from the gi service at ~17:03 on ___.

text: pelvic loops of bowel are normal in appearance.there is no pelvic free fluid or significant pelvic lymphadenopathy.foley catheter is seen within the bladder.
summary: no acute intraabdominal trauma.

text: there are emphysematous changes at the bases with hyperinflation, and bibasilar, right greater than left, dependent opacities that may represent atelectasis.within the limitations of a non- contrast study, the gallbladder, liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there are diffuse vascular calcifications and marked atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and iliac distributions.the right kidney is unremarkable but does have a 24 mm diameter lesion, which is most likely a simple cyst.in the lower pole of left kidney, there is a 27 mm diameter lesion with solid components, and the possibility of a neoplasm is raised by this study.there are also several subcentimeter hypoattenuating areas, which may represent cysts.in the left renal pelvis, there is a calcific density 17 mm x 8 mm in axial dimensions, like a non- obstructing stone, and it is surrounded by ureteropelvic thickening.the stomach is not particularly distended.however, the proximal small bowel is markedly distended, with slow passage of contrast, which does not pass distally.the distal loops of bowel are very distended containing fluid.in the mid-to-right lower quadrant, there is an apparent transition point where the small bowel transitions from dilation to collapse over a very short interval, near but not within the incisional hernia.in the right upper quadrant, there is a probable anastomotic site between residual distal colon and small bowel.a segment of dilated proximal small bowel passes through the ventral hernia, but the hernia does not appear to be the nidus of obstruction.there are multiple small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes, but no free air or fluid.
summary: small-bowel obstruction, with transition point in the mid-to-right lower quadrant, near but outside of the ventral hernia.ventral hernia, containing bowel.likely bilateral renal cysts, not well evaluated here.also, a 27 mm lesion with solid components in the left kidney, which could represent a renal cell carcinoma, and an evaluation with ultrasound and/or mr is recommended.apparently status post right colectomy.emphysema.

text: there is heterogeneous enhancement in the post partum uterus.there are surrounding fluid collections which contain air which are within normal limits at this stage in the post operative period.a foley catheter is present in the bladder.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic nodes are seen.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are identified.surgical clips are present in the anterior abdominal wall.
summary: marked distention of numerous small bowel loops from the distal jejunum through the ileoanal anastomosis.findings are consistent with a post operative ileus.no evidence for mechanical small bowel obstruction.collapsed loop of proximal jejunum and duodenum fills with contrast on two hour delay.these results were discussed with the surgical and gynecological house staff at the time of interpretation.

text: the distal ureters, bladder, uterus, and adnexa are unremarkable with the exception of a small likely hemorrhagic cyst versus prominent follicle on the right.small amount of likely physiologic free fluid in the dependent pelvis.no abnormal lymph nodes in the deep pelvis.
summary: left pyelonephritis, the ct appearance of which is not significantly changed compared to ___.small bilateral pleural effusions, also unchanged.left basilar atelectasis, improved.

text: the uterus is enlarged but has decreased in size from the prior study.free pelvic fluid has almost completely resolved.both ovaries are imaged and have normal ct appearance.there is no free air within the pelvis.there are no pelvic masses or enlarged inguinal lymph nodes.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are seen within the imaged osseous structures.
summary: no intra-abdominal abscess.no evidence of bowel obstruction, perforation, or inflammation.post-partum uterus.incidental note is made of a small ventral hernia which contains only fat on this exam.

text: evaluation of the visualized lung bases demonstrates minimal dependent changes of atelectasis.in addition, there is a focal air bronchogram seen at the inferior most aspect of the right lower lobe, which may represent a small focus of consolidation.no concerning pulmonary nodules or masses are seen at the visualized lung bases.the visualized portions of the heart and pericardium are also unremarkable.assessment of the abdomen and its solid visceral structures is limited without the administration of iv contrast.allowing for this limitation, no focal mass lesions are seen within the liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, or kidneys.no abdominal lymphadenopathy or free fluid is evident.evaluation of the stomach demonstrates no interposed loops of large bowel between the stomach body/antrum and the anterior wall.however, the superior portion of the gastric edge is covered anteriorly by the anterior lip of the liver, although the inferior 50% of the stomach at the body and antrum across most of its length appears to have a window of direct access from the anterior abdominal wall.this appears amenable to percutaneous gastrostomy.note is also made of vascular calcifications diffusely involving the aorta, without aneurysmal dilatation.minimal degenerative changes are seen, particularly involving the thoracic levels of the vertebral body.multiplanar reformatted images were also reviewed at the interpretation, particularly useful for assessing the relationship of the anterior abdominal wall and the stomach as well as adjacent structures such as the liver and loops of large bowel.
summary: no interposed loops of large bowel between the stomach and the anterior abdominal wall.the top portion of the stomach and the body and antrum is covered by the liver, although the more inferior aspects are not.the patient proceeded to the interventional radiology suite, for percutaneous gastrostomy placement.

text: large heterogeneous, lobulated pelvic mass is seen, with significant mass effect on the bladder.mass measures upwards of 15.9 (ap) x 15.9 (cc) x 14.2 (trv) cm.the mass demonstrates marked extrinsic compression on the sigmoid colon, however, oral contrast is seen passing through the sigmoid colon.fat plane is identified between the colon and mass.foley catheter is seen within the bladder, which is displaced anteriorly secondary to the large pelvic mass.no definite fat plane identified between the mass and bladder, however, the mass appears to be extrinsic to the bladdder.small amount of free fluid is noted within the pelvis.
summary: large heterogeneous, lobulated pelvic mass seen, most likely of gynecological origin.patient recalls history of tah/bso, however, prior records not available at time of dictation.less likely considerations include lymphoma (although very unlikely given no lymphadenopathy identified elsewhere), or bladder origin.marked extrinsic compression of sigmoid colon, without evidence of obstruction.right sided hydronephrosis and proximal hydroureter.small hypoattenuating lesions seen within the liver.metastases cannot be excluded.compression fracture of l1, of ___ chronicity.poorly defined low attenuation lesion in uncinate process of pancreas, incompletely evaluated on this study.primary versus secondary neoplasm suspected.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 11:20p.m.___.

text: few images through the lung bases demonstrate no pleural effusions.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal in appearance.small low-attenuation lesion in the upper pole of the right kidney is a simple cyst and measures 9 mm in diameter.there is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter on either side.there is no bowel obstruction.there is lipomatous hypertrophy of the ileocecal valve, and there is increased fat density seen in the walls of the lower portion of the ascending colon, with a strictured appearance, and these have progressed slightly compared to ___.no enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are present.
summary: the findings in the lower proximal portion of the ascending (right) colon are most consistent with a chronic inflammatory process.

text: a rectal tube is noted in the fecal-loaded rectum.the colonic wall is minimally edematous, in keeping with patient's liver disease.there is an indwelling foley catheter in the collapsed urinary bladder.moderate amount of simple ascites pools in the dependent pelvis.there is no free air or gross lymphadenopathy in the pelvis.moderate anasarca is noted throughout the lower pelvic wall.
summary: large amount of non-hemorrhagic ascites throughout the abdomen.no evidence of intra-abdominal hemorrhage.intact roux-en-y anastomosis.cirrhotic liver.gas-distended loops of bowel with decrease of caliber just distal to the j-j anastomosis.while this could represent post-operative changes from gastric bypass, early partially small bowel obstruction cannot be excluded.minimal-to-mild colonic wall edema, likely secondary to patient's end-stage liver disease.fecal loading in the rectum.

text: there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.patient is status post whipple procedure.expected postoperative pneumobilia is identified.focal dilatation of bile duct within segment vi of the liver (2, 30) is slightly more prominent on today's exam.extensive amount of mesenteric stranding adjacent to the gastrojejunostomy site is unchanged.tiny residual fluid collection in this region (2, 38) measuring approximately 1.7 cm persists.there are no new fluid collections identified.the spleen, residual pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.multiple mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are unchanged, none of which meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.patient is status post aortoiliac stent.there is moderate amount gastric distention.
summary: interval resolution of large intra-abdominal fluid collections with only minimal fluid collection seen adjacent to the gastrojejunostomy site (2, 38) measuring approximately 1.7 cm.no new fluid collections identified.prominent focal dilatation of the bile duct within the right lobe segment vi of the liver.

text: there is a geographic region of hypodensity noted within segments ii and iii of the liver which is new.no additional liver abnormalities are identified on this non-contrast study.there is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen is borderline enlarged measuring 13 cm in craniocaudad dimension.the adrenal glands, kidneys, and pancreas are grossly unremarkable in appearance.multiple retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified which do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is a small-to-moderate amount of intra- abdominal ascites.
summary: diffuse ground-glass opacities with focal areas of sparing and additional patchy reas of superimposed consolidation.these findings may be consistent with pneumonia and or aspiration with possible superimposed edema.bilateral pleural effusions moderate on the right and small on the left.diffuse body wall edema and mild-to-moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites without focal or organized fluid collections identified.geographic areas of hypoattenuation involving the medial aspects of segments ii and iii of the liver which are new compared to the prior study.these findings may related to edema or infarct.

text: a left gluteal hematoma is similar in appearance compared with prior and is now noted to measure approximately 4 x 7.5 x 8.0 cm.there is no active extravasation seen.no pseudoaneurysm is noted, however, there is not robust arterial phase opacification and thus the evaluation of this is limited.no new hematoma is appreciated.the visualized osseous structures are unchanged in appearance without fracture.the visualized intrapelvic organs are notable only for a prostate, which is enlarged and demonstrates heterogeneous enhancement (2; 40).a foley catheter is present within the bladder which is collapsed.there is no intraperitoneal free fluid or free air.
summary: similar to slightly decreased size of left gluteal hematoma, without evidence of active extravasation or pseudoaneurysm.enlarged prostate gland with heterogeneous peripheral enhancement which is asymmetric on the left.recommend correlation with psa and digital rectal exam.

text: the lung bases are clear.there is bibasilar atelectasis.a new nodule within the right lung base (300b, 22) is identified and measures 3 mm.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the spleen, liver, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.the gallbladder contains a gallstone.there are scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes, none of which are pathologically enlarged, but are increased in number.the patient is status post ileostomy and proctocolectomy.multiple markedly dilated loops of small bowel measuring up to 5 cm which have acute angles are identified with more distal collapsed small bowel loops.dilated loops extend to a point just beyond the suture line (300b, 19 image) in the small bowel.contrast is seen entering the ileostomy.these findings are concerning for a high grade partial small- bowel obstruction.there has been interval development of free fluid within the pelvis.there is extensive mesenteric fat stranding identified (2:45).there is no evidence of free air or bowel wall thickening.marked anterior abdominal wall subcutaneous soft tissue fat stranding is identified (301b, 39) which may be post surgical.
summary: markedly-dilated proximal small bowel loops and more distal collapsed small bowel loops.multiple dilated loops of small bowel make acute angles and these findings are concerning for a high grade partial small bowel obstruction.contrast is seen distally.transition point may be close to the suture line in the small bowel, right side of the bdomen.extensive mesenteric fat stranding, which is nonspecific.extensive anterior abdominal wall subcutaneous soft tissue fat stranding, new when compared to prior exam.interval development of pelvic free fluid.right lower lobe nodular opacities measuring up to 3 mm.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ by telephone at 8:00 p.m.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate, seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: progression of bibasilar atelectasis and consolidation consistent with pneumonia.the known pulmonary emboli which were demonstrated previously were not examined on this abdomen and pelvis ct.interval increase in gallbladder distention and new pericholecystic fluid.the findings are potentially concerning for acute cholecystitis; clinical correlation is recommended.this could be further assessed with ultrasound and/or hida scan.results discussed with dr.___ at 3:59 p.m..

text: the lung bases are clear.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver appears normal without evidence of focal lesions on this noncontrast study.within the fundus of the stomach medially, there is a large filling defect, consistent with the previous history of nissen fundoplication.clips are seen in the left upper quadrant.the spleen is unremarkable.the stomach is mildly distended with contrast.no definite ulcer is seen on the ct scan to correspond with the egd findings.there is no evidence of free air within the abdomen.there is no abscess, phlegmon, or significant stranding identified within the abdomen.there are no significant abnormal lymph nodes seen.the gallbladder, kidneys, pancreas, spleen, and intra-abdominal bowel appear normal.
summary: status post nissen fundoplication.no evidence of free air or intra- abdominal abscess.ulcer identified by egd not definitely seen on this ct study.findings discussed with the gastrointestinal team.

text: there is a large right-sided pneumothorax.there is a moderate amount of atelectasis/aspiration at the lung bases.there is a fracture at the posterior aspect of the 9th rib on the right.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenals appear normal.there are multiple simple cysts within both kidneys.there is also a 17 x 13 mm cystic structure at the upper pole of the right kidney that has a calcified rim.follow-up with mri may be helpful in the appropriate clinical setting.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy is identified.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.
summary: large right-sided pneumothorax.fracture of the 9th rib on the right.atelectatic/aspiration changes at the lung bases.simple cysts within both kidneys.there is a cyst with rim calcifications in the upper pole of the right kidney.evaluation by mri may be helpful in follow-up.

text: the lung bases are clear.extensive coronary artery calcifications are noted.there are degenerative changes of the spine.the liver and gallbladder are normal.the adrenal glands, kidneys and pancreas are stable in appearance, noting simple renal cysts with an additional tiny left renal hypodensity, too small to characterize, unchanged.the spleen has enlarged in size compared to the prior study, and splenomegaly is now present.additionally, there is a peripheral region of linear/wedge-shaped hypodensity, best seen on images 36 and 37 of series 3.the abdominal viscera are otherwise within normal limits.there are atherosclerotic changes of the aorta, including peripheral calcification as well as crescentic mural thrombus within an abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.6 x 3.4 cm in size as seen on image 53 of series 3.there are prominent degenerative changes of the spine.there is no free pelvic fluid, lymphadenopathy, or free air.prominent prostatomegaly is seen.there is a fat-containing left inguinal hernia.there is descending and sigmoid colonic diverticulosis.there are degenerative changes of the spine.note is made of a retroaortic left renal vein.
summary: interval development of splenomegaly with a linear/wedge-shaped peripheral hypodensity, most consistent with a perfusion abnormality.clinical correlation is recommended.given the patient's history of fever, the enlargement of the spleen may be secondary to a viral process.abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.6 x 3.4 cm in size.colonic diverticulosis.enlargement of the prostate gland.atherosclerosis with involvement of the coronary arteries.

text: the liver is normal without focal or diffuse abnormality.the gallbladder, intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts are normal.a hypoechoic lesion with peripheral rim enhancement is again seen in the body of the pancreas, measuring 7 x 7 mm, similar to prior.the pancreas is otherwise unremarkable.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the right kidney has been surgically removed and right renal bed is unremarkable.the left kidney is unremarkable.the left ureter is normal in course and caliber.the esophagus and stomach are unremarkable.the small and large bowel enhance homogeneously and are normal in course and caliber.the appendix is normal.diverticulosis is present without evidence of diverticulitis.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.scattered calcifications are present within the abdominal aorta.the portal and intra-abdominal systemic vasculature is otherwise unremarkable.no free abdominal fluid, abdominal wall hernia, or pneumoperitoneum.
summary: 7-mm hypodense lesion with peripheral enhancement in the body of the pancreas, similar to prior and concerning for a metastatic lesion.numerous bilateral pulmonary nodules, measuring up to 8 mm in the right upper lobe, similar to prior.status post right nephrectomy without evidence of local recurrence.status post right lower lobe wedge resection with stable post-surgical changes.enlarged prostate gland.findings were entered into the oncology table database.

text: abnormal appearance of the right lower quadrant renal transplant is identified which demonstrates hyperenhancement of the peripheral cortex and nonenhnaceement of the medulla.moderate hydronephrosis is a new finding.multiple adjacent lymph nodes are likely reactive, measuring up to 1.7 cm in short axis.adjacent facial thickening and inflammatory fat stranding of the overlying soft tissue and skin thickening are again noted.no fluid collections around the transplant are identified.the bladder itself appears unchanged.the rectum is unremarkable with scattered descending colon and sigmoid diverticula noted without evidence for acute diverticulitis.punctate calcifications within the prostate are noted.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.thoracolumbar spondylosis is noted.
summary: abnormal appearance and enhancement of the renal transplant as described with new mild to moderate hydronephrosis likely representing a vascular insult of venous or arterial etiology.no focal peritransplant fluid collections noted.colonic diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.decrease in size of tiny bilateral pleural effusions.small left lower lung opacity may represent focal atelectasis, though an early pneumonic consolidation cannot be excluded.

text: there is layering ascites within the pelvis.a foley is present within the bladder.there is a rectal tube.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.no fluid collections are present within the groin.there are small bilateral inguinal lymph nodes.a central line is present within the right common femoral vein.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: retroperitoneal air in the left mid-abdomen suggestive of a mid-descending colon preforation.diffuse wall thickening involving the secum and ascending colon.this is non-specific appearance, but likely consistent with colitis.low attenuation liver lesion, not significantly changed in the interval.please refer to prior ct and mri for further evaluation.unchanged left adrenal adenoma.ascites.

text: the urinary bladder is distended but appears normal.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is an apparent annular filling defect within the cecum (sequence 2 image #44).as no formal colonic evaluation has been performed at this institution, direct visualization may be considered for further evaluation.there is pelvic free fluid.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.no suspicious osseous lesions.there are degenerative changes of the lumbar spine, with associated grade 1 anterolisthesis of l5/s1.vascular calcifications are noted.
summary: no discrete abscess collection, as clinically questioned.ascites.small bilateral pleural effusions.diffuse interlobular septal thickening, probably related to chf, less likely infectious or inflammatory.cannot exclude cecal neoplasm.consider direct visualization, if no recent colonic evaluation has been performed.grade 1 anterolisthesis of l5 on s1.

text: there is fatty infiltration of the liver but no focal lesions.gallstones are again seen dependently in the gallbladder.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.the stomach, large and small bowel are within normal limits.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, or free air or fluid.similar prominent atherosclerotic plaque in the infrarenal aorta, with calcifications is again seen.
summary: more extensive bilateral lower lobe consolidations, with increased bilateral effusions, greater on the right than left.similar calcification of the left ventricle.fatty infiltration of the liver.unchanged prominent, although non-pathologically enlarged, mediastinal lymph nodes, by ct criteria.cholelithiasis.much less fat stranding adjacent to the pancreas compared to the prior study.

text: vascular calcifications seen along the aorta and iliac vessels.the urinary bladder is collapsed and contains a foley.the ureters are poorly visualized.the uterus is within normal limits and the adnexa are not seen.innumerable subcutaneous soft tissue nodules are seen throughout most soft tissue structures.a right hip prosthetic is seen.multiple lytic bone lesions are also noted,
summary: multiple soft tissue nodules in the lung bases, in the peritoneal cavity and throughout the subcutaneous tissues.along with mutiple osseous lesions, the findings are consistent with diffuse myeloma.pancreatic head and mass is poorly delineated because patient was not given iv contrast due to history of multiple myeloma.

text: the urinary bladder, prostate, and seminal vesicles appear unremarkable.the ileoanal pouch is nondistended but appears unremarkable.again small pelvic free fluid is smaller than seen on ___.there is no pelvic free air.pelvic nodes, both in the mesentery and in the perirectal region measure up to 9 mm in short axis, unchanged.
summary: no small-bowel obstruction.prior proctocolectomy, with ileoanal anastomosis.pelvic free fluid is smaller than on ___.no free air.resolved bilateral pleural effusions.trace perihepatic fluid.

text: evaluation of the abdomen is limited secondary to lack of contrast enhancement.there appears to be a hypodensity in the medial left hepatic lobe measuring approximately 1.5 x 1.0 cm.this may represent vessels or fat but without iv contrast it is impossible to further characterize.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and kidneys are grossly normal.in the region of the left adrenal gland there is an approximately 1 cm fat density mass which likely represents an adenoma.the right adrenal gland is normal.the visualized nonopacified loops of small and large bowel are normal.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the abdominal aorta is somewhat ectatic and calcified as are the iliac vessels.no periaortic fluid collections.no evidence no free fluid and no free air.
summary: unable to evaluate for aortic dissection secondary to inability to administer contrast.however, no indirect evidence of dissection.3 mm nodule at the left lung base.a chest ct in three months is recommended as followup.hypodense region in left hepatic lobe which, without iv contrast, is difficult to further characterize.likely represents local fatty infiltration.calcified ectatic abdominal aorta.left adrenal adenoma.

text: chest: the visualized portion of the thyroid appears unremarkable.no axillary lymphadenopathy is seen.the previously described subcarinal lymphadenopathy has now resolved.the previously described right hilar lymphadenopathy has decreased in size now measuring 19 x 6 mm (2;33).the lungs are clear of masses, consolidations, or nodules.the heart and great vessels are normal-appearing small amount of fluid is seen in the pericardial recess.there is no pleural effusion.
summary: increase in pancreatic head mass size with increase in size of hepatic metastases.interval resolution of subcarinal lymphadenopathy and decrease in right hilar node.stable left adrenal nodule.

text: the rectum contains a moderate amount of stool.note is made of sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.the appendix is normal.urinary bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the prostate is notable for dystrophic calcification and the seminal vesicles are normal.there is no free gas in the pelvis.there is no pelvic sidewall or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no abdominal or pelvic lymphadenopathy or evidence of primary malignancy.indeterminate exophytic density from the right kidney.this is of mixed density and possibly a hyperdense cyst.would recommend comparison to ultrasound.unchanged pleural effusions.pericholecystic fluid in the setting of anasarca and diffuse retroperitoneal and mesenteric edema, likely related to third spacing of fluids/volume resuscitation.

text: there is bibasilar airspace consolidation involving the right and left lower lobes and a focal area of airspace consolidation anteriorly within the right lung base.the central venous catheter terminates in the right atrium.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.there is no pericardial effusion.low density within the ventricles suggests anemia.the nasogastric tube terminates in the proximal duodenum.tips device and surgical clips about the liver are noted.large-volume ascites is nonhemorrhagic by density.no focal high density is identified to suggest a sentinel clot.a 15-mm focus of air in the non-dependent portion of the peritoneum appears to be extraluminal, although this is difficult to definitely characterize due to large-volume ascites (2:55).the liver is small with a nodular contour consistent with cirrhosis.pancreas and kidneys have unremarkable non-contrast ct appearance.the adrenals are suboptimally visualized.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 17 cm.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.opacification of the lumen of the gi tract is limited by the small amount of contrast.there are no abnormally dilated loops of small bowel.there is fecal material throughout the colon, however, the sigmoid is relatively decompressed.

text: there is a rounded area of consolidation at the right lung base.additional tiny foci of opacity are seen.these findings are worrisome for septic emboli given the patient's history.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the liver, gallbladder, adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable.small ill-defined hypodensity is noted in the body of the pancreas.there is a rounded area of splenic hypoperfusion consistent with infarction.additional tiny areas of hypoperfusion are noted in the spleen.there is fluid tracking along the entire length of the left psoas muscle.within this there are rounded areas of rim enhancement consistent with abscesses.at the l3-4 disc level there is a 2.5 x 1.5 cm abscess anterior and left lateral to the disc and adjacent to the aorta.in addition there is a tiny focus of rim enhancement along the right side of the disc.there is a small amount of abdominal free fluid.stomach and bowel loops are unremarkable.
