text: in the visualized lung bases, there are increased diffuse ground- glass opacities, with denser focal consolidations in the bilateral lower lobes.both processes are progressed compared to ___, and most likely reflect progressive ards with superimposed bibasilar pneumonia/aspiration.in view of bony injury fat embolism should also be considered.in the liver, again seen is a linear low attenuation region within the superior aspect of the left lobe, just below the heart.while on previous study this was thought to possibly represent an artifact, its similar appearance on the current study suggests the presence of a mild grade 1 liver laceration.mild heterogeneity at posterior margin of segment 7, may represent contusion.additionally, there has been interval development of a trace amount of slightly hyperdense perihepatic fluid, likely representing a small associated subcapsular hematoma.there are no other focal liver lesions identified.mild periportal edema is new.the gallbladder is unremarkable.there is no cholelithiasis or ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal gland, and kidneys are normal.there is symmetric renal parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion.there is no hydronephrosis.there is no perinephric stranding.the stomach, duodenum, intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.an ng tube terminates within the stomach.there is no mesenteric fluid collection, bowel distention, bowel thickening or other evidence of mesenteric or small-bowel injury.there is no free fluid.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.slight haziness of the mesentery and subcutaneous soft tissues likely reflects diffuse anasarca.the aorta is normal in caliber.major mesenteric vessels appear patent.the ivc is unremarkable.
summary: interval worsening of diffuse bilateral ground-glass opacities in the lungs, with more focal consolidations at the bilateral bases.this is consistent with evolving ards, with superimposed multifocal pneumonia.given the location, aspiration should be considered.fat emboli are also a consideration given the history of trauma and fracture.persistent linear low-attenuation focus at the dome of the left lobe of the liver, with interval development of a small sliver of slightly hyperdense perihepatic fluid.findings are most suggestive of a small grade 1 liver laceration.mild heterogeneity at posterior margin of segment 7, may represent contusion.diffuse soft tissue edema, with new periportal edema, suggests fluid overload.no evidence for mesenteric or bowel injury.small amount free fluid in pelvis.findings communicated to dr.___ ___ at 18:38 hours on ___ by dr.___.

summary: new expansile, retrohepatic, mixed high-attenuation collection with mass effect on the ivc and adjacent liver, consistent with a hematoma.small to moderate serosanguinous fluid is seen throughout the abdomen and pelvis.nonenhancing hypodense irregularity of the liver margin anterior to the aforementioned collection, the appearance for which tear/laceration of the liver capsule and/or parenchymal liver injury is possible.irregularity and attenuation of the proximal intrahepatic left main portal vein.a small focus of high attenuation seen on series 2, image 18 at the periphery of the retrohepatic collection could indicate an element of active extravasation from arterial injury.the above findings were called immediately to dr.___ ___ of the surgical team caring for the patient.

text: the bladder, uterus, and adnexal regions are unremarkable.the patient is post-proctocolectomy.the pre-coccygeal collection remains present, minimally decreased in size from the prior study, currently measuring 1.9 cm ap x 4.1 cm tv x 4.4 cm si, previously 2.0 cm ap x 4.4 cm tv x 5.9 cm si.there is slightly less air in the collection today, though air does persist, and there is low-density material within the collection as before.inflammatory change within the fatty tissues inferior to this collection persists, best appreciated sagittally (7:32).no pelvic or inguinal nodes reach ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: minimal decrease in size of post-operative pre-coccygeal collection.there is decreased air within the collection; low-density material persists within it as before.mild interval increase in size of a lymph node anterior to the left common iliac artery, now 11 mm in short axis.while this finding could be reactive, continued attention on followup studies is recommended.

text: there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: limited evaluation of the portal vein.no gross filling defects within the main portal vein to suggest thrombus.if there is further clinical concern about portal vein thrombosis a duplex doppler ultrasound of the liver is recommended.moderate to large right pleural effusion.cirrhosis, collateralization, and splenomegaly, all consistent with portal hypertension.2 mm nonobstructing right renal stone.

text: the liver is normal in shape and contour.there are no focal hepatic lesions.the portal vein is patent.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation.the gallbladder is unremarkable without evidence of stones or sludge.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable without evidence of obstruction or perforation.there is no free air in the abdomen.the abdominal vasculature is normal in course and caliber.there is moderate ascites, unchanged from the prior exam.there is new bilateral hydronephrosis.the hydronephrosis is moderate on the right with associated mild right hydroureter.the hydronephrosis is mild on the left.the left ureter is normal.no focal renal masses are present.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.
summary: new large left rectus sheath hematoma with hematocrit level suggestive of underlying coagulopathy, but no definite evidence of active extravasation.unchanged appearance of the large pelvic mass involving the right ovary.this is consistent with the patient's known metastatic adenocarcinoma.pelvic mass compresses both ureters distally resulting in new bilateral hydronephrosis, moderate on the right and mild on the left with associated right hydroureter.small bilateral pleural effusions, increased in size from the prior exam.stable moderate ascites.omental stranding may be due to third spacing, although omental metastases cannot be fully excluded.

text: the appendix is visualized, measuring up to 6 mm in its greatest diameter.several foci of air are noted within the lumen of the appendix.the wall of the appendix is relatively well seen and high attenuation, suggesting enhancement.there is no significant adjacent stranding.the rectum, sigmoid, distal ureters and urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free pelvic fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: appendix measuring at the upper limits of normal with likely wall enhancement related to phase of contrast.there is a low suspicion for appeniditis given other features including air in the lumen and lack of associated findings.recommend clinical correlation.large paracardial effusion associated pleural effusion, hepatic and venous congestion.further cardiac evaluation is recommended.periportal adenopathy.small amount of free fluid in pelvis.

text: direct comparison is made to prior exam dated ___.again, moderate atelectasis is seen at the lung bases with small bilateral pleural effusions, left slightly greater than right.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and gallbladder are grossly unremarkable.evaluation of the liver reveals a small, hypoattenuating area near the dome on image #12 series 2.this likely represents a simple cyst or hemangioma.again, significant peripancreatic stranding is identified.there is no clear evidence of decreased attenuation within the pancreatic parenchyma to suggest necrosis.the findings of peripancreatic fluid are again consistent with patient's known pancreatitis.there is again noted to be significant fluid extending within the left pericolic gutter as well as within the retroperitoneum, predominantly on the left.these findings are likely related to underlying pancreatis.increasing stranding is identified within the mesentery and omentum.currently, there is moderate nearly completely diffuse distention of the small bowel.there is a short segment of collapsed small bowel near the terminal ileum.the progression to this segment of collapsed bowel is somewhat gradual.therefore, the small bowel findings are likely related to functional ileus, likely due to the patient's pancreatitis.the pelvic structures are grossly unremarkable.the remainder of the bowel is grossly unremarkable.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are seen.
summary: findings of pancreatitis with increased fluid within the abdominal cavity.also, suggestion of a functional ileus, likely related to the patient's pancreatitis.no focal fluid collection to suggest abscess is seen.relatively homogeneous pancreatic profusion without clear evidence of necrosis.small bilateral pleural effusions and moderate bibasilar atelectasis.

text: bladder and distal ureters are within normal limits.again noted are proximally dilated loops of small bowel with distal compressed loops, suggesting obstruction, with a transition point most likely in the left lower quadrant.loculated regions of free fluid with enhancing walls likely represents malignant ascites, and is slightly improved since the last examination.uterus and adnexa are not identified.no lymphadenopathy is seen in the pelvis.previously described right internal iliac vein filling defect not well identified on today's study.subcutaneous soft tissues notable for anasarca.bone windows show degenerative changes.multiplanar reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.
summary: small-bowel obstruction with candidate transition point in left lower quadrant.large left pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.overall, slight improvement in carcinomatosis and malignant ascites.findings discussed with dr.___ by telephone at 6:15 p.m., ___.

summary: diffuse intra- and extra-peritoneal air with no definite extravasation of the oral contrast material suggests contained rupture of the duodenum.localized fluid collection measuring 3.2 x 1.5 cm posterior to the second portion of the duodenum, most likely sequela of the recent perforation of the duodenum.status post billroth type ii and 7 x 8.2 cm mass of the greater curvature of the stomach, possibly also invading the splenic flexure of colon.the differential possibilities include adenocarcinoma and gist.23 mm soft tissue lesion of lesser curvature can not be further evlauated.further evaluation with mr ___ ___ basis (after resolution of retroperitoneal air) is recommended.the differentials include lymph node, soft tissue mass, or cytic lesion of the adjacent pancreas.status post left nephrectomy.small bilateral pleural effusion, right greater than left.small hypodense lesions of the liver, which are too small to characterize.cholelithiasis with no evidence of cholecystitis.

summary: normal evaluation of the appendix.again visualized is a complex midline/right adnexal cystic mass probably represents the endometrioma.

text: the appendix is not definitively identified; however, there are no secondary signs of acute appendicitis in the right lower quadrant.there is colonic diverticulosis.the proximal sigmoid colon is collapsed, there appears to be mild wall thickening and there is adjacent fat stranding consistent with acute diverticulitis.no definite drainable fluid collection is seen.on series 2, image 60, there is a focus of gas measuring 0.8 cm, which most likely represents a diverticulum; however, difficult to entirely exclude microperforation.the previously seen left adnexal cyst has resolved in the interval.the left ovary is not well evaluated on the current study.the uterus and right adnexa are stable in appearance.no bowel obstruction is seen.

text: there is increased bilateral basilar dependent reticulation (2:1), right more prominent than left.there is also parenchymal opacity in the right middle lobe (2:2) which could be representative of aspiration or infection.there are multiple surgical clips adjacent to the heart related to patient's prior coronary bypass surgery.there are sternal cerclage wires.a 2.2 x 1.7 cm hyperdense (77 ___) well-circumscribed lesion is identified either adjacent to, or less likely within, segment iii/ivb.the surrounding liver parenchyma demonstrates ill-defined hypodensity.on the coronal images, this hyperdensity appears to lie within an ill-defined, abnormal gallbladder which demonstrates abnormal wall thickening and possible intra-luminal soft tissue density.the gallbladder is not distended.no definite pericholecystic fluid is noted.there is a cbd stent in situ.there is pneumobilia, likely related to patient's recent instrumentation.there is mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.there are two foci of hyperdense material in the area of the hepatic hilum (2:14 through 15), which could represent small stones in the biliary system or vascular calcifications.the spleen and adrenals are unremarkable.the tail and body of the pancreas are unremarkable; however, the head of the pancreas is full and prominent.there is no intrapancreatic duct dilatation.there is no fluid around the head of the pancreas, nor is there significant adjacent fat stranding.findings may represent pancreatitis.there is a hyperdense exophytic mass arising from the interpolar region of the left kidney (2:24) measuring 1.8 x 1.4 cm and measuring 36 hounsfield units.there is an additional area of equivocal hyperdensity in the interpolar region of the left kidney (2:28) measuring 17 x 23 mm and again could represent a hyperdense mass.in the superior pole of the right kidney, there is a 2.3 x 2.1 cm fluid density cystic structure with a small focus of calcification along its periphery (2:21).this likely represents a simple cyst.there are punctate areas of hyperdense material within the medulla of both kidneys likely representing calculi.both kidneys are atrophic.there is an additional low density mass arising from the anterior border of the right kidney (2:23) measuring 1.3 x 1.3 cm and measuring 6 hounsfield units, likely representing a simple cyst.the stomach and abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air.there is no free fluid.there is extensive atherosclerotic disease of the abdominal aorta and abdominal arterial vasculature.
summary: well-circumscribed hyperdensity adjacent to the left lobe of liver, likely representing a gallstone within an abnormal gallbladder.the gallbladder demonstrates abnormal wall thickening and possible intraluminal soft tissue.findings may represent chronic cholecystitis, but gallbladder carcinoma cannot be excluded.mrcp with inclusion of the liver is recommended for further evaluation.ill-defined hypodensity within segments iii/ivb of the liver, surrounding the abnormal gallbladder, may represent reactive inflammation.again, neoplastic infiltration of the hepatic parenchyma cannot be excluded.cbd stent in situ with associated pneumobilia.intrahepatic biliary dilatation is mild.prominence of the pancreatic head suggestive of mild pancreatitis.there is no pancreatic duct dilatation or parenchymal atrophy.pancreas can be further evaluated with mrcp.infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 4.8 cm in maximum diameter.atrophic kidneys.multiple left-sided hyperdense renal lesions are likely hemorrhagic cysts, but can be further evaluated at the time of mri.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.enlarged prostate with prostate calcifications, likely bph.recommend clinical correlation.findings of this study were discussed with dr.___ ___ of the surgical service at 5:15 pm on ___

text: cardiac size remains enlarged with extensive coronary artery calcifications in three vessels as well as aortic calcifications.again seen is a large right pleural effusion, and small partially loculated left pleural effusion.adjacent consolidations are present, and may represent atelectasis versus infiltrates.non-contrast evaluation of the liver is unremarkable.there is a gallstone present in the gallbladder.again noted are coarse calcifications in the spleen.extensive vascular calcifications are present.pancreas is somewhat atrophic.adrenal glands are unremarkable.there are numerous hypodensities in the kidneys bilaterally, some are consistent with appearance of simple cysts, some are too small to definitely characterize, and are better evaluated on the recent renal son___.___ calculi are present in the renal collecting systems or along the course of the ureters.a g-tube is in place.there is no small bowel loop dilation.contrast is seen in the loops of small and large bowel.normal appendix is seen.there is small amount of free fluid in the abdomen.there is no free air in the abdomen.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bilateral pleural effusions, partially locuated on the left.there is adjacent compressive atelectasis.diffuse ground-glass opacities are nonspecific and may be related to pulmonary edema as seen on chest radiograph.there are mild mitral annular calcifications.the liver is normal without focal liver lesion identified.the gallbladder is absent.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilation.the spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly without hydronephrosis.diverticula are seen in the large bowel without adjacent inflammatory changes.the appendix is visualized and is normal (2:61).numerous hypodensities are seen in the kidneys, some of which are compatible with simple cysts, the others of which are too small to characterize, the largest in the right renal interpolar region measuring 2.8 x 3.2 cm.one lesion in the left renal interpolar region measures 2.6 x 1.6 cm with heterogeneous enhancement, and partial fat attenuation, and may be an angiomyolipoma.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber without obstruction.post-surgical changes are seen at the hiatus, compatible with the appearance of a fundoplication.the abdominal aorta is of normal caliber throughout with mild atherosclerotic calcifications.the main portal vein, splenic vein, and smv are patent.small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are not enlarged by size criteria.
summary: post-surgical changes at the hiatus, compatible with fundoplication.small bilateral pleural effusions, partially loculated on the left, with adjacent compressive atelectasis.heterogeneously enhancing left renal lesion, probably an angiomyolipoma, but further evaluation with non-urgent mri is recommended.dr.___ ___ was paged at 5:23pm ___ to discuss the findings and recommendations.finding #3 discussed with ___ (rn caring for the patient) by phone at 5:47pm ___.

text: limited view of the chest demonstrates a new small-to-moderate right pneumothorax.the left lung base is clear.again seen is the ptc drain extending from the left anterior upper abdomen through the left intrahepatic ducts and coiled within the proximal duodenum.there has been no significant change in segmental intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.also unchanged is the periductal cystic area in anterior segment ii.gallbladder is not seen.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is free passage of contrast through to the rectum.compared to ___, there remains colonic wall thickening of the cecum and ascending colon; however, this has improved.tubular structure seen in the right lower quadrant, thought to represent the appendix is again seen, but is somewhat smaller in caliber, now measuring 10 mm.there are no dilated loops of bowel.there is no obstruction.there has been decrease in a small amount of perihepatic ascites.there is no pathologic abdominal lymphadenopathy or free air.
summary: interval improvement in colonic wall thickening of the cecum and ascending colon consistent with inflammation or infection.interval decrease in size of appendix and reduction of free pelvic fluid.new small-to-moderate right pneumothorax.___ ptc drain in an unchanged position, with stable intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.this was discussed with dr.___ at 9:15 p.m.on ___.

text: abutting and displacing the right psoas muscle is a 5.5 x 6 cm aneurysm/pseudoaneurysm at the bifurcation of the common iliac artery similar in size from ___ but enlarged from ___.there is thrombus within the aneurysm/pseudoaneurysm and there is stranding of the adjacent retroperitoneal fat, new since ___.filling may be retrograde supplied by the transfemoral graft.small bowel abuts this region of inflammation (which is positive on the nuclear medicine study of ___); small bowel is unchanged in position from the ___ and the ___ studies which raises the possibility of adherence of the small bowel to this inflammatory site.numerous normal-sized inguinal and pelvic nodes are seen, more prominent on the right.the bladder and distal left ureter appear normal.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear normal.
summary: pseudoaneurysm or aneurysm at the bifurcation of the common iliac artery, significantly larger than on the ___, but stable in size from the recent ___ study, which displaces the right psoas muscle laterally.it contains thrombus and likely is filled in a retrograde fashion.mesenteric fat-stranding about this aneurysm/pseudoaneurysm and adjacent small bowel, which may be tethered to the site of inflammation, dut does not exhibit any definite ct signs suggestive of active crohn's disease.signs of either active or past crohn's disease are not seen in other portions of the bowel.right ureter may be caught up and obstructed in this inflammatory process in the right pelvis since the more proximal ureter is dilated in comparison with prior the study of ___.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, distal ureters and adnexa are unremarkable.the uterus appears to be surgically absent.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are noted.
summary: relatively stable appearance of large, 9.2 x 6.2 x 7.5 cm low-attenuation fluid collection within the lower anterior abdominal wall anterior to the abdominal fascia dating to janurary ___.diffuse atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and its major branch vessels.mild-to-moderate degenerative disease at the lower thoracic and lumbar spine.findings were posted to the ed dashboard.

text: there are sigmoid diverticula, without evidence of diverticulitis.the large bowel, bladder, and distal ureters are otherwise unremarkable.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.a focal metallic density is seen just inferior to the prostate, probably postoperative.examination of osseous structures show several regions of sclerosis and ring- like sclerosis involving the left iliac bone just superior to the acetabulum, the right iliac bone just adjacent to the sacroiliac joint.the sclerotic nature of these foci given a benign appearance.no significant soft tissue abnormalities are noted.
summary: no evidence of metastatic adenocarcinoma.there is diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis and a small soft tissue density in the subxiphoid region just anterior to the liver.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with associated atelectasis.a portion of this effusion is loculated medially.there is ascites surrounding the spleen and liver.the liver appears unremarkable on this noncontrast study.a gallstone is seen within the gallbladder.there is no evidence of wall thickening nor is there pericholecystic fluid.the pancreas and spleen are grossly normal.the kidneys are atrophic and contain scattered hypodensities too small to characterize but likely represent cysts.a single calcification is seen within the cortex of the right kidney.the adrenal glands are normal.contrast is seen through the mid jejunum.there is no extravasation of contrast in the region of the stomach or duodenum.there is no thickening of either the large or small bowel.there is haze throughout the mesentery, suggestive of mesenteric edema.multiple, scattered, nonpathologically enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes are present.there are also scattered, though nonpathologically enlarged, retroperitoneal nodes.no free air is seen within the abdomen.
summary: no evidence of bowel perforation.ascites.large fluid collection in the subcutaneous tissues on the right which could be a hematoma, although the density is lower than expected..no bowel wall thickening or focal stranding to suggest bowel inflammation.

text: there is a 13-mm hypodensity in segment ___, compatible with a benign cyst.in segment vii, centrally adjacent to the ivc, there is a 14-mm hypodense lesion with a peripheral focus of enhancement, possibly representing a hemangioma, unchanged from the prior study.there are numerous stones identified within the gallbladder, but no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid to suggest acute cholecystitis.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation.the spleen is normal.the pancreas is atrophic but without ductal dilation or focal masses.the right adrenal is normal.there is some thickening of the left adrenal, without distinct nodularity.an 18 x 32 mm exophytic solid mass arising from the interpolar region of the left kidney is again identified.numerous additional hypodense lesions of the kidneys bilaterally are too small to characterize, most compatible with cysts.renal parenchyma enhances symmetrically.there is no hydronephrosis.there is no perinephric fluid collection.the stomach is decompressed by an enteric tube.visualized intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable, without bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.the patient is status post right hemicolectomy, with ileocolic anastomosis in the right upper quadrant appearing unremarkable.the colon contains scattered stool and air, with a large stool ball in the rectum, extensive sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis or other colonic inflammatory process.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.the aorta is diffusely atherosclerotic, but normal in caliber.the major mesenteric vessels are patent, including the superior mesenteric and portal veins.the origins of the celiac axis and sma are calcified.
summary: multifocal ground-glass and tree-in-___ opacities in the lungs, with more dependent consolidative opacitied.while a component of pulmonary edema may be present, the findings are also concerning for aspiration versus evolving multifocal pneumonia.continued radiographic followup is warranted.status post right hemicolectomy, without evidence for surgical complication, including no evidence for fluid collection or abscess formation.solid exophytic renal mass extending from the interpolar region of the left kidney, unchanged from prior study.while this may represent a lipid-poor angiomyolipoma, renal cell carcinoma cannot be excluded and mri could be considered for more definitive diagnosis.large left posterior flank fluid collection again noted stable in size.this may represent a benign process such as a seroma or resolving hematoma.a denser component of the collection along its lateral aspect is more conspicuous today and may represent a more acute blood clot, enhancing soft tissue component cannot be excluded soft tissue thickening in the right groin stable cholelithiasis, without evidence of acute cholecystitis.aortic and coronary atherosclerosis.urgent findings were discussed with dr ___ by dr ___ shortly following imaging.

text: a minimal left pleural effusion is noted with some associated atelectasis.no lung nodules identified.below the diaphragm the liver is visualized and a focal area of low attenuation is seen in segment viii.no non-contrast ct is available.however the appearances are most likely consistent with a cyst.the spleen is normal.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys are normal.the pancreas is normal.no significant retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy noted.an ivc filter is in situ.the ivc is patent proximal to the ivc filter with no evidence of any thrombus.just distal to the ivc filter and proximal to the ivc bifurcation a filling defect is noted in the ivc.this thrombus extends into the left common iliac vein.this further extends into the left external iliac vein and left common femoral vein.the left internal iliac vein is not well evaluated but appears also to contain some thrombus.a peg tube is in situ and this appears to have been a recent placement with some free peritoneal air at the site of its insertion and deep to the anterior abdominal wall with some air also extending into the anterior abdominal musculature.a radiopaque bony density measuring 10 cm is situated just superficial to the anterior abdominal wall musculature and in the subcutaneous fat.upon discussion with the team this represents part of the patient's cranium status post craniectomy.just deep to this note is made of a collection which contains fluid and air.the left rectus abdominis muscle is thickened and heterogenous and this heterogeneity extends posterior to the rectus abdominis muscle and the appearances are likely consistent with a rectus sheath hematoma.some high attenuation is present in this hematoma which may be contrast extravasation and active hemorrhage.no old cts available for comparison.the remainder of the bowel where visualized is normal.no free fluid.
summary: ivc thrombus extending into left common iliac vein, left external and internal iliac veins and left common femoral veins.left rectus sheath hematoma.part of patient's cranium, recently placed surgically to ensure viability of same, over right lower quadrant and subcutaneous tissue superficial to the abdominal muscle with a collection just deep to it.clinical correlation advised ivc filter in situ.collapsed t12 vertebra.rectus sheath hematoma with probable active hemorrhage.peg tube in situ with some free intraperitoneal status post placement.dr ___ ___, pager ___, has been contact___ regarding these findings at 20.00 on ___.

text: there is small amount of free pelvic fluid.small amount of stool is seen within the rectum.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.patient is post-hysterectomy.there is a foley catheter within urinary bladder.
summary: findings of persistent small-bowel obstruction, with transition point not definitely identified, but thought to be within distal ileum.slight increase in size of right greater than left pleural effusions.no evidence of drainable fluid collection in the abdomen or pelvis.

text: again identified is a small fibroid within the uterus.the uterus and adnexa are otherwise unremarkable.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.no free fluid or masses.bone windows redemonstrate diffuse sclerotic bone lesions within the iliac bones, sacrum, spine, and ribs.however, new on the current study are sclerotic lesions identified within the vertebral bodies of t9 through l4, as well as within the left posterior 10th rib.
summary: progression of disease with new metastatic liver lesions, and increased involvement of the lower thoracic and lumbar spine.interval resolution of right upper lobe collapse.large left and small right pleural effusion.interval enlargement of a single anterior mediastinal lymph node, measuring 1.4 x 0.8 cm.

text: the urinary bladder, prostate gland, and seminal vesicles are normal.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: three stable liver lesions.no evidence of local tumor recurrence in the resection bed.no lymphadenopathy or other new lesions

text: the left lower lobe is consolidated.patchy right middle and lower lobe consolidations are also noted.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the liver is unremarkable.small stones are noted in the gallbladder which is fairly distended.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and bowel loops are stable within the limits of the study without iv contrast.a gastrostomy tube is again noted.there is no free air.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.no evidence of hydronephrosis or hydroureter.continued pulmonary consolidations consistent with pneumonia.cholelithiasis.

text: bowel loops are grossly normal, given lack of oral contrast.the bladder wall appears somewhat thickened, which may be due to collapse.the prostate is normal.there are numerous phleboliths in the pelvis.no free air, free fluid, or lymphadenopathy is identified.bone windows show extensive degenerative changes of the spine.there is evidence of previous laminectomy at multiple lumbar levels, unchanged.there is mild scoliosis of the lower lumbar spine.no fractures are seen.
summary: intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, with possible filling defect seen at distal common bile duct, which in retrospect was seen on the ___ ct scan.the gallbladder is absent.this was discussed with dr.___ in person at 8:30 p.m., ___.if clinically indicated, right upper ultrasound may be useful for further evaluation of this finding.multiple bilateral renal cysts.these are not significantly changed since the exam of ___.small splenule in anterior aspect of the spleen.no evidence of bowel pathology, free fluid, or free air.bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.extensive degenerative changes of the spine.

text: two right lower quadrant pig-tail drains are new in the interval and reside within the largest of the extensive, loculated rim- enhancing fluid collections, slightly decreased in size in the interval.soft tissue surrounding the aorta and iliac branches is unchanged.the bladder is unremarkable.

text: direct comparison is made to prior exam dated ___.the lung bases are grossly clear.the liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas appear unremarkable.calcification again seen within the left adrenal gland.the right adrenal gland appears unremarkable.the kidneys appear normal.evaluation of the bowel reveals fatty infiltration of the wall of the duodenum.this finding is consistent with the patient's history of celiac sprue.the bowel is otherwise grossly unremarkable.pelvic structures are grossly normal.the patient is status post hysterectomy.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.marked levoscoliosis of the lumbar spine is incidentally noted.
summary: no acute abnormality is identified.findings of fatty infiltration of the wall of the duodenum, a finding seen with celiac sprue.

text: oral contrast opacifies the stomach and colon.a percutaneous gastrostomy tube appears positioned within the stomach lumen.no extraluminal contrast spillage is seen.moderate pneumoperitoneum is present (2b:14).mild atrophy of the native kidneys is better visualized on the ct examination from 6:30 p.m.
summary: no evidence of contrast spillage following oral contrast administration.appropriately positioned percutaneous gastrostomy tube terminating within the stomach lumen.moderate pneumoperitoneum.please refer to the 6:30 p.m.study for a more complete evaluation of the abdomen and pelvis.

text: foley catheter is within a decompressed bladder.there is a catheter noted within the rectum.there is large amount of stool in the rectosigmoid.no bowel wall thickeinng or obstruction is seen.the uterus shows prominent endometrial cavity.visualized osseous structures show multilevel degenerative changes as well as diffusely heterogeneous bones which could relate to osteopenia.however, if patient has a history of malignancy then this could be further evaluated on an outpatient mri.there is sclerosis at the sacroiliac joints.degenerative changes in the spine are noted.pelvic subcutaneous dependent edema is noted.
summary: no acute ct findings to explain patient's symptoms.no bowel wall thickening.nodular contour of the liver suggests cirrhosis.upper abdominal varices.subtle hypodensity in the liver adjacent to the falciform ligament on axial images was not substantiated on reformats and may be artifactual.prominence of the endometrial cavity is not optimally evaluated on this study.given postmenopausal status of the patient consider an nonemergent pelvic ultrasound for further evaluation.abundant fecal loading in the rectosigmoid, could relate to constipation in the appropriate clinical setting.dr.___ was notified of the updated read at 11:24 p.m.on ___.

text: lung bases show minimal bibasilar dependent atelectasis, with no pneumothoraces.liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, stomach, small and large bowel, intra-abdominal great vessels, kidneys, ureters, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.there is no free fluid, no free air, and no lymphadenopathy in the abdomen.
summary: no solid organ injuries.l2 vertebra by burst fracture, with bone fragments within the spinal canal and small retroperitoneal hematoma.

text: the bladder, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is no inguinal or deep pelvic lymph adenopathy.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: percutaneous biliary drainage catheter terminating in the common duct.persistent and slightly increased size of periportal fluid collection.prominent intrahepatic left bile duct.splenomegaly.no evidence of abscess.small vague subpleural opacities within the lungs, nonspecific, which may relate to atelectasis or an infectious/inflammatory etiology.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, and distal colon are unremarkable.
summary: interval decrease in size of intrahepatic fluid collection with pigtail catheter present.patent portal venous stent and portal venous system.decrease in size of left anterior abdominal wall fluid collection.stable pneumobilia with cbd stent in place.

text: the patient is status post partial gastrectomy, with postoperative changes in the abdominal wall, with soft tissue and fat stranding.previously noted small collection at the level of umbilicus has decreased in size, and there is no definitive collection identified.there is ill-defined hypodensity at the postoperative site adjacent to a newly edematous duodenal stump near the suture line, measuring 3.4 x 2.6 cm, increased in size since prior study.no thick wall to the collection.gallbladder is asymmetrically thick-walled, moreso toward the duodenal stump and with adjacent fat stranding continuous from the fluid collection.pancreatic parenchyma appears slightly edematous in the head and there is mild fat stranding adjacent to the postoperative collection.there is retrograde flow of contrast to the duodenal stump.contrast readily passes through the g-j anastamosis and the j-j anastamosis.there is a small hypodensity in the liver, unchanged since prior study, however, no other focal liver lesion is noted.again note is made of diffuse extrahepatic ductal prominence, measuring up to 1 cm, unchanged since prior study.spleen is unremarkable.adrenal glands and visualized portion of large and small intestines are within normal limits.small mesenteric nodes are noted.there are small bilateral renal cysts and left parapelvic cyst.small reactive lymph nodes are noted.
summary: further decrease of the collection in the abdominal wall at incision, with remaining soft tissue stranding.increase in size of fluid collection at the postoperative site adjacent to an edematous duodenal stump, measuring 3.4 cm with surrounding fat stranding extending to gallbladder, peripancreatic area, and proximal jejunum from the gastrojejunostomy.the process is non- specific, and differential diagnosis include duodenitis, leak from the stump, pancreatitis, or even recent gall bladder perforation.renal and parapelvic cyst.sigmoid diverticulosis and bladder diverticula.retrograde flow in the jejunal limb.patent anastamoses.wet read was provided to ed dashboard.

text: there is diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon, with adjacent fat stranding, compatible with acute uncomplicated diverticulitis.there is no free fluid or fluid collection in the pelvis.the urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: mass-like cecal wall thickening.differential diagnosis includes lymphoma/leukemia, carcinoma or typhlitis.pseudo-thickening secondary to retained stool is less likely.when acute symptoms resolve, recommend correlation with colonoscopy and biopsy.alternatively, repeated imaging can be performed.acute uncomplicated sigmoid diverticulitis.

text: the visualized portions of the lung demonstrate bilateral dependent atelectasis.there are no nodules, masses or pleural effusions.the heart size is normal and there is no pericardial effusion.the liver enhances homogeneously without masses.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there is no evidence for biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenals are normal.incidentally noted is a small amount of fat seen within the tail of the pancreas and is unchanged since prior exam.there are two large right renal cysts and a smaller hypodensity in the inferior right kidney which is too small to characterize but also likely represents a cyst.otherwise, the kidneys enhance homogeneously and excrete contrast without hydronephrosis.there is a mild amount of atherosclerosis about the abdominal aorta and bilateral iliac arteries.the portal vein, splenic vein and superior mesenteric vein are patent.there is no lymphadenopathy.the patient is status post hysterectomy.the bladder is full, but unremarkable.there is extensive sigmoid diverticulosis, without diverticulitis.
summary: no findings to explain patient's weight loss, specifically no evidence for intra-abdominal malignancy.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis.extensive stable degenerative changes of the lumbar spine as noted above.

text: the lung bases demonstrate no significant change in the diffuse ground-glass opacities.there remains a tiny right pleural effusion.the liver and spleen continue to demonstrate multiple punctate low attenuation foci, two within the liver and one within the spleen.these are unchanged in appearance from previous exam.there is an additionally, approximately 1 cm low attenuation focus within the anterior/inferior portion of the liver which is also not changed in size/appearance since the previous exam.there is a tiny amount of pericholecystic fluid.the gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys are otherwise, unchanged in appearance since the previous exam.the visualized abdominal vessels and opacified loops of large/small bowel are stable.there is no free air or new lymphadenopathy.
summary: no interval change in the appearance of the liver and spleen.no new hepatic or splenic lesions.stable ground-glass opacities within both lung bases.stable small right pleural effusion.slightly thickened walls of the rectosigmoid colon.these findings are non-specific, but correlation with patient's clinical examination is recommended.no evidence of intestinal obstruction.

text: a diverting colostomy is present which is filled with oral contrast in the right lower quadrant.contrast is also passing through the native colon into the rectum, where there is a moderate volume of stool.there are changes from chronic osteomyelitis throughout the distal lumbar spine and pelvis, with a large soft tissue mass in the presacral space.new since the prior study are air bubbles in the soft tissue mass and adjacent stranding.a soft tissue defect is present along the posterior paraspinal tissues extending from the inferior aspect of l2 through the sacrum.there is an adjacent fluid collection which also demonstrates internal air.air in this location could be due to recent debridement.a large skin defect is present over the right ischial tuberosity, where there is also chronic osteomyelitis change in the right hip joint.there are no intrapelvic fluid collections.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.the bladder contains a foley catheter.there are multiple pelvic lymph nodes in the iliac chains and perirectal space.
summary: no intraabdominal or intrapelvic abscess.new air bubbles in presacral soft tissue mass, worrisome for infection.air bubbles along posterior paraspinal chronic osteomyelitis in previously seen fluid collection.this could be due to debridement or represent acute infection.

text: the lung bases demonstrate bilateral trace pleural effusions with atelectasis.calcified atherosclerotic disease is also seen in the coronary arteries.within the limits of a non-contrast study: the liver shows no intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is distended with a locule of gas (2a; 30) and also contains contrast material.these are compatible with patient's known recent ercp.the pancreas demonstrates moderate amount of peripancreatic fat stranding.a plastic stent is seen in the pancreatic head coursing into the duodenum.there is no pancreatic duct dilation.there is no surrounding fluid collection.the spleen and adrenal glands appear normal.the kidneys appear atrophic but show no hydronephrosis.oral contrast has advanced to the transverse colon and there are no dilated small or large bowel loops.there is no lymphadenopathy, free air, or free fluid.calcified atherosclerotic disease is noted at the origin of the major aortic branch points.
summary: pancreatitis; stent extending from the distal common bile duct into the duodenum; no evidence of pseudocyst.no extraluminal air to suggest bowel perforation.extensive atherosclerotic disease.stable atrophic kidneys.

text: there is diffuse colinic wall thickening with proliferation of the mesenteric fat, most pronounced in the sigmoid and rectal regions, though evident in the transverse colon as well.there is no abscess.there are no sinus tracts or fistulae.the appendix is normal.there is no free fluid or free air.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: pancolitis compatible with provided history of ulcerative colitis.

text: there is a small right-sided pleural effusion.there is right lower lobe atelectasis.there is small ascites.there is likely periportal edema, a nonspecific finding.limited non-contrast evaluation of the spleen and adrenal glands is unremarkable.pancreas appears grossly unremarkable, although enhancement characteristics may not be assessed without iv contrast.note is made of stranding in the right anterior and posterior pararenal spaces.stomach is unremarkable.small bowel loops are of normal caliber with no wall thickening.note is made of submucosal fatty proliferation in the large bowel with no definite large bowel wall thickening.there is an exophytic lesion at the lower pole of the left kidney with hounsfield attenuation value of 50 that is incompletely assessed on this non-contrast study.there is extensive atherosclerotic disease.there is focal ectasia of the aorta with maximal anteroposterior diameter of 3.0cm and transverse diameter of 3.2cm.no intra- abdominal free air.
summary: small right-sided pleural effusion and right lower lobe atelectasis.small ascites.nonspecific stranding in the anterior and posterior right pararenal spaces.correlation with patient's amylase and lipase is recommended.**4.3.2 cm abdominal aortic aneurysm.follow-up recommended.right kidney small hyperdense lesion.evaluation with us recommended.

text: there has been near complete resolution of the mid abdominal fluid collection.there is a small amount of residual fluid (1.5 x 2.5 cm).the percutaneous biliary drainage tube and periportal drain are unchanged.again seen is a small amount of fluid in the pericolic gutters.the remainder of the exam is not significantly changed.
summary: marked reduction in size of mid abdominal fluid collection as described.

text: there are no pleural effusions.the lung bases appear clear.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear within normal limits.parts of the proximal small bowel are slightly prominent in caliber measuring up to 30 mm in diameter and distal parts of the small bowel are mildly fluid filled.the appearance suggests a mild ileus of small bowel.the terminal ileum is mostly collapsed.there is a small hyperdense focus in the lumen which probably represents enteric contrast which has passed through into the distal ileum.despite underdistension the wall appears minimally prominent in caliber, but the possibility of backwash ileitis could be considered to account for the appearance.the entirety of the colon shows wall thickening in the distal part of the colon within the sigmoid and to some extent transverse colon shows effacement of usual haustrations.there is also a small quantity of ill-defined fluid in the right paracolic gutter and fat stranding about ascending colon.
summary: findings consistent with pancolitis.collapsed terminal ileum which is difficult to evaluate but with mildly prominent wall thickness, equivocal for inflammation that could be seen with backwash ileitis.no evidence of drainable fluid collection.

text: aside from mild atelectasis, the lung bases are clear.lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of the abdominal viscera for focal lesions.allowing for this limitation, the gallbladder is unremarkable.calcified hepatic granulmoata are unchanged.the spleen is normal in size.the pancreas and adrenals are unremarkable.the kidneys are normal in their non-contrast appearances, without hydronephrosis or stones.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.the stomach, small bowel, and colon are normal in caliber.there are no enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.
summary: no renal or ureteral stones.the previously identified enhancement along the course of the urethra is not seen on this non-contrast study.

text: bilateral subsegmental atelectasis is seen.mild bilateral pleural effusion is identified.coarse calcifications of the mitral valve.a nasogastric tube is seen with its tip in the stomach.normal anatomy of the stomach is seen without small or large bowel interposition between the stomach and the anterior abdominal wall.normal appearance of the duodenum with normal position of the treitz ligament.a subcentimeter hypodense focus is seen in the liver (2, 25), too small to characterize.otherwise, no gross pathology is seen within the liver.the gallbladder is mildly dilated with small stones within it (unchanged from prior examination).no signs of cholecystitis are seen.punctate calcifications are seen within the spleen, unchanged from prior examination and most consistent with old granulomatous disease.the pancreas and both adrenals are unremarkable.simple cyst is seen in the upper pole of the left kidney measuring 24 x 23 mm (2, 27).no evidence of renal stones, hydronephrosis is seen.an irregularity of the right renal cortex is identified (2, 34) and might be consistent with old pyelonephritis.the visualized small and large bowels are within normal limits.atherosclerotic changes are seen along the course of the aorta, which is of normal caliber.
summary: bilateral small nonhemorrhagic pleural effusion with secondary subsegmental atelectasis.cholelithiasis without signs of cholecystitis.no findings to suggest prior abdominal surgery

text: mild-to-moderate right hydronephrosis extends to the level just proximal to the ureterovesicular junction where question is raised of a small intraluminal filling defect (300b:38).periureteal stranding at this level is mild.no obvious ureteral or intravesicular calculi are identified.the decompressed bladder contains a foley catheter.calcifications along the course of the foley are likley prostatic, and may represent the "uvj stone" seen on ultrasound.there is no free pelvic fluid or pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.bone windows reveal no concerning osteolytic or sclerotic lesions.multilevel thoracolumbar spondylosis and facet arthropathy is observed.
summary: moderate right hydronephrosis with an intraureteral filling defect just proximal to an apparent transition point in the distal ureter proximal to the ureterovesicular junction.while these findings may represent a recent passed stone with intraureteral blood clot, an obstructing ureteral neoplasm is not excluded.comparison to outside ct would be helpful; however, if this is not available, further evaluation with mru may be indicated.persistent right nephrogram, indicates at least moderate obstruction.aneurysmal dilatation of the descending thoracic and upper abdominal aorta.known type b dissection is not well evaluated on this study.small calcified left ventricular apex aneurysm.right grreater than left basilar lung consolidation may reflect atelectasis.

text: the lung bases show patchy ground glass opacities at the bilateral lung bases, likely representing atelectasis.there are no pleural effusions.there is a gj tube in the stomach and proximal small bowel.enteric contrast is seen in distal loops of small bowel and colon.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and intra-abdominal great vessels are within normal limits.bilateral kidneys show symmetrical excretion of contrast, with no renal masses or hydronephrosis.there is a low attenuation area in the posterior mid pole region of the right kidney which measures -32 ___, likely representing a small angiomyolipoma.multiple attenuation areas in the left kidney, the largest measuring 3.3 x 2.9 cm, likely represent renal cysts.bilateral adrenal glands and ureters are normal.there is no free fluid, and no free air in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: gj tube in the stomach and proximal small bowel.suprapubic urinary catheter.angiomyolipoma in the right kidney.multiple renal cysts in the left kidney.no hydronephrosis.no intrabdominal abscess or free fluid.soft tissue mass with internal calcifications in the right groin could represent an enlarged lymph node or undescended testicle.given the enlarged prostate, neoplasm is a possible etiology.correlation with physical exam is necessary.further evaluation by mri or biopsy could be performed for better characterization.

text: there are coronary artery calcification .the imaged portions of the lung bases demonstrate bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.liver again demonstrates a low attenuation lesion in the right lobe with associated calcification that is better evaluated on the contrast study obtained on ___.stomach appears to be in place in its entirety and does not abut the anterior abdominal wall due to interposition of the transverse colon between the stomach and the anterior abdominal wall.there is a j-tube that appears to enter the jejunum with an apparent distal balloon.no large fluid collection is seen in the subcutaneous tissues along the j-tube tract.no extravasation of oral contrast is seen.ivc filter and right upper quadrant arterial coils are noted.adrenals are prominent with no focal masses.the pancreas is unremarkable.bilateral low-attenuation renal lesions are again seen, and better demonstrated on the previous contrast- enhanced study.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis bilaterally.large bowel is unremarkable.no intra-abdominal free air is identified.atherosclerosis of the aorta and iliac vessels is noted.
summary: no extravasation of contrast is seen.no subcutaneous fluid or abscess is demonstrated along the j-tube tract.unchanged low attenuation lesion in the right lobe of the liver with associated hyperdensity that could represent calcification.further evaluation could be performed with mri.bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.

text: the patient is status post cystectomy with formation of a neobladder and right-sided ureterostomy.appearance of postoperative changes in the pelvis appears similar to prior studies, with unchanged presacral soft tissue.no pelvic free fluid or adenopathy is noted.pelvic floor reconstruction is unchanged in appearance.
summary: obstructing right ureteropelvic junction 6 x 4 mm calculus causes obstruction with prominent perinephric stranding and fluid.otherwise, postoperative changes are as previously seen.findings were initially posted on the ed dashboard upon completion of the study.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate and seminal vesicles, rectum and distal sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.small bilateral fat-containing inguinal hernias.additional note is made of equivocal gastric wall thickening, which might simply relate to collapse.small axial hiatal hernia.
summary: allowing for limitations of the study, interval progression in colonic wall thickening extending from cecum to splenic flexure of colon consistent with ongoing colitis.no evidence of bowel obstruction or perforation.slight increase in size of a small left pleural effusion, low in density, and adjacent atelectasis.bilateral nonobstructing renal stones.equivocal thickening of the gastric wall is poorly evaluated on this non-contrast enhanced study with a collapsed stomach.findings could simply relate to underdistension, although fold thickening cannot be excluded.small axial hiatal hernia.

text: the bladder, prostate, seminal vesicles, distal ureters, and rectum appear normal.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of acute process in the abdomen or pelvis.left renal mass, which on prior mri (___) was concerning for renal cell carcinoma.appropriate followup should be performed.this was documented in the emergency department dashboard at the time of the study.

text: there are coronary calcifications.there is atelectasis and consolidation at the lung bases.again seen is high attenuation material in the nephrectomy beds bilaterally extending down the paracolic gutters consistent with retroperitoneal hematoma.the extent is not significantly changed compared to the prior examination.surgical clips are seen at the site of prior nephrectomy.contrast is seen within the gallbladder.the liver is normal.a hypodensity in the spleen is unchanged.tiny foci of low attenuation in the pancreatic tail are not as well evaluated on this non-contrast examination.the adrenal glands, as well as the visualized loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.small foci of intraperitoneal free air are consistent with recent laparoscopic surgery.
summary: no significant change in extent of retroperitoneal hematomas in the nephrectomy bed tracking down the pericolic gutters.free intraperitoneal air status post nephrectomy.coronary artery calcifications.small pancreatic tail hypodensities not well assessed.see prior report of ___.

text: multiple colonic diverticula are seen.additionally, there appears to be a diverticulum right at the level of the stoma.contrast is present throughout the colon and in within the colostomy bag.there is no free air within the abdomen.again, the uterus is fibroid.there is a new 3.5 x 3.5 cm cystic-appearing lesion in the right adnexa, which was not apparent in ___.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.there are marked degenerative changes of the lumbar spine.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.there is a tiny sub-cm bone island in the sacrum.multiplanar reformatted images are obtained, which support these findings.
summary: no evidence of obstruction or perforation.left renal lower pole cystic-appearing mass has slightly increased in size in the interval.the ct attenuation characteristics of this is at the borderline for a cyst.confirmation of the cystic nature of this may be performed by ultrasound or mri; future ct may confirm stability.there is a new 3.5 cm right adnexal cystic-appearing mass.in a patient who is post- menopausal, evaluation by pelvic ultrasound is suggested for further characterization of this lesion.there is a 1.6 cm nodule anterior to the right pulmonary vein, of unclear clinical significance.this has changed minimally since the study of ___ ___.

text: there is colonic diverticulosis, though no signs of acute diverticulitis.no pelvic free fluid is identified.enlargement of the prostate gland is again noted measuring 5.1 x 4.4 cm, similar in size compared to prior examination.protrusion of an enlarged prostate gland into the posterior wall of the bladder is unchanged from prior.large coarse bladder calculi are also stable.seminal vesicles are unremarkable.
summary: diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.appendix not visualized, though no secondary signs of acute appendicitis.porcelain gallbladder.stable infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring up to 4.5 cm.unchanged calcified enlarged prostate gland.stable 8-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.new compression deformities of the l3 and t12 vertebral bodies, though appear subacute.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions with a right lower lobe opacity could reflect atelectasis and/or pneumonia.the imaged portion of the heart base is unremarkable with trace pericardial effusion.limited non-contrast evaluation of the liver demonstrates minimal periportal edema and perihepatic ascites.the hepato- caval anastomosis is largely unremarkable.a subhepatic drain exiting in the right lower quadrant is noted.there is marked indistinctness in the periportal and pancreatic region, likely post surgical.the adrenals and visualized portions of the pancreas are unremarkable.there are multiple fluid-filled foci that are tracking along the bowel loops, which appear smaller in certai areas and larger in others suggesting redistribution.the splenectomy bed demonstrates a collection measuring 6.6 x 5.8 cm, which is now lower attenuation otherwise grossly unchanged since the prior study with two drains in situ.ng tube is extending into the stomach.the previously noted bowel wall thickening and dilation has now resolved and bowel loops are grossly unremarkable.contrast has passed through to the distal ileum.there is no evidence of obstruction.
summary: post-surgical changes from hepatic transplant and splenectomy with unchanged fluid collection in the splenectomy bed and multiple small fluid pockets with interval redistribution as described above.interval resolution of bowel wall thickening.no evidence of bowel pathology with passage of contrast up to the distal ileum.no evidence of obstruction.bilateral pleural effusion with patchy right lower lobe consolidation could reflect atelectasis and/or pneumonia.foley catheter in situ with moderate residual urine, question catheter function.

text: the liver measures 25 cm in the craniocaudal dimension and the spleen measures 12.5 cm in the ap dimension.there is no evidence of focal liver lesion.the kidneys are unremarkable except to note a 1.4 cm hypodense lesion in the interpolar region of the left kidney measuring fluid density (15 ___).the splenic, smv, and portal veins are patent.the celiac axis is patent.several sub 1.5 cm hypodensities in both kidneys likely represent cysts, but are too small to characterize.scattered subcentimeter nodes in the mesentery are not enlarged by ct size criteria.the abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable without evidence of pneumatosis, free air or obstruction.
summary: diffuse bilateral ground glass opacities and scattered areas of focal consolidation has a wide differential which includes infectious (aspiration, pcp or viral), inflammatory (drug reaction from bleomycin) or neoplastic (multifocal bac) etiologies.followup after therapy can be obtained to ensure resolution of these lesions.hilar and mediastinal adenopathy may be reactive or may reflect burkitt's lymphoma recurrence and should be followed to resolution.fusion of the left transverse process of l5 to s1 increases risk for degenerative disc disease at l4-l5.mild hepatosplenomagealy.severe apical bullous emphysema.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis.the liver is stable in appearance.mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is again seen.the gallbladder and common duct are also stable.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.again noted is small nodular fullness of the left adrenal gland.the right adrenal gland and kidneys are stable.multiple bilateral renal cysts are again seen.the stomach is unremarkable.loops of small and large bowel are diffusely fluid filled.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: no free air or free fluid to suggest colonic perforation.diffusely air-filled loops of small and large bowel and slight thickening of the sigmoid colon.this is suggestive of an enterocolitis, however, the appearance is not significantly changed compared to several prior cts.

text: the evaluation of the pelvis is limited by streaky artifact from patient's left hip prostheses.the bladder, rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is small amount of free fluid in the pelvis, slightly more than on the previous examination.there are no pathologically enlarged lymphatic nodes seen in the pelvis or inguinal region.there is diffuse subcutaneous soft tissue edema.there is a large defect in the anterior abdominal wall.
summary: no perinephric stranding, no perinephric fluid collection.

text: the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the prostate gland, seminal vesicles, and rectum are unremkable.a rectal catheter is in place.there are multiple sigmoid diverticula without associated inflammatory changes.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: focal areas of intramural hyperattenuation of several small bowel loops on early post-contrast images, concerning for active extravasation.small hiatal hernia.small pericardial effusion.scattered sigmoid diverticula with no associated inflammatory changes.left renal hypodense lesion of intermediate density, with no apparent enhancement, compatible with a proteinaceous or hemorrhagic cyst.a 1.8 x 1.3 hypodense lesion arising from the greater curvature of the stomach, is on nonspecific appearance, and maybe further assessed with eus, as clinically indiated.finginds discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ at 4:40 am ___.

text: a balloon foley catheter tip is seen within the bladder.no free fluid.the prostate is enlarged.the vascular structures are intact.intrapelvic bowel loops are normal.bone windows show a fracture of the right inferior ramus, right sacrum, right pubic bone, and l2 vertebral body and left lamina.soft tissue stranding is seen adjacent to the right pubic bone fracture in the space of retzius, as well as anterior to the l2 fracture, consistent with minimal amount of hemorrhage.there is > 50% compromise of the spinal canal at the l2 level.
summary: no evidence of solid organ injury, or focal intraabdominal or retroperitoneal hematoma.minimal amount of soft tissue stranding consistent with blood products is seen adjacent to fractures, as described above.fracture of the l2 vertebral body and left lamina, right sacrum, right pubic bone, and right inferior ramus.> 50% narrowing of central canal at l2 level -- please see report of ct t- and l- spine of the same day for further details.

text: there is a left common iliac artery stent beginning at the origin of the left common iliac artery and terminating just proximal to location of probable site of bleeding, although it is difficult to assess with certainty as to the exact location of the origin of bleed.comparison with mri is also difficult secondary to differing anatomic landmarks and plain acquisition.allowing for these differences, the acute hemorrhage on the prior mri appeared to originate approximately 2.5 cm below the aortic bifurcation, which would be expected to be at or just distal to the distal tip of the existing left common iliac stent.again noted is the large multilobulated pseudoaneurysm lateral to the left common iliac artery.allowing for differences in technique, the pseudoaneurysm and left hematoma are not significantly changed from the mra performed earlier today and extends into the left psoas muscle.there is stable moderate left hydroureteronephrosis to the level of large left retroperitoneal hematoma.there is a large right inguinal hernia with fat herniating into the right scrotum.the liver, galbladder, spleen, bilateral adrenal glands, pancreas, and right kidney are unremarkable.the visualized loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no evidence of intraperitoneal free air.the osseous structures demonstrates orthopedic hardware within the lumbar spine which obscures the adjacent soft tissues.degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine are noted.
summary: left common iliac arterial stent spanning from the origin of the left common iliac artery and likely ending at or just proximal to the probable location of arterial bleed (based on the prior mri), although the exact origin of bleed is difficult to definitively assess secondray to comparison with differing technique of mra and significant obscuration caused by the large left retroperitoneal hematoma and adjacent orthopedic hardware.there has been no significant change in size of left mulilobulated pseudoaneurysm and hematoma as compared to mra performed earlier today.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at 6:35pm on ___.

text: dense vascular calcifications are again noted.bladder is nondistended and contains a foley catheter.there is prominence to the right posterior lateral aspect of the rectal wall.there is no free pelvic fluid.uterus is unremarkable.
summary: small right pleural effusion.bibasilar atelectasis, right greater than left.dense vascular calcifications.large hiatal hernia.apparent non-specific large bowel wall thickening without stranding or pneumatosis.a component of bowel ischemia cannot be excluded.if clinical symptoms persist, a followup study could be performed to evaluate progression/change.

text: no consolidation at the lung bases.there is no pleural effusion.there is trace pericardial effusion within physiologic range.there are multiple punctate hypodensities in the liver, too small to be characterized; however similar to ct from ___.the gallbladder, spleen, bilateral adrenal glands and pancreas appear within normal limits.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast symmetrically with no evidence of hydronephrosis.the stomach and loops of small bowel appear within normal limits.there is a single intra-abdominal focus of free air on the right (2:37), uncertain if extraluminal, could be post-surgica or may relate to the appendix which courses nearby.there are atherosclerotic changes in the abdominal aorta; however, the aorta is of normal caliber.
summary: status post radical prostatectomy.large fluid collection containing numerous foci of gas and peripheral rim enhancing, raising concern for abscess/infected collection.bladder collapsed and not fully assessed on this study.please note that patient had subsequent ct cystogram on ___ which demonstrated extraperitoneal bladder rupture.ovoid hyperdense structure in the right pelvis, non-specific, may represent post-surgical hematoma.small amount of free fluid tracking along the paracolic gutter, some measure hyperdense, could be free fluid or small amount of hemorrhage post-surgical.single focus of air in the right mid abdomen, uncertain if it is extraluminal, could be related to recent surgery or tip of the appendix.multiple punctate hypodensities in the liver, incompletely characterized; however, appear similar to ct from ___.

text: imaging is repeated through the abdomen due to motion.the visualized lung bases show no focal consolidation nor pleural effusion.small pericardial effusion appears slightly increased compared to a ct torso of ___, measuring 11 mm at thickest points.7-mm ill-defined hypodensity in the left lobe of the liver corresponds to a small hemangioma seen on recent mri (2b:63).extremely subtle isodense 7.5-cm rounded lesion in the posterior right hepatic lobe with faint hypoechoic anterior rim corresponds to focal nodular hyperplasia seen on the same mri.otherwise, no new liver lesion is seen.the gallbladder is not distended.the spleen and three small splenules appear unremarkable.the pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, ureters, stomach, and visualized loops of small bowel, colon and appendix appear unremarkable.no free air or free fluid is noted within the abdomen.the abdominal aorta is of normal caliber.no lymph node enlargement is seen meeting ct size criteria for adenopathy.
summary: 7.5-cm right isodense right hepatic and 7-mm hypodense left hepatic lesions correspond to focal nodular hyperplasia and hemangioma, respectively, as seen on recent mri of 13 days prior.no new findings in the liver or spleen.small pericardial effusion, unchanged from ___, slightly larger since ___.

text: the rectum and sigmoid are decompressed.the bladder and prostate are normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.
summary: ct of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis with no evidence of traumatic vascular or solid organ injury.acute fracture of the posterior right 9th rib, without pneumothorax.fatty liver.unremarkable ct of the thoracic spine with no evidence of fracture.normal ct of the lumbar spine with no evidence of fracture.

text: the bladder is markedly distended.the distal ureters appear unremarkable.the uterus, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable with the exception of sigmoid diverticulosis but no evidence of diverticulitis.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.pelvic lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: jp drain seen terminating near the gallbladder fossa.low-attenuation fluid collections within the liver, the largest measures 7.6 x.2.2 x 1 cm.the differential diagnosis includes postoperative intrahepatic hematoma, biloma; however, an infectious process cannot be excluded.correlate with drain output.no billiary dilation.portal vein is patent.colonic diverticulosis without diverticulitis.bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar compressive atelectasis.markedly distended bladder.

text: the rectum, sigmoid appear unremarkable.small amount of air is seen within the bladder, likely secondary to foley catheterization.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: multiple large mediastinal lymph nodes.evidence of lung fibrosis with interstitial and alveolar changes, consistent with history of interstitial lung disease.acute comminuted left femoral neck fracture.

text: non-contrast appearance of the liver is unremarkable.there is a small amount of perihepatic free fluid.gallbladder is collapsed.the spleen is unremarkable.adrenal glands appear normal bilaterally.the pancreas is grossly normal.kidneys have been internally decompressed with bilateral ureteral stents in place with proximal coils well positioned in the bilateral renal pelves and distal coils in the urinary bladder.nonspecific perinephric stranding is stable.the abdominal aorta contains atherosclerotic calcifications notably at the origin of the major branch vessel.there is no aneurysm seen.retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not appear enlarged.the stomach is decompressed.the duodenum appears grossly unremarkable.
summary: diffuse distention and mild dilation of small and large bowel without transition and with numerous air-fluid levels seen.overall, the configuration suggests a diagnosis of gastroenteritis, though clinical correlation is strongly advised.slight interval increase in right-sided simple-appearing pleural effusion.stable volume of small abdominal ascites.interval placement of bilateral ureteral stents with resolution of previously noted hydronephrosis.

text: no pathologically enlarged nodes within the pelvis, retroperitoneum, mesentery.the urinary bladder is catheterized with a moderate amount of air.the prostate contains a few calcifications.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of splenic rupture.splenomegaly.cirrhotic liver with varices.right middle lobe opacity which in appropriate clinical setting could represent aspiration.focal nodular densities within the right lower and right middle lobe which are nonspecific, may represent atypical atelectasis but can be re-evaluated for stability/ resolution on follow up scan.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate, seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.beginning in the right inguinal canal and extending to the upper scrotum, is a 6.9 cm fluid collection, little changed in size since ___, but containing a new focus of gas within its caudad extent.just inferior to this, a 2.8 x 3.9 cm collection is seen very superficial with little subcutaneous tissue overlying it (2:105).a right hydrocele is unchanged, but the more superficial collection appears new in comparison with the prior study.the left inguinal canal appears unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air within the pelvis.bone windows show no lesions suspicious for metastatic disease.
summary: a 6.8 cm fluid collection in the right inguinal canal superior to the scrotal sac is minimally increased in size but contains a new focus of gas.a more superficial 3.9 x 2.8 cm collection is new.status post orthotopic liver transplant with unchanged splenomegaly.emphysema.results discussed with ___ ___ at 7:30 pm on ___.

text: there are large, heterogeneous, predominantly high-density fluid collections within the musculature of the left superior leg (sartorius and vastus lateralis).the anterior collection is 6 x 9 cm in axial dimensions and extends approximately 7 cm.the lateral collection measures approximately 9 x 9 cm and extends at least 10 cm in length.the caudal aspect of this collection is not visualized.fluid- fluid levels are seen within the lateral collection.these collections are larger than the reported dimensions from the ___ study, suggesting acute- on- chronic intermuscular hematomas.these collections appear separate from the femoral vasculature.there are dense vascular calcifications.there is a moderate- to- large amount of pelvic ascites.fluid is seen extending into a right inguinal hernia, as noted in the prior report.a foley catheter is present in a nondistended bladder.the intrapelvic loops of large and small bowel are grossly unremarkable.there are small inguinal lymph nodes.there is diffuse subcutaneous anasarca.a dense rounded structure is again noted within the posterior pelvis likely representing retained barium in a colonic diverticula.there is asymmetry of the psoas muscles (right greater than left) suggesting atrophy of the left psoas.
summary: large right thigh hematomas.heterogeneous high intensity is consistent with acute-on-chronic hemorrhage.moderate ascites.dense vascular calcifications.both femoral heads and necks demonstrate a mottled appearance.comparison with prior study will be made and an addendum will be issued at that time.

text: there is persistent bibasilar atelectasis.an aortic valve replacement is in place.a large subcapsular and perinephric hematoma surrounding the right kidney has slightly increased in size in the interval.for example, the maximal axial dimensions are approximately 13.3 x 12.2 cm (previously 11.1 x 8.1 cm).this large perinephric/retroperitoneal hematoma is seen compressing the right kidney with a persistent nephrogram in the right kidney.these findings are compatible with a page kidney.a right ureteral stent is identified coiled within the right renal pelvis and bladder.there are nonobstructing renal calculi bilaterally.allowing for the lack of iv contrast, the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.there is layering tiny stones or milk of calcium within the gallbladder.there is a small pericardial effusion.
