summary: interval increase in size of large right subcapsular and perinephric renal hematoma.this hematoma is compressing the right kidney with a persistent nephrogram consistent with a page kidney.

text: foley catheter and air are seen in the bladder.the prostate is generous in size, measuring 5.2 x 4.2 cm in the axial plane.sigmoid diverticulosis is noted.there is heterogeneous high-density material in the pelvis posterior to the rectum which likely represents hematoma related to the shattered right acetabulum.no pelvic lymphadenopathy.the iliac vessels appear unremarkable.no active vascular extravasation of contast is identified.
summary: communited fracture of the right posterior acetabular column with posterior displacement of the femoral head.additional comminuted intertrochanteric right femoral fracture with associated hematoma.high density presacral collection within the pelvis is consistent with an associated hematoma.acute nondisplaced right-sided rib fractures involving ribs 7, 8 and possibly old right-sided rib fractures posteriorly.small right pleural effusion, measuring simple fluid density.atrophic kidneys with indeterminate exophytic lesion of the interpolar region of the left kidney.renal ultrasound is recommended to establish benignity.findings were discussed with the trauma team at the time of the exam.

text: ct of the chest without contrast: there is moderate to large sized pleural effusions bilaterally, new since the ct chest of ___.these appear larger than the ct abdomen of ___.there is associated atelectasis bilaterally.scattered ground-glass opacities are nonspecific, likely infectious or inflammatory in nature.these ground-glass opacities are predominantly seen in the right upper lobe.there is a small pericardial effusion, new since ___.there is calcification of the coronary arteries.a left-sided central venous line terminates at the upper svc.an endotracheal tube is seen appropriately positioned within the trachea.an ng tube terminates within the stomach.
summary: moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions, which have increased in size since ___.a few scattered ground-glass opacities predominantly in the right upper lobe are nonspecific but likely infectious or inflammatory.bilateral atelectasis interval formation of a small pericardial effusion.moderate ascites, which is new.given the limitations of a non -iv contrast study, no abscess or other source of infection is seen.anasarca.expected appearance of remaining sigmoid and rectum after sub-total colectomy.

text: a nasogastric tube terminates in the lower esophagus.the visualized lung bases demonstrate consolidation of the dependent right lower lobe with previously administered oral contrast present within the right lower lobe airways.there are small bilateral pleural effusions and dependent atelectasis of the left lower lobe.the patient is status post distal gastrectomy and gastrojejunal anastomosis.loops of jejunum and colon are interposed between the anterior abdominal wall and the stomach.previously administered oral contrast is present throughout the colon.the stomach and proximal jejunum are mildly distended with gas.evaluation of the solid abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.non-contrast view of the liver, spleen, pancreas, and right adrenal gland is unremarkable.re- demonstrated is the low density round lesion of the left adrenal gland, which measures 18 mm and has hounsfield unit compatible with adenoma.previously administered iv contrast is noted within the renal collecting systems.the kidneys are otherwise unremarkable.there is no ascites.again seen is a large sludge ball or noncalcified stone of the gallbladder without ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.bone windows demonstrate multiple nondisplaced rib fractures, more numerous on the right, unchanged from the recent ct torso.based upon these diagnostic findings, a decision was made to attempt percutaneous jejunostomy placement after consultation with the referring physician, ___.___ ___.written informed consent had been previously obtained from the patient's proxy, after discussion of risks and benefits.a preprocedure timeout was performed to verify the patient's identity and indication for the procedure.the patient was placed supine on the ct table and the abdomen prepped and draped in sterile fashion.however, prior to performing any intervention, the patient suddenly became hypoxic, thought secondary to aspiration.oxygen was supplied by facemask.dr.___ and respiratory therapy were called and promptly arrived at the ct suite.the respiratory therapist then performed suction of the patient's airways with improvement in oxygenation.the patient was observed in the radiology holding area until his respiratory status stabilized.dr.___ then escorted the patient back to his room for further care.
summary: percutaneous gastrojejunostomy not performed due to patient aspiration and respiratory compromise.the referring physician, ___.___ ___ and respiratory therapy were consulted and after the patient's respiratory status stabilized, he was transferred back to his room for further care.ct evidence of prior aspiration with previously administered oral contrast present in the airways of the right lower lobe.left adrenal adenoma.status post distal gastrectomy.nondisplaced rib fractures, similar to the prior ct torso study.large sludge ball or noncalcified gallstone within the gallbladder without ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ on ___.

text: an area of consolidation with air bronchograms is seen nondependently in the left lingula.there are trace bilateral pleural effusions and small areas of consolidation dependently in both bases.a moderate amount of ascites is seen surrounding the liver and spleen, tracking into both pericolic gutters, left greater than right.no focal masses are seen within the liver.the gallbladder is not clearly seen on this noncontrast study.the patient may have had a cholecystectomy.the spleen is small but otherwise normal- appearing.the pancreas is grossly normal.multiple vascular calcifications are seen along the celiac axis, aorta, and at the origins of the sma, renal arteries and ___.two calculi are seen within the pelvis of the left kidney, one at the base of what appears to be an extrarenal pelvis.there is no overt hydronephrosis.a circular hypodensity that appears to be a simple cyst is seen within the right kidney.oral contrast is only seen through to the proximal small bowel.a bright linear density 2 - 2.5 cm in length is seen slong the greater curvature of the stomach.it is not seen on the kub from eariler today.there is some asymmetric thickening just adjacent to this area.part of the density extends inferior to the thickening.no part of this density is seen within the bowel lumen.there are no adjacent air or contrast collections.thickened mucosal folds are seen within the duodenum in the proximal jejunum.the cecum is borderine distended, measuring 6-9 mm across (depending on axis of measurement).however, given the amount of distension, the wall is slightly prominent.the transverse colon measures from 5-7 mm across, and given this amount of distension, the wall is also slightly prominent.the large intestine tapers at the splenic flexure to a collapsed descending and sigmoid colon.no free air is seen within the abdomen.no air is seen within the bowel wall.no air is seen within the portal venous system.
summary: consolidation suspicious for pneumonia, given air bronchograms in the lingula.metallic density in the region of the wall of the greature curvature of the stomach.this could represent a surgical staple but could also be a foreign body.surrounding thickening suggests possible microperforation at this region.mild distension of the cecum in transverse colon.there is a minimal amount of bowel wall thickening that is less than would be expected for a patient with c.difficile colitis.as no iv contrast was adminsitered for this study, it is excessively difficult to evaluate for ischemic bowel.while this possibility is unlikely, it cannot be definitively excluded.mucosal thickening seen within the duodenum and proximal jejunum.this could be the result of an inflammatory condition, but also would be consistent with patient's generalized anasarca and ascites.measurements of the cecum and transverse colon do not meet the criteria for toxin megacolin.additionally, there is no evidence of perforation or pneumatosis coli.there is no evidence of obstruction.these revised findings were discussed with both the medicine and surgical house staff.

text: the lung bases demonstrate unchanged mild chronic atelectasis or scarring at the right lung base, and a residual left pleural effusion, although this is somewhat decreased since the prior study (2:19).the liver again demonstrates heterogeneous fatty infiltration, with history of cholecystectomy.there has been previous cyst-jejunostomy, with unchanged suture material in the left upper quadrant.there has been previous splenic embolization, splenectomy, and distal pancreatectomy, with embolization coils again visualized.the tract in the left lateral abdomen at the site of previous catheter is identified, but the catheter has been removed.there is no abnormal fluid collection in the abdomen.a jejunostomy tube is in unchanged position.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.numerous prominent mesenteric nodes are seen, but none are pathologically enlarged.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is a large amount of stool in the colon.osseous structures appear unremarkable.
summary: no abnormal fluid collection in the abdomen.

text: lung bases reveal dependent atelectasis and possible tiny left-sided pleural effusion.non-contrast evaluation of the liver, spleen, pancreas, kidneys, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.patient is status post cholecystectomy.a tiny calcified granulomas identified in the left lobe of the liver.no free air, free fluid, or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified.oral contrast has passed through loops of small bowel and colon to the rectum and there is no evidence of obstruction.
summary: no evidence of obstruction or cause of patient's abdominal pain.no significant change from one week prior.

text: examination of the lung bases demonstrates a small left pleural effusion, and bilateral subsegmental atelectasis.the small bowel demonstrates extensive fecalization, with markedly dilated loops of fluid-filled, fecalized small bowel.more distally, air and stool are identified within the colon and rectum.there is no evidence of pneumatosis, portal venous gas, or bowel wall edema.a small amount of simple ascites is identified lateral to the liver, consistent with simple ascites.surgical clips are identified in the site of prior cholecystectomy.a tips is not changed in position since the prior study.a right internal jugular central venous catheter terminates with the tip just at the superior margin of the scan, likely at the cavoatrial junction.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and ureters are unremarkable.there is no free air or mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: extensively fecalized, markedly dilated loops of small bowel suggest small bowel obstruction.no evidence of intestinal ischemia.not markedly different in appearance since the prior ct scan over five weeks prior.

text: there is air in the bladder consistent with recent instrumentation.no evidence of fistulization between the bladder and bowel.the uterus and rectum are unremarkable.there is a persistent fluid collection within the pelvis (3:63) measuring 17.7 x 57.7 mm in the axial plane, but appears essentially stable in size.there is no free fluid or pathologic pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: resolved fluid collection at the splenic flexure.stable appearance of fluid collections in the left upper quadrant and pelvis.interval increase in size in right lower quadrant fluid collection status post drain removal.new extra-peritoneal fluid collection in midline abdominal wound with air communicating with the outside.

text: a small residual collection is seen in the right lower quadrant.this is also decreased in size, currently measuring 5.2 x 2.3 cm (previously 6.6 x 3.0 cm).there is ascites in the pelvis.the uterus is unremarkable.a foley catheter is seen in the bladder.on bone windows, there are no concerning osteolytic or osteosclerotic lesions.
summary: further decrease in size of the previously drained fluid collections in the paracolic gutter bilaterally.loculated fluid in the lesser sac is increased; however, there is no enhancing rim or air in this region to suggest infection.increase in bowel wall edema and small bowel loops, particularly in the left lower quadrant and pelvis.this is likely related to third spacing.bilateral pleural effusions are stable.

text: at the visualized lungs, there is no suspicious pulmonary nodule.no pleural effusion is noted.the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.slightly decrease in size of hypoenhancing lesion in the midline now measuring 8.7 x 3.7 x 4.8 cm (cc x tv x ap) at 300b:14 and 3:27.unchanged anterior abdominal wall lesion, measuring 20 x 9 mm (3:30).the liver enhances homogeneously without evidence of intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation and no focal lesion is identified.surgical clips are seen in the gallbladder fossa indicating prior cholecystectomy.hepatic and portal veins are patent.the patient is status post partial gastrectomy with roux-en-y gastrojejunostomy, without anastomosis complications.the remainder of the small bowel appears unremarkable.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis, masses or stones.at the abdominal aorta there is mild atherosclerotic calcification without aneurysm or stenosis noted.there is no lymphadenopathy, free air or free fluid.
summary: slight decrease in size of large midline epigastric gist tumor with stable anterior abdominal wall lesion.there is no new lesion identified.

text: the uterus and adnexa are normal.the bladder is distended and the wall is not thickened.there is sclerosis around the anterior left si joint and also around the lateral aspect of the anterior right si joint.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are seen within the visualized osseous structures.there is a subcutaneous cyst in the left buttox, unchanged from the prior exam.the coronal reformats confirm the above findings.
summary: no area of small bowel obstruction or bowel inflammation.no intraabdominal abscess.no stranding or inflammation around the j-tube site.a single loop of bowel measuring 3.5 cm is located at a suture line in the right upper quadrant.this same region is present on the prior examination and is likely the patient's normal gastric remnant.

text: the rectum and adnexa are unremarkable as is the prostate.a foley catheter is present within the bladder with a small amount of non- dependent air noted.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes are identified.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesion.
summary: quite limited non-contrast study, with: 1.status post endovascular graft repair of abdominal aortic aneurysm with decrease in sac diameter compared to ___.evaluation for endoleak is not possible, but there is no evidence of hemorrhage within the sac, or the retroperitoneum.2.evaluation for aortoenteric fistula is extremely limited but there is no evidence of such on this study.3.cholelithiasis with a dilated galbladder.4.colonic diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis.5.anasarca with bilateral pleural effusions and ascites.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis and a small left pleural effusion.small low attenuation focus is noted in the right hepatic lobe.the bladder is filled with vicariously excreted contrast.the pancreas is atrophic.the spleen, adrenal glands, right kidney, stomach, and bowel loops are stable within the limits of this noncontrast study.the adrenal adenoma is again noted on the right.residual contrast is seen in the renal collecting systems.the patient is status post rf ablation of the left exophytic renal lesion.there is a significant amount of perirenal attenuation fluid, which tracts along the retroperitoneum and into the pelvis consistent with hemorrhage.of note, there is a linear hypodense area adjacent to the treated renal lesion, which could represent an injury to the renal parenchyma.specks of free air are seen related to the recent procedure.there is a fat-containing ventral hernia.
summary: moderate amount of left perirenal, retroperitoneal, and pelvic hemorrhage status post left renal rf ablation.these findings were discussed with dr.___, at 10:30 a.m., ___, as well as the surgical, body interventional, and vascular interventional services.

text: there is a large collection of extraluminal contrast material at the site of the previously drained abscess.two jp drains are noted within this collection.the collection is situated anterior to the remnant pancreas.best appreciated on series 2, image 47 through 52, there is a structure containing oral contrast material which is seen directly adjacent to an opacified loop of bowel, presumably representing a blind loop of bowel.this structure appears to communicate with the above described abscess cavity via a narrow, anteriorly coursing tract.this tract is in close proximity to the biliary and pancreatic drainage limb.following injection of the previously placed percutaneous biliary drainage catheter, no definite free spillage of contrast could be demonstrated through the biliary anastomosis.there is opacification of several of the intrahepatic biliary ducts.there are no focal liver lesions.the spleen and adrenals are unremarkable.hypodensities within the right kidney are again identified, likely representing cysts.ureters are not dilated.postoperative changes from a whipple procedure are noted.there is a stent within the pancreatic duct, which drains into the above described drainage limb.there is no bowel obstruction.there is no lymphadenopathy by size criteria.abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.there is evidence of previous gastric resection with gastrojejunostomy noted.limited view of the lung bases demonstrates small bilateral effusions and dependent atelectasis.
summary: large collection anterior to the pancreas containing oral contrast material, from presumed leak.the site of leak may emanate from a bling ending loop of bowel in the region of the enteroenterostomy.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis at the lung bases.there is no pericardial effusion.study is suboptimal due to lack of iv contrast for evaluation of solid organs.previously described two hepatic hypodensities are difficult to appreciate on a non-contrast study.the spleen measures 15 cm in craniocaudal diameter.the gallbladder is distended, and there is small amount of pericholecystic fluid, could be due to third spacing and ascites.pancreas appears normal.the adrenal glands are normal.kidneys are normal in size with no evidence of hydronephrosis or renal stone.there is small amount of ascites.there is no free air.there is no bowel obstruction.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the retroperitoneum or mesentery.
summary: splenomegaly.hypodensities seen in the liver on prior scans are suboptimally evaluated on this non-contrast scan.bilateral small-to-moderate pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis.no evidence of retroperitoneal bleeding.ascites and anasarca.

text: there is a stable moderate-sized right pleural effusion with compressive right lower lobe atelectasis.additionally, linear atelectasis involving the right middle lobe is also demonstrated.the patient is status post partial hepatectomy, and there is evidence of regeneration of the left lobe of the liver, which again is noted to extend into the left upper quadrant.multiple embolic coils are seen within the medial segment of the left lobe of the liver.the left portal vein, main portal vein, and left hepatic veins are all patent.again demonstrated is stable mild pneumobilia, unchanged in the interval.a percutaneous transhepatic biliary catheter is again noted with the tip positioned within the posterior aspect of the resected liver margin.additionally, a surgical drain is also noted within this region.again demonstrated are several perihepatic fluid collections.the previously identified air- fluid collection in the right upper quadrant just lateral to the lateral-most coil within the liver is smaller in size, measuring approximately 1.8 cm, previously 2.2 cm.additionally, no more air is seen within this focal fluid collection.there has been slight interval increase in size of the fluid collection lateral to the resected margin of the liver.the previously seen small loculated fluid collection in the right upper quadrant just anterior to the liver margin with a rim of enhancement has also decreased in size and measures approximately 0.9 cm, previously 3.2 cm.within the medial segment of the liver, there appears to be ill-defined areas of hyperenhancement demonstrated surrounding round, central areas of low attenuation, likely representing mildly dilated biliary ducts.these ill- defined areas of hyperenhancement appear new in the interval.again demonstrated are several peripancreatic fluid collections, which are decreased in size since the prior study, the largest collection now measures 2.3 x 4.0 cm, previously 3.4 x 5.1 cm.there has been mild increase in the amount of moderate free fluid within the abdomen and pelvis.within the tail of the pancreas, there is a tiny 5 mm cystic lesion.the pancreas otherwise appears unremarkable, and no pancreatic duct dilatation is seen.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.jejunostomy tube remains in stable position.the distal ureters appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen.
summary: minimal increase in size of the perihepatic fluid collection in the right upper quadrant adjacent to the resection margin.interval decrease in size of peripancreatic fluid collections.additionally, interval decrease in size of several loculated perihepatic fluid collections.slight interval increase in the amount of free fluid within the abdomen and pelvis.ill-defined areas of hyperenhancement demonstrated within the medial aspect of the left lobe of the liver surrounding biliary radicles.this may represent a perfusion anomaly, or perhaps, cholangities.clinical correlation is recommended as well as follow-up imaging.stable moderate-sized right pleural effusion with dependent atelectasis.stable minimal biliary duct dilatation within the medial segment of the left lobe of the liver.dfddp

text: evaluation of solid abdominal viscera is extremely limited by lack of intravenous contrast, within this limitation the liver, spleen, adrenals, pancreas, and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is mildly distended and contains sludge.along the anterior abdominal wall there is a collection within the region of the laparotomy incision which measures 1.7 cm and now contains mottled gas within it new compared with the prior study, concerning for a small abscess.a pigtail drainage catheter remains in place in the right lower quadrant, there has been interval evolution of the drained collection, which has now decreased in size but contains mottled gas concerning for the presence of a gas-forming organism.the stomach is collapsed.loops of small bowel are normal in caliber without evidence of obstruction.there is marked wall thickening within distal ileal loops, not well evaluated without intravenous contrast.there is no intraperitoneal free air.the colon contains residual dense contrast material and is normal in caliber.the bladder is distended and otherwise normal in appearance.there is mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, likely inflammatory.the aorta is normal in caliber.there is no osseous abnormality.
summary: the pigtail catheter remains well positioned, with interval evolution of peritoneal collections now decreased in size but also now containing mottled gas concerning for the presence of a gas-forming organism.no obstruction, there is wall thickening within distal ileum as seen previously but not well characterized without intravenous or oral contrast.small 1.7 cm mottled collection of gas and soft tissue within the anterior laparotomy wound concerning for small abscess.

text: intrapelvic bowel displays diffuse areas of diverticulosis with no acute diverticulitis identified.patient appears to be status post hysterectomy.the bladder is slightly distended with no enhancing masses identified.no free fluid is noted within the pelvis and there is no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes identified.
summary: no intra-abdominal trauma identified.bilateral pleural effusions (right greater than left) with small amount of dependent atelectasis within the left lobe and rml collapse.no definite airway obstruction on this limited lung exam.findings may be better evaluated with dedicated hrct of chest if clinically indicated cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.incompletely characterized left adrenal lesion.can be further evaluated with dedicated adrenal ct if neccesary.multiple simple left renal cysts.diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, and prostate are unremarkable.there is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.foley catheter is seen in place.
summary: no evidence of focal chest, abdominal, or pelvic abscess or other embolic source.severe emphysema with evidence of right upper lobe pneumonia.bilateral kidney cysts with the largest measuring 7.0 x 6.1 x 6.0 cm on the left.these findings were discussed with dr.___ of the patient's primary clinical team at approximately 16:50 hours on ___.

text: no pneumonia or pleural effusion in the lung bases.two nonspecific pulmonary nodules are seen at the lung bases in the right lower lobe, 4 mm, (2:4) and 4 mm, (2:1), which are not clearly identified on the prior ct.there is again seen ill-defined hypoenhancing mass in the body of the pancreas with ill-defined margins measuring approximately 4 cm, with a similar appearance compared to prior study, and with retroperitoneal extent.the splenic vein is not visualized and there are multiple collateral vessels in the left upper quadrant.there is a partial thrombosis of the left portal vein, which was also seen on prior scan.there are multiple hypodense foci in the liver, with similar distribution compared to prior study and concerning for liver metastasis.there is hypodense mass indenting the posterior wall of adjacent ivc above the level of the hepatic venous confluence.adjacent to the ivc there is a dominant necrotic node, as also seen on prior study.the gallbladder appears unremarkable.there is no biliary duct dilatation.the proximal pancreas appears within normal limits.the tail of the pancreas is atrophied, as described on prior ct.there is a large amount of ascites, which is new compared to prior ct.there is catheter in place for peritoneal drainage.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is new peritoneal thickening along the left hemi-diaphragm, diffuse omental infiltration, and some mesenteric infiltration.there is small bowel wall thickening, probably reactive to peritoneal carcinoma.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted along the abdominal aorta.retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen to be necrotic adjacent to pancreatic mass also seen on prior ct.an aortic node has hypoattenuating center, also seen on prior scan.no free air is seen.
summary: new large volume ascites.catheter in place for peritoneal drainage.large pancreatic mass.liver metastasis.new areas of peritoneal thickening along the left hemi-diaphragm, infiltration of the mesentery, and diffuse omental cake suggesting peritoneal carcinomatosis.small bowel wall thickening, probably due to peritoneal tumor involvement.partial thrombosis of left portal vein, also seen on prior scan.findings were posted on the ed dashboard.

text: large bilateral pleural effusions are identified with extensive atelectasis and consolidation in the lower lobes of both lungs.new areas of consolidation and ground-glass opacity are identified in the right middle lobe and right lower lobe suggesting pneumonia or aspiration.extensive fluid collections are identified throughout the abdomen as on prior ct.the margins of the fluid collections are less discernable from bowel on the current ct performed without iv contrast.the fluid collection with a percutaneous drain in situ in the right abdominal flank is stable in size.a 4.4 cm x 7.0 cm subdiaphragmatic fluid collection in the anterior abdomen (series 2, image 17) is also stable in size.a new fluid collection measuring 7.7 cm x 7.0 cm is identified adjacent to the pancreatic tail (series 2, image 38) and along small bowel, extending inferiorly towards the left flank.a large 6.7 cm x 15.3 cm area of fluid in the mid lower abdomen (series 2, image 60) has not changed significantly since the prior study.the pancreatic head is indistinct in outline, consistent with inflammation and possible necrosis.areas of metallic artifact adjacent to pancreatic head are consistent with recent coiling of pseudoaneurysm.persistent contrast enhancement (persistent nephrogram) of the kidneys due to earlier radiological studies is consistent with acute renal impairment.no focal parenchymal abnormality is identified in the liver on this study performed without intravenous contrast.the spleen appears unremarkable.the adrenal glands are normal in appearance.the small and large bowel are not significantly dilated.
summary: extensive fluid collections identified in the abdomen and pelvis, most of which are stable in size.percutaneous drains remain in situ within one of these along the right.a new fluid collection is seen adjacent to the pancreatic tail extending along small bowel loops to the left abdominal flank.new areas of consolidation and ground-glass opacity are identified in the right middle lobe and right lower lobe consistent with pneumonia or aspiration.

text: there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis.there are coronary artery calcifications.evaluation of abdominal viscera for focal lesion is limited without the use of intravenous contrast.within this limitation, the liver, spleen, pancreas are normal.the gallbladder is distended.the kidneys have a normal non-contrast ct appearance.there is no renal or ureteral stone or hydronephrosis.there is no free fluid within the abdomen or free air.there is a small fat-containing midline anterior abdominal wall hernia.this is best appreciated on the sagittal imaging (300b:35), and has associated subcutaneous stranding.the loops of small bowel and colon are normal in caliber, without evidence of obstruction.there is a small hiatal hernia.there are no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.there is significant vascular calcifications of the aorta and branch vessels.
summary: no renal or ureteral calculi.no hydronephrosis.small fat-containing umbilical hernia with associated inflammatory change of the subcutaneous tissue.atherosclerotic vascular calcification.bilateral l5 pars defects.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, bladder, and intrapelvic loops of bowel including the appendix are within normal limits.there is no pelvic free air or fluid.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is seen.
summary: thickened and inflamed portion of the duodenal bulb and proximal second segment of the duodenum, compatible with duodenitis, and corresponding with patient's known location of duodenal ulcer.no free air or extravasation of contrast to suggest perforation.no evidence of appendicitis or obstruction.

text: the bladder is decompressed, and there is a foley catheter in the bladder.there is air in the bladder presumably from foley catheter insertion.again seen is extensive anasarca.images through the upper thighs again demonstrate extensive anasarca.no abscess identified.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ on ___.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.extensive anasarca.no abscess identified.small amount of free fluid in the lesser sac and around the greater curvature of the stomach and around the liver.no organizing fluid collections are identified.there is a hint of extravasation seen adjacent to a mildly thickened jejunal loop adjacent to the surgical defect and likely corresponding to the patient's known fistula.there is a small collection of fluid with air in the subcutaneous tissues of the right lateral abdominal wall in communication with the open surgical defect.

text: liver remains nodular in contour with hypertrophy of the left lateral segment and caudate lobes.heterogeneous enhancement of the anterior and lateral right lobe of the liver, can be seen in the setting of cirrhosis.multiple cyberknife fiducial markers are present in segment v of the liver.hyperenhancement adjacent to the gallbladder is not as well visualized on the current exam and may be related to differences in bolus technique.no new arterial enhancing foci are present throughout the liver parenchyma to suggest hepatoma at this time.no significant intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.stable appearance of the gallbladder with a gallstone.no evidence of acute cholecystitis.replaced right hepatic artery arising from the superior mesenteric artery.accessory left hepatic artery arising from the left gastric artery.small amount of perihepatic fluid is seen.stable sequela of portal hypertension including splenomegaly measuring up to 18.6 cm.recanalized umbilical vein with large periumbilical venous varix herniating into the anterior abdominal wall.numerous periesophageal varices are present.smaller collaterals are seen throughout the abdominal cavity.hepatic and portal veins are patent.the splenic vein, imv, and smv are normally opacified.numerous small lymph nodes are present in the peripancreatic, periportal, celiac axis, and porta hepatis regions.additionally, prominent lymph nodes are present in the aortocaval and periaortic regions.these have not significantly changed in comparison to prior exam.the adrenal glands, pancreas, and right kidney are unremarkable.stable cyst upper pole of the left kidney, measuring 9 mm.no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.no suspicious renal masses are present.there is a circumaortic left renal vein.abdominal aorta is normal in caliber and opacification.proximal branch vessels are patent.the stomach, duodenum, small bowel loops remain normal in caliber.stranding throughout the small bowel mesentery centrally with innumerable lymph nodes are seen and unchanged in distribution and size.normal appendix.scattered colon diverticula without evidence for diverticulitis.
summary: patient with known hcc status post cyberknife treatment; no evidence for recurrence at the treatment site.no new arterial-enhancing lesions are evident on this exam.cholelithiasis.multiple sequelae of portal hypertension are unchanged, including esophageal varices, paraesophageal varices, large recanalized umbilical vein and periumbilical herniated varix.splenomegaly.small amount of perihepatic and mesenteric ascites.variant hepatic arterial anatomy is again noted.subtle focal ares of peribronchial thickening and septal thickening in the right middle lobe and left lower lobe are likely inflammtory or infectious.

text: the pelvis is filled with massively dilated sigmoid colon.the urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.no free air or fluid is seen within the pelvis.
summary: massively dilated sigmoid colon that contains inspissated fecal material.this appearance is concerning for fecal impaction.there is also proximal dilatation of large bowel loops.no obstructing lesions are seen.mild enlargement of intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts.22-mm cystic lesion within the pancreatic head that is most worrisome for intrapancreatic mucinous neoplasm.multiple hypodense lesions within both kidneys that most likely represent cysts; however, at least two lesions in the mid pole of the right kidney do not have the appearance of simple cysts.this area can be further followed up if clinically indicated.consolidated area within left lower lobe that is supplied by a branch from the aorta.the appearance is consistent with sequestration.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of dictation.

text: no free air.interval decrease in the abdominal ascites.there has been interval enlargement of the well-defined peripherally enhancing peripancreatic hypoenhancing collection which continues to be concerning for walled off pancreatic necrosis.changes of necrotizing pancreatitis are again seen with a paucity of enhancing pancreatic tissue; in particular necrosis appears to extend from pancreatic head to tail margin, with inability to identify the pancreatic duct in this segment of the gland.this collection partially occupies this space and now measures 15.7 cm in transverse, previously 14.1 cm and 4.3 cm in ap dimension adjacent to the level of the pancreatic head and 5.1 cm in ap dimension adjacent to the level of the pancreatic tail, whereas previously, the maximum ap dimension of this collection was 3.4 cm.located more caudally, just cephalad to the mid transverse colon, there is interval development of an additional well-defined fluid collection which communicates with the main peripancreatic collection and measures 2.9 x 4.6 cm.previously this consisted of patchy fluid measuring 4.5 x 7 mm.these fluid collections do not demonstrate internal foci of air.the enhancing portions of the pancreas appear stable.there is no identifiable pancreatic duct.there is increased attenuation of the splenic vein which remains patent.no evidence of splenic artery or gastroduodenal artery aneurysm.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber without aneurysmal dilatation or dissection.there is a tiny hypodensity in the left hepatic lobe, too small to characterize.the remainder of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands demonstrate symmetric enhancement.there is a tiny hypodensity in the left kidney, likely a cyst, however, too small to characterize.both kidneys demonstrate symmetric excretion without hydronephrosis.the gallbladder is distended without radio-opaque stones.moderate atherosclerotic calcifications of the infrarenal aorta, aortic bifurcation, iliac vessels, and distal branches.the celiac trunk, sma, renal arteries, and ___ are patent.portal vein and mesenteric venous structures are grossly patent.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is continued gastric distention.the duodenum is decompressed.multiple dilated small bowel loops are again seen, although with decreasing caliber compared to the prior exam.these bowel loops now measure 3 cm in greatest dimension, previously up to 4.2 cm.however, there is interval worsening of the bowel wall edema.there is also interval increased thickening of the appendix measuring up to 1 cm, previously 7 mm.the colon is relatively decompressed.
summary: findings consistent with necrotizing pancreatitis, with interval enlargement of the peripancreatic hypoenhancing fluid collection consistent with walled off necrosis.previously seen patchy fluid more caudad to this collection just superior to the mid transverse colon has now developed into a discrete collection and communicates with the predominant peripancreatic collection.no foci of air are identified within these fluid collections to suggest definite infection.improving caliber of multiple small bowel loops, however with worsening bowel wall edema.increased thickening of the appendix also noted.findings are consistent with progressive bowel edema reactive to continued inflammatory changes (free fluid) in abdomen and pelvis.more marked narrowing of the splenic vein, which remains otherwise patent.stable small bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar subsegmental atelectasis.tiny pericardial effusion.decreased abdominal ascites.tiny hepatic and left renal hypodensities, likely cysts, however too small to characterize.these findings were discovered and discussed with dr.___ ___ at 3:40 p.m.on ___.

text: a foley catheter is present within the bladder.there is no free pelvic fluid.intrapelvic loops of bowel are grossly unremarkable.there is stranding adjacent to the right superficial femoral artery likely relating to prior instrumentation.there is no retroperitoneal hemorrhage.
summary: there is air trapping adjacent to the clavicles bilaterally.no communication with the lungs, esophagus or trachea is identified.question prior jugular instrumentation.a small amount of air is seen posterior to the left main stem bronchus and adjacent to the aorta although no communication with the bronchial tree is identified.no evidence of aortic dissection.no evidence of fracture or dislocation.

text: the rectum, prostate and urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is a moderate degree of wall thickening and mild surrounding stranding adjacent to the distal sigmoid colon.no drainable collections are noted.other scattered diverticuli are noted throughout the sigmoid and descending colon.there is no free pelvic ascites or lymphadenopathy.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: small left pleural effusion with patchy and slightly ground-glass bibasilar opacities, left greater than right.while this may represent atelectasis given the patient's history of seizure, aspiration pneumonia/pneumonitis should be considered.bowel wall thickening with possible surrounding stranding in the distal sigmoid colon, in association with diverticulosis.this could represent very mild/early case of diverticulitis.alternatively this could all be secondary to muscular hypertrophy within the colonic wall due to long standing diverticulosis.

text: a small amount of free fluid is seen in the dependent portion of the pelvis.there is no free air.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is present.a large lytic lesion involving a majority of the left iliac bone is again present and consistent with patient's known myeloma.the patient is also status post orif left proximal femoral fracture.
summary: mild nonspecific thickening of the gastric folds and proximal duodenum.this may represent infectious or inflammatory gastroenteritis.no bowel obstruction or appendicitis.stable large right hepatic lobe lesion most likely representing a hemangioma.stable right renal angiomyolipoma.small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.multiple lytic osseous lesions involving several vertebral bodies and the pelvis.the largest of these occupies a majority of the left iliac bone and appears without change.findings are in keeping with a history of myeloma.

text: decompressed distal loops of bowel and remaining colon are again identified.no contrast is noted within the colostomy site.multiple surgical clips and soft tissue thickening adjacent within the presacral space are stable as is a left inguinal lymph node.
summary: severe small bowel obstruction.recommend continue radiographic follow-up with plain radiographs or repeat ct.a well defined transition point is unable to be localized.progression of metastatic disease within the liver and lungs.

text: a foley catheter is present within the bladder.diffuse abnormality of the intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel is seen.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: diffuse abnormality of the entire length of small bowel with fold and wall thickening and impressive wall edema.this is concerning for ischemic bowel, although no assessment can be made as to the patency of the mesenteric veins or arteries or the enhancement characteristics of the bowel mucosa.notably, there is no pneumatosis, and no portal venous gas is identified.patchy opacities in both lower lobes.5 mm renal stone.the above was discussed with dr.___ ___ at approximately 12 p.m.on ___ and also relayed to the emergency dashboard and flagged for urgent attention and discussed with dr.___ (surgery).

text: the partially visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis and small effusions.the partially visualized heart appears slightly enlarged, but otherwise normal.the liver has a nodular contour.there are multifocal hypoenhancing and a single hyperenhancing lesion within the liver (3:18), stable in appearance.a 2.3 x 2.5 cm hypoattenuating lesion in the left lobe of the liver (3:11) appears unchanged, compatible with a cyst.the portal vasculature remains patent.the cbd is dilated, unchanged.there are multiple duodenal diverticulae.there is a stable 2 x 1.6 cm side branch cyst in the mid body of the pancreas (3:25) which is stable.there are additional cystic side branches arising off the distal body of the pancreas (3:29), unchanged.the spleen is enlarged measuring 20 cm in craniocaudal dimension.there is heterogeneous enhancement to the spleen with multifocal millimeter-sized hypodensities.in the posterior aspect of the spleen (3:28) is a new 19 x 13 mm region of hypodensity.near the inferior tip of the spleen is a stable 9-mm hypodensity (3:41).the adrenals appear normal.the gallbladder is absent with surgical clips in the gallbladder fossa.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.there is no hydronephrosis.a hypodensity in the interpolar region of the right kidney (3:33) appears unchanged but is too small to characterize.there may be a 3-mm nonobstructive calculi in the left kidney (3:30).there is a nasogastric catheter within the stomach.the abdominal aorta and its branches appear widely patent without aneurysm.there is no free air in the abdomen.there is diffuse mesenteric stranding with fluid within the layers of the mesentery, unchanged.there are scattered retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes, unchanged.there are splenorenal collaterals, compatible with portal hypertension.
summary: decreased size of pelvic fluid collection.bowel wall thicking and narrowing at ileo-sigmoid anastamosis, but no obstruction.multiple duodenal divertiulae.stable appearance to hypoattenuating and hyperattenuating liver lesions, better described on prior mri.cirrhotic liver.portal hypertension.enlarged spleen with multifocal hypodensities, including a new hypodensity, which may reflect an infarct.enlarged bartholin gland cyst.

text: there are bilateral small pleural effusions.left-sided pleural effusion has increased in size while the right-sided pleural effusion has remained stable.there is adjacent bibasilar atelectasis.the heart size is normal.the spleen and adrenal glands are within normal limits.the right kidney demonstrates small hypodensities, too small to characterize.the left kidney remains atrophic with a large staghorn calculus as seen on multiple prior studies.there is unchanged hydronephrosis of the upper pole of the left kidney.patient is status post whipple with associated mild pneumobilia, unchanged.the liver is otherwise normal in appearance.the pancreatic body and tail are normal in appearance.there is increased soft tissue density within the retroperitoneal and mesenteric fat; however, this is diffuse and thought more likely due to patient's volume status as there is also diffuse anasarca of the overlying soft tissues.in the proximal small bowel near the junction of the anastomosis between the stomach and bowel, there is apparent circumferential wall thickening and mild adjacent fat stranding which could represent an enteritis.otherwise, the other visualized loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: apparent circumferential wall thickening of a short segment of proximal small bowel near the anastomosis between the stomach which could reflect a focal enteritis.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.diffuse anasarca.stable appearance of left staghorn calculus.small bilateral pleural effusions.the left-sided pleural effusion has increased in size since the prior study.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 1:00 a.m.on ___, via telephone by dr.___ ___.

text: the prostate remains enlarged and heterogeneous, measuring up to 4.5 cm in transverse dimensions, with coarse peripheral calcifications.pelvic and inguinal lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.the bladder is partially distended with urine.a small right hydrocele is present.a lymph nodal conglomerate directly inferior to the aortoiliac bifurcation has increased in size to 7.3 x 3.7 cm, previously 5.7 x 3.9 cm.evaluation is suboptimal without intravenous contrast, but there is apparent partial encasement of the left common iliac artery, and medial abutment of the left common iliac vein.faint surrounding fat stranding is present.scattered additional retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.visualized loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.scattered sigmoid diverticula, without acute inflammation.note is made of a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.tiny fat-containing inguinal hernias are also present, right greater than left.the bones are slightly demineralized.mild multilevel degenerative changes are present, with mild diffuse disc bulges, mild facet hypertrophy, and ligamentum flavum thickening resulting in canal or foraminal stenoses.please note that ct cannot visualize intrathecal detail.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are identified.there are no pathologic fractures.there is diffuse fatty atrophy of the paraspinal muscles.
summary: heterogeneous and enlarged prostate, similar to the prior exam.interval increase in size of nodal conglomerate inferior to the aortoiliac bifurcation.small fat-containing umbilical and bilateral inguinal hernias, right greater than left.dfddp

text: there is an enhancing soft tissue mass in the right aspect of the bladder.the distal ureter is dilated on the right.there is no contrast extravasation.there are shotty lymph nodes in the pelvis without evidence of pathological enlargement.there is a minimal amount of free fluid.
summary: hypoattenuating lesion in the left lobe of the thyroid gland, ultrasound examination is recommended for further evaluation.bladder mass causing right hydronephrosis.lytic bone lesion in t11 near the right pedicle, which is concerning for a metastatic focus.a bone scan would be recommended for further evaluation if clinically indicated.degenerative changes in the lumbar spine.

text: assessment of the viscera is limited due to lack of iv contrast administration.a non-enhanced liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys appear unremarkable.note is again made of cholelithiasis.the non-opacified stomach, small bowel, colon, and appendix appear unremarkable.no free air or free fluid is noted within the abdomen.patient is status post endovascular stenting of the infrarenal aortoiliac aneurysm, with little change in sac diameter, currently measuring 6.0 x 5.6 cm (2:93), previously 5.9 x 5.8 cm.note is made of an unchanged fat-containing umbilical hernia.no lymphadenopathy is noted.
summary: multiple new rib fractures on the left.small left non-hemorrhagic pleural effusion.dependent atelectasis.left lower lobe consolidation possibly likely atelectasis, less likely aspiration.no intra-abdominal injury seen.findings were initially posted on the ed dashboard via ccc upon completion of the study.

text: the bladder lumen demonstrates the ureteral stent terminating within it.the prostate and seminal vesicles as well as the rectum appear unremarkable.no pathologic pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.the osseous structures demonstrate no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: persistent fluid collection in the abdomen with foci of air as described above.contrast has not yet reached the right ureter, so persistent leak cannot be excluded.right ureteral stent in place.small cortical perfusion abnormality in the superior pole of the right kidney, which could represent infection or possibly infarction in this region.3 mm pulmonary nodule which has been stable for at least one year.one- year follow up is recommended to ensure continued stability.findings discussed with dr.___ at 5:50 p.m.on ___.the patient will return for a delayed scan later today to assess for contrast extravasation from the right ureter.if patient cannotbe contaced, we ccan repeat the study at no charge.

text: once again seen is focal thickening of the splenic flexure and descending colon.as noted on the prior study, low attenuation within this colonic wall is nonspecific and could represent edema due to infection, inflammation or ischemia.the sigmoid colon is diffusely diverticular.there is now a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.the rectum and bladder are normal in appearance.there is a foley catheter within the collapsed bladder.the patient is status post left hip replacement.the soft-tissue and osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: persistent low attenuation within the descending colon with thickening of the wall in this region.infection, inflammation or ischemia due to venous congestion are possible etiologies.there is continued patency of the celiac trunk and sma.in the interval since the prior study, a small amount of free fluid has accumulated within the pelvis.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate patchy consolidation in the right middle/lower lobes, and dense consolidation in the left lower lobe.these findings are concerning for aspiration and/or infection.a small simple left and trace right pleural effusion are present.the heart is enlarged.moderate atherosclerotic calcification is present.there is no pericardial effusion.within the limitations of a non-contrast study, the liver, adrenal glands, spleen are normal.nodularity adjacent to the inferior right hepatic lobe and right adrenal gland (2:17, 20) are new.there is diffuse fatty atrophy of the pancreas.the gallbladder is normal.the right kidney is atrophic, with two large simple cysts.the largest cyst in the upper pole of the right kidney measures 6.2 cm.a simple cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney measures 2.4 cm.the kidneys are atrophic.bilateral moderate hydroureteronephrosis is new since the prior study.no obstructing stones are seen.at the level of the pelvic inlet, there is ill-defined soft tissue encasing both ureters.the stomach, small bowel and large bowel are unremarkable.there is a small ventral abdominal hernia containing a portion of the transverse colon (2:42).there is new omental nodularity and thickening (2:16) in the midline lower abdomen.also seen are multiple retroperitoneal lymph nodes, which are new since earlier study.for example, the largest aortocaval lymph node (2:38) now measures 17 mm.there is no intra-abdominal free air.the aorta has extensive atherosclerotic calcification, with focal ectasia in the distal portion just about the bifurcation measuring approximately 2.6 cm.a 13 mm nodule in the umbilicus is concerning for a metastatic deposit.
summary: bibasilar consolidations, with small pleural effusions, concerning for pneumonia and aspiration.new bilateral moderate hydroureteronephrosis which appears secondary to masses encasing the distal portion of the ureters.new omental nodularity, retroperitoneal and iliac lymphadenopathy, concerning for metastatic disease.

text: examination of the lung bases displays increased bilateral pleural effusions, right slightly greater than left, with areas of compression atelectasis.no focal pulmonary nodules or opacities are identified.there is also a small pericardial effusion which has worsened slightly from prior examination.no focal liver lesions are identified.the gallbladder is slightly distended but appears otherwise normal.the spleen, pancreas, stomach, left adrenal gland, and kidneys appear normal.unchanged right adrenal lesion.there is increased abdominal ascites with worsening colonic wall edema and slightly decreased mucosal hyperenhancement when compared to prior examination.no small bowel dilatation is identified.there are unchanged surrounding colonic inflammatory changes.again identified is an ivc filter.no evidence of free air within the abdomen.evaluation of lymphadenopathy is limited due to marked ascites.ct of the pelvis with intravenous contrast.again identified is procto- pancolitis with marked worsening of wall edema involving intrapelvic loops of large bowel.there is increased free fluid noted within the pelvis.air is noted within a foley containing urinary bladder.the distal ureters and bladder appear otherwise unremarkable.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: marked worsening of known c.difficile pancolitis with increased wall edema.no evidence of perforation.increased bilateral pleural effusions and intra-abdominal/pelvic ascites.stable right adrenal lesion, probably an adenoma, but incompletely evaluated on current study.small pericardial effusion.

text: infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm has mildly increased in size, measuring 8.9 x 7.6 cm, compared to ___ when it measured 8.5 x 7.1 cm.there is a serpiginous channel within the aneurysm, extending from near the origin of the stent inferiorly to the bifurcation of the grafts (2:67, 86).the channel is had widened in diameter and now measures 20 mm, compared to 11 mm previously.there are bibasilar pleural effusions, greater on the right, with associated atelectasis.cardiomegaly, mitral annular, cad and aortic valve calcifications are noted.the liver enhances homogeneously, with the exception of a 4-mm hypodensity in segment vi that is too small to characterize.central and extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is unchanged and appears to be caused by mass effect of the aneurysm (2:64).the kidneys enhance heterogeneously, but there is no hydronephrosis or mass.the spleen and adrenals are unremarkable.the stomach and small bowel are normal.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: increased size of abdominal aortic aneurysm, now measuring 8.9 cm in greatest dimension compared to 8.5 cm on ___.evidence of type 3 endoleak and widened luminal channel as described above.central and extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation, most likely due to mass effect from the aneurysm, unchanged.stable 7.9-cm right inguinal seroma.findings were discussed by dr.___ ___ with dr.___ by phone at 5:07 p.m.on ___.mjmgb

text: again note is made of cirrhotic liver with small amount of ascites, decreased in amount compared to the prior study.there is prominent hyperdense branching structure within the portal system of the porta hepatis, which is new compared to the prior study, representing left portal vein thrombus.spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, the visualized portion of large and small intestines are within normal limits.there is a defect in the abdominal wall with herniating fat.small peripancreatic node is seen.there is pneumatosis in a segment of left sided small bowel.possible small extraluminal air is seen in the left lower quadrant, interposed between two loops of bowel.the mesenteric arteries and veins are patent.no portal venous air is seen.
summary: status post low anterior dissection.5cm presacral extralumenal collection with feces and air at the surgical site, increased in size compared to the previous examination.this is most concerning for a presacral abscess, although the precise relationship of this collection to the adjacent bowel is difficult to discern.cirrhotic liver with decreased amount of ascites.left portal vein thrombosis.pneumatosis of the small bowel.possible tiny amoutn of free air in the left lower abdomen adjacent to the pneumatosis.mesenteric arteries and veins, within limits of technique, are patent.ischemia of the bowel cannot be excluded.the information was discussed with the referring physician, ___.___ ___ in person at 6pm on the day of the exam.

text: a foley catheter has been placed within the bladder, and there is air layering within the bladder dome.there is density within the prostate gland adjacent to the foley catheter, possibly representing calcifications, but clinical correlation is recommended to exclude a prostatic urethral injury with extravasation of contrast.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there is no free fluid and no free air within the pelvis.there is no pathological pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no solid organ injury, free fluid or free air within the abdomen.density within the prostate gland in the setting of contrast opacified urine within the bladder could represent extravasation of urine due to a prostatic urethral injury versus calcification within the prostate.clinical correlation is recommended to exclude urethral injury.no fracture is identified.multiple hepatic lesions, previously shown by ultrasound to represent cysts and hemangiomas.possible loose body within the left hip; felt unlikely to represent an acute fracture.these findings were communicated to the clinical providers at the time of interpretation.

text: the common iliac vessels are opacified bilaterally.the external iliac arteries are patent.there is some arthrosclerotic plaque bilaterally.the internal iliac artery is patent on the right; however, partially occluded on the left.there is widening of the common femoral artery on the left.this vessel occludes at some point and flow to the lower extremity appears to be maintained via the profunda femoris.on the right, the profunda femoris is occluded and the superficial femoral artery appears intact.the small bowel is unremarkable.there are multiple diverticula in the sigmoid colon; however, there is no evidence for diverticulitis.there is a tiny amount of ascites in the pelvis.foley catheter as well as air identified in the bladder.on bone windows, there are extensive degenerative changes along the lumbar spine.no concerning osteolytic or osteosclerotic lesions are seen.there is a clip around the infrarenal ivc.
summary: obstructing stone in the distal common bile duct at the level of the ampulla.no evidence for mass cholelithiasis without evidence for cholecystitis.fatty infiltration of the liver.multiple hypodense lesions in both kidneys.a lesion in the left upper pole measures higher density and may represent a complex cyst.it is seen anteriorly and measures 2.7 cm in size.a second lesion on the left measuring 7.2 cm also demonstrates increased density (20 ___).confirmation of the cystic nature of these lesions with ultrasound is recommended.infrarenal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.7 cm.small amount of ascites.diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis.

text: direct comparison is made to prior examination dated ___.minimal bibasilar atelectasis is noted.again, within the lesser sac, there is a 6.4 x 11.8 cm fluid collection, which contains several small foci of air on the current exam.this may be related to placement of a catheter into the right flank collection, which is seen to communicate with this collection in the lesser sac.collection within the lesser sac also appears to extend to communicate with a stable collection about the spleen, which measures up to 3.6 x 5.5 cm in the axial dimension.nonobstructing left renal calculus is again noted.the contour of the kidneys is irregular and the evaluation of the renal parenchyma is limited by the lack of intravenous contrast, however, this finding is presumed to be secondary to congenital fetal lobation.the adrenal glands, spleen, gallbladder, and liver are grossly unchanged, given the limitations of a non-contrast ct.right-sided pigtail catheter is identified with its distal tip within the patient's right flank collection, which appears significantly decreased in size on the current exam measuring up to 5.6 x 9.3 cm.this collection does extend up to the level of the interpolar region of the right kidney and demonstrates hyperattenuating areas more cranially with blood products.small fluid is identified within the region of the right iliac crest.this is slightly increased in size since the prior exam.pelvic structures are otherwise unchanged.deformity of the inferior pubic ramus on the right is noted consistent with prior trauma.no lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.
summary: decrease in size of right flank collection with pigtail catheter in place.stable lesser sac collection with extension into the perisplenic region.nonobstructing left renal calculus.

text: there has been interval development of small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis.a central line is in place with its tip in the right atrium.the partially imaged mediastinum and lung bases are otherwise unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.an orogastric tube, and percutaneous gastrojejunostomy tube are in place, in satisfactory position.there has been interval placement of an endovascular abdominal aortic stent with the proximal tip at the level of the t11-12 disc, and the distal extensions ending in the proximal common iliac arteries.there is hazy high-density fluid within the aneurysm sac distal to the attachment of the left iliac component, but proximal to the bifurcation, best seen on series 2:43.the degree of retroperitoneal hemorrhage is not significantly changed, but there has been some interval organization of the hematoma.there is a new lobulated high density fluid within the right groin, extending into the pelvis along the left external iliac artery.within the pelvis, the hematoma measures 5.6 x 8.9 x 7.7 cm (ml x ap x cc), and is centered along the right pelvic sidewall adjacent to the acetabulum, displacing the uterus and bladder to the left.the left kidney is again displaced laterally due to the retroperitoneal hematoma, not significantly changed, and again appears hypoperfused at the interpolar and upper pole regions.both kidneys are atrophic, also not changed.there is wedge-shaped hypodensity throughout most of segment iii of the liver, as well as the anterior aspect of segment ii with persistent enhancement of the capsule.this study was not optimized for the evaluation of the intra-abdominal arteries, but the proximal celiac axis is patent.there is a stent within the proximal superior mesenteric artery.there is a small amount of simple free fluid in the right lower quadrant.no biliary dilatation.fatty liver is unchanged.there are multiple new wedge-shaped peripheral hypodensities within the spleen.the adrenals are unremarkable.the pancreas is unremarkable.the large and small bowel are normal in caliber with no evidence of obstruction or wall thickening and no areas of differential wall enhancement.there is high density material throughout the large and small bowel, likely representing liquid feeds, since no oral contrast was administered.there is a locule of air within the bladder, presumably due to recent catheterization.there is no free air within the abdomen.there is fluid within the endometrial cavity of uncertain significance.no lymphadenopathy is identified.there is a surgical midline defect within the subcutaneous fat and skin.the subjacent muscles and fascia are intact.there are no worrisome osseous lesions or fractures.
summary: left lateral segment hepatic infarcts.multiple small splenic infarcts.suspected type 2 endoleak of abdominal aneurysm repair.new large right pelvic hematoma extending to the groin.stable retroperitoneal hematoma.there is no specific evidence of a bile leak.the findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ from vascular surgery at 18:30 on ___.

text: a transition to collapsed bowel is demonstrated just proximal to the ileorectal anastomosis.adjacent mesenteric changes and small nodes are again seen in this area as well, which may reflect patient's underlying crohn's.the rectum, uterus, adnexa, and bladder are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval development of a diffusely dilated small bowel with a transition just proximal to the ileorectal anastomosis consistent with small bowel obstruction.unchanged mesenteric inflammatory changes and lymph nodes which may be related to the patient's underlying crohn's disease.resolution of bilateral pleural effusions.nodular opacity in the right middle lobe measuring 4 mm, a nonspecific finding possibly representing a resolving area of inflammatory change versus a nodule.this could be further evaluated with a follow-up chest ct to ensure resolution.

text: there is sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.the rectum, seminal vesicles and prostate are unremarkable.a foley is present within the bladder.the distal ureters are unremarkable.no free fluid is seen within the pelvis.there are no pelvic pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.severe degenerative change of lumbar spine with ankylosis at l4-5 and dextroconvex scoliosis.diffuse osteopenia.
summary: noderate pneumoperitoneum is more than usual for seven days post partial colectomy, but this may be within normal limits.no evidence of contrast extravasation at the anastomosis site.enlarged retroperitoneal periaortic and pericaval lymph nodes likely representing metastatic spread of disease.hypodense hepatic lesions, too small to characterize and metastatic disease cannot be excluded.small bilateral pleural effusions.small amount of free fluid with diffuse mesenteric fatty stranding may be postoperative.hypodense renal lesions, too small to characterize.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: there is wall thickening and submucosal edema in a loop of jejunum.the aorta, common iliac and internal iliac vessels are heavily calcified.in this setting, the abnormal jejununal loop is concerning for ischemic bowel.however, its appearance is nonspecific and inflammatory/infectious causes cannot be excluded.clinical correlation is suggested.this was discussed with dr.___ at approximately 4 p.m.on ___.a right inguinal hernia is again noted.the small bowel is not dilated.oral contrast does not reach the cecum.the rectum and sigmoid colon are distended with stool.overall, there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is a foley catheter within the bladder.the prostate is unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid.there is a high attenuation soft tissue mass in the right groin, which overlies the common femoral vessels and likely represents a hematoma.
summary: anterior mediastinal mass which most likely represents a hematoma.follow-up is suggested.small bilateral pleural effusions.thickened and edematous jejunal loop likley ischemic in origin.small amount of free intraperitoneal fluid.free intraperitoneal gas, which may be secondary to a recent g-tube placement.clinical correlation is suggested.stable appearance of right inguinal hernia without evidence of bowel obstruction.high attenuation soft tissue mass in the right groin most consistent with a hematoma.

text: right lower lobe small atelectasis is seen, similar to the previous study.linear atelectasis is noted in the left lower lobe.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.liver shows normal size and attenuation throughout.there are two focal high density peripheral lesions adjacent to the capsule of the right lobe of liver, which are similar to the previous study.there is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile dilatation.gallbladder is resected.stomach with signs of prior gastroplasty with the feeding tube within its lumen that was percutaneously inserted.adrenals are unremarkable bilaterally.kidneys are of normal opacification bilaterally with normal cortical thickness.of note, there is a non-occlusive thrombus of the left renal vein.the findings were present on the previous scan, but were more difficult to appreciate due to different technique and different opacification.there is an impression that the thrombus got smaller as compared to the previous study.small numerous retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted along the retroperitoneum.spleen is unremarkable.the right retroperitoneum, there is currently a small amount of debris and large amount of air, findings are compatible with status post recent debridement.further noted, small amount of fluid in the peritoneum in the right upper and mid abdomen, which probably continues to the organized fluid collection in the right anterior pelvis, which is measuring 12.8 x 10 cm x 7.4 cm.drainage catheter is noted in the right upper quadrant.
summary: status post debridement of the right flank with a small amount of debris and large amount of air in the retroperitoneum.stable-appearing right anterior pelvic fluid collection with small amount of fluid in perihepatic in the right mid abdomen, which seems to be connected to the pelvic fluid collection.findings are unchanged as compared to the previous examination.left nonocclusive renal vein thrombosis.the findings were communicated on the phone to dr.___ at 13:25, on ___.

text: the distal ureters, bladder, rectum, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid and no pelvic lymph adenopathy.the osseous structures reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: resolution of right retroperitoneal fluid collection with residual inflammatory changes in the duodenum and pancreatic head.no new fluid collections.

text: imaged lung bases are clear.there are coronary calcifications noted.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.a stable 5 mm hypodensity in the right lobe of the liver is too small to characterize, likely represents a simple cyst.otherwise, the liver enhances homogeneously.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without signs of hydronephrosis or masses.the stomach, small and large bowel appear normal, without wall thickening or obstruction.there is diffuse atherosclerotic disease in the descending aorta and its branches without aneurysm formation.there is moderate calcification involving the right renal artery with a plaque in the origin causing probably moderate stenosis.extensive atherosclerosis is seen in both common iliac arteries with a patent stent in the right common iliac artery.there is extensive calcification involving the bilateral common and superficial femoral arteries.there is no free air, free fluid, or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the abdomen.
summary: large peripherally enhancing fluid collection in the right inguinal region with marked surrounding inflammation.these findings are consistent with abscess, but a hematoma can have similar appearance.extensive calcifications involving the descending aorta and its branches with a patent right common iliac stent.calcified atherosclerosis with moderate stenosis in the right renal artery.these findings were discussed by phone with the surgery team on the time of reporting.

text: dependent atelectatic changes are noted at the lung bases.no pleural effusions or definite pulmonary nodules are present.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, right adrenal gland, stomach, and loops of large and small bowel appear unremarkable.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is no pneumatosis.no free air is present.a trace amount of ascites is seen adjacent to the liver.again seen is stranding around the left adrenal gland as well as around both kidneys, greater on the left than on the right.these findings appear relatively unchanged since the prior study.again identified is a simple cyst within the lower pole of the right kidney.also identified again are nodular soft tissue density masses adjacent to the left kidney measuring 1.2 x 2.8 cm in greatest dimensions, decreased in size from the prior study when it measured 1.4 x 4.3 cm.multiple lymph nodes are seen within the retroperitoneal region, primarily within the para- aortic and aortocaval regions.this is not significantly changed since the prior study.additionally a nodular soft tissue density mass is seen anterior to the left psoas muscle which has decreased in size since the prior study and measures approximately 1.4 x 1.8 cm, previously 2.7 x 3.4 cm.calcifications are again identified within the aorta.
summary: limited study given the lack of oral or iv contrast.fluid-filled, non-dilated loops of bowel, particularly within the colon, without evidence of bowel obstruction or bowel wall thickening.these findings are non-specific and no definite colitis is identified.interval decrease in size of nodular soft tissue density masses adjacent to the left kidney and left psoas muscle.extensive lymphadenopathy within the retroperitoneal, pelvic, and inguinal regions.stable appearance of right inguinal fluid collection.unchanged appearance of stranding surrounding the left adrenal gland and kidneys bilaterally.

text: extensive peri-bronchovascular opacities at the lung bases, left greater than right, has progressed compared to ___.left greater than right pleural effusions are small.atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications are noted.gynecomastia is present bilaterally.non-contrast evaluation of the known cirrhotic liver and sequela of portal hypertension, including peri-esophageal and peri-splenic varices are unremarkable.stones are again present within the gallbladder.the pancreas, spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.left renal hypodensities are incompletely characterized but appear unchanged in size.there is large volume ascites.intra- abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable though evaluation is limited without intravenous or oral contrast.there is no pneumoperitoneum.atherosclerotic calcifications involve the abdominal aorta though it is of normal caliber.
summary: large-volume ascites.no evidence for abdominal or pelvic hemorrhage.extensive peri-bronchovascular opacity at the lung bases would be consistent with infection.small left greater than right pleural effusions.cholelithiasis.cirrhosis with portal hypertension, though noncontrast evaluation is limited.diffuse anasarca.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the bladder, prostate, seminal vesicles are normal.there is no free fluid or abnormal pelvic/inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: nonspecific fluid-filled loops of small bowel, otherwise unremarkable ct of abdomen and pelvis.

text: the transplanted kidney in the left lower quadrant is normal in appearance, with appropriate enhancement and excretion.the peritransplant fat is clean.there is no hydronephrosis.enteric contrast has reached the level of the rectum, without evidence of obstruction, diverticulosis, diverticulitis or wall thickening.the abdominal and pelvic vasculature is diffusely calcified.again, there is a small collection just deep to the midline surgical incision, which is smaller in the interval, and likely a post-surgical seroma or hematoma.there is no gas within it to suggest abcess formation.there is a small right inguinal hernia, containing fat.
summary: no evidence of intraabdominal abscess or acute inflammatory process.diffuse vasculopathy including coronary artery calcifications.gallbladder stones, chronic, without evidence of cholecystitis or biliary obstruction.unchanged hiatal hernia and fat containing right inguinal hernia.normal bowel caliber without evidence of obstruction.
