text: the patient is status post right hip replacement.there is significant asymmetry between the thighs, right greater than left.there is a hematoma extending from the right inguinal region to the last imaged portion of the thigh, which is approximately 15 cm from the right metallic femoral head.the hematoma is present in the adductor compartment extending superiorly along the medial thigh with a fluid-fluid level.the visualized liver, spleen, gallbladder, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.the kidney is normal appearing.there is a 5 cm cyst in the left kidney.no pelvic masses are identified.no free fluid is identified.bone windows show the osseous structures to be normal appearing.
summary: large hematoma extending from the right inguinal region along the adductor compartment of the right thigh with mass effect causing subluxation of the prosthetic hip.left renal cyst.

text: the internal-external biliary drain is unchanged in position; and a new internal-external drain has been placed traversing the segment vi of the liver with its tip also in the duodenum, the central intrahepatic biliary duct and lateral segmental biliary ductal dilatation have nearly completely resolved, although some mild dilatation still persists in the left lobe.a new pigtail catheter has also been placed in a posterior subcapsular hepatic collection which has now resolved.further seperate collections medial and lateral to the inferior right lobe of the liver are similar at 65 x 25 mm and 32 x 64 mm, loculated enhancing collections at the gallbladder fossa are stable, the largest component is 18 x 28 mm.the appearance of the pancreas, kidneys, adrenal glands, spleen is unchanged.no large bowel dilatation or bowel wall thickening.a small pocket of free fluid surrounds the anterior border of the spleen.the prostate gland is enlarged.the abdominal aorta, renal arteries, sma, celiac axis, and ___ are all widely patent.bilateral pleural effusions have slightly increased in size and associated with overlying compressive atelectasis.degenerative changes throughout the lumbosacral spine with vacuum phenomena at t11, t12 and l1 are unchanged.
summary: interval placement of a second internal-external biliary drain with resolution of intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation in the right lobe of the liver.2) new pigtail catheter which has drained a subcapsular fluid collection posteriorly to segment vi/viii.3) lateral and medial oblong hepatuic subcapsularfluid collections abutting the inferior right lower lobe and loculated enhancing collection in the gallbladder fossa are stable.4) interval increase in the bilateral pleural effusions which are now moderate with overlying compressive atelectasis.the case was discussed with dr ___ ___.

text: the lung bases show minimal dependent atelectasis, with no pleural effusions or pneumothoraces.the liver contains a low attenuation area in its posterior right lobe, which is nonspecific in appearance on this single contrast phase study.otherwise, the liver has a homogeneous enhancement pattern, with no evidence of traumatic injury.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, stomach, small and large bowel, and intraabdominal great vessels are unremarkable.bilateral kidneys show symmetrical excretion of contrast, with no renal injuries, masses or hydronephrosis.bilateral adrenal glands and ureters are unremarkable.there is no free fluid, and no free air in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: low attenuation area in the liver is too small to fully characterize on this limited study, but could represent a hemangioma or cyst.otherwise, there is a normal ct appearance of the abdomen and pelvis, with no intrabdominal injuries.

text: partially imaged lungs demonstrate minimal dependent atelectases.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.imaged heart and pericardium appear normal.the liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesion.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder, spleen and pancreas appear unremarkable.the stomach, loops of small and large bowel appear normal.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without focal lesion or hydronephrosis.there are bilateral adrenal lesions, measuring 1.4 x 1.1 cm in the right and 1 x 1.4 in the left.these lesions are not well characterized due to lack of multiphasic contrast.there is no intra-abdominal free air, free fluid or lymphadenopathy.a nasogastric tube tip ends in the stomach.
summary: lower back hematoma without intraperitoneal or extraperitoneal bleed.no osseous fractures.bilateral adrenal lesions are not well characterized in this not multiphasic study.they may represent adenomas but associated hematoma can not be ruled out.these findings were discussed by phone with dr.___ at the time of reporting.

text: evaluation of the pelvis is slightly limited by streak artifact from left total hip arthroplasty.gas within the nondependent portion of the urinary bladder is likely related to the foley catheterization.there is no evidence of contrast leaking from the bladder into the small bowel.a filling defect is noted within the dependent portion of the bladder and likely represents clot.a second foley catheter appears to enter the vagina and terminates within the fluid collection in the presacral region following a similar configuration as the on the prior mre.the presacral fluid collection is not significantly changed from prior.the patient is status post colectomy.
summary: no evidence of enterovesical fistula or bowel obstruction.limited evaluation of known enterovaginal fistula without significant change in the known presacral fluid collection.small anterior abdominal fluid collection just anterior to presumed mesh, with an air-fluid level increased from prior.evidence of right-sided vesicoureteral reflux.cholelithiasis.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are normal.the bladder is decompressed with a foley catheter in place.a calcified uterine fibroid at the posterior uterine body is noted.there is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: abnormal dilated gallbladder with an irregular margin and a small amount of pericholecystic stranding.central density is intermediate but increased from normal.no pericholecystic fluid is seen.the findings raise concern for gangrenous cholecystitis versus gb mass.ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation of the gallbladder.mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation as seen on mri ___.no small-bowel obstruction.indeterminant left adrenal nodule is stable from ___.initial findings #1 and #2 were discussed with dr.___ ___ (surgery) 10:50 a.m.___.revised findings discussed with dr.___ ___ (icu resident) by phone at 5:13pm ___.

text: there are trace bilateral pleural effusions.absence of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the abdominal parenchymal organs and vasculature.there is ct evidence of anemia.liver is nodular in contour, and slightly shrunken, consistent with reported history of cirrhosis.there is an ill-defined hypodensity in segment iv (2, 19), which is incompletely characterized without iv contrast.there is pneumobilia, as well as air within the gallbladder lumen.gallbladder is also filled partially with oral contrast, which appears to have entered the gallbladder via a fistulous connection from the second portion of the duodenum.in this region, the duodenum is markedly thickened, with prominent peri-duodenal inflammatory stranding.air and oral contrast material is also seen in the distal common bile duct.there is soft tissue prominence in the region of the ampulla, though no definite nodule or mass is seen, and this prominence may be post-procedural related to recent eus.there are prominent porta hepatis, and peripancreatic lymph nodes, but the non-contrast appearance of the pancreas itself is unremarkable.pancreatic duct is not dilated.there are no pancreatic calcifications.prominent varices are seen throughout the left upper abdomen.spleen is mildly enlarged.non-contrast appearance of the kidneys is unremarkable.adrenal glands are normal in size bilaterally.there is no free intraperitoneal air.
summary: pneumobilia, and air and oral contrast material within the gallbladder lumen, concerning for fistulous connection between the adjacent ulcerated second portion of the duodenum seen on recent egd.cirrhotic liver, with incompletely characterized hypodensity in segment iv, prominent periportal lymph nodes, and numerous large splenorenal varices in the left upper quadrant.trace bilateral pleural effusions.

text: the wall of the large bowel is thickened with some thumb printing again consistent with pseudomembranous colitis.the visualized portions of the urinary bladder, distal ureters, prostate are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: decrease in size in morison's pouch fluid collection since prior examination.previously it had measured 8.3 x 4.0 cm and currently it measures 3.6 x 2.3 cm.a drainage catheter is in place.diffuse large bowel wall thickening and thumb printing consistent with pseudomembranous colitis.post-surgical changes in the abdomen as described.

text: there is diffuse ectasia and atherosclerotic plaque of the abdominal aorta without aneurysmal dilatation.there is a short segment of sigmoid colon which demonstrates multiple diverticula and diffuse stranding of the surrounding fat, consistent with acute diverticulitis.there is no focal or coalescent fluid collection/abscess that would be amenable to percutaneous drainage.a small segment of small bowel adjacent to this demonstrates mild dilitation and the distal small bowel in the rlq is decompressed.there is no free fluid in the deep pelvis.distal ureters and noncompressed bladder with indwelling foley catheter are unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the pelvis.
summary: acute uncomplicated sigmoid diverticulitis; no focal fluid collection/abscess that would be amenable to percutaneous drainage.adjacent small bowel dilitation, likely related to sentinal ileus; if clinically concerned serial kubs could be perfomred to exclude an deveoping partial sbo.emphysematous changes and atelectasis at the lung bases.findings discussed with dr.___ and ___ after the study.

text: multiple loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.the urinary bladder, distal ureters, uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: no abscess.no evidence of metastatic disease in the abdomen or pelvis.left renal simple cyst, with other left renal hypodensities too small to characterize.degenerative changes at l2-3 in the lumbar spine, with compression deformity of l2 of unknown acuity.largely stable appearance of right lower lobe consolidation.

text: there are consolidations at the lung bases bilaterally.on the left there is airspace opacification with an associated small pleural effusion consistent with pneumonia.on the right there is a larger pleural effusion with associated dense atelectasis.imaging of the organs of the abdomen is limited without iv contrast.however, no gross abnormalities are identified in the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, or kidneys.the gallbladder has high attenuation material within it.there are no inflammatory changes or abscesses or free fluid in the abdomen.there is a fairly large amount of free air antidependently in the abdomen.there is a peg with the balloon inflated in the stomach.the gastric wall is not apposed to the abdominal wall.enteric contrast has passed through to the mid to distal ileum and there is no extraluminal contrast to suggest perforation.the colon is notable only for diverticula in the descending portion.there are no adjacent inflammatory changes or fluid collections.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: free intraperitoneal air without evidence of bowel perforation.clinical correlation is needed but this most likely represents air related to recent peg placement with leakage around the tube into the peritoneal cavity.left lower lobe pneumonia and possible right lower lobe pneumonia.small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with associated dense atelectasis at the right lung base.the gallbladder contains relatively high attenuation material which may represent either gallbladder sludge or vicarious excretion of contrast if patient has had recent iv contrast.

text: the stomach is distended.the oral contrast that was administered did not transit past the stomach.there are dilated loops of small bowel which are similar in diameter to the dilation seen on the prior radiograph.the small bowel enters a parastomal hernia (2, 64).due to technique, the entire hernia is not well evaluated, but the small bowel then exits the hernia and remains dilated.there is no transition point visualized.this suggests a probable ileus, or less likely, a partial small bowel obstruction.there is free fluid within the para-hernial sac.there is no free air.there is no small bowel wall thickening or pneumatosis.there is no air seen within the portal vein.there is no frank ascites within the abdominal cavity.the colon is somewhat collapsed near the colostomy.the patient's hartmann pouch is unremarkable.there is marked atrophy of the left lobe of the liver.the right lobe is unremarkable without masses or lesions.the portal veins are patent.there are multiple layering gallstones within the gallbladder.there is no evidence of cholecystitis.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast appropriately.there is no mesenteric or abdominal lymphadenopathy.the vasculature is normal in course and caliber.the bladder and prostate are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: dilated loops of small bowel are seen proximal and distal to the parastomal hernia, suggesting an ileus, although partial obstruction cannot be fully excluded.this study is somewhat limited due to motion.if clinical suspicion continues to exist for mechanical obstruction, would recommend repeat ct.bilateral small pleural effusions.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.results were communicated with dr.___ ___ at 9:25 p.m.on ___ via telephone by dr.___.

text: there is a new small right pleural effusion, with adjacent atelectasis.a central venous catheter terminates at the cavoatrial junction.the patient's known hepatic lesions are less conspicuous on the current study.the low-attenuation lesion in the anterior spleen is again noted.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.known bilateral renal cortical cysts are less conspicuous.cholecystectomy clips are again noted.the collection in the bed of the pancreatic body and tail now contains predominantly air and measures 12.6 x 3.3 cm, compared to 15.0 x 2.9 cm on the prior study.relatively spared pancreatic parenchyma in the uncinate process, head and neck region appears similar.the second periduodenal collection now contains a right anterior approach pigtail catheter and measures approximately 5.6 x 2.1 cm, compared to 7.2 x 4.1 cm on the prior study.the collection contains mostly air, which may be related to frequent flushing of the catheter.no new abdominal fluid collections are seen.scattered non-pathologically enlarged mesenteric and peripancreatic lymph nodes are similar, likely reactive in nature.there is trace ascites adjacent to the liver tip, as before, with moderate stranding of the peritoneal fat, greater on the right.post-surgical changes in the anterior abdominal midline are noted.the mass effect of the periduodenal fluid collection upon the duodenum cannot be assessed given the lack of contrast in the duodenum.all of the oral contrast is contained within the stomach.
summary: interval decrease in a predominantly air containing pancreatic pseudocyst and periduodenal fluid collection with persistent inflammatory changes of pancreatitis, but no evidence of new collection.

text: the transplanted pancreas is noted to enhance normally, and there is a trace amount of fluid density in the transplant bed.the transplanted kidney contains multiple simple cysts and enhances normally and demonstrates excretion.surgical sutures are noted about the transplanted pancreas.no bowel wall abnormalities are noted.there is no lymphadenopathy.there is vascular calcification.the bladder wall appears somewhat thickened.the overall degree of ascites has descreased markedly in the interval.the osseous structures demonstrate no suspicious abnormalities.
summary: overall improved appearance with decreased amount of ascites and smaller pleural effusions.no obvious bowel abnormalities.inparticular there is no evidence for bowel obstruction as demonstrated on plain film.

text: the urinary bladder is normal.the coloanal anastomotic site delineated by suture (2a:92) appears similar; however, oral contrast has not reached that level on today's study.there is a stable presacral fluid collection with air bubbles measuring 7.3 x 2.5 cm (2a:79), unchanged compared to prior study.
summary: stable appearance of fluid collection in the splenectomy bed surrounding the tail of pancreas which appears edematous.basilar atelectasis and small to moderate left pleural effusion, stable.stable presacral fluid collection with foci of gas, which could be post-surgical fluid collection or phlegmon.

text: pelvic small and large bowel structures are within normal limits.bladder and uterus appear normal.there is no free pelvic fluid.there is no pelvic adenopathy.there are several large lymph nodes in both inguinal regions, measuring up to 20 mm in short axis diameter.
summary: multiple new pulmonary nodules as described.given the patient's history of multiple malignancies, a pet/ct would be indicated for further evaluation.technically very limited pe study.no central pe was seen, however, more peripheral pes cannot be excluded.multiple hypoattenuating lesions in both kidneys, most of which fulfill the criteria for simple cysts.several of the lesions are too small to characterize.multiple enlarged inguinal lymph nodes bilaterally.no evidence of fractures or injury to solid organs or vessels.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, distal ureters, bladder, prostate gland, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are identified.
summary: no evidence for acute intraabdominal or intrapelvic injury including visceral laceration, free air, or free fluid.left upper lobe ground-glass opacities consistent with contusion.

text: there is extensive stool in the rectum and throughout the colon, again consistent with constipation and probably impaction.a foley catheter is present in the bladder with associated air within the dome of the bladder.the uterus appears normal.there is an unchanged cystic lesion in the right ovary of 28 x 20 mm in axial dimensions, probably a follicle.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy, or free fluid.
summary: new patchy bibasilar consolidations, which may represent aspiration, but are nonspecific.stable renal and splenic cysts.stable right adnexal cyst.fat-containing umbilical hernia.probable fecal impaction.

text: mdct was performed from the base of the lung to the iliac crest following administration of oral and intravenous contrast.the patient is status post whipple procedure.there is pneumobilia.there is heterogeneous enhancement of the liver as previously noted.however, in the posterior segment of the right lobe of the liver, there is a new low-attenuation lesion, series 2, image 60, measuring 18.6 x 16.6 mm.this is concerning for metastatic disease.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the gallbladder has been removed.the patient is status post whipple procedure.the tail of the pancreas is unremarkable.the pancreatic duct and the remaining body of the pancreas measures approximately 4.9 mm and is unchanged in size since the prior study.the soft tissue mass previously identified to the right of the sma and anterior to the left renal vein in the region of surgical clips now measures 2.3 x 2.2 cm.previously, it measured 1.7 x 2.1 cm.a lymph node adjacent to the hepatic artery is again noted and is essentially unchanged in size allowing for volume averaging.a portacaval node is noted, series 2, image 58, measuring 7.8 x 14.1 mm which is essentially unchanged.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast in a normal fashion.there is a left upper pole renal cyst measuring 3.8 cm which appears to be simple in nature and is unchanged.left lower pole low-attenuation lesion consistent with a simple cyst, series 2, image 77 measures 10 mm and is also unchanged as is an exophytic 2.2 cm left lower pole renal cyst.
summary: there are multiple new pulmonary nodules concerning for worsening metastatic disease.increased size of adenopathy adjacent to the sma.new low-attenuation lesion in the posterior segment of the right lobe of the liver, also concerning for worsening metastatic disease.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions, slightly increased from prior.there is compressive atelectasis.there are gallstones.the liver, pancreas, spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.kidneys are atrophic bilaterally.there is an endovascular repair of infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.aneurysm sac is stable in size measuring 5.5 x 5.5 cm.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.small bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.stable 5.5 cm infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm sac, status post endovascular repair.slightly increased small bilateral pleural effusions and slight increased free fluid in the pelvis.cholelithiasis.

text: the distal ureters, bladder and rectum are all unremarkable.there is no free fluid, no free air, and no abnormal lymph node enlargement within the pelvis.the bones demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: severe pancreatitis.no evidence of cyst, mass, or pancreatic necrosis.fatty liver.adrenal mass on the left, unchanged since prior exam.

text: though this exam is not tailored for supradiaphragmatic evaluation, minimal atelectatic changes are identified within the lung bases.4 mm solid pulmonary nodule in lingula is unchanged since ___.no pleural effusion identified.heart size is normal with a small pericardial effusion versus stable thickening of the anterior stripe of the pericardium.there is no heterogeneity within the unenhanced liver to suggest malignancy.there is no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation evident.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the pancreas conatains interdigitating fat but no discrete lesions.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.patient is status post a left partial nephrectomy.minimal stable surrounding postinflammatory scarring.there is a stable 1 cm right lower renal pole hypodensity, better evaluated on and thought to represent a hemorrhagic renal cyst on the ___ mri.the stomach is unremarkable.a large duodenal diverticulum is noted.additionally, diverticula noted throughout the colon without evidence of surrounding inflammation to suggest diverticulitis.the rectum, prostate, seminal vesicles and bladder are unremarkable.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.no free air identified.there is a large hematoma centered within the left iliacus with extension throughout the left posterior pararenal space into and around the left quadratus lumborum, psoas muscle, as well as tracking along the left lateral conal fascia and into the left abdominal wall musculature.the inferior aspect of the hematoma is not visualized though hematoma is noted to decrease in size as it extends along the left iliopsoas muscle into the thigh.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout.no retroperitoneal, mesenteric or portacaval lymphadenopathy evident.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions identified.bilateral, left greater than right, fat containing inguinal hernias are present.
summary: left retroperitoneal hematoma centered in the left iliacus with extension throughout the posterior pararenal space into the left psoas, quadratus lumborum and abdominal wall musculature.hematoma is remote from the left kidney with left partial nephrectomy.stable 1 cm hypodensity in inferior pole of right kidney, better visualized and characterized as a likely hemorrhagic renal cyst on a prior mri.4 mm pulmonary nodule in lingula, stable since ___.

text: there is a new small left and minimal right pleural effusion with associated bibasilar atelectasis.compared to prior exam from ___, there is new intrahepatic biliary dilatation with ectatic cystic duct dilatation in the segment vi of the right liver lobe, likely representing abscesses from concurrent cholangtitis.there is minimal pericholecystic fluid surrounding the gallbladder, but no evidence of gallstones or pericholecystic stranding.the commun bile duct is dilated measuring 13 mm.there is no evidence of distal common bile duct stones.the pancreatic duct is unchanged dilated measuring 6 mm.there are unchanged focal calcifications in the pancreatic head, likely sequela of chronic pancreatitis.there are unchanged multiple cystic lesions in the pancreatic tail and in size decreased pancreatic pseudocyst at the splenic hilum.there is unchanged metastatic focus in the soft tissues of the pararenal space posterior to the descending colon (series 301b, image 34).there is a new cystic component posterior to the descending colon and there is a new geographic area in the adjacent inferior pole of the spleen, consistent with splenic infarct.the left adrenal gland is unchanged and enlarged consistent with metastasis.patient is status post right nephrectomy.there are unchanged multiple lesions in the left kidney.there is left extrarenal pelvis.the left ureter appears normal.there are multiple scattered retroperitoneal lymph nodes, especially paraaortic measuring up to 1.3 cm (series 2, image 35).the portal vein and smv are barely visualized and completely thrombosed.the splenic vein is not seen and also likely thrombosed.this is significantly progressed from prior exam from ___ where there had been only focal thrombosis within the smv, portal and splenic vein.there is no free air.there is a small amount of simple free fluid in the pelvis.there is moderate amount of fluid in the right lower quadrant.the stomach, small and large bowel are all mildly dilated and fluid-filled.multiple small bowel loops measuring up to 2.4 cm.there is a right small bowel containing inguinal hernia without evidence of small bowel obstruction or incarceration.foley catheter is in the urinary bladder.the prostate and seminal vesicles are normal.
summary: new severe intrahepatic biliary dilatation and possible intrahepatic abscess formation likely due to cholangitis.no evidence of stones or masses in the pancreatic head.complete thrombosis of the portal, splenic vein and smv, significantly progressed compared to ___.new splenic infarction.pseudocyst at the splenic hilum has decreased in size.new right inguinal small bowel containing hernia without evidence of obstruction or incarceration.small-to-moderate amount of free fluid in the right lower quadrant and pelvis.unchanged pulmonary nodules and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: ct abdomen: the lung bases are clear.the heart size is normal.the spleen, adrenal glands, stomach, small bowel, gallbladder, and kidneys are within normal limits.there is marked atrophy of the pancreas.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: findings highly concerning for colonic malignancy in the cecum and proximal ascending colon with associated perforation causing a large abscess which extends through the right lower quadrant anterior abdominal wall and into the subcutaneous tissues.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 6:10 p.m.on ___ in person.

text: there is a foley catheter within the urinary bladder.otherwise, the bladder is unremarkable.the distal ureters opacify well with contrast.there are multiple colonic diverticula but no evidence of acute diverticulitis.there is no free pelvic fluid or lymphadenopathy.
summary: no traumatic injury of the abdomen or pelvis identified.small stones and sludge within the gallbladder, but no ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.

text: the liver and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys contain multiple nonobstructing stones bilaterally measuring 1-2 mm.punctate calcifications are noted within the pancreas.the spleen is enlarged.the gallbladder contains hyperdense material which could represent sludge or excretion of contrast from prior ct study.ascites is present, predominantly perihepatic and perisplenic.several lymph nodes are noted, however, these are not pathologically enlarged by ct criteria.no free air is seen.loops of small and large bowel are of normal size and caliber.
summary: bibasilar consolidations, increased from the prior examination concerning for infection.diffuse ground glass opacities, likely pulmonary edema.no evidence of bowel obstruction.splenomegaly.multiple nonobstructing renal stones bilaterally.diverticulosis.

text: the visualized heart is unremarkable.the lung bases are clear.the pericardium and pleura are intact without effusion.the liver is normal without focal or diffuse abnormality.the gallbladder, intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts, and pancreas are normal.the spleen enhances heterogeneously, now decreased in size with increased regions of perfusion compared to prior.splenic vein thrombus is not definitively seen.bilateral adrenal glands are normal.bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.bilateral ureters are of normal course and calibur.the esophagus and stomach are normal.small and large bowel have a normal course and caliber.the terminal ileum is unremarkable.colonic diverticulosis is present without diverticulitis.the appendix is not visualized, but no secondary signs of appendicitis are present.no definite sign of either crohn's disease or c.diff colitis.large atherosclerotic calcifications are present in the abdominal aorta immediately adjacent to the origins of both the celiac axis and the sma (301b: 49).the celiac axis is opacified with contrast.the proximal sma is not well-opacified but reconstitutes distally, likely from collateral flow.additional scattered atherosclerotic calcifications are present along the course of the abdominal aorta and iliac vessels.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.no pneumoperitoneum, free abdominal fluid, or abdominal wall hernia.
summary: large calcified atherosclerotic plaques immediately adjacent to origin of celiac axis and superior mesenteric artery.proximal sma is not well-opacified but reconstitutes distally.findings are concerning for hemodynamically significant stenosis of both celiac artery and sma and this may cause chronic mesenteric ischemia.no evidence of crohn's or c.diff colitis.heterogeneous appearance of spleen, compatible with known prior splenic infarct.findings were communicated by ___ ___ to dr.___ ___ on ___, ___ at 1650.

text: the lung bases are clear, with minimal dependent atelectasis noted.mitral annular calcifications are present.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.medullary pyramid density likely represents a small amount of excreted contrast as this has not been present on prior studies.the gallbladder appears somewhat distended.however, no stones are seen and there is no evidence of biliary ductal dilatation.the size is similar to the ct of ___.there is no free fluid, bowel dilatation, or pathologic lymph node enlargement within the abdomen or pelvis.vascular calcifications are moderate.
summary: no ct evidence of acute process within the abdomen or pelvis.although the gallbladder is slightly distended, it is similar in size when compared to the study of ___.

text: a foley catheter balloon is inflated within the urethra.the uterus, sigmoid colon and rectum are normal.there is a moderate amount of free fluid within the pelvis, measuring simple fluid density.soft tissues demonstrate severe anasarca.bone windows again demonstrate heterotopic bone formation posterior to the proximal left femur, which may be consistent with myositis ossificans related to prior trauma.the prominent lymph nodes along the subcutaneous tissues of the lower chest are stable.
summary: fluid and air tracking along the gj tube site consistent with known clinical leak.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess or extraluminal contrast extravasation.no evidence of obstruction.bibasilar airspace opacity is likely consolidation with small bilateral pleural effusions.unchanged splenic infarcts of unknown etiology.moderate amount of ascites and severe anasarca.right renal hemorrhagic cyst.foley catheter balloon is inflated within the urethra and should be repositioned.heterotopic bone formation associated with the left proximal femur may relate to myositis ossificans related to prior trauma.this heterotopic bone has slowly increased in size and prominence since ___, at which time there was an intramuscular hematoma in this region.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of the exam.

text: small bilateral pleural effusion right greater than left.mild bilateral atelectasis right greater than left.status post cabg.part of right effusion is not in a dependent location.there has been interval resolution of pneumobilia.no focal liver lesion is detected.left lobe of the liver is severely atrophied.cholelithiasis with no evidence of cholecystitis.common bile duct stent.the distal tip of the stent is adjacent to a 25 x 28-mm hypodense lesion within the posterior part of the pancreatic head which based on the previous study demonstrates avid enhancement.the remainder of the pancreas is atrophied.the patient is status post right nephrectomy and right adrenalectomy.a striated nephrogram pattern of the left kidney is noted.two 7-mm non- obstructing stones of the mid pole of the left kidney are visualized.the patient is status post aortobifemoral stent grafting with interval development of perigraft gas collection which is located both inside the aneurysmal sac and outside the aneurysmal sac in the retroperitoneal cavity.the extensive retroperitoneal hematoma on the right side which extends into the lower pelvis is unchanged in size and extension.moderate distention of the small bowel and large bowel loops are unchanged compared to the prior study.large ventral hiatal hernia containing bowel loops is unchanged.non- pathologically enlarged node is noted in the portacaval region measuring 7 mm in the short axis.
summary: mild distention of the small bowel and large bowel loops with no evidence of bowel obstruction.findings are most compatible with ileus.status post aortobifemoral graft with no interval change in the size of extensive right retroperitoneal hematoma.gas locules noted in the aneurysmal sac and in the retroperitoneal region are most likely post-surgical in nature.cholelithiasis.status post right total nephrectomy with a hypodense mass of the pancreatic head.differential possibilities include metastatic renal cell carcinoma and primary hypervascular tumor of the pancreatic head.please note that this mass was avidly enhancing on arterial phase of the prior study.large ventral hernia containing loops of small bowel and large bowel.small bilateral pleural effusion, right greater than left.non obstructing left renal stones.

text: the small and large bowel are dilated fluid-filled without evidence of obstruction.there is no fluid collection or extravasation of oral contrast.there is mild left basilar atelectasis.the lung bases are otherwise clear.there is a trace pericardial effusion.evaluation of the liver is limited in the absence of iv contrast, but there is no gross abnormality.gallbladder wall edema and low volume ascites are likely secondary to aggressive fluid resuscitation (2ac:29).the pancreas, spleen, and adrenals are normal.the kidneys are grossly unremarkable, and there is no hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.oral contrast passes freely through the stomach is normal.the patient is status post right hemicolectomy.there is no free intraperitoneal air.
summary: dilated, fluild-filled small and large bowel.this finding is non-specific and while colitis is possible, it is most likely representative of a diarrheal state.no abscess.low volume ascites and gallbladder wall edema, likely secondary to aggressive fluid rehydration.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.mjmgb

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.the effusion on the right is unchanged in size however there is now high density material within the fluid which was not present on the prior study.the appearances are indeterminate, however hematoma/hemorrhage is the likely cause.the left sided effusion has increased slightly in size but is otherwise unremarkable.there is ___-atrial cardiac enlargement, with mild mitral valve calcification, unchanged.the pericardial effusion is unchanged in size.
summary: extensive free air within the abdomen.no definite cause is identified and might be related to the recent peg tube insertion.no leakage of enteric contrast into the peritoneal cavity.5.0 x 2.2 cm rim enhancing collection adjacent to the left iliacus muscle most likely representing evolution of a previous retroperitoneal hemorrhage/hematoma.bilateral pleural effusions with high attenuation material within the effusion on the right.the effusion is unchanged in size when compared to previously and the appearances are of uncertain significance (particularly without precontrast images), possibly representing prior hemorrhage.bilateral renal infarcts, unchanged.interval superior mesenteric artery stent insertion.dr ___ discussed this result with dr ___ (pager no ___) by telephone at 14.50 on ___.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureter, prostate, seminal vesicles and rectum and sigmoid colon have normal appearance.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal nodes are noted.no free air was noted within the pelvis.
summary: no evidence of disease recurrence in the abdomen and pelvis.unchanged 4 mm hypodense lesion of the dome of the liver.unchanged mild intra- and extra-hepatic bile duct dilatation.consolidative changes of the left lung base most likely representing atelectasis, however early pneumonia cannot be excluded.

text: there is extensive consolidation posteriorly in both lower lobes, with adjacent pleural effusions.there are also parenchymal foci of calcified density which were present on the study of ___.the liver is of diffusely low attenuation, consistent with fatty infiltration.there are multiple stones within the gallbladder.the spleen is normal.a small splenule is noted.there are no peripancreatic fluid collections.there is no evidence of pancreatic necrosis, though evaluation is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.both adrenal glands are normal.there is residual contrast material in both kidneys from the study performed two days earlier.a small cyst is again noted in the midpole of the right kidney.the stomach, small bowel and colon are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid scattered throughout the peritoneal cavity.
summary: extensive pulmonary consolidation bilaterally and small pleural effusions.marked fatty infiltration of the liver.no pancreatic pseudocysts or evidence of pancreatic necrosis on this non- contrast exam.small amount of peritoneal free fluid.

text: there are bilateral simple pleural effusions, which are new from the prior exam.there is dependent atelectasis.there are no discrete pulmonary nodules.the base of the heart is normal in size.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the coronary arteries.there is a small pericardial effusion, unchanged from the prior exam.
summary: percutaneous cholecystostomy tube has been dislodged and is no longer in appropriate position, new from the most recent cholecystotomy tube check on ___.decrease in distention of the gallbladder with persistent mild distention and wall thickening and edema; given longstanding cholecystostomy tube presence this most likely represents changes of chronic cholecystitis but hida would be necessary to confirm continued patency of the cystic duct (as has been seen on prior recent studies).new abdominal low-density fluid in the mesentery, right paracolic gutter, pelvis, and right inguinal hernia.this is of unclear etiology, and could be ascites or a bile leak.recommend gallbladder scan for further evaluation.bowel wall thickening in the ascending and transverse colon is likely due to intramural edema or fatty changes from chronic colitis.new bilateral small pleural effusions.stable splenomegaly.given that prior studies have demonstrated continued patency of the cystic duct, and that the cholecystostomy tube has reportedly had high outputs prior to being dislodged, the overall picture suggests dysfunction at the distal cbd and hida is recommended to assess.results were discussed with surgery intern and surgery chief resident at 4:30 p.m.on ___ via telephone by dr.___ ___.results were additionally discussed with the medicine resident, dr.___ at 5:30 p.m.on ___ via telephone by dr.___.

text: again seen is moderate cardiomegaly and extensive coronary and valvular calcifications.there are bilateral effusions, moderate on the right and small on the left.there is mild basilar atelectasis.a hepatic cyst is again noted in addition to multiple small low-attenuation foci, which may represent cysts or hemangiomas, but are too small to be fully characterized.the gallbladder is mildly distended.there is slight prominence of the pancreatic duct.the spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are stable.again noted are a right renal cyst and additional small low-attenuation foci, which may represent cysts, but are too small to be fully characterized.stomach and small bowel loops are unremarkable.there is a small amount of ascites and diffuse mesenteric inflammatory stranding.there is no free air.aortic graft is again noted.
summary: wall thickening and adjacent inflammatory stranding of the sigmoid colon and rectum, most consistent with an infectious colitis such as clostridium difficile.long segment diverticulitis, inflammatory colitis, or ischemic colitis are considered less likely possibilities.no free air or abscess.re-demonstration of multiple bladder diverticula.the bladder wall appears somewhat thickened, likely secondary to its decompressed status.if there is concern for cystitis, correlation with urinalysis could be performed.bilateral pleural effusions and mild ascites.aortic graft is again seen.

text: multiple coronary artery calcifications are noted.moderate bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis are seen at the visualized lung bases.a 9-mm rounded area of hypoattenuation seen at the liver dome (2:15).no other focal lesions identified within the liver.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, splenule, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.a 7.6 x 7.7 cm rounded low-attenuation lesion is seen in the right kidney, most likely representing simple cyst.rounded hypoattenuating lesions within the left kidney are also seen, consistent with cysts.there is a 1.5-cm exophytic relatively high-attenuation lesion seen arising from the mid pole of the left kidney (2:41).nonspecific perinephric stranding is seen bilaterally.no abnormally dilated loops of bowel are seen.there is no evidence of free air or free fluid within the abdomen.psoas muscles appear symmetric.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.moderate bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.coronary artery calcifications.bilateral renal cysts.1.5-cm relatively hyperattenuating rounded lesion in the mid pole of the left kidney likely represents a hyperdense cyst; however, this could be confirmed with ultrasound.small hypodensity seen at the liver dome, possibly representing a cyst versus partial voluming artifact.this could also be confirmed with ultrasound.coronary artery calcifications.vascular calcifications and calcification of the vas deferens, suggesting a history of diabetes.enlargement of the prostate.

text: limited view of the lung bases demonstrates unchanged right lower lobe 8 mm (2:1) and 4 mm (2:7) nodules.thickening and scarring along the left major fissure is new since the prior study.limited view of the heart demonstrates incompletely imaged pacemaker with leads.small hiatal hernia.please note, assessment of solid visceral organs is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.the liver is hypoattenuated, compatible with diffuse fatty infiltration.there is no focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is contracted.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.the right adrenal gland contains a 1.6 cm adenoma, which has not changed from the prior study.within the left adrenal gland laterally, there is a 2.5 cm lesion, unchanged from the prior study.within the body of the gland, there is thickening, which is rounded measuring 2.1 x 1.5 cm also stable.the kidneys demonstrate multiple cystic lesions in the kidneys bilaterally, not as well seen due to noncontrast nature of this study.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, though scattered nonenlarged nodes are seen.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.the appendix is seen and is normal.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.
summary: unchanged bilateral adrenal nodules.unchanged left pelvic node with irregularity to the bladder, incompletely assessed given incomplete distention and absence of iv contrast.unchanged l2 vertebral body and 9th right rib metastases.unchanged right lower lobe nodules.

text: the lung bases demonstrate mild bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is a moderate amount of ascites.the liver appears nodular and shrunken consistent with cirrhosis.there is pericholecystic fluid, which can be seen with third spacing.a large gallstone is again identified and unchanged.within the limitations of a non- contrast exam, the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.ng tube is seen terminating in the stomach.small bowel loops are normal in caliber.the previously identified wall thickening within the proximal small bowel is no longer identified.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction or dilated loops of small bowel.the abdominal aorta is of normal caliber throughout.there is no definite mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free air identified.
summary: cirrhotic-appearing liver with moderate amount of ascites.pericholecystic fluid, which could be related to third spacing.gallstone is unchanged.clinical correlation is recommended.no evidence of bowel obstruction or dilated loops of bowel.no evidence of free air.

text: the bladder wall is thickened, with a foley catheter now situated appropriately with the balloon within the bladder lumen.the rectum appears unremarkable as does the prostate and seminal vesicles.there is no lymphadenopathy or free pelvic fluid.
summary: no evidence of obstruction.resolution of the previously noted left kidney collecting system fullness with an nu stent remaining in place.thickened bladder wall.changes in the lung bases suggestive of aspiration, as before.

text: the uterus, adnexa, bladder, and distal ureters, and pelvic loops of bowel are within normal limits.there is no pelvic free air or pathologic lymphadenopathy.
summary: moderate right pleural effusion with associated right relaxation atelectasis.tiny right apical subpleural nodule.given the history of neoplasm, recommend attention to this area in followup or chest ct in three months whichever is soonest.perihepatic fluid.biloma cannot be excluded.recommend mr ___ ___ or nuclear medicine hepatobiliary study.status post hepatic trisegmentectomy.status post left nephrectomy with thrombus in the left renal vein.subcentimeter hypodensities in the left kidney.please refer to the mr for further details.left adrenal thickening characterized as adenoma on recent mr.coronary artery calcification.peripancreatic fluid, likely secondary to partial nephrectomy.correlate with labs to exclude pancreatitis.

text: there has been dramatic decrease in size of several of the conglomerate lymph node masses.in particular, a left retroperitoneal lymph node cluster previously measuring approximately 7.3 x 3.8 cm now measures approximately 4.9 x 2.1 cm.there has been a similar decrease in size of several retroperitoneal lymph node clusters as well as lymphadenopathy extending along the bilateral iliac chains.liver, pancreas, and adrenals are unremarkable.again seen is heterogeneous material within the gallbladder, likely representing stones and sludge.there is no evidence of acute complication.the spleen has demonstrated an interval decrease in size.presently, it measures a maximum of 16 cm in maximal craniocaudal extent, previously measuring 18 cm.kidneys are unchanged in appearance, again noting scattered hypodensities which are too small to characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.abdominal aorta is normal in caliber throughout.bowel loops are all normal in caliber, without evidence for obstruction.
summary: substantial decrease in size of lymphadenopathy within the chest, abdomen, and pelvis.

text: there is atelectasis at the lung bases, right worse than left.the remainder of the lung bases are clear, and the visualized portions of the heart and pericardium are within normal limits.there is a trace right-sided pleural effusion.at the anterolateral aspect of the liver, there is a 4.2 cm tv x 4.7 cm ap x 7.3 cm si fluid density collection, which on non-contrast images has a semilunar hyperdense portion in the dependent aspects, which has the appearance of hematocrit level.in addition, after the administration of iv contrast, there is a thin layer of hyperdense material settling on this layer, which persists in delayed imaging and represents a small amount of contrast settling on the hematocrit level.in the superior portions of this fluid collection, there is air which is presumably associated with the pigtail catheter which is well-positioned in the collection.in addition, there are inflammatory changes and rim enhancement surrounding this fluid collection, with some inflammatory changes also seen along the intercostal space that the catheter is tracking.there are no other separate fluid collections identified from this drained collection.the liver appears to be displaced medially by this fluid collection.there are surgical clips extending along the hepatic hilum towards the right lobe of the liver, and the gallbladder is unremarkable in appearance.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no abdominal lymph adenopathy or free fluid.
summary: anterolateral perihepatic fluid collection, with drainage catheter well- positioned within it.a hematocrit level is seen, and a small amount of contrast extravasates into this collection, without evidence of brisk hemorrhage.in addition, the pigtail of the catheter is positioned in a lower-density portion of this collection, probably representing a more serous component of the collection.this fluid collection has increased somewhat in size since the prior ct performed three days ago.no subhepatic fluid collection is seen.

text: the bladder contains a foley catheter and contrast material.the bladder wall is abnormally thickened.again noted is a left sided ostomy defect.
summary: limited study without contrast was designed primarily to evaluate for obstruction.this demonstrates small- bowel obstruction with transition point just proximal to the stoma site.for pulmonary abnormalities and better assessment of the abnormal esophagus please refer to the chest cta performed several hours earlier.

text: there is a partially calcified lesion at the fundus of the uterus, unchanged degnerated uterine fibroid.
summary: no evidence of sbo.no acute process of the abdomen or pelvis.

text: ct chest: there is a small left-sided pneumothorax with no evidence of tension.no shift of the mediastinum is seen.there is a significant amount of subcutaneous air overlying the left anterior chest wall.there is a trace left-sided pleural effusion which measures simple fluid density.an area of ground-glass opacity in the left upper lobe may represent a tiny pulmonary contusion.the right lung is clear.the airways remain patent.there is no pericardial effusion.extensive coronary calcifications are present.the pulmonary artery is top normal in diameter, which could reflect component of pulmonary hypertension.there is no evidence of intrathoracic vascular injury.there is calcified atherosclerotic disease of the intrathoracic aorta.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.
summary: displaced fractures ofthe left anterolateral 3rd through 6th ribs with small left pneumothorax.nondisplaced sternal fracture without significant hematoma or vascular injury.trace left-sided pleural effusion measuring simple fluid density.significant subcutaneous emphysema over the left anterior chest wall.

text: the urinary bladder wall is unremarkable.visualized loops of small and large bowel including the cecum and appendix are normal with no evidence of fat stranding or wall thickening.air and stool are identified in all segments of the colon which is nondistended throughout its course.no free fluid, free air and no lymphadenopathy.
summary: interval resolution of fat stranding in the region of the cecum and ascending colon suggestive of resolving inflammatory process.no evidence of abscess within the abdomen or pelvis.two small nodules measuring approximately 4 mm in the left lung base which were not seen on the previous study and may represent inflammatory nodules.a chest ct is recommended if there is concern for acute pulmonary infection.however, if patient is relatively asymptomatic from a pulmonary point of view, followup chest ct is suggested in three months to document resoution vs progression.slight interval decrease in distal esophageal wall thickening.

text: scarring within the lower anterior abdominal wall is noted, consistent with recent surgery.the bladder is unremarkable.the uterus is visualized.there are no adnexal masses.there is no inguinal or deep pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: large mass in the head/neck of the pancreas with innumerable small peripancreatic lymph nodes.this mass abuts and compresses the superior mesenteric vein.features are most suggestive of primary pancreatic adenocarcinoma, with a mucinous pancreatic tumor less likely given the dilated pancreatic duct and atrophy in the pancreatic tail.low density lesions in the liver incompletely characterized on this exam and attention should be paid to these on follow-up.no evidence of bowel obstruction or other complications from recent surgery.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.these unexpected findings were discussed by telephone with dr.___ ___ on the afternoon of ___.two small low-density lesions within the liver, too small to definitively characterize.attention to these on followup is recommended.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, bladder, adnexa, and uterus are normal.there is no free pelvic fluid or lymphadenopathy noted.there is profound dextroscoliosis without any acute bony abnormalities.3d reconstructions: coronal and sagittal reconstructions were essential in delineating the anatomy and pathology.
summary: no evidence of small or large bowel masses.mild left hydronephrosis that is likely due to the patient's profound scoliosis and subsequent anatomical distortion.profound dextroscoliosis of the thoracolumbar spine.possible neurofibroma approximately at the level of t10 extending from the vertebral canal into the right posterior lung base.this should be correlated with the patient's prior imaging.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate unchanged bibasilar opacities likely atelectasis or scarring.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.coronary calcifications are noted.the liver is normal in attenuation without focal lesion.mild periportal edema is noted.the portal and hepatic veins appear patent.the gallbladder is nondistended with surrounding wall edema which could be related to the adjacent colonic edema.the pancreas is unremarkable.the spleen is not fully assessed, but is enlarged to at least 18.7 cm.the bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.exophytic upper pole right renal cyst is seen along with multiple hypodensities in the left kidney which are too small to be fully characterized.the small bowel is grossly unremarkable.there is pancolonic mural edema and thickening.there is surrounding stranding as well.there is no free intraperitoneal air.extensive lymphadenopathy is seen within the periportal, mesenteric and paraaortic nodal chains without notable interval change from the prior study.dense aortic calcifications are noted.
summary: mural edema involving the entire colon extending to the rectum compatible with pancolitis and proctitis.pseudomembranous colitis, such as c.difficile, is most likely.other infectious colitides are secondary diagnostic considerations.unchanged extensive adenopathy compatible with provided history of cll along with splenomegaly.this was discussed in person with dr.___ by dr.___ at 18:25 on ___.

text: visualized portions of the lung bases are free of nodules, consolidations, or effusions.there is hyperdense contrast material heterogeneously filling the majority of the right lobe of the liver with a preference for the periphery.the 3-cm lesion seen on prior mri in the medial portion of the caudate is not seen on this study; however, it does appear to be covered by the contrast and chemotherapy injection (3:21).the smaller lesion seen in segment vii is again not directly visualized on this study but does appear to be included in the region of the chemoembolization.there is a portacaval stent in place.the liver has a very nodular contour.within the limits of non-contrast technique, the gallbladder is absent.within the limitations of non-contrast technique, the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is a minimal amount of mesenteric edema.there is no frank ascites.there is no free abdominal air.
summary: cirrhotic liver status post chemoembolization of the right lobe and caudate lobe.the lesions in the caudate lobe and segment vii are in the area covered by the chemoembolization.

text: there is diffuse wall thickening involving the cecum, and extending to the proximal and mid portions of the transverse colon.additionally, the region of the colon at the hepatic flexure is particularly ahaustral in apperance.there more distal portions of the transverse colon do not show significant wall thickening.however, portions of the descending colon may also have some degree of wall thickening, although this is difficult to assess as it is decompressed.the sigmoid colon and rectum appear unremarkable.there is pericecal fat stranding present.there is no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.examination of the osseous structures showed degenerative changes of the lumbar spine.multiplanar reformatted images were obtained which help demonstrate these findings.
summary: ascending colon wall thickening and pericolonic fat stranding, possibly with mild wall thickening in the descending colon as well.please note that the appendix measuring up to 7 mm in diameter, but there is no periappendiceal fat stranding.this may be in part related to inflammatory changes at the base of the appendix and cecum.right hyperdense lesions in the kidneys likely represent hyperdense cysts.however, renal ultrasound is suggested to confirm the cystic nature of these lesions.

text: limited view of the lung bases demonstrates patchy collapse or consolidation within the right lower lobe.there is extensive, diffuse ascites.in addition, there is relatively hyperattenuating material layering dependently within the peritoneal reflections, mostly on the left side of the abdomen and pelvis.this likely represents a small amount of layering blood.there is a small amount of free intraperitoneal air, presumably postprocedural.the lack of intravenous contrast administration limits the evaluation of the solid organs.allowing for this limitation, again seen is a shrunken and nodular liver, in keeping with cirrhosis.the spleen is enlarged, measuring approximately 13 cm in length.there are small gallstones, without evidence of gallbladder complication.the adrenals, and kidneys are grossly normal in contour.there is no bowel obstruction.moderate amount of stool is present within the colon.the aorta is not aneurysmal.mild atheromatous calcifications are noted.
summary: small amount of layering hemoperitoneum within the abdomen and pelvis, left greater than right.findings were discussed with clinical service at the time of interpretation.

text: in the right lateral aspect of the ascending aortic replacement, there is a low-attenuation collection which measures 4.1 x 3.1 cm in maximal axial dimensions and extends along the path of the ascending aorta.the overall size is unchanged from the prior ct, though the attenuation has slightly decreased.this likely represents a post-surgical fluid collection.there is no mediastinal adenopathy identified.there is mild increased attenuation in the retrosternal region along the sternotomy without any appearance of loculated fluid, therefore most likely compatible with post- surgical changes.bilateral pleural effusions are identified as well as subjacent atelectasis.these are similar to both seen on the prior study.there is no evidence for pneumothorax.the tracheobronchial anatomy appears unremarkable.there is minimal pericardial effusion.the unenhanced liver appears unremarkable, though it is only partially included in the scan due to body habitus.there is a gallstone within the gallbladder which measures about 1.8 cm in diameter.the pancreas appears unremarkable.the spleen is unremarkable.there is no fat infiltration surrounding the gallbladder.the kidneys contours appeared to be slightly full.however, there is no hydronephrosis.correlation with bun/cr is recommended.in the posterior aspect of the left renal interpolar region, there is a hyperattenuating focus measuring 5 mm, which is nonspecific, but may represent a hyperdense cyst.there is no bowel dilatation.there is no significant bowel wall thickening.in the retroperitoneum, there is streaky fat infiltration, which is of indeterminate etiology.there is no loculated collection identified in the abdomen and pelvis.
summary: similar size, with interval decreased attenuation, of fluid collection adjacent to the ascending aortic replacement.this is likely related to post- surgical changes.cholelithiasis.no ct evidence for acute pancreatitis or acute cholecystitis.persistent bilateral pleural effusions with subjacent atelectasis.no hydronephrosis.tiny hypodense lesion in left kidney too small to characterize.these findings were discussed with ___ ___ at the time of interpretation on ___.

text: ureters are unremarkable down to insertion into the bladder.numerous calcifications are seen in the seminal vesicles.the appearance of the bladder base suggests that the patient has undergone a prior turp of the prostate gland.the bladder is unremarkable.what is new is immediately posterior to the sigmoid colon is a 2 x 2.3 cm abscess.no contrast was extravasated in this area and this area does contain a small punctate focus of _____.the adjacent bowel wall is slightly thickened, consistent with the given history of crohn's disease.no perianal fistulas are noted.the remaining bowel wall is unremarkable.no ascites or free fluid is noted in the deep pelvis.no inguinal or deep pelvic adenopathy is identified.
summary: previously noted thickening at the anastomosis is no longer present.a new small 2 x 2.3 cm abscess is identified posterior to the sigmoid colon.the presence of this abscess was communicated directly with the patient's physician, ___.___ ___ at 3:45 p.m.on ___.

text: the study is limited due to marked streak artifact from patient positioning.the imaged lower chest is remarkable for mild cardiomegaly and atelectasis at the lung bases.
summary: cystitis with no ct evidence of pyelonephritis.marked osteopenia with multilevel degenerative changes of the lumbosacral spine.stable wedge compression fracture of the t12 vertebral body.

text: rectum, sigmoid colon, pelvic bowel loops, urinary bladder, uterus, and bilateral adnexa are unremarkable.there is no iliac chain or inguinal adenopathy.
summary: no evidence of lymphoma recurrence or progression with multiple calcified lymph nodes consistent with treated lymphoma.sub-5-mm hepatic hypoattenuation could reflect cyst or hemangioma, but too small to characterize.small right pleural effusion and bibasilar atelectasis.relative sclerotic appearance of t11 vertebral body could reflect radiation-associated changes and correlation with bone scan on a non-emergent basis is recommended.

text: the urinary bladder is catheterized.there is a foley catheter.the prostate and rectum are unremarkable.there is no free fluid.
summary: high grade complete small-bowel obstruction of the distal ileum with transition point in the right lower quadrant seen best on coronal images (series 4, image 16).contrast in the colon is likely from prior exam as there is no contrast in the distal small bowel at the site of the focal transition.well-demarcated fluid collection just below the anterior abdominal wall in the site of previously seen hematoma.superinfection cannot be excluded.mixed sclerotic appearance of left iliac bone, unchanged most consistent with chronic fibrous dysplasia.these findings were discussed with dr.___.

text: there is a significant amount of ascites of free fluid within the pelvis.the bladder is decompressed with a foley seen within it.the pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is a fat-containing left inguinal hernia.the prostate and seminal vesicles appear normal.
summary: worsened metastatic disease with innumerable hepatic metastases, enlarging and new implants adjacent to the stomach and spleen in the omentum and new ascites and omental deposits.

text: the visualized portions of the lung bases demonstrate bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right with associated atelectasis.the partially imaged heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver appears nodular consistent with cirrhosis.no focal liver lesions are identified.the tips shunt is in place.the portal vein appears patent.there is a large amount of ascites with anasarca in the subcutaneous tissues.a 3-cm splenule is adjacent to a stablly enlarged spleen.splenic varices are again seen.the gallbladder, pancreas, both adrenal glands, and intra-abdominal portions of the small and large bowel are within normal limits.locules of nondependent air in the cecum are contiguous with intra-luminal free air, consistent with air in stool rather than pneumatosis.there is a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.the kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis.the aorta is normal in caliber.
summary: no retroperitoneal bleed.right thigh hematoma with soft tissue swelling extending into the right thigh.bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.nondependent air in the cecum consistent with air in stool rather than pneumatosis.known cirrhosis with ascites.

text: lung bases show minimal atelectasis.the liver is normal in size and density.high-attenuation material is seen within the gallbladder likely representing vicarious excretion of contrast.the kidneys, adrenal glands, and pancreas are within normal limits.the bowel loops are unremarkable.again seen is a grade 4 laceration of the spleen extending into the hilum with intraparenchymal extravasation of contrast material.large amount of hemoperitoneum is present, slightly increased around the liver, albeit not significantly changed in the perisplenic regio.given the timing/density of the extravasted contrast and only slight increase in the extent of hemopertoneum, would be suspicous for venous injury.the abdominal aorta maintains a normal contour and caliber.the splenic artery and is patent.
summary: compared to a prior exam from ___ ___ obtained nine hours prior, there is slight increase hemoperitoneum.again seen is a grade 4 laceration to the splenic hilum with active intraparenchymal extravasation of contrast material.given only slight increase in the hemoperitoneum and timing/density of extravasating contrast material, venous injury is suspected.vicarious excretion of contrast into the gallbladde, which may be related to hypvolemia.

text: the appendix is identified with small amount of air within the lumen.the rectum, sigmoid colon and unopacified loops of large and small bowel appear unremarkable given the limitations.
summary: small foci of calcification within the right kidney, the largest measuring 4 mm within the lower pole.nephroureteral stent appears within standard position.post-traumatic appearance of the sacrum.post traumatic new bone formation causes pseudoarthrosis between the left sacral ala and left iliac bone.

text: evaluation of lung bases demonstrates changes of dependent & compressive atelectasis with small bilateral pleural effusions.several punctate hyperdensities seen at the lung bases are consistent with small calcified granulomas.the aerated portions of the lung bases are unremarkable.visualization of the heart and pericardium demonstrates diffuse and heavy coronary artery calcifications versus stents.heart and pericardium are otherwise unremarkable where visualized.ng tube is present.allowing for the non-contrast technique, the liver is unremarkable.a calcified focus seen at the margin of the gallbladder and liver (series 2, image 22) probably represents a punctate calcified granuloma.gallbladder is unremarkable.pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.a calcified focus is seen in the region of the gallbladder neck, although it is uncertain whether this might represent a calcified stone within the cystic duct or a calcification of the proper hepatic artery.evaluation of the right kidney demonstrates a 17-mm lobulation, which is isodense to the renal cortex at the lower pole.left kidney demonstrates a vague 15-mm hypodensity in the interpolar aspect of the left kidney.the latter has attenuation characteristics consistent with a renal cyst; the former within the right kidney may represent a hemorrhagic cyst, but is incompletely characterized on this examination.no retroperitoneal adenopathy or free fluid is seen.a 12 x 8 mm calcified focus probably representing calcified lymph node is seen in the peritoneal fat (series 2, image 76).there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage or findings to account for hematocrit drop.left common femoral central venous catheter is present, with the tip at the proximal aspect of the left external iliac vein.bilateral small pleural effusions and moderate associated compressive atelectasis.small contour abnormality is seen at the lower pole of the right kidney.while this might represent a hyperdense cyst, this is not characterized on this examination.renal ultrasound targeted towards the lower pole of the right kidney is recommended when the patient becomes hemodynamically stable or on an outpatient basis to evaluate whether this represents a solid or cystic lesion, or might represent a lobulation of normal renal parenchyma.extensive atherosclerotic disease, particularly involving the coronary arteries and left renal arteries.evidence of prior granulomatous disease.

text: the liver demonstrates no focal lesion.the spleen and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the pancreas is diffusely atrophic.bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.a 13-mm exophytic lower pole left renal cyst is unchanged.patient is status post gastrectomy and gastrojejunostomy with stable postoperative changes.multiple fiducial seeds are seen along the lesser curve.no evidence of obstruction or leak.small and large bowel loops are normal in caliber.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy by ct size criteria.patient is status post infrarenal aaa repair with maximal infrarenal aortic diameter of 3 cm.major branching vessels are patent.
summary: status post gastrectomy and gastrojejunostomy with patent anastomosis.stable small pulmonary nodules in the right lung measuring up to 5 mm since ___.status post abdominal aortic aneurysm repair with maximal infrarenal aortic diameter of 3 cm.no ct evidence of local recurrence or distant metastasis.

text: visualized portions of large and small bowel are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy.osseous structures are unremarkable.
