summary: severe acute pancreatitis with patchy enhancement of the pancreatic head and uncinate process indicating hypoperfusion; small areas of patchy necrosis cannot be excluded.progression of peripancreatic fluid not appearing organized at this time.peripancreatic inflammatory change extends to the stomach, and produces secondary colitis of the hepatic and splenic flexures.there may also be partial duodenal obstruction from edema/inflammation.a delayed abdominal radiograph could be obtained in ___ hours to assess for passage of contrast into the small bowel.large bibasilar consolidations, probably aspiration pneumonia.cholelithiasis.small amount of ascites.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 9 pm on ___.

text: tiny pleural effusions are present bilaterally.there is mild dependent atelectasis as well.cardiac pacemaker wires are also identified.a small pericardial effusion is seen.the noncontrast enhanced liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, ureters, stomach, and loops of large and small bowel are all within normal limits.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the gallbladder is not well visualized.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.tiny bilateral pleural effusions with mild atelectatic changes at the lung bases.small pericardial effusion

text: compared to ___, there has been interval placement of a colostomy.the colostomy to the left of midline has an adjacent 1.3 x 3 cm fluid density collection in the subcutaneous fat.a small fluid and gas tract can be seen extending from the region of the peritoneal origin of the colostomy to the midline skin surface.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy in the pelvis.bone windows reveal destructive change at l4 similar to the previous exam without suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: small fluid collection in the subcutaneous fat adjacent to the new colostomy site.small gas and fluid tract extending from the peritoneal origin of the colostomy to the midline skin surface may be post surgical.there are no intraperitoneal fluid collections.no other changes from ___ are identified.

text: the urinary bladder has a foley catheter and is collapsed.distal ureters are normal.the sigmoid colon is collapsed with a small focus of air present within the rectum.a small amount of free fluid is present within the pelvis.there is a left inguinal hernia.there are sigmoid diverticulae but no evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: findings consistent with colonic adesion vs stricture with acute narrowing at the splenic flexure and proximal colonic dilation.comminuted, horizontal fracture of the right acetabular roof and associated hematoma.

text: the urinary bladder contains gas in its nondependent portion likely due to a foley catheter in place.there is no significant free pelvic fluid.the uterus is not clearly visualized.correlation with prior surgical history is recommended.there are no pelvic masses or significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of groin or retroperitoneal hematoma.bilateral renal artery aneurysms evaluation of which is difficult on this unenhanced ct.the largest aneurysm is seen on the left and measures at least 1.4 cm in diameter.these findings cannot be further evaluated on this unenhanced study.

text: the visualized portion of the lung bases are clear.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.the liver shows no focal lesion or intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is decompressed without evidence of stones or wall edema.the splenic size is at the upper limits of normal.the adrenal glands are normal bilaterally.the pancreas shows no masses or ductal dilatation.the kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or perinephric fluid/stranding.an 8 mm hypodensity in the mid pole of the left kidney is incompletely characterized but likely represents a cyst.the stomach is status post gastric banding.the small and large intestine show no evidence of obstruction or wall thickening.oral contrast has progressed to about the mid ileum.liquid stool is seen throughout the colon.there is no lymphadenopathy, free air, or free fluid.
summary: fluid in the colon consistent with history of diarrhea.no evidence of colitis or typhlitis.

text: tiny 4-mm nodule is noted at the branch point of a pulmonary arterial branch (series 2: image 5) stable since ___.no new nodules, opacities or effusions demonstrated.the visualized portion of heart appears unremarkable.no focal liver lesion is identified.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, stomach and abdominal large and small bowel appear within normal limits.the pancreas appears within normal limits without ductal dilatation or focal mass identified.there is moderate calcified atherosclerotic plaque within the abdominal aorta and iliac branches.there is a new tiny hypoattenuating focus within the anterior cortex of the interpolar region of right kidney (series 2: image 24) measuring 5 mm, too small to adequately characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy per ct size criteria demonstrated.no soft tissue abnormality identified in the anterior abdominal wall.
summary: no acute abdominal abnormalities identified to explain pain.specifically, the pancreas appears within normal limits and no anterior abdominal wall findings are demonstrated.moderate calcified atherosclerotic plaque within the abdominal aorta and iliac branches.stable l5 spondylolysis and grade 1 spondylolisthesis.

text: there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.there is diffuse dilatation of the colon with colonic wall thickening in the descending colon and sigmoid.there are a few linear areas of air parallel to the bowel wall suspcious for pneumatosis.there is no evidence of portal venous gas or free air within the abdomen.the urinary bladder is unremarkable.there is thickening of the rectal wall.bone windows demonstrate degenerative changes of both hips and a bipolar rod traversing the left femoral neck.there is demineralization and degenerative change in the lower lumbar spine.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are seen.
summary: dilated colon with possible pneumatosis and thickening of the descending and sigmoid colonic walls.additionally there is a finding of calcification running through the lumen of the infrarenal abdominal aorta at the level of the takeoff of the ___.these findings are concerning for ischemic colitis.other considerations include infectious colitis or inflammatory colitis.rectal wall thickening.a low rectal lesion should be excluded with physical exam as a cause of low obstruction.small amount of free fluid in the abdomen.coarse opacity at the lung bases suggest chronic aspiration vs developing infection.this is less likely atelectasis.these findings were telephoned immediately to dr.___ ___, the emergency room physician caring for the patient.

text: the rectum, bladder, and distal ureters are visualized and are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air present within the pelvis.there is diverticulosis without diverticulitis within the sigmoid colon.there is a generally atrophic uterus with a large fibroid emanating from the fundus with intramural calcification.bilateral adnexal cystic structures are noted largest on the right measuring 3.3cm in greatest dimension.
summary: no evidence of splenic injury or intra-abdominal trauma.diffuse degenerative changes throughout the lumbar spine.generally atrophic uterus with large fibroid originating from its fundus.bilateral adnexal cysts, larger on the right measuring 3.3 cm in greatest dimension.this is abnormal in a post-menopausal woman and further evaluation with an elective focused ultrasound examination is recommended.

text: images of the lower thorax are unremarkable.pre-contrast images of the abdomen demonstrate no calcifications in the liver, pancreas, spleen, or kidneys.post-contrast images demonstrate a normal appearance of the liver parenchyma.a peripheral cyst, which does not enhance is present on series 7, image 25.there is diffuse intrahepatic biliary dilatation and dilatation of the common bile duct.the gallbladder is present.the pancreatic duct is dilated measuring up to 1 cm in diameter.there is a heterogeneous mass present emanating from the region of the pancreatic head and uncinate process.it extends caudally and involves the second and third portions of the duodenal wall medially and extends below the sma.the epicenter of this mass measures 3.0 x 3.7 cm in the ap and transverse dimensions.there are numerous peripancreatic lymph nodes.the largest has a low density necrotic center and is located to the left of midline adjacent to the smv and measures approximately 2.5 cm in diameter.paraaortic lymph nodes and portacaval lymphadenopathy is also present.the common hepatic artery lies between two lymph nodes.the common hepatic artery is compressed by these abnormal lymph nodes.there is a lymph node present in the region of the origin of the gastroduodenal artery, the fat plane posterior to the gastroduodenal artery is obliterated, best seen on series 6, image 38.a jejunal branch of the sma is compressed and encased by an enlarged lymph node, best seen on series 6, image 52.the portal vein, splenic vein, and smv are patent.the fat plane between the portal vein and an abnormal lymph node is obliterated, best seen on series 7, image 32.the spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.there is aortic atherosclerosis.there are no dilated bowel loops.
summary: mass at the head and uncinate process of the pancreas, most consistent with a pancreatic adenocarcinoma abd extendind behind tyhe sma to left mesenteric root necrotic nodes.cbd and pancreatic duct dilation to the ampulla raising the possibility of primary ampulacy malignancy although it is unlikely.multiple enlarged necrotic lymph nodes in the region of the porta hepatus, with extrinsic mass effect on the hepatic artery and the origin of the gda.in view of the above, this mass does not meet ct criteria for local resectability.no distant metastases are identified.

text: there is no free fluid or masses.contrast reaches the level of the rectum.the bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.a foley catheter is seen in the bladder.note is made of a right inguinal hernia.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lesions.
summary: interval improvement in the drainage of the left upper quadrant subphrenic abscess, after the interval placement of a second catheter which is draining the more inferior portion of the abscess just anterior to the stomach.the more superior and anterior pigtail catheter shows improved drainage in the interval, although there is a small remaining area of fluid superior to the catheter which remains, measuring 6.2 x 2.9 cm.bilateral basilar atelectasis and small pleural effusions.

text: the lung bases are clear, and liver and gallbladder appear unremarkable.the kidneys, adrenal glands, spleen and pancreas appear unremarkable.the stomach is less distended than on the prior study.proximal small bowel is distended with the small bowel diameter being increased compared to the prior study, now measuring 5.7 cm maximum.the bowel wall is not thickened.there is a transition point in the lower pelvis in the same location.there are areas of possibly collapsed redundant small bowel in the lower pelvis surrounded by soft tissue and stranding.residual collapsed colon is again seen in the right lower quadrant leading to the colostomy in the right abdomen.associated with that is a fat-containing incisional hernia, which is unchanged.rectal stump is again seen containing fluid and air, consistent with the presence of a known fistula.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: small-bowel obstruction, with a transition point in the lower pelvis.the small bowel diameter is somewhat increased in the upper abdomen compared to the prior study.air-fluid level in the rectal stump, consistent with known small bowel to rectal stump fistula.unchanged soft tissue mass in the lower pelvis near the transition point.

text: redemonstrated is the perinephric hematoma, which extends along the retroperitoneum into the pelvis, along the iliopsoas muscle.this is stable from the prior examination measuring approximately 3.3 cm in the largest perinephric component near the inferior pole and 15.2 x 7.4 x 13.8 cm in transverse, ap, and craniocaudal dimensions respectively (previously 15.6 x 7.8 x 13.7 cm).the perinephric and retroperitoneal hematoma remains high in density without liquefied component or significant surrounding inflammatory changes to suggest superimposed infection.evaluation of the lower pole partially treated pseudoaneurysm is limited by lack of intravenous contrast.again, there is mass effect on the right kidney with anterior displacement.there is no hydronephrosis.there is also mass effect and narrowing of the ivc.multiple splenic calcifications are consistent with sequelae of prior granulomatous disease.the patient is status post cholecystectomy without obvious intra or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the liver, adrenal glands, left kidney, and pancreas have a grossly unremarkable unenhanced ct appearance.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.small periaortic retroperitoneal nodes are visualized.there is no free fluid in the abdomen.bilateral small pleural effusions previously present have resolved.bilateral bases demonstrate linear strands of atelectasis.there is a 5.5 mm nodular opacity at the left base, likely atelectatic change, given the appearance in this region on prior ct examinations.the heart is at the upper limits of normal in size.there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: stable large perinephric/retroperitoneal hematoma without evidence of superimposed infection.probable residual left lower pole renal pseudoaneurysm is not evaluated on this non-contrast examination.diffuse marked anasarca.resolution of small bilateral pleural effusions with basilar atelectasis.a 5.5 mm nodular opacity at the left base likely represents resolving atelectatic change; however, attention on followup is warranted.6.2 cm lytic lesion in the right proximal femur is incompletely imaged.this appears nonaggressive without cortical thinning/breakthrough.differential considerations include fibrous dysplasia, unicameral bone cyst or chondromyxoid fibroma, although this is not expansile.for complete extent of the lesion, consider femoral radiographs.

text: again seen is minimal bibasilar dependent atelectasis.there is no pleural effusion or pulmonary nodules seen.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.there is redemonstration of stable mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation that is unchanged compared to ___.the common bile duct is normal in caliber.the gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear normal.again note is made of a subcentimeter likely cyst in the lower pole of the right kidney that is unchanged.an extrarenal pelvis on the left also is unchanged.there is moderate atherosclerotic disease seen along the aorta.the patient is status post aortobifemoral bypass.
summary: resolution of previously seen inflammatory changes associated with uncomplicated acute appendicitis.no evidence of discrete abscess or drainable collection seen.unchanged stable mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the patient is status post aortofemoral bypass.there is resolution of previously seen organized hematoma within the pelvis.

text: please note the lack of intravenous contrast, significantly limits detailed evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs and bowel.there are bilateral small pleural effusions, left greater than right with associated atelectasis.marked cardiomegaly is additionally noted.an 8-mm low-attenuation focus within the left lobe of the liver is too small to characterize but likely represents a simple cyst (2:21).similarly, a 7-mm low-attenuation focus in the right lobe of the liver is too small to characterize but also likely represents a simple cyst (2:26).the liver is otherwise unremarkable.please note, moderate abdominal and pelvic ascites also limits detailed evaluation.the spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, stomach, and abdominal portions of the small bowel appear grossly unremarkable.there are bilateral simple renal cysts, the largest of which is located at the upper pole of the right kidney and measures 5.3 cm in diameter (2:20).the kidneys are otherwise unremarkable.numerous colonic diverticula are present.there is no definite evidence of diverticulitis but assessment is limited secondary to ascites.extensive anasarca of the subcutaneous tissues is also noted.there is no intra- abdominal free air.
summary: limited study secondary to the lack of intravenous contrast and moderate abdominal and pelvic ascites.1.cardiomegaly with small pleural effusions may indicate an element of congestive heart failure.2.extensive diverticulosis without definite evidence of diverticulitis within the limitations as described above.no definite bowel wall thickening.3.bilateral simple renal cysts.4.bilateral pars defects at l5-s1 level.no spondylolisthesis.5.anasarca.

text: contrast reaches the rectum.again, there is diffuse thickening of the colon.the bladder, ureters, and visualized portions of small bowel are unremarkable.again noted is a fibroid uterus.the left adnexa is little changed, again with possible hydrosalpinx and a 2.5 cm left ovarian cyst.there is no fluid collection or free air.
summary: diffuse colonic wall thickening, which appears worse compared to ___.this appearance may be partially due to underfilling of the colon.no abscess or free intraperitoneal air is identified.

text: the bladder is moderately distended.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.a few prostatic calcifications are evident.
summary: new left lower lobe consolidation concerning for pneumonia.lesser changes at right base.partially obstructing right ureteral stone with mild associated right ureter hydronephrosis, improved compared to the ct of ___.no evidence of gallbladder pathology or acute left lower quadrant process.

text: a foley catheter is seen with its tip in the bladder.a rectal tube is noted.the uterus appears normal.the adnexa are not well visualized.
summary: large bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with bilateral consolidations.an infectious etiology cannot be ruled out.soft tissue thickening and induration posterior to the spinal rod placement.this soft tissue is consistent with postoperative changes but a superimposed infection cannot be ruled out.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear.note is made of a large amount of coronary artery calcifications.there is a hiatal hernia.mild circumferential thickening is demonstrated in the visualized portions of the distal esophagus without a focal lesion identified.no focal liver lesions are seen.focal fatty infiltration along the falciform ligament is noted.a tiny hypodensity is noted in the right kidney, too small to characterize but likely representing a cyst.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenals, kidneys, pancreas, ureters, and opacified loops of large and small bowel are otherwise unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.there is no free air or free fluid.a tiny amount of air is noted in the subcutaneous tissues along the right anterior abdominal wall, presumably at the site of an injection.
summary: no evidence of obstruction.mild circumferential thickening of the distal esophagus and associated hiatal hernia, possibly related to esophagitis.coronary artery calcifications.`

text: the collection in the right hemipelvis with a mildly enhancing rim is somewhat larger and measures 1.9 x 2.5 cm.an additional collection in the right hemipelvis also is more prominent on today's study.multiple diverticula are seen in the sigmoid colon without evidence for diverticulitis.the rectum, bladder, distal ureters and uterus show obvious abnormalities.there is a foley catheter in place.bone windows demonstrate degenerative changes of the spine.the patient is s/p bilateral hip surgery.
summary: moderate to high-grade small bowel obstruction.there has been interval decompression of the small bowel s/p ng tube placement.there is an area of thickened bowel within the mid jejunum, which may represent a transition point.two areas of aneurysmal dilatation of the abdominal aorta below the takeoff of the renal arteries.no evidence for rupture.mildly increased size of fluid collections in the abdomen and pelvis as described above.small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with associated dependent atelectasis.the above findings were discussed with the surgery resident.

text: there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.the residual rectum is unremarkable.the uterus appears normal.there is a small amount of air in the bladder, which can be explained by the previously placed foley catheter.the cystic lesion in the right adnexal region has decreased in size, now measuring 20 x 20 mm (previously 27 x 31).therefore most likely representing a resolving cyst.
summary: no definite evidence of prevailing pulmonary emboli.resolution of bilateral consolidative opacities.increase in extent of patchy ground glass opacities mostly in the upper lobes.this may represent changes due to fluid overload.an infectious process cannot be excluded but seems less likely.increase in bilateral pleural effusions.minimal improvement in the mediastinal lymphadenopathy.almost complete resolution of inflammatory and/or edematous changes in the mesentery and retroperitoneum, including resolution of pericholecystic fluid and stranding around the duodenum, if that was fluid within the mesentery and stranding.no evidence on today's study for bowel wall thickening in the ilium.decrease in size of the right adnexal cystic structure.the findings were discussed with the medical team at the time of the dictation.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bilateral pleural effusions, with associated bibasilar atelectasis.the liver enhances homogeneously, without evidence of focal mass lesion.there is no ascites.there is no evidence of intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.a calcified gallstone is seen within the gallbladder, measuring 9 mm.there is no evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.the left adrenal gland is within normal limits.there is nodular enlargement of the right adrenal gland, measuring 1.9 x 1.2 cm.bulk fat is noted within the center of this nodule enlargement, most consistent with adrenal adenoma.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.multiple low attenuation foci are seen within both kidneys.the largest and most discrete of these likely represent renal cysts, but other areas are more ill-defined, and cannot be completely characterized.some linear areas may represent scarring.the stomach is dilated, measuring roughly 22 x 12 cm, containing a mix of oral contrast and air.there is no evidence to suggest gastric outlet obstruction.the remainder of the intraabdominal loops of opacified bowel are of normal caliber, and otherwise normal in appearance.extensive atherosclerotic disease with heavy calcification is noted throughout the arterial vasculature.there is evidence of stents within the left proximal left renal artery and the common iliac arteries bilaterally, which appear patent.no free air, free fluid, or pathologic mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.pacemaker wires are seen, with their leads terminating in the right ventricle.
summary: no evidence of enterovesicular fistula.bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.cholelithiasis, without evidence of cholecystitis.substantial dilatation of the stomach, without obvious obstruction raises concern for gastroparesis.extensive atherosclerotic vascular disease, with calcification, and multiple grafts and stents seen.right femoral arterial graft appears occluded.multiple bilateral renal hypodensities too small to characterize likely represent cysts.t12 vertebral body compression fracture, of indeterminate age.

text: a foley catheter is present within the bladder which appears unremarkable.the uterus is heterogeneous in appearance suggesting fibroids.a focal heterogeneous collection is present along the right presacral space measuring 3.9 x 3.9 x 3 cm in greatest axial dimension (2:76).
summary: bowel leak from the splenic flexure of the colon with extraluminal oral contrast extending into the subdiaphragmatic space.a surgical drain is noted traversing through the leak.new focal 1.2-cm hypoattenuating region within the left lobe of the liver not displacing the intervening hepatic vasculature may represent perfusion abnormality, however metastasis cannot be excluded and attention will be paid to this region on followup ct.3.8-cm heterogenous collection within the right presacral space, possibly representing hematoma from previous surgery.moderate amount of free fluid under the left hemidiaphragm.small left pleural effusion with atelectasis and trace right effusion.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ from general surgery at 4:15 p.m.on the day of the examination.

text: there is no free air or free fluid in the pelvis.the distal ureters, bladder, and prostate are grossly normal.
summary: patent portal vein.no filling defects are identified at the anastomotic site.small right lower anterior abdominal wall seroma as described above.

text: there is stable moderate pelvic ascites.the foley catheter has been removed and the bladder appears unremarkable.the prostate appears normal.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: stable small nonocclusive chronic thrombus within the main portal vein.patency of the hepatic veins.stable appearance of perisplenic, gastric and esophageal varices.splenorenal shunt.no evidence of recurrence around rf ablation site or new hepatic lesions elsewhere.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.

text: there is a pessary within the vagina.the rectum, urinary bladder, uterus and adnexa are unchanged when compared to the previous study.there are again noted small inguinal lymph nodes which are unchanged when compared to the previous study.there is unchanged appearance of the heavily calcified renal transplant in the right pelvis.bone windows: there are no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: there is no source of infection identified on this study.extensive mediastinal, retroperitoneal and left axillary lymph adenopathy.the large left axillary lymph node measures 1.7 cm.large csf fluid collection in the abdomen is increased when compared to the previous study.

text: again seen is coarse calcification within the uterus consistent with calcified fibroids, unchanged.there is sigmoid diverticulosis.there is evidence of sigmoid colostomy.multiple minimally dilated loops of small bowel are seen within the pelvis.at this point of imaging, contrast is not yet reached the colon.there is no ascites, lymphadenopathy, or free intraperitoneal gas.review of bone windows demonstrates multilevel degenerative disc disease of the lower thoracic and lumbar spine.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: interval resolution of bilateral pleural effusions and improving bibasilar airspace disease.interval near resolution of the fluid collection at the surgical bed consistent with a biloma.there is only a trace amount of fluid left in near the catheter which is appropriately positioned.fibroid uterus.multiple minimally dilated loops of small bowel, if patient has lower abdominal or pelvic pain a followup scanning can be performed.

text: there are small amounts of fluid within the anterior abdominal incision.ascites tracks of the pelvis.there is evidence of triple-a repair with a waist noted, probably related to suturing of the aneurysm sac around the endograft material.the opacified bowel loops are normal in appearance without evidence of ischemia.there is a foley catheter in the bladder.some ascites tracks into the right groin, probably through a hernia in the inguinal region.the bones reveal no suspicious abnormalities.there are scattered colonic diverticuli.
summary: ascites of intermediate attenuation, probably representing hemorrhagic ascites/hemoperitoneum bibasilar collapse/consolidation with pleural effusions.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon and uterus are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid, pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy present.a prominent outpouching from the bladder superiorly is more pronounced than on prior studies, likely a bladder diverticulum.fascial thickening in the right pelvis, retropubic space, and along the right lateral conal fascia are stable.
summary: no small bowel obstruction.enterocutaneous fistulous tract arising from the second portion of the duodenum extending to the right lateral flank skin surface, similar to prior, containing gas and a small amount of oral contrast material.previously noted right pelvic/retropubic fluid collection is nearly resolved with only with residual stranding seen in the region of the fluid collection.these findings including the change from the wet read were discussed with ___ ___ and ___ ___ at 7 pm on ___.

text: the appendix is not clearly visualized, but there is no evidence of appendicitis.the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and distal ureters are normal.there is a foley catheter within the bladder.there is no inguinal pathological lymphadenopathy, or free fluid.
summary: no evidence of bowel pathology or other acute abnormalities to explain the patient's symptoms.sclerosis of the left iliac bone.

text: the rectum is distended with stool measuring approximately 7.4 cm in diameter.the bladder is collapsed.there is evidence of bifemoral bypass grafts.the sigmoid and prostate are within normal limits.
summary: no evidence of intrahepatic gas as suggested on prior ultrasound.repeat ultrasound is suggested given this change in appearance.bibasilar dependent atelectatic changes/consolidation with associated effusions.gas distended loops of bowel with air-fluid levels but without transition suggesting ileus.stool distended rectum.small infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged nodes within the pelvis.there is substantial stranding throughout the subcutaneous tissues consistent with anasarca.there are coronary artery calcifications.
summary: interval development of small left greater than right pleural effusion.pericardial effusion, ascites, and subcutaneous fat stranding, all consistent with anasarca.calcified mesenteric mass unchanged in size.ct differential diagnosis for these appearances include carcinoid and sclerosing mesenteriris, less likely inflammatory pseudotumor.no definite evidence of abscess.bilateral renal calculi.

text: the large bowel is collapsed and several small diverticula are scattered throughout.focal wall thickening of the sigmoid colon is present.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.a foley catheter is in place.no uterus is identified.the rectum is normal.the osseous structuers are diffusely demineralized and there is vacuum phenomenon at multiple lumbar articulations.soft tissue is unremarkable.atelectasis is present at the lung bases.there is a small right pleural effusion.coronally reformatted images confirm the above findings.
summary: free air within the abdomen, probably from large bowel perforation.the thickened sigmoid colon, diverticuli and abdominal lymphadenopathy suggest perforated diverticulum versus carcinoma as the proximal cause.no direct site of contrast extravasation is identified.findings were discussed with the emergency department resident at the time of the study.

text: the previously identified hematoma in the space of retzius has slightly improved in size compared to the prior exam, still, however, exhibiting some mass effect on the bladder and impinging on the posterior aspect of the right rectus muscle.no other areas identified which are suspicious for hematoma.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious areas.there is degenerative disc and degenerative joint disease appreciated.lung bases demonstrate minimal atelectasis only.
summary: compared to the study done one day earlier, there has been some improvement in the size of the hematoma within the space of retzius no new suspicious areas identified i.e., no findings to explain this patient's continued hematocrit drop.

text: as described above, the fluid collection tracking into the pelvis is still present, but improved.bowel loops are otherwise normal.there is no lymphadenopathy identified.large corticated 7-mm calcification in the deep pelvis adjacent to the right side of the prostate is unchanged.bladder and distal ureters are normal.vascular structures are within normal limits.bone windows show no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.
summary: hypoperfusing pancreas with regions of relative hypodensity suggestive of pancreatic necrosis; no definite abscess or pseudocyst is seen.peripancreatic fluid collections are still present, but improved.persistent splenic vein thrombosis with collateralization of gastric and splenic vessels indicating sinistral hypertension (focal left-sided portal hypertension).geographic hypodensity in the liver suggestive of perfusion abnormality versus diffuse focal fatty infiltration.findings were discussed with dr.___ by telephone at 11:30 a.m., ___.

text: the urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable.there are calcifications present within the prostate gland.there is no evidence of abscess within the pelvis.there is a small amount of pre-sacral fluid which is nonspecific.the appendix is normal in appearance.there is a small amount of free fluid noted within the right lower quadrant.there is fat stranding present within the left groin which is likely related to a recent procedure in the region.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions and consolidation of the lung bases.no radiographic evidence of intra-abdominal or perinephric abscess.

text: again noted is free fluid.the abnormal loop of colon in the mid pelvis may contain a small focus of pneumatosis.this loop of colon demonstared pneumatosis on several prior studies dating back to ___.diffuse vascular calcifications are noted, but the major abdominal vessels are patent.no significant osseous abnormality.
summary: no evidence of intraabdominal abscess.persistent abnormal colon.although the vessels are patent, ischemia as well as infectious and inflammatory etiologies should be considered.

text: liver is nodular and heterogeneous in appearance, consistent with cirrhosis.patient had prior mri on ___, which demonstrated multiple indeterminate lesions, please see that report.arterially enhancing focus in the right lobe (series 2, image 15), measures 1.4 cm and is without significant interval change since ___.apparent hypodense lesion in segment iv is also without significant change to slightly increased in size, today measuring 2.7 x 2.2 cm, previously 2.3 x 2.0 cm, previously characterized as a cyst.the remainder of the liver remains heterogeneous.the spleen remains massively enlarged, measuring 20 cm in length and remains heterogeneous, with innumerable small internal hypodensities, without significant change.multiple hypodense/cystic lesions throughout the pancreas are without significant interval change, measuring up to 1.8 cm in the body of the pancreas, unchanged.the adrenal glands are normal.a tiny subcentimeter hypodensity in the right kidney is too small to further characterize.the kidneys uptake and excrete contrast symmetrically bilaterally.there is no hydronephrosis.multiple duodenal diverticula are again seen.the main portal vein is prominent, but patent, as is the splenic vein.splenic hilar varices are again noted.the stomach is relatively collapsed, although its walls appear hyperemic, which could relate to gastritis.clinical correlation is advised.there are several dilated loops of small bowel containing air-fluid levels with small bowel measuring up to approximately 4 cm in diameter, and with relative transition point seen in the right lower quadrant (series 300b, image 26), near level of small bowel/sigmoid anastomosis, with adjacent thickening and inflammatory changes.more distal loops of bowel/rectosigmoid are collapsed.mesenteric fluid is seen, which could relate to patient's cirrhosis and portal hypertension, but early bowel ischemia is not excluded.no drainable fluid collection is currently identified.left lateral wall abdominal hernia is again seen, containing loops of small bowel and fluid.no significant caliber change is seen in the small bowel as it enters or exits the hernia.
summary: high-grade small-bowel obstruction with abrupt transition point in the right lower quadrant at the level of small bowel/sigmoid anastomosis with collapse of more distal bowel and adjacent moderate thickening and inflammatory changes.no drainable fluid collection seen.mesenteric fluid seen, which could relate to cirrhosis and portal hypertension, although early bowel ischemia cannot be excluded.left lateral wall hernia containing fluid and bowel without evidence of obstruction at that level.hepatic cirrhosis with heterogeneous, multinodular liver.as recommended on prior mri from ___, close continued followup is recommended with multiphase ct or mri.evidence of portal hypertension with massive splenomegaly as well as varices.collapsed stomach with hyperenhancement of the gastric wall, which could relate to gastritis.clinical correlation advised.trace bilateral pleural effusions.left base consolidation, which may relate to atelectasis, although infection is not excluded.multiple pancreatic cystic lesions, unchanged.

text: there is marked deformity of the pelvis and the visualized bones of the pelvis.compared with the prior study, the right hip/above-the-knee amputation stump has been further resected and there is now a cavity extending to the bone.at the base of this cavity, the bone appears irregular in contour which is suggestive of osteomyelitis.there is a focus of free air in the soft tissue near this irregular area of bone which may be a continuation of the cavity.the thickening of the tissue about the right acetabulum is likely inflamed and extension of infection is likely.there is no definable fluid collection in the soft tissue surrounding the cavity.without iv contrast, however, a small collection cannot be ruled out.there is bilateral inguinal lymphadenopathy, likely reactive.there is fusion of the left pelvis and left femur, which appears unchanged from the comparison study.there is marked deformity and dysmorphism of the left femur, which is also unchanged.this chronic dysmorphic bone is likely secondary to abnormal healing from prior fractures and/or chronic osteomyelitis.the femur and patella are internally rotated.there is diffuse muscle atrophy of the left leg.as seen on the comparison ct, there is high-density material in the thecal sac as well as marked degenerative changes of the visualized spine and chronic deformity.a left lower quadrant ostomy is seen.the liver, kidneys, and visualized portions of the small and large bowel appear unremarkable.stool with contrast is seen in the colon.

text: there are very small bilateral pleural effusions of low density with minimal atelectatic change.there is a 9-mm diameter dependent stone within the gallbladder.the gallbladder is moderately full, but otherwise unremarkable.the liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.a 7-mm diameter hypodense focus in the right kidney is too small to characterize.the stomach and small bowel are within normal limits.however, there is marked wall thickening of the ascending, tranverse, and descending colons, as well as portions of the sigmoid.the transverse colon is not uniformly dilated but segments it measure up to 6 cm in diameter.there is also stranding in the central and right lower quadrant mesenteries with a small amount of ascites, particularly about the liver.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air.atherosclerotic calcifications are present, but the proximal sma appears to opacify and is likely patent.

text: small nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions bilaterally result in significant atelectasis of the lower lobes.there are several scattered nodules measuring 3 mm in the right lower lobe (3:8) and 7 mm in the right upper lobe (3:2).coronary artery calcifications are mild.there is also aortic valvular and mitral annular calcification.there is a large hiatal hernia.calcifications within the liver and spleen reflect prior granulomatous disease.there is extensive and severe intra- and extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the common bile duct measures up to 13 mm.the pancreatic duct is also dilated up to 6 mm.both the common bile and pancreatic ducts become inconspicuous in the region of the pancreatic head, and though evaluation is limited due to lack of iv contrast, there is a probable mass involving the pancreatic head and circumferentially thickening and narrowing the second portion of the duodenum (3:35).the pancreatic head mass measures approximately 2.6 x 2.5 cm.the duodenal lumen narrows to only 4 mm.abutting the second portion of the duodenum there is extensive retroperitoneal air as well as free intraperitoneal air consistent with perforation related to the ercp and duodenal dilatation.multiple hypoattenuating lesions in both kidneys are consistent with simple cysts.the spleen, adrenal glands are normal.the small and large bowel loops are moderately distended with air, related to the recent endoscopy.extensive diverticulosis involving the descending colon is noted.small umbilical hernia containing air (presumably extending from the free intraperitoneal air), as well as fat, is noted.at the very inferior aspect of the imaged portion of the abdomen, there is a rounded cystic structure in the presacral space (3:67).while this cystic structure may represent the bladder, this is difficult to delineate without views of the pelvis.there are extensive bony metastases involving the entire visualized portion of the sacrum and ischia bilaterally, complete sclerosis of the l5 and t9 vertebral bodies and scattered sclerotic foci in the l1 and l4 vertebral bodies as well as multiple right-sided ribs.
summary: free retroperitoneal and intraperitoneal air consistent with duodenal perforation related to recent balloon dilatation of duodenal stenosis.findings were discussed emergently with the gi endoscopist.limited evaluation due to lack of iv contrast.the mass centered within the pancreatic head with circumferential involvement of the duodenum, suggests a primary pancreatic adenocarcinoma.there is resultant extensive intra- and extra-hepatic as well as pancreatic ductal dilatation.moderate right and small left pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.large hiatal hernia.incompletely imaged cystic structure in the pelvis may represent the bladder, however, a cystic pelvic mass cannot be excluded and if management will change, a dedicated pelvic ct is recommended.extensive bony metastases from the patient's known metastatic breast cancer.

text: moderate bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis appear simple and similar in size.mild heterogeneous enhancement of the left hepatic lobe (to a greater degree in segment iv-b) appears similar.a biliary stent terminating in the duodenum is in similar position, with associated nondependent intrahepatic biliary air.the gallbladder is decompressed and contains air locules.the spleen and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.focal cortical thinning of the left upper renal cortex suggests scars.a faint subcentimeter right upper renal cortical lesion is too small to characterize, but statistically, most likely represents a cyst.a pancreatic pseudocyst replacing the majority of the pancreatic body and tail and anteriorly displacing the stomach measures 12.4 x 7.5 cm compared to 15.2 x 8.2 cm on the prior study.it demonstrates a similar lobulation along its left lateral margin, adjacent to the spleen.the portal vein and superior mesenteric vein appear patent.the splenic vein is not seen, suggesting occlusion.the splenic artery traverses the collection and there is a 19 x 17 mm focus of enhancement adjacent to the distal artery, which was present on the prior study.no new fluid collections are seen.there is no pathologic lymph node enlargement or within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: imaged loops of small and large bowel appear normal in caliber and configuration without evidence of obstruction or inflammation.there is a rejected transplant kidney within a right lower abdominal wall hernia, unchanged from prior examination.a second transplanted kidney is seen within the midline pelvis in unchanged position.additionally, there is a small soft tissue density with calcifications in the left lower quadrant that is unchanged and likely corresponds to a previously rejected prior renal transplant.there is no pelvic free fluid.the bladder is decompressed and has a foley catheter within it.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.dense vascular calcifications are noted.there is a sacral decubitus ulcer with underlying area of soft tissue stranding and subcutaneous foci measuring 11.6 (tv) x 1.9 (ap) x 15.2 (cc) cm.there are phlegmonous changes, though no drainable fluid collection.numerous foci of air are seen within the sacral decubitus ulcer, extending superiorly to the level of the upper sacrum.additionally, there is air extending anteriorly into the left mesorectal fat (2:37).air abuts the posterior margin of the coccyx (501b:29); there is no underlying cortical destruction evident on this ct examination, though mri is more sensitive for detection of early osteomyelitis.coarse calcifications are seen within the left anterior abdominal wall (4:5), unchanged from prior examination.there is mild edema within the overlying soft tissues.no bone destructive lesion or acute fracture is identified.

text: mdct was performed from the base of the lungs to the iliac crest following administration of oral and intravenous contrast.the contour of the liver is slightly irregular and nodular, but unchanged from the prior study.again noted is a low-attenuation lesion in the dome of the liver seen on series 2b, image 54, which measures approximately 7 mm.compared to the prior study, this tiny lesion appears to have decreased further in size.peripheral to this tiny lesion, there is an area of hyper-enhancement also unchanged from the prior study.previously noted low-attenuation lesions in the left lobe of the liver are less obvious on today's study.the stomach, spleen, pancreas, left adrenal gland, left kidney, and aorta are unremarkable.there is a stable 13 mm lesion in the right adrenal gland, which was previously identified as an adrenal adenoma.there is either one larger septated cyst or two smaller adjacent cysts in the upper pole of the right kidney.taken as one large cyst, this measures 4.9 x 3.7 cm.compared to the most recent study of ___, the size has increased from 3.5 x 2.2 cm.most likely this represents size increase of two adjacent simple cysts or size increase of one septated cyst as no nodular components are seen.however, close attention to this right renal lesion should be paid on subsequent imaging.

text: there is a non-obstructing calculus in a calyx of the left renal interpolar region measuring approximately 8 mm in diameter.there are also some tiny 1-2mm non-obstructing calculi in the interpolar region and lower pole of the left kidney (series 6, image 36 and 38), and also in the lower pole of the right kidney (series 6, image 36).there is an exophytic low-attenuation lesion at the left kidney which is not completely characterized on this study, measuring about 13 mm maximally with attenuation compatible with a simple cyst.the left adrenal gland appears normal.there is a low-attenuation lesion, likely reflecting a cyst measuring 2.1 x 1.9 cm in the interpolar region of the right kidney.extending from the interpolar region to the lower pole, there is a perinephric crescenteric abnormal area of soft tissue which measures 2.1 x 3.9 cm in the axial plane, unchanged from most recent examination.this is compatible with a chronic hematoma.this tracks to some degree into the adjacent perinephric fascia, tracking down the retroperitoneum, similar to prior examination.no calculi are seen on the right.there is also a small subcentimeter hypoattenuating lesion, too small to characterize, in the upper pole of the right kidney, likely reflecting additional cyst.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.prominence of the common bile duct is similar to multiple prior exams.no intrahepatic bile duct dilatation is seen.the spleen is normal in size.there is calcification of the abdominal aorta, which is irregular in contour and tortuous.it measures a maximum of 2.8 cm.no bowel obstruction is demonstrated.

text: the right-sided effusion and associated atelectasis has resolved.a small simple left pleural effusion is unchanged.there is no consolidation, nodule, or mass in the visualized lung base.the liver appears normal in attenuation.there are no focal liver lesions.there is no intra- or extra- hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is unremarkable.there is no cholelithiasis or ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.the spleen, pancreas, right adrenal gland, and kidneys are normal.a sliver of perisplenic fluid, decreased from prior study, remains.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion.there are no renal mass lesions identified.there is no hydronephrosis.again demonstrated is a 1.8- cm left adrenal nodule, with attenuation of 50 ___.this is in incompletely characterized on this single- phase study, but is not definitively characterized as an adrenal adenoma.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are normal.there is no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.contrast has not reached the cecum.the cecum, ascending, and transverse colon are unremarkable.the sigmoid colon terminates in the left lower quadrant end- colostomy.at the site of a previously identified rim-enhancing fluid collection in the left pelvis, there is minimal linear soft tissue density, consistent with scarring, but no residual fluid collection is identified.there is no enhancement in this region.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is no free fluid or free air.the aorta is normal in caliber and configuration.the major mesenteric vessels appear patent at their origins.the portal vein is patent.

text: there has been interval development of bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right.there is trace pericardial effusion seen along the anterior border of the heart (2, 4).within the limitations of a non-contrast exam, there is perisplenic and perihepatic free fluid, which measures simple fluid.dense fluid seen in the gallbladder: sludge vs prior iv contrast vicarious excretion.adrenal glands, spleen, pancreas, and liver are unremarkable.the kidneys demonstrate bilateral parapelvic cysts, unchanged.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified, none of which meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.the largest of these lymph nodes measures approximately 9 mm in short axis diameter and is anterior to the right renal vein (2, 26).extensive small bowel wall thickening is again identified, increased when compared to prior exam, now involving both the jejunum and ileum.there is no evidence of small bowel dilatation or obstruction.there is no evidence of free air.
summary: limited exam due to non-contrast.interval increase in intra-abdominal and pelvic free fluid as described above and new bilateral pleural effusions.persistent small bowel wall thickening which has progressed to involve both the jejunum and ileum.no evidence of obstruction or free air.colonic wall thickening involving the ascending, transverse and descending colon, new when compared to prior exam.these findings can be seen with infection, inflammatory etiology or graft versus host disease.differential diagnosis also includes ischemia, although this is less likely.

text: there is a small right pneumothorax.there is a small right pleural effusion, with increased density compatible with a component of hemothorax.there is bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pulmonary contusion or laceration.there is no pericardial effusion.liver is notable for a large laceration, extending to the hepatic hilum, not well seen given limited contrast opacification on this study, but compatible with a grade 5 injury given extension adjacent to the central hepatic vessels.there is associated hemoperitoneum and hyperdense stranding in the region of the porta hepatis.vascular patency is not assessed on this study.presence or absence of active bleeding is also not well assessed.the spleen, pancreas, and left adrenal gland are normal.there is a right adrenal hemorrhage.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast excretion.there is no hydronephrosis.there is no extraluminal contrast to suggest injury to the renal collecting systems.there are multiple cysts identified bilaterally, including parapelvic cysts on the right.there are no enhancing renal mass lesions.there is a mesenteric hematoma identified in the right upper quadrant.there is no evidence of bowel injury, including no bowel wall thickening, and no free air in the abdomen.the aorta is normal in caliber, with mild atherosclerosis.stomach is somewhat distended.there is a moderate hiatal hernia.
summary: small right pneumothorax with small right hemothorax.basilar atelectasis, without pulmonary contusion or laceration.large liver laceration, less well seen than on prior studies given a small contrast dose.this does appear to extend to the hepatic hilum, compatible with a grade 5 injury.small associated hemoperitoneum is noted.right adrenal hemorrhage.no evidence for renal injury, or injury to the collecting system or bladder.small mesenteric hematoma in the right upper quadrant.no definite evidence of bowel injury.no free air.multiple right-sided rib fractures, some displaced, without flail segment.no further fractures identified.sigmoid diverticulosis, without diverticulitis.

text: a moderate right-sided pleural effusion is present.dependent atelectasis is seen at both lung bases.a large retroperitoneal soft tissue mass engulfs the abdominal aorta, celiac, sma, and renal arteries and displaces the pancreas and portal vein anteriorly (2:34).the mass measures 5 cm in the ap direction and 12 cm transversely.the soft tissue mass is heterogeneous with scattered central areas of hypodensity.the mass invades the ivc, extending superiorly to the liver and inferiorly to the iliac bifurcation where venous flow becomes occluded.diffuse intrahepatic biliary dilatation and infiltrative lesions are seen throughout the liver parenchyma.perihepatic ascites is present which descends down the right paracolic gutter.the main portal vein is patent.the mid left portal vein is thrombosed (2:21).the pancreas and spleen are normal.the gallbladder is not distended with no gallbladder wall thickening.a stone is seen in the neck of the gallbladder (2:37).numerous hypodensities are seen within the kidneys which are too small to characterize.smaller soft tissue masses are seen more inferiorly in the retroperitoneum (2:46).the ivc is occluded and dilated just proximal to the confluence of the iliac veins (2:44).diffuse anasarca is seen throughout the subcutaneous tissues.a moderate amount of ascites is seen in the right paracolic gutter, smaller amount in the left paracolic gutter and pararenal spaces.
summary: large 5 x 12 cm soft tissue mass engulfing the aorta, sma, celiac and renal arteries and extending into the ivc which is thrombosed.this most certainly represents a neoplastic mass.with a history of lung cancer this may represent metastasis.moderate intrahepatic biliary dilatation and infiltrative lesions thrombosis of the left portal vein.diffuse anasarca, moderate right pleural effusion.findings were discussed via telephone with dr.___ ___ at 5 a.m.on ___.
