text: visualized lung bases demonstrate mild dependent bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and ureters are unremarkable.there is a 1.9-cm right renal cyst.there is no hydronephrosis.there are multiple dilated loops of small bowel, with air-fluid levels, consistent with obstruction.there is a small epigastric ventral hernia, which a loop, or portion of a loop, of small bowel enters, and distal to this loops of bowel are completely decompressed.within the hernia, there is a loop of small bowel, which measures 2.7 x 2.4 cm, and demonstrates thickened enhancing wall, with surrounding inflammatory stranding, consistent with incarceration, and concerning for strangulation.there is no pneumatosis, free air, or other evidence of perforation.there is no free intraperitoneal air, free fluid, or abnormal mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: high-grade small-bowel obstruction, secondary to incarcerated loop, or portion of a loop, of small bowel within small epigastric hernia.thickened enhancing wall, with surrounding inflammatory stranding of this incarcerated loop is concerning for strangulation.this likely relates to abdominal wall weakness, as evidenced by rectus muscle diastasis.above findings were discussed in person with dr.___ at time of study interpretation on ___.

text: a foley catheter is seen within the urinary bladder, with some air within the bladder lumen.the prostate and seminal vesicles appear unremarkable.again seen is the colonic wall edema extending to the rectum.there is an extensive amount of free fluid within the pelvis.two fluid collections are identified in the left inguinal region, measuring 1.8 and 1.8 cm respectively.the distal aortic bypass graft is again identified.there is no pathologic pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy seen.the osseous structures do not show any concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.there is degenerative change of the lumbar spine.
summary: pancolitis extending from the rectum to the cecum.given this patient's recent antibiotic use, infectious etiologies are of concern.likely enlarged lymph node adjacent to the ascending colon, though a small abscess in this region is possible though less likely.multiple hypodensities of varying sizes within the liver are concerning for abscesses in this patient with bacteremia.additionally, there is a mottled appearance to the spleen which may indicate splenic involvement.ascites and large amount of free fluid within the pelvis.two small fluid collections in the left inguinal region are likely postoperative in nature given recent instrumentation.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.these findings were discussed with ___ ___ at 11:15 a.m.on ___, as well as with ___ ___ at 1:45 p.m.the same day.

text: the patient is status post catheterization 36 hours ago with residual intravenous contrast.the visualized lung bases show a 4-mm pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe (2:11) and a 5-mm pulmonary nodule in the right lower lobe (2:2).there are prominent interstitial lung markings, but no focal consolidation or pleural effusion.bibasilar atelectasis is present.limited imaging of the heart shows slightly enlarged size without pericardial effusion.the coronary arteries are densely calcified as is the aortic valve and mitral valve annulus.the visualized portion of the esophagus is unremarkable.a prominent right hilar lymph node does not meet ct size criteria for lymphadenopathy measuring 7 mm in short axis (2:6).the descending thoracic aorta is densely calcified without aneurysmal dilatation.residual contrast shows homogeneous enhancement of the liver with no focal lesions detected.no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is seen.the gallbladder is filled with vicariously excreted contrast.the pancreas contains a coarse calcification in uncinate process but otherwise appears unremarkable.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are within normal limits.both kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast normally without evidence of hydronephrosis.a hypodense lesion in the cortex of the left mid to lower pole measuring 1.2 cm can be accurately characterized as a simple renal cyst (2:40).the stomach is unremarkable.the duodenum contains a small intramural lipoma in the second or third portion.the intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel show no wall thickening or obstruction.the descending colon contains a few diverticula without inflammatory changes.no free air or ascites is present.small volume retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for lymphadenopathy.the abdominal aorta is densely calcified without aneurysmal dilatation extending into the iliac arteries and its branches within the pelvis.
summary: stranding and small amount of fluid, possibly hemorrhage, along the right external iliac vessels with no drainable collection.severe extensive atherosclerotic disease.bilateral 4-5mm pulmonary nodules.a followup ct is recommended in 12 month's time to assess stability.

text: lung bases are well aerated with the exception of trace dependent atelectasis.there is no pleural effusion.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.the liver demonstrates trace peri-falciform hepatosteatosis.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the spleen is studded with tiny foci of calcifications likely related to prior granulomatous disease such as histoplasmosis or tb.the pancreas, adrenal glands, and left kidney appear unremarkable.small and large bowel loops are normal in caliber.again seen is a large right-sided perinephric hematoma, difficult to directly compare to prior non-contrast-enhanced exams, but appears to demonstrate increased mass effect with flattening of posterior renal margin as compared to preceding exam, suggestive of mild interval enlargement.there is, however, no active extravasation.wedge shaped perfusion abnormality at the lower pole of the right kidney is again seen.previously seen pseudoaneurysm is not apparent.the perinephric hematoma extends into a large 14 x 7.4 cm right retroperitoneal component, without significant interval change in size and appearance, also without active extravasation.there is stable leftward displacement of the ivc and compression by the right rp hematoma, (2b, 289).there is trace increased perihepatic fluid.there is no free air.
summary: possible mild interval enlargement of a right perinephric hematoma as evident by increased mass effect on the renal parenchyma, with stable appearance of inferior extension into a large retroperitoneal hematoma.no active extravasation.

text: the bladder and distal ureters are normal.there is no pelvic lymph node enlargement.no pelvic free fluid.intra- pelvic bowel loops are normal.the prostate is unremarkable.bone windows demonstrate a destructive lytic lesion within the left inferior pubic rami and left acetabulum.a small lytic lesion is also seen within the right inferior iliac ___.again identified in the t3 and t4 vertebral bodies are extensive soft tissue masses causing destruction and extending into the spinal canal.
summary: continued appearance of bilateral subsegmental pulmonary emboli.unchanged appearance of extensive metastatic disease within the pulmonary parenchyma.interval increase in the amount of patchy ground-glass opacity within both lungs, nonspecific in appearance but may represent edema or atypical infection.osseous metastasis as described above.left renal mass consistent with renal cell carcinoma.bilateral adrenal metastasis seen.

text: multiple sigmoid diverticula are seen, without evidence of acute diverticulitis.the bladder appears unremarkable.prostate appears unremarkable.central venous catheter is seen within the left femoral vein.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.
summary: no evidence of acute intra-abdominal pathology.multiple new round low-attenuation lesions seen within the kidneys bilaterally which do not meet ct criteria for simple cysts on this single- phase study.given patient's history of hemodialysis, and therefore increased risk of renal cell carcinoma, followup imaging is recommended.

text: the small bowel diameter is at the upper limits of normal.there is no evidence of mechanical small bowel obstruction.the colon is diffusely thick walled, compatible with given history of colitis.there is no evidence of colonic obstruction.the patient is status post roux-en-y gastric bypass procedure.similarly to ct one day ago, there is distention of the bypassed segment of stomach with fluid measuring up to 9 cm in diameter.there is also air within this gastric remnant.as described on ct of ___, is an abnormal pocket of gas in the region of the tail of the pancreas.extending from this, there is abnormal stranding in the left anterior pararenal space with abnormal soft tissue tracking down the left anterior pararenal space and posterior to the descending colon.in this process, posterior to the descending colon, there is a further small pocket of extraluminal gas.these findings are concerning for a fistula.there is moderate ascites.the liver is diffusely low in attenuation compatible with steatosis.the spleen is normal in size.there is no significant retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is a left hip arthroplasty.no focal bone lesion is seen.
summary: unchanged fluid distention of the gastric remnant.no evidence of mechanical bowel obstruction.diffuse colonic wall thickening compatible with colitis.pockets of gas adjacent to the tail of pancreas and tracking down the anterior pararenal space in close proximity to the descending colon.the extraluminal pockets of gas are concerning for fistula formation vs.contained small perforation, unchanged from the prior ct.no identifiable discrete fluid collection.moderate ascites.marked fatty liver.

text: there is thickening within a long segment of sigmoid colon wall, with surrounding inflammatory change consistent with acute diverticulitis.there is no evidence of abscess or perforation.incidentally, a moderate amount of gas is noted within the vaginal vault, and the question of fistula is raised.there is no pelvic free fluid.the bladder and uterus are unremarkable.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: sigmoid diverticulitis without abscess or free perforation.question of ___-vaginal fistula, clinical correlation is suggested.follow- up to ct resolution of findings is recommended.

text: the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the uterus and adnexa appear grossly unremarkable.no inguinal or iliac adenopathy is identified.
summary: concentric thickening of the rectum and sigmoid colon to a greater extent than prior study, with minimal surrounding stranding suggesting acute mild flare of inflammatory bowel disease.no evidence of abscess or fistula formation.ventral hernia as before.fatty infiltration of the liver.

text: the urinary bladder, prostate gland, and rectum are normal in appearance.no bone lesions worrisome for malignancy are seen.
summary: markedly abnormal pancreas with diffuse abnormal soft tissue and peripancreatic fat stranding that is new compared to ___.this finding could be seen with acute pancreatitis; however, neoplasm cannot be excluded, and further evaluation if clinically warranted to be performed by mri.left thyroid nodule.cholelithiasis.4 a focal area of ground-glass opacity in the right lower lobe is unchanged compared to ___.

text: there is a small amount of free fluid seen within the pelvis, which is seen in continuity with abdominal ascites.the rectum, sigmoid colon and prostate are normal.foley catheter is seen in place within the decompressed bladder.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: multiple new ground-glass nodularities seen bilaterally in lung bases; may represent multifocal pneumonia or aspiration.mild interval increase in splenomegaly and ascites.hyperattenuation of renal medulla bilaterally is new and of uncertain clinical significance.___ represent developing nephrocalcinosis, cortical necrosis or renal tubular acidosis.

text: foley catheter is in place and some dystrophic calcifications are noted within the prostate, which is mildly enlarged.the transverse, descending, and sigmoid colon and rectum are unremarkable.small locules of free air are noted to extend into the right inguinal canal.no pathologically enlarged pelvic sidewall lymph nodes with some scattered reactive inguinal lymph nodes present.
summary: unremarkable-appearing ileocolonic anastomotic site with no peri-anastomotic fluid collection or significant inflammation.minimal peritoneal fluid and mesenteric stranding as expected.small bowel ileus.pockets of hematoma within the abdomen and lower pelvis left rectus sheath likely at prior port site as detailed above.expected mild-to-moderate amount of residual postoperative pneumoperitoneum.mild perihepatic ascites.

text: subsegmental atelectasis seen at the visualized lung bases with trace pericardial effusions.pacing lead seen in the right ventricle and coronary sinus.small pericardial effusion is identified.heart size appears slightly enlarged.allowing for limitation of non-contrast technique, the liver, pancreas, spleen, splenule, and adrenal glands appear grossly unremarkable.high-density material is seen within the gallbladder, possibly vicarious excretion of contrast, versus sludge and stones.multiple rounded low-attenuation lesions seen in the kidneys bilaterally, possibly cysts although incompletely characterized.there is no evidence of free air or free fluid within the abdomen.psoas muscles appear symmetric, and there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is an aneurysmal infrarenal aortic dilation measuring upwards of 3.4 cm in greatest dimension.atherosclerotic calcifications seen throughout the aorta, including the origins of the renal arteries bilaterally.right iliac stent is noted.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.aneurysmal dilatation of the infrarenal aorta measuring up to 3.4 cm in greatest axial dimension.right iliac stent.

text: visualized lung bases reveal minimal dependent atelectasis within the left lower lobe.otherwise, the visualized lung bases are clear.there is no pleural effusion.visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there is a perisplenic collection measuring approximately 7.3 cm x 4.4 cm, which extends along the medial aspect of the spleen, anterior to the splenic hilum .this collection is now hypodense centrally, compatible with liquifaction of blood products.the overall size of this from the prior study is similar however there is now a well defined wall surrounding the collection compatible with an organized evolving hematoma.there is another large collection with a similar appearance along the medial aspect of the left hepatic lobe which measures 7.2 cm x 5.9 cm.this also represents an organized liquifying hematoma.these collections appear to communicate along the subphrenic intervening space (s2:11).these collections are somewhat atypical in shape and appearance for subcapsular hematoma especially given the fact that they communicate.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are otherwise unremarkable.the spleen demonstrates heterogeneous enhancement pattern, in this early arterial phase.the stomach and visualized small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free intraperitoneal air or adenopathy.
summary: evolving perisplenic and perihepatic hematomas, which appear to communicate.if there is need for fluid drainage (symptomatic or concern for superinfection), these collections would be amenable to ct or us guided percutaneous drainage.

text: the bladder is partially collapsed, containing a foley catheter and nondependent air, likely post-instrumentation.a small 2.1 cm bladder diverticulum is seen along the right anterior aspect of the bladder dome.the prostate and rectum appear unremarkable.there is a fat-containing right inguinal hernia.mild soft tissue thickening is seen in the region of the right groin (2, 87), with subjacent soft tissue contour abnormality, sugggestive of a small defect or wound (300b, 30).there is no groin hematoma to the extent visualized.
summary: no retroperitoneal hematoma, colitis, abscess, or hydronephrosis as queried.redemonstration of triangular left paraaortic soft tissue mass extending along the left renal artery, also with an aortocaval component on the right.etiology of this lesion is unclear.___ multiple renal lesions, many of which are complex and/or too small to fully characterize, it is felt mri may be valuable in further assessment of renal lesions as well as the retroperitoneal soft tissue mass.small exophytic lesion along the anterior liver margin demonstrates isodensity to liver on prior contrast-enhanced studies, although assessment incomplete given single phase study.this could be further assessed by mri at the time of renal and retroperitoneal mass assessment.pancreatic head and tail cysts, which could represent either side branch ipmn or cystic neoplasm.consider further assessment by mrcp as previously recommended.apparent skin defect and thickening as well as evidence of inflammation lateral to the right groin (300b, 30), to be correlated with physical exam and direct visualization.bladder dome diverticulum and axial hiatal hernia.stable t12 wedge compression.

text: bladder, distal ureters, and visualized portions of small and large bowel appear unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air.
summary: status post drainage catheter placement with significantly reduced size of superior portion of perihepatic fluid collection.persistent fluid collection in the superior right paracolic gutter may benefit from an additional drain placement.no evidence of free retroperitoneal air to suggest duodenal laceration.bibasal pleural effusions and dependent atelectasis, with slight increase in size of left-sided pleural effusion.the study has been reviewed and discussed with the surgical team.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions are new and are associated with subjacent small areas of atelectasis.the liver, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.bilateral multiple hypodensities within the kidneys are unchanged.these are too small to be characterized, likely cysts.trace of fluid in the right paracolic gutter is new.subcentimeter lymph nodes in the retroperitoneum and mesentery do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement and are unchanged.note is made of pancreatic divisum.there is no free air within the abdomen.stomach is markedly dilated.hypodense soft tissue mass involving the cecum and right colon is unchanged.there is no evidence of proximal obstruction and probable invasion/infiltration into the bladder is still present.previously described area of wall thickening within the splenic flexure of the colon and wall thickening and fat stranding around the distal rectum have resolved.the aorta is normal in caliber.
summary: mass involving the cecum and right colon is unchanged, this is without proximal bowel obstruction and continued probable invasion to the bladder, differential diagnosis includes neoplasia (colon cancer/lymphoma).a mass involving the colon should be biopsied endoscopically rather than percutaneously due to direct communication to gut lumen and intestinal flora.resolved proctitis and previously described lesion in the splenic flexure.dilated stomach.new bilateral pleural effusions.small quantity of new ascites.

text: the distal ureters, bladder, rectum, uterus, adnexa, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the osseous structures are normal.
summary: partial small bowel obstruction with transition point in the proximal jejunum.these results were communicated to dr.___ at 8:00 p.m.on ___.

text: a 3.1 x 3.5 cm hypodensity in segment iii (3, 24) has decreased in size, previously measuring approximately 4.4 x 5.3 cm.it continues to lie in close proximity to a thick-walled peripancreatic air and soft tissue collection .this collection currently measures approximately 7.7 x 18.0 cm, compared to 9.1 x 2.2 cm.this collection contains approximately three drains, which are in appropriate position.there is a new low attenuation collection in the region of the right rectus sheath, which measures approximately 2.7 x 14.8 cm and contains within it strandy intermediate attenuation, which may represent hemorrhage.two of the drains which terminate in the peripancreatic region appear to traverse the inferior aspect of this collection.a fourth drain enters from the right flank and terminates in the subhepatic region.a gastrostomy tube is present.there is a small amount of free fluid and associated peritoneal fat stranding throughout the abdomen and pelvis.scattered non-pathologically enlarged mesenteric nodes are likely reactive.there is no bowel dilatation.there is no definite evidence of colonic wall thickening, although evaluation is limited by the lack of colonic contrast.a rectal tube and foley catheter are present.the sigmoid colon appears unremarkable, with at least one diverticulum noted.in the left hemipelvis, there is a 3.2 x 5.2 cm low-attenuation collection of fluid, without air.there is diffuse stranding of the subcutaneous tissues, compatible with anasarca.an anterior abdominal midline wound is closed with skin staples.
summary: interval decrease in the size of a peripancreatic tissue and air collection, with three drains in appropriate position.additional small right rectus sheath fluid collection, with a small hemorrhagic component.5.2 cm fluid collection in the left pelvis is new when compared to the prior study.

text: there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis with some nodular atelectasis in left lung base.there are coronary artery calcifications.the visualized heart and pericardium are otherwise unremarkable in appearance.
summary: percutaneous transhepatic cholecystostomy tube in proper position with interval improvement of intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.submucosal fat infiltration in the cecum with surrounding hazy peritoneal fat and resolving surrounding fluid.these findings may be representative of gastroenteritis.bilateral renal cysts.mildly enlarged spleen.fat-containing right-sided inguinal hernia.

text: within the visualized lung bases, there is peripheral interstitial thickening, which may reflect chronic interstitial changes.mild superimposed dependent atelectases are also seen.there is no pleural effusion.visualized heart and pericardium are notable for coronary artery calcifications.there is a 5.3 cm x 4.3 cm cystic mass predominantly within segment ii of the liver with suggestion of internal heterogeneity, with an ultrasound performed on the same day demonstrating multiseptations as well as internal debris.while these findings are incompletely characterized without iv contrast, this is concerning for a hepatic abscess.additional adjacent hypodensities are also seen within segment ii/iv (2:9) measuring approximately 1.2 cm, as well as (2:12) measuring approximately 8 mm.these are too small to characterize, and could represent cysts.additionally, there are several ill- defined rounded hypodensities in the caudate lobe of the liver, with slight expansion of the caudate lobe.these do not appear to represent simple cysts, and may represent additional abscesses.the liver is otherwise grossly unremarkable.layering hyperdensity within the gallbladder (2:26) could reflect layering sludge or stones.there is no evidence for intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is a 2-cm rounded hypodensity in the lower pole of the left kidney, which may reflect a cyst.within the lower pole of the right kidney, there is a more ill-defined low- attenuating lesion (2:42) and an exophytic lesion arising from the interpolar region of the right kidney measuring approximately 5 mm.these lesions are too small to characterize.a small hiatal hernia is present.otherwise, the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.there is diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon, without diverticulitis.a rectal tube is seen.there is no free air or free fluid.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen.a left paraaortic node (2:33) measures approximately 8 mm in short-axis.there is extensive atherosclerotic disease of the visualized thoracic aorta and the abdominal aorta, with a stent seen within the distal aorta and extending into the common iliacs bilaterally.
summary: 5-cm cystic lesion within the left lobe of the liver, with suggestion of internal heterogeneity.concurrent ultrasound demonstrates marked internal debris and multi-septations.while this lesion is incompletely characterized without iv contrast, this is concerning for a hepatic abscess.additional vague hypodensities in the caudate lobe may also reflect additional abscesses.differential diagnosis for these lesion inludes necrotic metastases, although this seems less likely.the large lesion in the left lobe is amenable to aspiration/catheter drainage.(the latter was discussed with dr.___ on monday ___ at 11:46am by dr.___ foci of air within the bladder, with a foley catheter in place.several locules of air appear somewhat peripheral in location.this may be located within the lumen of the bladder related to instrumentation; however, correlation with a ua is recommended to exclude associated cystitis.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.hypodensities in bilateral kidneys, too small to characterize.

text: there is free fluid tracking into the pelvis.the bladder, rectum and sigmoid colon are normal.there is no inguinal lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathology.
summary: multifocal pulmonary opacities, which could represent an infectious process.bilateral axillary and right hilar lymphadenopathy, all could be related to the underlying infectious process.moderate bilateral pleural effusions.although there is ascites, fluid within the lesser sac and adjacent to the pancreatic head raises the suspicion of pancreatitis.splenomegaly.periportal lymphadenopathy.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, distal ureters, bladder, and prostate are unremarkable.there is interval increase in the amount of intrapelvic free fluid.again, noted is subcutaneous edema consistent with anasarca.
summary: interval increase in the amount of intraabdominal ascites with increased nodularity in the omentum and peritoneum since the ___ scan.this finding may represent sequelae from infected ascites versus peritoneal carcinomatosis, which would be less common in chronic lymphoid leukemia.interval increase in the bilateral lung base pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.unchanged soft tissue nodule at the right lung base, which may represent sequelae from prior chest tube placement, however, metastatic disease cannot be excluded.interval near-resolution of left lung base soft tissue nodule better appreciated on the ___ examination.stable appearance of intraabdominal and intrapelvic lymphadenopathy.splenomegaly, unchanged.at the immediate conclusion of this examination, these findings were discussed in person with the surgeon caring for the patient, dr.___ ___.

text: the distal right ureter is normal in caliber.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis or pelvic lymph node enlargement.the urinary bladder and rectum are unremarkable.bone windows demonstrate extensive surgical change within the lower thoracic and upper lumbar spine.there are no new suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: interval progression of disease with increased size and number of innumerable bilateral pulmonary nodules, interval appearance of large numerous hepatic masses which likely represent metastases, and increased size of retroperitoneal masses in the region of the previous left-sided nephrectomy.please refer to the oncology table for further information.

text: there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.minimal bibasilar atelectasis is noted.the gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.within the liver, tiny hypodense lesions which are too small to characterize are notable (2, 31 and 2, 27).there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.patient is status post roux-en-y gastric bypass.small bowel loops are normal in caliber without focal wall thickening.there is no free fluid or free air.
summary: extensive subcutaneous inflammatory changes and soft tissue stranding in the left groin as described above.areas of subcutaneous air are now identified and likely due to recent debridement.no focal fluid collection or involvement of the retroperitoneum is noted.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ via telephone.

text: a foley catheter is in place within the bladder, and there is contrast and a small amout of gas within the bladder.no extravasation of contrast opacified urine is identified on the delayed images.there is a large amount of blood layering in the pelvis, contiguous with the hemoperitoneum described within the abdomen.the prostate and seminal vessicles appear unremarkable.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there is no pathologic appearing pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: massive hemoperitoneum, with varying densities within the extravasated blood surrounding the liver and spleen, indicative of acute hemorrhage and probable active extravasation.lacerations of the right lobe of the liver and of the spleen.enlargement and heterogenous density of the left adrenal gland consistent with adrenal adenolipoma.no other solid organ injury identified.no free intraperitoneal air.no fractures identified.these results were discussed immediately with the trauma team caring for the patient.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and prostate gland are unremarkable.there is a fat-containing right inguinal hernia.scattered inguinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for enlargement.osseous structures demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic foci.
summary: resolving right adrenal hematoma.diffuse fatty infiltration of the liver.fat- containing right inguinal hernia.

text: visualized portion of the liver, gallbladder, small and large bowel appear normal.the patient's native kidneys are atrophic.atherosclerotic disease is visualized in the abdominal aorta which is normal in course and caliber.the patient is status post right iliac fossa renal transplant.note is made of an indwelling pigtail nephrostomy tube as well as a pigtail catheter located immediately adjacent to the transplanted kidney.a small amount of fluid is seen along the pedicle of the transplanted kidney; however, there is no focal fluid collection that is amenable to drainage.also seen is the patient's urologically placed stent in the collecting system of the transplanted kidney which extends from the renal pelvis to the bladder.approximately 40 cc of dilute optiray was injected into the indwelling nephrostomy tube.this contrast opacified the transplant kidney collecting system and tracked along the indwelling pigtail nephrostomy tube into the fluid and air containing collection in the right anterolateral abdominal soft tissues.delayed imaging at approximately 5 minutes after nephrostomy tube contrast injection did not reveal contrast in the patient's bladder, implying occlusion of the urologically placed stent.incidental note is made of a fat-containing umbilical hernia.no suspicious osteolytic or osteoblastic lesions.
summary: no drainable fluid collection is seen adjacent to the right iliac fossa transplant kidney.there is a small amount of fluid tracking along the transplanted kidney pedicle.indwelling nephrostomy tube is patent.contrast injected through this tube opacified the transplanted kidney's collecting system as well as tracked along the nephrostomy tube tract into the fluid and air containing collection in the right anterolateral abdominal wall soft tissues.on delayed imaging, no contrast is seen in the bladder, implying occlusion of the urologically placed ureteral stent.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___, who was present while the patient was in radiology at the ct scanner.

text: there is again seen a perihepatic loculated fluid collection which contains now in the most inferior aspect of it a percutaneous drain (2:48).the most inferior aspect of this collection is decreased in size compared to the prior study, measuring 1.3 cm in the transverse dimension and 5.4 cm in the ap dimension compared to 8.2 x 3 cm.small locules of gas are seen, expected post drain placement.per report, a drain was also placed within a more inferior right pelvic collection previously.the collection is smaller in size compared to the prior study; however, the pelvic drain is no longer visualized.the collection measures 6.8 x 3.2 cm (ap and transverse dimension, 2:73), compared to 11 x 8.4 cm on the prior ct.the inferior extension of this collection within the cul-de-sac is not significantly changed in size.previously seen left lower quadrant collection remains collapsed with the percutaneous drain in place.there is a small loculated collection within the left pelvis, measuring 3.6 x 2.8 cm (2:73), unchanged in size compared to the prior study.the right upper quadrant collection which connects with a small collection medial to the ascending colon and anterior to the right kidney measures 4.6 x 4.3 cm (45:2), compared to 5.5 x 4.4 cm.the collections are unchanged in morphology with barium coating.there is no pneumoperitoneum.liver demonstrates no evidence of focal masses.there is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation.spleen is stable in size and morphology.pancreas is normal in appearance without evidence of dilatation or pancreatic duct or masses.bilateral kidneys demonstrate no hydronephrosis or suspicious enhancing masses.
summary: status post ultrasound-guided placement of a percutaneous drain within the inferior aspect of the right perihepatic collection which is smaller in size compared to the prior study.per report, a separate drain was placed within the right pelvic collection which communicated with cul-de-sac.this collection is smaller compared to the prior study, however, the drain is not visualized, likely removed.left lower quadrant collection remains collapsed with drain in place.no new collections are seen.

text: there are multiple low-attenuation lesions in the left lobe of liver consistent with hepatic abscesses.these are mostly at the superior aspect of the left lobe (segments ii and ___).some of these fluid collections contain air.the largest abscess measures 4.2 x 8.6 cm in axial dimensions.this and the remainder of the hepatic abscesses have slightly reduced in size from prior study.there is pneumobilia.the left portal vein is thrombosed.the right portal vein and main portal vein are patent.there is no focal lesion in the right lobe of liver.there is rim-enhancing abnormal fluid extending from the left lobe of liver across the subphrenic space to the left flank.the left subphrenic collection has increased in size, now measuring approximately 9 x 5 cm in axial dimensions.there are multiple locules of rim-enhancing fluid in the left flank.there is a large focal fluid collection in the left flank, measuring 13 x 10 cm in diameter.this has markedly enlarged compared to most recent ct.there is moderate ascites.the pericardial effusion present on previous examination has now resolved.there are bilateral pleural effusions, worse on the left.there is left basal collapse.there is a left cyst at the right lower lobe and patchy air space opacification in the right lower lobe and right middle lobe.the adrenal glands and kidneys are normal bilaterally.the pancreas is atrophic and calcified, consistent with given history of chronic pancreatitis.there are several enlarged porta hepatis and celiac axis lymph nodes.there is no significant focal bone lesion.there is a fracture of the eleventh rib, unchanged from previous study.there are large bilateral hydroceles.there is generalized subcutaneous edema involving the abdomen diffusely and the proximal thighs.
summary: interval development of a large left flank collection.increase in size in left subphrenic collection.decrease in size in multiple left lobe liver collections.left portal vein thrombosis case discussed with on-call transplant fellow.

text: moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions are present containing low-density fluid (17 and 14 ___).there is associated bibasilar dependent atelectasis/consolidation.the partially visualized heart appears normal.the body of the stomach is adjacent to the abdominal wall without interposing loops of large bowel (2:32).remaining abdominal and partially visualized pelvic loops of small and large bowel demonstrate colonic diverticulosis without diverticulitis.lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of solid intra- abdominal organs.calcifications within the spleen may represent granulomas.adrenals appear unremarkable.kidneys appear normal.liver appears unremarkable.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta and its branches.no free air and no free fluid is seen in the abdomen.the left lobe of the liver crosses the midline superior to the stomach.
summary: no colonic loops interposed between stomach and abdominal wall.the left lobe of the liver crosses the midline superior to the stomach.

text: the bladder is collapsed about the foley.there is no definite communication demonstrated between the bowel and bladder on today's examination despite the use of delayed imaging and the installation of rectal contrast.
summary: no definite ___-or-rectal vesicular fistula demonstrated.once the patient has cleared the contrast in his bowel from this ct examination, the possibility of fistula can be investigated under fluoroscopy with injection of contrast into the bladder while looking for leak into the rectum.plain film of the abdomen including the pelvis should be performed prior to ordering the study to insure that contrast is cleared.improved bilateral pleural effusions.resolved right psoas hematoma.improved left thigh hematoma on limited images.diffuse subcutaneous edema.continued marked ascites.

text: a 4.8 x 4.9 cm hypoattenuating peritoneal implant is seen adjacent to the rectum not significantly changed from prior ct from ___.the peritoneal implant anterior to the sigmoid colon measures 5.3 x 2.2 cm is unchanged.there is extensive sigmoid diverticula without evidence of diverticulitis.no pelvic free fluid is identified.the bladder, prostate, seminal vesicles are unremarkable.
summary: dilated fluid-filled loops of proximal small bowel consistent with small-bowel obstruction.transition point is identified in the right lower quadrant adjacent to a peritoneal implant.the distal loops of small bowel within the pelvis and colon are decompressed.no free air or pneumatosis is identified.

text: the distal ureters, rectum, and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.mild circumferential bladder wall thickening is noted.no intraluminal filling defect seen.there is heterogenous enhancement of the uterine myometrium.
summary: circumferential bladder wall thickening is likely secondary to underdistension, however, cystitis cannot be completely excluded; correlate with urinalysis.heterogenous enhancement of the uterus is likely secondary to phase of imaging due to contrast.if there is clinical concern for uterine pathology, then pelvic exam and, if indicated, an ultrasound can be performed for further characterization.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 6:15pm on ___.

text: the bladder is distended but normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or masses.intrapelvic bowel loops are normal.the prostate is unremarkable.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.degenerative change of the si joints and spine is noted.
summary: normal ct evaluation of the abdomen and pelvis without findings to explain the patient's abdominal pain.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable.incidental note is made of calcified fibroids.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy, and no pelvic free fluid is identified.osseous structures demonstrate mild degenerative change of the lumbar spine.

text: there has been improvement in the prior right lower lobe consolidation and effusion.there are is no residual focal consolidation.however, anterior to the liver, there is a small rim- enhancing fluid collection that appears to split the pleura, concerning for a small loculated effusion, due to enhancemnt empyema cannot be excluded.the liver is unremarkable.there are no focal lesions identified.there is mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, but the gallbladder is decompressed.there are no obstructing gallstones identified.there is no pericholecystic fluid or gallbladder wall thickening.portal vein appears patent.the spleen appears normal.the pancreas is atrophic, but there is no pancreatic mass identified.cysts in the bilateral kidneys and nonspecific perinephric stranding are unchanged from prior study.the adrenal glands appear normal.there is symmetric renal parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion bilaterally.there is no hydronephrosis.again seen is an ill-defined soft tissue mass within the mesentery and retroperitoneum, with well-defined margins.enlarged lymph node adjacent to the right psoas muscle is also unchanged (2:56).there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta and iliac vessels.however, there is no aneurysmal dilatation, the major mesenteric vessels appear patent.stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.contrast passes into the colon.there is no colonic wall thickening or pericolonic inflammation.there is diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis in sigmoid colon.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate mild dependent subsegmental atelectasis.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.the liver is normal without focal liver lesion identified.there is no intrahepatic bile duct dilation.tiny pneumobilia is likely due to two common bile duct stents in place, attesting to stent patency.the gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly without hydronephrosis.there has been interval removal of the percutaneous drain from the right posterior pararenal fluid collection.the collection has decreased in size in the interim, measuring 4.2 x 1.3 x 2.9 cm (tv x ap x cc), previously 4.6 x 2.1 x 3.7cm when measured in a similar plane.small satellite fluid collections in communication with the larger collection measures up to 1.9 x 1.1 cm (tv x ap) posteriorly, previously 1.9 x 1.8 cm, also smaller.there is adjacent stranding in the right paracolic gutter.no new fluid collection is identified.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber without obstruction.there is no free intraperitoneal air.the appendix is visualized and is normal.mild stranding in the anterior mesentery is likely post-surgical, unchanged from ___.small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are not enlarged by size criteria.
summary: slight interval decrease in size in right posterior pararenal rim-enhancing fluid collection with small satellite collections.interval removal of the percutaneous pigtail drainage catheter.no new fluid collection.no other acute abdominal pathology.

text: in the interval since the prior study, there is increase in bilateral pleural effusions, which are now moderate in size, and there is associated atelectasis of the adjacent lung.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.the gallbladder is distended.there is slight interval decrease in the amount of fluid in the perirenal spaces bilaterally.the unopacified loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is high attenuation in the walls of the ascending, transverse, and descending colon in this non-constrast-enhanced study, which is consistent with hypoperfusion/stasis and the diagnosis of shock bowel.an approximately 10 x 3 cm high attenuation collection consistent with hemorrhage is noted in the peritoneum at the level of the pancreas, and this hemorrhage can be seen insinuating itself among the mesentery extending into the pelvis.in addition, there is an approximately 8.6 x 4.6 cm high attenuation collection in the subcutaneous fat to the left of midline in the mid to lower abdomen, which is consistent with a hematoma.there is no free air and no lymphadenopathy.

summary: no evidence of gluteal abscess.interval reduction of bilateral pleural effusions.interval decrease in the bilateral patchy diffuse airspace consolidations consistent with the given history of the ards.large anterior abdominal defect with a surgical sutures visualized in the small bowel, consistent with given history of small bowel resection and anastomosis.small amount of free intra-abdominal and pelvic fluid.bullet fragment adjacent to the inferior aspect of the l4 vertebral body anteriorly.

text: two mediastinal drains are demonstrated within the anterior mediastinum with a small amount of associated pneumomediastinum seen.additionally a left anterior chest tube is demonstrated, which is partially imaged on this examination.the heart is enlarged, and there is a small pericardial effusion.additionally small bilateral pleural effusions are present with bibasilar compressive atelectasis.the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, stomach, and loops of large and small bowel are all within normal limits.high density material is demonstrated throughout the gallbladder consistent with vicarious excretion of contrast.the gallbladder otherwise is unremarkable.there is a mild amount of perinephric stranding demonstrated around both kidneys, and evidence of focal cortical scarring on the left.no hydronephrosis or renal calculi are demonstrated.the proximal ureters are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is no evidence of a retroperitoneal hematoma.the aorta is normal in caliber throughout.

text: a transplant kidney is in place within the left lower quadrant.there is a perinephric fluid collection about the transplant kidney, measuring approximately 55-60 hounsfield units on the initial examination.there is a laceration within the lateral aspect of the transplant kidney, which appears to approach the opacified collecting system.an additional laceration is seen within the medial aspect of the upper pole of the transplant kidney.the renal artery and vein appear patent.a 9 mm rounded, hypodense lesion is seen within the upper pole of the kidney.two additional small, rounded, hypodense lesions are seen within the upper pole.there is no definite evidence of active extravasation of contrast and no definite evidence of change in density of the perinephric fluid collection on the delayed images.delayed images obtained through the pelvis demonstrate a segment of renal cortex that appears to retain contrast in the nephrographic phase in comparison to the remainder of the renal parenchyma.there is intermediate density fluid layering within the pelvis.a foley catheter is in place within the bladder, with air within the bladder consistent with foley insertion.the uterus and adnexa appear unremarkable.the visualized portion of the transplant ureter appears unremarkable.
summary: multiple lacerations of transplant kidney with perinephric hematoma.there is no definite evidence of active extravasation of contrast.there is abnormal retention of contrast within a segment of renal cortex on the delayed images consistent with contusion.renal lacerations appear to extend towards the opacified collecting system without evidence of extravasation of urine.no evidence of hepatic or splenic laceration.no free air within the abdomen.no fractures identified.left rectus sheath hematoma.results were discussed with the trauma team at the time of interpretation.

text: the well-distended urinary bladder, distal ureters, prostate, seminal vesicles, rectosigmoid colon, and pelvic loops of bowel as well as the appendix appear unremarkable.no pelvic free fluid or adenopathy is noted.filling defect which completely occludes and expands the left common iliac and superior portion of the common femoral artery is consistent with an embolus.there is reconstitution of column of contrast in the left common femoral artery distal to the embolus.
summary: aortic valve prosthesis with hypoattenuating lesion surrounding the valve, with small portion extending into the ascending aorta, and also with anterior component causing mass effect on the pulmonary valve.findings consistent with report of abscess as seen on tee.if further characterization of the collection or delineation of its effect on the adjacent pulmonary valve is required, prospectively gated cardiac cta would be recommended.splenic infarctions.left common iliac artery embolus.soft tissue density in the mesentery between loops of small bowel, of uncertain etiology, could represent a phlegmon, less likely isolated lymph node.numerous small mediastinal lymph nodes.

text: direct comparison is made to prior examination dated ___.ill-defined patchy opacities are again seen at the right lung base, markedly improved since the aforementioned prior examination.this examination is limited by the lack of intravenous contrast.again, there is a hypoattenuating lesion within the posterior aspect of the right lobe of the liver.this does not appear to be significantly changed in size.currently, the attenuation of the liver has increased, likely reflecting a lesser degree of steatosis versus the prior study.there is heterogeneity of the attenuation of the liver, predominantly at the dome with question of an ill-defined hypoattenuating lesion on image #7 of series 2.given the patient's clinical history, mri is recommended for further characterization of the liver.heterogeneity may reflect underlying diffuse disease such as cirrhosis, however, metastatic disease is also a consideration given the patient's clinical history.also, the spleen appears diffusely heterogeneous with numerous areas of low attenuation.again, mri may be used for further evaluation of this finding.this appearance is new and not seen on the prior study.though metastatic disease is a differential consideration, this would be somewhat unlikely consideration.alternatively, ultrasound may be used for evaluation of the liver and spleen as clinically dictated.the gallbladder, adrenal glands, pancreas, and kidneys appear grossly unremarkable.the bowel is grossly unremarkable.pelvic structures are grossly unremarkable, noting post-surgical changes.there is no evidence of recurrence of tumor within the pelvis.no significant lymphadenopathy is identified.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.

text: bilateral pleural effusions have resolved.bibasilar patchy atelectasis remains.small hypodensity within the dome of the liver is unchanged, too small to characterize by ct.note is made of a small hiatal hernia.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, stomach, small bowel loops, adrenal glands are unchanged.kidneys are unchanged with note again made of atrophic left kidney.hypodensity within the right kidney again identified, possibly a cyst, but not fully evaluated by ct.there is no free air in the abdomen.note is again made of a dense atherosclerotic calcification of the aorta and its major branches including both main renal arteries and the sma.note is made of an accessory left inferior renal artery.note is again made of gallstones.ct pelvis _____ contrast: drainage catheter is curled within the dependent portion of complex pelvic collection that has decreased in the interval.the exact measurements of the collection are difficult secondary to adjacent bowel loops, but maximal measurements today are 5.2 x 4.1 cm, that is decreased from 8.1 x 5.5 cm.the collection is complex with heterogeneous attenuation, likely multiple septa.bowel wall thickening of the sigmoid is unchanged.multiple diverticula are present.the rectum is normal.the ascending and transverse colon are normal.no pathologic adenopathy is identified.small intraperitoneal air has been resorbed.

text: in the prerectal contrast pelvis, the previous oral contrast is seen in relatively unchanged position in the visualized distal small bowel and did not reach the sigmoid colonic anastomotic site.there are unchanged pelvic fluid collections, mostly in the anterior low pelvis with extension to the anastomotic suture line.there are small scattered extraluminat gas pockets, overall unchanged from prior study.subsequently, 200cc diluted optiray contrast was dripped through the rectal foley catheter.repeat pelvic scan demonstrates a definite interval increased attenuation of the pelvic fluid collections, indicating extravasation of rectal contrast.however, the precise location of the leak cannot be identified in this non-realtime non-fluoroscopic study, but is believed to be along the anastomatic line.

text: there is high-attenuation material in the right ischial rectal fossa adjacent to the inferior pubic rami on the delayed images.this still has high density within it.this represents a hematoma.this displaces the bladder to the left.additionally, there is some hematoma extending along the extraperitoneal right pelvic floor.there is soft tissue hematoma in the right buttock and hip.there is no evidence of free fluid in the abdomen.there is no evidence of bladder injury.bone windows demonstrate comminuted fragments through the right iliac ___ which extend into the sacroiliac joint, the anterior/inferior right sacrum, the right superior and inferior pubic rami, the left superior and inferior pubic rami.fractures through the right ribs posteriorly 9 through 11.there is a fracture through the anterior left acetabulum.the right-sided superior pubic rami fractures do not appear to involve the right acetabulum.there is diastasis of the right sacroiliac joint.

text: the urinary bladder, prostate, and rectum are within normal limits.there is evidence of sigmoid diverticulosis with no wall thickening or fat stranding in the pericolic region to suggest diverticulitis.within the mid to distal ileum there is a short segment of bowel wall thickening with associated surrounding fat stranding.this short segment of small bowel is significantly improved when compared to the prior study of ___.no extraluminal air is seen on today's examination.there are multiple adjacent calcified lymph nodes suggesting old granulomatous disease in this region.oral contrast fills the cecum indicating no evidence of obstruction.the appendix is normal in appearance filling with contrast.there is a direct left inguinal fat containing hernia.surgical clips are present within the right inguinal region.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: improved appearance of wall thickening/inflammatory change involving a short segment of small bowel within the mid to distal ileum.the features of this process suggests an infectious or inflammatory etiology.an ischemic process is less likely.crohn's disease is also unlikely given the normal appearance of the terminal ileum.dilatation of the infrarenal abdominal aorta measuring 3.5 x 3.1 cm in greatest dimension.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.fat containing direct left inguinal hernia.

text: suture material and postsurgical changes are identified at the lung bases, where there has been partial right lower lobectomy.there is resulting hyperinflation of the right middle lobe.a single surgical clip is identified at the left lung base.there is a small right pleural effusion.multiple hypodense liver lesions are better evaluated on recent mr abdomen.however, an approximately 3 cm segment vii hypodense lesion is again identified (2:7), as well as multiple hypodense liver lesions in the left lobe and a hyperdense lesion, all difficult to measure without iv contrast.these are again consistent with metastatic involvement of lung cancer.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, ureters, large bowel, and small bowel are unremarkable for non- contrast examination.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction or intra- abdominal free air or fluid.

text: there is mild bibasilar dependent atelectasis.no pleural or pericardial effusion is seen.a small hiatal hernia is noted.evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is limited without intravenous contrast.diffuse hypodensity of the liver is consistent with fatty deposition.nodular increased density adjacent to the gallbladder fossa is due to focal sparing.the unenhanced spleen, pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.multiple gallstones are seen within the gallbladder without pericholecystic fluid.the renal contours are symmetric without hydronephrosis.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber without obstruction.the colon is featureless from the mid transverse colon through the rectum with bowel wall thickening, suggestive of chronic inflammatory change.no adjacent fat stranding is seen to suggest acute inflammation.there is no free fluid and no free air.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are present.
