text: foley catheter is in situ.there is a small amount of free fluid.the rectum, sigmoid colon and large bowel is normal.
summary: migration of gastric tube into the rectus sheath.there is a clear connection, however, into the stomach and no evidence for free air or free fluid.repositioning of tube is recommended.no radiographic explanation for falling hematocrit.multiple incidental findings including right staghorn calculus, porcelain gallbladder, anasarca, bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis, and severe atherosclerotic disease.the case was discussed with dr.___ at 4 p.m.on ___.

text: the distal ureters are normal in caliber.the urinary bladder, uterus and rectum are unremarkable.there is no free fluid within the pelvis or abdomen.there is no intraperitoneal air.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: diffuse bilateral air space disease with interstitial thickening and areas of interstitial nodularity, as well as ground-glass opacity.these findings could represent pulmonary edema/ards, as well as a superimposed infectious etiology.given the patient's history of immune compromise, cmv or pcp are included in the differential.multiple small areas of high density within the soft tissues of the anterior and lateral abdominal wall.these could represent areas of subcutaneous injection, but clinical correlation is advised.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, seminal vesicles, prostate, and bladder are normal.no free pelvic fluid, and no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: small amounts of free air are seen within the abdomen.there is mesenteric stranding within the right mid abdomen, just superior to the neoterminal ileum, indicating acute inflammation.there is no thickening of the bowel wall, however.there are mildly dilated loops of small bowel in the right lower quadrant, though there is no obstruction as oral contrast passes through to the rectum.the findings are consistent with neoterminal ileitis related to crohn's flare, with perforation.no abscesses are seen at this time.small rounded hypodensities of each kidney, which are too small to characterize.findings were discussed with dr.___ in the emergency department at the time of interpretation.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, and uterus are within normal limits.the ovaries are prominent bilaterally, with multiple follicles.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.there are several enlarged left inguinal lymph nodes, measuring up to approximately 1.2 cm in short axis dimensions on the left.
summary: no intra-abdominal source of infection is identified on this study.there is no evidence of colitis.multiple enlarged left inguinal nodes, measuring up to approximately 1.1 cm in short axis dimensions.

text: there is a fibroid uterus with small calcifications, unchanged.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.no free fluid or masses.pelvic bowel loops are normal.no suspicious bone lesions are seen.
summary: new increased soft tissue density stranding subjacent to the nipple within the right breast.the findings are nonspecific, but underlying malignancy or involvement by lymphoma cannot be excluded.clinical correlation and correlation with the mammogram study is recommended.no evidence of intrathoracic or intra-abdominal/pelvic disease recurrence.

text: the prostate, bladder are within normal limits.there is extensive sigmoid diverticulosis.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.contrast passes through to the rectum.there is a central venous catheter extending into the right common iliac vein.there is some stranding in the right groin consistent with recent catheterization, but no hematoma.
summary: large hiatal hernia.coronary and aortic calcifications.small bilateral pleural effusions and atelectases.atrophic kidneys, with likely cysts on the left.since only a tiny possible small remnant is present on the right, corelation with surgical history is suggested.question of hematoma in the right lower quadrant, although postoperative changes, or old hematoma, are a possibility as well.the appearance is felt more likely chronic.if there is concern for continuing hemorrhage at a later time, a follow-up study could be helpful.the case was discussed with a resident covering the patient.

text: within the lung bases, a 1.6 x 1.5 cm lesion at the left base (2:6) appears grossly similar to the prior mri examination.an 8 x 8 mm lesion (2:1) also appears unchanged.there are small pleural effusions, right greater than left.within the abdomen, the liver is markedly enlarged and heterogeneous compatible with multifocal hepatocellular carcinoma.direct comparison with mri is limited, however, there may have been some progression.for instance, a lesion in the left hepatic lobe measuring 5.0 x 4.9 cm (2:15) measured approximately 4.8 x 4.4 cm previously.a lesion in the right lobe measuring 4.4 x 4.0 cm (2:24) previously measured 3.9 x 3.8 cm.there is mass effect including compression of the ivc, though patency is not assessed on this non-contrast examination.the stomach is distended and may also be due to mass effect.there is moderate ascites.some nodularity in the peritoneal fat posterior to the right lobe is present.diffuse colonic wall thickening is seen in the ascending colon, descending colon, sigmoid and rectum.the non-contrast appearance of the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are grossly within normal limits.no free air is identified.there is diffuse subcutaneous anasarca.the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the prostate gland appears grossly unremarkable.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.
summary: multifocal liver lesions compatible with known hepatocellular carcinoma.though direct comparison with mri is limited, there does appear to have been some progression.moderate ascites; the presence of infection is not assessed on this examination.additionally, diffuse areas of large bowel wall thickening may be related to edema/ascites, however, infection would appear similar by ct.nodularity posterior to the liver could be seen with peritoneal carcinomatosis.mass effect due to enlarged liver including compression of the ivc.distention of the stomach may also be secondary to obstruction from mass effect.assessment of patency of the veins is not performed on this non-contrast examination.pulmonary nodules at the left base as previously seen.

text: the bladder contains a foley catheter and a moderate amount of air.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear within normal limits.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: increased bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis.slight improvement in right lower lobe pulmonary abscess and in diffuse pulmonary nodular opacities, suggestive of improving infectious process.no evidence of abscess in the abdomen or pelvis.unchanged appearance of the abdominal aortic aneurysm repair site.unchanged left renal lesions incompletely characterized on this single phase examination.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bilateral atelectasis.there are no pleural effusions.the visualized portion of the heart demonstrates atherosclerotic changes.there are no pericardial effusions.in the distribution of the right hepatic artery, there is heterogeneous uptake of iodinated chemo-embolization material.there is increased and more focal uptake in the previously identified mass in the right lobe of the liver.this mass measures 5.8 x 5.3 cm.there is no chemoembolization material identified within any other organs.there are no new nodules identified in the liver; however, the full evaluation is limited due to lack of intravenous contrast material.the spleen, pancreas, adrenals, gallbladder are all unremarkable.in the upper pole of the left kidney, there is a 4.2 x 4.1 cm hyperdense mass which was better characterized on prior contrast- enhanced studies and was recognized as an enhancing mass concerning for malignancy.it has not changed appreciably in size compared to previous examination.there are scattered hypodensities within the parenchyma of the left and right kidneys, which are too small to characterize by ct criteria.there are no stones within the left and right kidneys.there is no hydronephrosis.again noted is an approximately 1.2-cm cystic structure adjacent to the head of the pancreas, which likely represents a pancreatic cyst.again noted is a small portacaval node as well as a small peripancreatic node which has not changed in size compared to previous examination.on previous examination, there is note made of partial thrombosis of the left portal vein.on this non-contrast-enhanced study, this is not well demonstrated.the stomach, and visualized portions of the small and large bowel are unremarkable in appearance.there are atherosclerotic changes of the abdominal aorta.there is no free air.there is no free fluid.
summary: heterogeneous distribution of chemoembolization material in the distribution of the right hepatic artery.there is increased uptake of this material within the mass occupying the right lobe of the liver.hyperdense mass in the superior left pole of the kidney again concerning for malignancy.1.2-cm cystic structure adjacent to the body of the pancreas as seen previously.unchanged appearance of portacaval and parapancreatic lymph nodes.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions are simple and slightly greater on the left, with adjacent atelectasis.a nasogastric tube is seen in a decompressed stomach.the liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are within normal limits.a splenule is noted.there is redemonstration of a small amount of ascites within the abdomen and pelvis.there are two small fat-containing hernias in the right lower quadrant and abdominal midline, compatible with known prior surgery, which included an ileostomy.the patient is status post subtotal colectomy.diffuse mesenteric fat stranding is nonspecific and similar when compared to the prior study.there is no evidence of bowel dilatation or pathologic lymph node enlargement.contrast passes freely to the hartmann's pouch in the pelvis.there are retroperitoneal and perisplenic varices which appear similar when compared to prior studies.
summary: no evidence of partial small-bowel obstruction.there is continued ascites, nonspecific mesenteric fat stranding and retroperitoneal collaterals, which are of uncertain etiology.underlying liver disease should be considered.small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis.

text: there is a soft tissue structure in the pelvis which is presumed to be the uterus.note is made of a vague soft tissue mass with potential cystic internal spaces in the right low pelvis.the colonic wall appears diffusely thinned.there is an area of focal asymmetric dilatation adjacent to a surgical suture margin and pelvic small bowel.
summary: large amount of fluid within the abdomen, which is not simple fluid from decompensated cirrhosis.there are enhancing septations and areas of soft tissue density.while the findings could be due to severe peritonitis, radiographic appearance is also consistent with peritoneal carcinomatosis.in this patient, possible sources could include ovary, bowel, breast, or pancreatic sources.evidence of cirrhosis.large right paracolic gutter loculated fluid pocket with mass effect upon liver.targeted ultrasound to assess for potential soft tissue bowel implants is recommended.the loculated fluid pocket adjacent to the liver could also be aspirated at that time, if clinical pain symptoms are thought to be due to pressure on the liver.no frank evidence of intra-abdominal abscess.diffusedly irregular areas of small and large bowel wall.see above recommendations.unchanged 17 mm right renal artery aneurysm.results were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 10:00 a.m.on ___.wet read results stating no abscess, massive amount of ascites called to dr.___ ___ at 1:00 a.m.on ___ by dr.___.

text: suture material and atelectasis in the right lower lobe are unchanged from ___.no pleural or pericardial effusion.hyperemia is noted at the right liver edge.a fluid collection is adjacent to the right liver in the surgical bed.a jp drain is adjacent to the collection, but does not appear to be within it.the jp drain is within a small amount of sub-diaphragmatic free fluid.scalloped deformity along the anterior margin of the left lobe is new from ___ and is probably site of left lobe mass resection per operative note.pneumobilia is due to biliary stent.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the spleen, pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.a hypodensity within the lower pole of the left kidney is too small to characterize, but is unchanged from the prior study.suture material is seen in the descending colon without evidence of obstruction.there is large fecal loading.the anti-meseteric wall of the transverse colon herniates ventrally, likely in the incision site.the small bowel is normal in course and caliber.there is a moderate amount of ascites, particularly in the perisplenic region, tracking down to the pelvis.abnormal enhancement of the peritoneum is noted.no free air.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.atherosclerotic calcifications are seen throughout the aorta without aneurysmal dilatation.the portal vein, splenic vein, and smv are patent.
summary: hyperemia and fluid collection at the hepatic surgical resection margin are likely post-surgical.the jp drain is adjacent to, but not within, the fluid collection.infection of the fluid collection cannot be excluded.___ hernia of the transverse colon, likely into the incision site; correlate for focal pain.moderate ascites.the jp is within sub-diaphragmatic free fluid and sampling may be helpful to assess for infection of the free fluid.abnormal enhancement of the peritoneum may be post-surgical, inflammatory, infectious or malignant.

text: the urinary bladder containing contrast from prior administration, distal ureters, prostate, rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of colitis or perforation.probable trace right pleural effusion.left basal atelectasis.findings suggestive of a right sided pulmonary infarct.

text: there has been marked interval improvement in the bilateral opacities at the lung bases.there is still some residual airspace opacity, which may represent resolving airspace disease and some residual atelectasis.there are no focal nodules.there is no effusion.there is an increase in the diffuse bowel wall edema which is seen throughout the entire small bowel to the ileostomy.there is trace oral contrast seen in the narrowed lumen.there is no pneumatosis.there is mesenteric stranding; however, this appears similar to prior study eight days ago.some residual free fluid remains around the liver.the liver is again shrunken and nodular consistent with known cirrhosis.there are no focal liver lesions.there is a stone in the gallbladder.the pancreas is normal.the spleen is again enlarged.the cyst in the interpolar region of the right kidney is less well seen than on previous contrast-enhanced study.the adrenals are normal.there is atherosclerotic calcification in the intra-abdominal aorta and iliac vessels.
summary: extensive mural edema throughout the entire small bowel.ischemia remains part of the differential although there are no specific findings to suggest it and the sma and celiac appeared patent on most recent iv contrast-enhanced study.no focal fluid collection or abscess.cirrhotic liver and splenomegaly persists.marked improvement in the diffuse airspace opacity bilaterally.findings discussed with dr.___ (transplant surgery) on the evening of the study.

text: there is no focal consolidation or pleural effusion.the liver is unremarkable.there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.the patient is status post interval cholecystectomy and surgical clips are seen in the gallbladder fossa.there is an area of fluid, measuring 1.9 x 1.6 x 1.6 cm, in the surgical bed, in the region of the previous gallbladder fundus.no discrete wall is seen surrounding this collection.the common bile duct is prominent, which can be seen post-cholecystectomy.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.pancreas is again densely calcified with prominence of the pancreatic duct, consistent with chronic pancreatitis.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast symmetrically with no evidence of hydronephrosis.there are small tiny hypodensities in the right kidney, too small to characterize.there is no bowel dilatation, pneumatosis, free air, or free fluid.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the retroperitoneum or mesentery.the abdominal aorta is of normal caliber.
summary: status post interval cholecystectomy.area of fluid in the surgical bed, as above, without discrete wall, of unclear etiology, may be postoperative, although biloma not entirely excluded.pancreatic calcifications and ductal prominence consistent with chronic pancreatitis.findings posted on the ed dashboard.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder are unremarkable.the uterus demonstrates calcified fibroids.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.2.4 x 2.0 cm right adnexal cyst is unchanged from prior pelvic ultrasounds.there is a patent aortofemoral bypass, with occluded native aorta and iliac arteries.there is diastasis of the rectus abdominus muscles in the upper abdomen.additionally, minimal subcutaneous fat stranding is seen within the anterior abdominal wall, within the midline, superior to the umbilicus (2:25), (301b: 34).osseous structures demonstrate moderate sacroiliac joint degenerative disease.
summary: no evidence of acute abdominal process.nonspecific mesenteric and right lower quadrant stranding without definite evidence of bowel pathology.rectus abdominus diastasis, with non-specific adjacent fat stranding in the subcutaneous tissues of the ventral abdominal wall.calcified fibroid uterus.patent aortobifemoral bypass.unchanged right adnexal cyst.findings posted to the ed dashboard at the time of scan completion.dfddp

text: there is a large ventral hernia containing bowel without evidence of incarceration.the bladder wall is markedly thickened and the anterior aspect of the bladder enters the ventral hernia.the bladder contains a large amount of air, possibly secondary to foley catheter placement.a calcified fibroid is seen within the uterus.the adnexa are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid or fluid collection.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: multifocal areas of decreased enhancement in both renal cortices suggests multifocal pyelonephritis, especially in a patient with history of gram negative septicemia.markedly thickened bladder wall suggests cystitis with possible ascending infection as etiology of the pyelonephritis.small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis.large ventral hernia.calcified uterine fibroid.these findings were discussed with the emergency department team.

text: the distal ureters are normal in caliber.the urinary bladder, prostate, and rectum are unremarkable.there is no evidence of pelvic or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesion or evidence of definite fracture.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic abnormality.

text: bilateral basal lung scarring with fibrosis, emphysema and large bulla are present, particularly at the right base.nodular consolidations at the right base are stable to slightly improved.the partially visualized heart appears normal.a small to moderate-sized hiatal hernia is present.the stomach is moderate to severely distended with orally administered contrast.proximal loops of jejenum are dilated extending up to a transition point in the left upper quadrant (2:40), but oral contrast extends beyond the transition point.bowel loops are dilated up to 3.4 cm.loops distal to the transition point are decompressed.stool is present in the residual colon.no free air or free fluid is present.a colostomy is present.the spleen appears unchanged with hypodensities in the upper pole, which likely reflect prior infarctions stable.the adrenals appear normal.numerous calcifications are present throughout the pancreas, likely related to prior pancreatitis with mild pancreatic duct dilation up to 6 mm.a single locule of air is present near the ampulla (2:36), which may relate to air within a duodenal diverticulum.enhancement of the left kidney is normal and unchanged.there is persistent poor enhancement of the lower pole of the right kidney (600b:43) compatible with prior of infarction.the abdominal aorta and its branches are patent.atherosclerotic disease of the infrarenal abdominal aorta is unchanged and there is no aneurysm.the gallbladder is distended, but there is no gallbladder wall thickening and no peri-gallbladder wall thickening.
summary: transition point in the left upper quadrant with dilated proximal loops of small bowel and stomach.oral contrast transits beyond the transition point suggestive of a partial obstruction.unchanged splenic, and renal infarctions.locule of air near the ampulla and cbd may be due to air within a duodenal diverticulum, stable.chronic thrombosis of the right iliac and femoral vein to the level of the common iliac vein bifurcation.emphysema and multifocal airspace opacities at the lung bases, unchanged.status post ostomy with sigmoid resection.no evidence for anastomotic leak, or free intra-abdominal air.gallbladder distention, but no signs of cholecystitis.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 5:20 p.m.on ___ by telephone by dr.___.

text: unchanged small right pleural effusion and mild atelectasis of the right lung base.there is a new large fluid collection at the gastrohepatic ligament measuring 10.2 x 5.8 cm, which based on its hounsfield units (4 ___) is relatively simple fluid rather than being a hematoma or abcess.no hematocrit effect is noted within this collection.the surgical clips are noted adjacent to the ivc and the portal vein.the patient is status post liver transplant.the drain anterior to the right lobe of the liver terminates in the right lower quadrant area.the biliary drain is also in place.the enlarged spleen measures 18 cm.multiple dilated tortuous vessels are not adjacent to the spleen suggesting the presence of varicosities setting of portal hypertension.small amount of fluid is noted in both anterior pararenal spaces and perihepatic and perisplenic spaces and in the pelvis.the adrenal glands, kidneys, and pancreas have normal appearance.the stomach, duodenum and loops of small bowel and large bowel have normal appearance.the bladder, distal ureters, the rectum, and sigmoid colon are normal.small amount of fluid is noted within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic, inguinal, mesenteric, or retroperitoneum nodes are noted.the aorta is moderately calcified with no aneurysm or stenosis.
summary: enlarging 10.2 x 5.8 cm fluid collection in the gastrohepatic ligament.no abscess cavity or hematoma.status post liver transplant with signs of prior portal hypertension with splenomegaly and multiple perisplenic collaterals.small amount of fluid in perihepatic, perisplenic spaces and within the pelvis.findings were discussed with dr ___ at the time of dictataion.

text: again note is made of gynecomastia.note is made of markedly increased ascites throughout the abdomen and pelvis, with persistent perihepatic fat stranding.one drainage tube terminating in subhepatic space is noted.there is 7 cm fluid collection filled with contrast in subhepatic area, corresponding to the finding on prior tube study.it is unclear if the collection is subhepatic or intrahepatic, or abscess, or represent a loop of postoperative bowel.the ascites is markedly increased compared to the prior study.the study is limited for the evaluation of major abdominal organs due to lack of intravenous contrast ___.note is made of cirrhotic liver with splenomegaly.there is no significant bowel obstruction.no hydronephrosis or renal stone.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted, however, no significant lymphadenopathy is identified.there is fat- containing periumbilical hernia, unchanged compared to the prior study.
summary: markedly increased ascites seen throughout the abdomen and pelvis, with fat stranding diffusely in the abdomen, especially surrounding the liver.7 cm fluid collection filled with contrast at the tip of the tube in subhepatic area, which may represent leak, abscess, or loop of bowel.further evaluation by tube ct study is underway.d/w referrign surgical service in person.limited study for evaluation of the major abdominal organs, due to lack of intravenous contrast ___.cirrhotic liver and splenomegaly.bilateral hydroceles, greater on the right.bibasilar atelectasis, and tubular opacity in left lower lobe measuring 1.2 cm, unchanged since prior study.gynecomastia.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions.there is associated dependent atelectasis, right greater than left.there is a small amount of fluid surrounding the liver and a moderate amount of pelvic fluid.the contour of the liver is slightly irregular, consistent with history of cirrhosis.there is air within biliary ducts, likely related to recent ercp.there is contrast within the gallbladder.there is a stent in the distal common duct.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.the adrenals are unremarkable.there are splenic varices.there is no evidence of kidney stones.there are a few tiny lesions within the right kidney which have fat density and likely represent angiomyolipomas.bilateral proximal ureters are slightly prominent.there are multiple sub-cm retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes.loops of small bowel are not dilated.there is no evidence of diverticula or inflammatory changes adjacent to the colon.
summary: moderate amount of ascites.contrast within the gallbladder from prior ercp.multiple sub-cm mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes which are nonspecific and may be related to inflammatory process.no evidence of diverticulitis.

text: redemonstrated is endometrial hypodense thickening which remains concerning for malignancy.the bilateral adnexa, rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable.there is no pelvic free fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is a stable calcific density anterior to the bladder since ___ of uncertain etiology.note is made of interval development of appendoliths within the appendix; however, the appendix is not dilated.
summary: findings are concerning for acute cholecystitis secondary to distal cbd obstruction.endometrial thickening remains concerning for malignancy.recommend correlation with biopsy.

text: lung bases show elevation of the left hemidiaphragm, with bilateral atelectasis and pleural effusions.there is a small pericardial effusion, and coronary artery calcifications.there is excretion of contrast into the gallbladder.the liver, pancreas, adrenal glands, stomach, and small bowel are unremarkable.replaced hepatic artery from the sma.there is a small amount of ascites.there is some heterogeneity of the spleen, with hypodensity corresponding to areas of prior splenic infarct.there is also poorly defined heterogeneity of both kidneys, representing combination of renal cysts and areas of prior infarction.additionally, an exophytic renal cyst is again seen in the lateral aspect of the midpole of the right kidney.there is vascular calcification of the aorta, particularly the infrarenal portion.there is no abdominal lymphadenopathy.there is diffuse mesenteric fat stranding, particularly involving the right lower quadrant.the appendix is normal.the wall of the hepatic flexure may be thickened.in examination of the vascular structures of the abdomen (limited by noncontrast technique), there is a subtle hypodensity in the base of the celiac artery, which may represent thrombus, especially when correlated in retrospect with the prior study of three days ago.however, note that evaluation of vascular thrombus is neither sensitive nor specific in this noncontrast examination.
summary: no free air or drainable fluid collection within the abdomen.thickening of the proximal colon (to the hepatic flexure) of unclear clinical significance.possible thrombus within the proximal celiac artery.

text: the small bowels are unremarkable.there are multiple small rounded quasi-radiolucent objects in the sigmoid colon.these likely represent the ingested cocaine packets.the rest of the colon is unremarkable.the bladder is normally distended without any focal abnormality.there is no free air or fluid in the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: multiple cocaine packets in the sigmoid colon.incidental finding of l5 pars defect.the findings of this study have been communicated to the primary team, dr.___ ___, by phone at 4:30 p.m.on the date of the study.

text: there are new small amount of ascites within the pelvis.there is a foley catheter within the bladder, and air within the bladder, likely related to instrumentation.the rectum and sigmoid are normal.the uterus is unchanged in appearance, and may contain fibroids.no pathologically enlarged inguinal lymph nodes.there are rounded hypodensities in the common femoral arteries bilaterally, and the hypodensity within the left common femoral artery extends into the external iliac artery.these hypodensities are consistent with deep venous thromboses.the vessels are not expanded and these may be chronic.there is increased subcutaneous edema within the left proximal thigh.
summary: interim development of innumerable hypodense liver and splenic lesions, consistent with metastases.new trace ascites surrounding the liver and a small amount of pelvic fluid.bilateral common femoral deep venous thromboses.the left dvt extends into the left external iliac artery.largely unchanged osseous metastases.the presence of bilateral common femoral dvts was discussed with dr.___ at 6:15 p.m.on ___.

text: there is a large amount of pneumoperitoneum, suggesting hollow viscus perforation.largest amount of pneumoperitoneum is seen extending anteriorly along the abdomen and pelvis.while the exact location of perforation is not definitive, foci of gas are seen tracking along the right abdomen and pelvis, making perforation involving the right bowel, particularly the right colon, suspect.additionally, there is some subtle irregularity to the wall of the cecum and there is a small amount of free fluid adjacent to the cecum.the ascending colon is distended, measuring up to 8.8 cm in width, and contains large air-fluid level.air-fluid levels are also see in distended transverse and descending colons.foci of gas are also seen tracking along the left upper quadrant (to a lesser extent than in the right abdomen), in the periportal region, right lower quadrant, and in the right pelvis.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is no hydronephrosis.there is mild, nonspecific, bilateral perinephric fat stranding.small amount of perihepatic and perisplenic fluid is seen.0.7 cm nonspecific rounded calcification in the right upper quadrant on series 2, image 30, is nonspecific, and could represent calcified lymph node.
summary: large pneumoperitoneum suggesting hollow viscus perforation without definitive source identified, although foci of gas tracking along the right abdomen and pelvis along with irregularity of the cecum make the right colon/cecum suspect.distended cecum, ascending colon, and transverse colon with large air-fluid levels.small amount of perihepatic and perisplenic fluid.small amount of pelvic free fluid.hypodense right adnexal structure, likely arising from the right ovary, increased in size since the prior ct examination.given that the patient is postmenopausal, findings are of concern and a non-emergent pelvic ultrasound for further evaluation is advised.the above findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ of the surgical team on ___ at 2:00 p.m.

text: there is increased bibasilar atelectasis/consolidation with persistent bilateral effusions, moderate on the left and small on the right.the visualized heart is unremarkable, without pericardial effusion.
summary: pancreatitis, with increased inflammation and focal necrosis in head and tail.no drainable fluid collections.post-laparotomy for abdominal compartment syndrome.no evidence of end-organ ischemia.

text: no free air.there is a subcentimeter hypodensity in the right hepatic lobe which is too small to characterize.remainder of the liver demonstrates homogeneous enhancement without focal lesions.there is a focal area of heterogeneity along the inferior pole of the spleen which was not appreciated on the prior exam.within this region, there is a subcapsular wedge-shaped area with overlying retracted appearance.findings raise the possibility for a subacute splenic infarct.there is significant interval decrease in size of the peripancreatic fluid collections.the largest fluid collection now measures 2.3 x 3.5 cm.there is an additional smaller fluid collection at the level of the ligament of treitz measuring 1.2 x 1.0 cm (series 2, image 29).improving peripancreatic stranding is again seen, compatible with improving pancreatitis.normal-caliber pancreatic duct.kidneys demonstrate symmetric enhancement and excretion without hydronephrosis.adrenal glands are normal without nodularity.gallbladder is well distended without stones.enteric contrast reaches the splenic flexure.visible bowel loops are of normal caliber.the abdominal aorta is normal caliber.celiac trunk, sma, and renal arteries are of normal caliber and patent.the splenic vein is attenuated at the level of the pancreatic tail with large consequent collateral vessels.stable abdominal lymphadenopathy.
summary: improving pancreatitis with interval reduction in the size of peripancreatic fluid collections, although now with continued attenuation of the splenic vein, and new subacute splenic infarcts.normal-caliber bowel loops.tiny right hepatic lobe hypodensity most compatible with a cyst.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis with small trace pleural effusions, right greater than left.visualized portion of the heart and pericardium appears unremarkable.dobbhoff tube is coiled in the stomach with the tip ending in the body of the stomach.a linear radiodense foreign body measuring approximately 1.8 cm (4:35) is seen within the gastric body.a recent chest radiograph from ___ does not demonstrate this object, likely not included; however, prior chest radiographs demonstrate a similar-appearing radiodense foreign body; recommended clinical correlation with prior surgeries.the right adrenal gland is normal.the left adrenal gland appears bulky with a 12-mm nodule (7:19) , which is not completely characterized in this single phase study.both kidneys show symmetric opacification and excretion of contrast.the liver, spleen and pancreas are unremarkable.the liver demonstrates normal enhancement without focal lesions.a 13-mm gallstone is present within a non-distended gall bladder.minimal amount of pericholecystic fluid and perihepatic fluid is seen.the patient is status post extensive bowel surgery including remote total left colectomy, recent sigmoid colectomy with redo-ileocolonic anastomosis and a diverting ileostomy.the small bowel loops are unremarkable without evidence of bowel wall thickening or obstruction.there is normal flow of contrast through the bowel, exiting the right lower quadrant ileostomy.the visualized portion of the large bowel is unremarkable, with surgical sutures noted in the region of the sigmoid colon .the abdominal aorta is normal in course and caliber.multiple small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen, but not enlarged to ct limits of significant lymphadenopathy.a prominent periportal lymph node is seen measuring up to 13 mm.minimal amount of free fluid is seen layering in the pelvis and the right paracolic gutters.there is associated fat stranding within the pelvis which is nonspecific.no drainable intra-abdominal fluid collections are seen.in the anterior abdominal wall at the level of the umbilicus, multiple tiny air pockets are seen (4:51, 4:52).additionally some hyperdense material is seen inferiorly along the incision site.small bowel loops are seen closely opposed to this region, however no definite enterocutaneous fistula is identified in this study.there is no intra-abdominal free air.
summary: in this patient status post sigmoidectomy complicated by anastomotic leak requiring re-anastomosis and diverting ileostomy, no drainable intra-abdominal fluid collections are seen in the current study.multiple pockets of air are seen in the anterior abdominal wall at the site of incision at the level of the umbilicus, with some hyperdense material seen in the scar just inferior to this level.few small bowel loops are closely opposed to this scar, but no definite enterocutaneous fistula is identified at this time.a linear metallic density is seen within the body of the stomach, likely represents intragastric foreign body and has been demonstrated in multiple prior chest radiographs.recommended correlation with prior surgery.small amount of ascites in the pelvis and in the perihepatic and pericholecystic regions.a 13-mm left adrenal nodule.not completely characterized in this single phase imaging study.if the patient does not have a prior history of malignancy, a followup mri can be performed in six months for better characterization.the findings were discussed with dr.___ at 6:40 p.m.on ___.

text: there is dilatation of the small bowel up to the level of the stoma.patient is status post ileostomy.there is parastomal herniation of small bowel loops.some fluid is also visualized in the stoma.the large bowel is collapsed.multiple sigmoid diverticula are visualized without evidence of diverticulitis.there is no free air.a small amount of free fluid is present in the abdomen and pelvis.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions in the osseous structures.
summary: status post ileostomy with small-bowel obstruction at the stoma secondary to parastomal small bowel hernia.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.a 2-cm cystic area in the upper thoracic spine in the midline and subcutaneous tissue.this could represent a sebaceous cyst.direct visualization and clinical correlation is recommended.small right-sided pleural effusion.small amount of free fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.results discussed with dr.___.

text: 1.1-cm cyst is noted at the hepatic dome.the gallbladder is partially collapsed.the pancreas is atrophic.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation.the spleen is normal in size, with scattered coarse calcifications that may represent prior granulomatous disease.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys are slightly atrophic, with cortical thinning and lobulation.3-mm calcification is noted in the left interpolar cortex.bilateral hypodensities are too small to characterize, but likely represent cysts.the stomach and visualized loops of small bowel are unremarkable.coarse calcifications are noted throughout the abdominal aorta, with mild stenosis of the celiac, sma, bilateral renal artery, and ___ origins.the bones are diffusely demineralized.there is mild thoracolumbar levoscoliosis and multilevel degenerative changes.there is an age-indeterminate compression deformity of t8, with approximately 30% loss of height.there is no significant retropulsion into the spinal canal.moderate posterior disc-osteophyte complex is present at l4-l5, with abutment of the thecal sac outline.moderate facet hypertrophy and ligamentum flavum thickening are also present at this level.there is moderate fatty atrophy of the paraspinal and thoracoabdominal wall musculature.
summary: large fat-containing ventral abdominal hernia that tracks superiorly into a postoperative sternal defect, resulting in moderate compression of the anterior mediastinum.___ hernia of mid-transverse colon, without distal bowel obstruction.tracheobronchoplasty, with widely patent airways.multinodular goiter.age-indeterminate t8 compression deformity.atherosclerosis, with mild branch vessel stenoses.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate extensive bibasilar emphysema.a 3-mm nodule (102:4) and a 3.5-mm nodule (102:7) in the right middle lobe are unchanged.moderate to severe emphysema is partly visualized.pacing wires are present in the heart.an ng tube is present in the esophagus.the stomach is distended with an ng tube within the stomach.the spleen again demonstrates a 6 mm non-specific hypoattenuating focus that is unchanged.the adrenals are normal.several low-attenuation lesions are present within the liver that appear unchanged.a low-attenuation lesion, compatible with a cyst is present within the right renal hilum.the left kidney appears unchanged.no hydronephrosis is present.the abdominal aorta and its branches appear patent.the pancreas is somewhat atrophic but otherwise normal.no free air, free fluid or significant adenopathy is present.there is marked dilation of loops of bowel extending into a transition point in the lower anterior abdomen (300b:16) near the patient's neobladder.there is fecalization of small bowel contents proximal to the transition point.this location is similar to the prior study.trace interloop fluid is present.no perforation is evident.bowel loops are dilated up to 5.4 cm.
summary: findings suggesting small-bowel obstruction with dilated loops of small bowel with transition point in the region of the patient's neobladder, similar to the prior examination.interloop fluid is present, but no perforation.severe unchanged scoliosis.unchanged appearance to patient's neobladder.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands appear normal.simple cyst lower pole right kidney.the small bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: no significant change in ___ type a aortic dissection with fenestration of the ascending aortic component and repair of the aortic root.again all great vessels and mesenteric and renal arteries arise from the true lumen.the dissection is stable in length terminating at the aortic bifurcation with no extension into the iliac vessels.status post right inguinal hernia repair with post-surgical change and small amount of fluid in the right inguinal canal but no recurrent hernia of small bowel loops.diverticulosis.stable 1-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule for two years.

text: a small amount of free fluid is noted within the pelvis.patient's neobladder demonstrates no short interval change with a suprapubic foley catheter present and a small amount of intravesicular air.there is diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: diffusely dilated small bowel, overall decreased in caliber compared to a day prior with contrast present throughout the small bowel and colon, suggesting partial obstruction.there is no free air.moderate free fluid is seen as described.persistent retained contrast within a dilated right renal collecting system extending down to the neobladder.multiple small bilateral hypoattenuating renal lesions are too small to fully characterize.bilateral right greater than left pleural effusions and collapse of the right lower lobe.pelvic soft tissue ulceration and osseous deformity as described.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.anasarca.

text: no free intraperitoneal free air or fluid is demonstrated.the liver does not reveal any evidence of focal pathology.the gallbladder is not distended.pancreas, spleen, adrenals and kidneys are unremarkable.a large hiatal hernia is seen containing stomach and mesenteric fat.no evidence of proximal small bowel dilatation is seen.sagittal reformatted images demonstrate compressed fracture of l2 which is new in comparison to the previous ct from ___.no prevertebral hematoma or other findings suggesting the acute character of this fracture is seen, also no significant sclerosis which may suggest the chronic character of the fracture is present.ct of the pelvis after injecting of iv contrast.the bladder is catheterized and almost empty.no significant pathology of the seminal vesicles and prostate is seen.no evidence of small or large bowel dilatation is present.multiple diverticula are seen in the sigmoid with no evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: wedge-compression fracture of l2.clinical correlation is recommended for evaluation of acute or chronic character of this fracture.no evidence of free intraperitoneal air or fluid.no evidence of bowel obstruction.large hiatal hernia.

text: dependent atelectasis is mild.coronary artery calcifications are incompletely imaged.the heart appears mildly enlarged.a clip is seen anterior to the heart, near the base.the liver, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.large gallstones are noted.there is contrast retention in both renal cortices and collecting systems.focal cortical thinning in the right interpolar region is compatible with scar.calcification of the abdominal aorta, splenic and common iliac arteries is extensive, without aneurysm.there is no free fluid, bowel dilatation, pathologic lymph node enlargement or retroperitoneal hematoma in the abdomen or pelvis.soft tissue stranding anteriorly may be related to injections.
summary: left groin subcutaneous hematoma, without evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.retained renal contrast is compatible with acute tubular necrosis.cholelithiasis.colonic diverticulosis, without additional findings to suggest diverticulitis.these findings were conveyed to ___ ___ by ___ ___ at approximately 12 p.m.on ___.

text: anastomotic sutures at the rectosigmoid junction appear intact.there are two apparent regions of narrowing involving the sigmoid colon; one of which is located at the anastomotic site and the other more proximally in the left lower quadrant(2:42) near the distal descending colon.it is unclear whether these findings are fixed or transient.no focal mass is identified.contrast to the rectum without evidence of obstruction.the bladder is normal.there is pelvic ascites.
summary: two apparent foci of narrowing involving the sigmoid colon, one of which is located at the rectosigmoid anastomsis and the other in the more proximal sigmoid colon.while these findings could represent transient narrowing, a fixed stricture is not excluded.no evidence of discrete mass or bowel obstruction.non- healed fracture involving the anterior and posterior columns of the right acetabulum.mild callus formation about the right inferior pubic ramus fracture.increased trabeculation of the left iliac bone which may represent paget's.bilateral pleural effusions and adjacent atelectasis.ascites and body wall anasarca.8-mm hypodensity in the pancreas for which further evaluation with mri is recommended.

text: there is no free pelvic fluid or deep pelvic lymphadenopathy.the rectum, prostate, sigmoid colon and bladder are unremarkable.a foley catheter is noted.air is noted within the bladder likely due to recent catheterization.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of acute intraabdominal injury.multiple gallstones, without evidence of cholecystitis.mild stranding around the pancreas, which could represent subacute pancreatitis, clinical correlation is recommended.porto-renal shunt with large collateral vessels.

text: there is mild dependent bibasilar atelectasis, and a trace amount of bilateral pleural fluid, unchanged from previous exams.the appearance of the liver, including multiple hemangiomas is not significantly changed from ___.pneumobilia in the left lobe of the liver has slightly increased, and there is a small amount of gas in the main pancreatic duct, presumably related to recent ercp.biliary stent is seen extending from the common hepatic duct into the duodenum.appearance of the pancreas is unchanged, except to note gas within the main pancreatic duct as described above.evaluation of the portal vein is slightly limited by timing of the contrast bolus, but as before, the intrahepatic portions appear patent.the extrahepatic portal vein remains narrowed or possibly occluded, and multiple large collaterals, or areas of cavernous transformation are seen in the peripancreatic area and retroperitoneum, communicating with the superior mesenteric vein.atrophy in the region of the neck and body of the pancreas is stable, in the region of prior pseudocyst formation.there remains a mild amount of peripancreatic fluid surrounding the distal body and tail of the pancreas.the splenic vein remains patent, and spleen is normal.the adrenal glands, and kidneys are unchanged.there is no hydronephrosis.the gallbladder is filled with air and contrast, presumably related to recent ercp.stomach and intra-abdominal loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no free air, free fluid, or abnormal intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy.multiple borderline enlarged peripancreatic lymph nodes are unchanged from previous exam.
summary: no evidence of perforation.increased pneumobilia in the left lobe of the liver, and gas within the main pancreatic duct are presumably related to recent ercp.unchanged appearance of the pancreas, with atrophy of the neck and body, and focal stenosis in the pancreatic duct, with dilated pancreatic duct in the tail of the pancreas, remaining consistent with obstructive pancreatitis.unchanged mild surrounding inflammatory change.common bile duct stent now seen in place, without evidence of complication.diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.unchanged appearance of the extrahepatic portal vein, with high-grade stenosis or occlusion, and prominent collateral venous channels or cavernous transformation.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate mild bibasilar atelectasis without pleural or pericardial effusion.right-sided pleural calcifications are noted which could reflect prior pleurodesis, prior asbestos exposure or changes from prior trauma or infection.small lesion in the dome of the liver measuring 1.4 cm demonstrates some peripheral enhancement, but is incompletely characterized on this single-phase study.no additional focal hepatic lesions are seen with marked intra- and extra-hepatic ductal dilatation.the common bile duct is dilated to 19 mm with multiple filling defects including a heterogeneous lesion with multiple hyper- and hypo-dense foci.the hypodense foci are concerning for air.the gallbladder is distended with trace pericholecystic fluid, best seen on the coronal images, with numerous gallstones noted.no wall thickening or pericholecystic stranding is seen.the pancreas, spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically, with tiny hyperdensities in the upper pole of left kidney, are too small to fully characterized.stomach, small and large bowel is unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.aorta and major branches are patent with small amount of calcified atherosclerotic disease in the aorta.
summary: multiple likely stones within the common bile duct with marked intra- and extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation and gallbladder distention, compatible with choledocholithiasis.irregular attenuation of filling defect in the distal common bile duct could reflect a mixed composition stone versus air from gas-forming organism.less likely etiologies include recent intervention or fistulization with bowel.distended gallbladder with pericholecystic fluid, without wall thickening.hepatic dome lesion could reflect hemangioma but is incompletely characterized.nonurgent ___ with mr ___ ___ ct can be obtained for further ___.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.likely chronic t12 compression fracture.

text: rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.no evidence of pelvic free fluid or pelvic lymphadenopathy.bone windows demonstrate no evidence of lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: no evidence of small bowel obstruction.unremarkable abdominal and pelvic ct.

text: limited images of the lung bases are unremarkable.
summary: post-surgical changes from liver transplant with small amount of fluid in the porta hepatis, stable from the prior exam.no focal fluid collection.persistent splenomegaly and prominent portacaval lymph node, likely reactive.enhancement of the extrahepatic common bile duct in the region of the anastomosis, likely post-surgical.prominent right-sided pelvic lymph nodes of unclear etiology.

text: a large amount of pelvic ascites is noted.there is wall thickening of the rectosigmoid region which could be due to long-term exposure to abdominopelvic ascites.the bladder wall is moderately thickened which could be due to partially collapsed state.evaluation of the remainder of the pelvic structures is grossly limited due to absence of iv contrast and significant ascites.there is generalized anasarca.there are multiple enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes.

text: the lungs are clear.the unopacified liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands are unremarkable.residual contrast is seen within the collecting system bilaterally.the kidneys are within normal limits..
summary: moderate sized right retroperitoneal hematoma extending from the inguinal region up to the base of the right kidney.these findings were discussed with clinical team at the time of review.

text: a nasogastric tube is in place, terminating in the body of the stomach.along the lesser curvature of the stomach, anteriorly, there is a large ulcerating lesion approximately 24 mm at its base, and filled with contrast.a small gas bubble is present in the ulcer crater wall, but there is no evidence of perforation.there is no extravasation of contrast into the lesser sac or peritoneal cavity from this ulceration.unchanged are hypodense lesions in the left lobe of the liver.the gallbladder is distended, but without gallstones and is otherwise unremarkable.the pancreas, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.the patient is post-splenectomy.right renal hypodensity is unchanged.extensive atherosclerotic calcification of renal arteries is stable.there is no free fluid in the abdomen.no mesenteric lymph nodes meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: no evidence of gastric ulcer perforation.large, contrast-filled ulcer crater along the lesser curvature of the stomach.trace free fluid in the pelvis.heterogeneous airspace opacities in the posterior right upper lobe and right lower lobe suggest aspiration.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.likely cysts left lobe liver.

summary: there is no evidence of an intraabdominal abscess or hematoma.there are bibasilar consolidations and pleural effusion, concerning for aspiration pneumonia.

text: the pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.foley catheter is seen within the bladder.there is no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy or pelvic free fluid.
summary: alveolar opacity seen in the medial segment of the right middle lobe that either could represent more confluent atelectasis or a focus of pneumonia.also seen is a pulmonary nodule likely inflamatory in nature.no acute intra-abdominal pathology.gallstones

text: there is evidence of extensive surgical change within the pelvis with multiple surgical clips and formation of a neobladder.there are multiple coiled catheters in place within this neobladder.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.the rectum is unremarkable in appearance.there are no abnormally dilated loops of large or small bowel to suggest obstruction.there is no abnormal wall thickening within the visualized portions of large and small bowel.along the lower anterior abdominal wall there is evidence of surgical change with staples and fat stranding within the superficial soft tissues and pelvic fat.there is a tiny umbilical hernia which contains fat.there is a 6mm herniation of omental fat along the surgical incision.there is diastasis of the rectus sheath.there is evidence of increased soft tissue density adjacent to the left rectus abdominis muscle of decreased attenuation.this finding is suggestive of a possible post surgical change or hematoma.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.there is extensive degenerative change within the lumbar spine.

text: as before, there are partially imaged small to moderate sized bilateral pleural effusions, not significantly changed.a small area of decreased lung parenchymal attenuation in the lingula could be a congenital finding such as lobar emphysema or a small ccam, not significantly changed in appearance.coronary artery calcifications are seen.evaluation of the abdominal contents is limited secondary to lack of intravenous contrast material.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and right kidney are within normal limits.tiny non-obstructing left lower pole renal calculi are noted (301b: 47,44).the left kidney is otherwise within normal limits.there is a moderate sized hiatal hernia.the stomach is otherwise unremarkable.the small bowel demonstrates mild wall thickening likely secondary to third spacing.there is colonic diverticulosis, predominantly within the distal sigmoid colon (2:61), without evidence of active diverticulitis.the colon is unremarkable.large volume ascites is mildly increased compared to prior ct from ___.there is no free air in the abdomen.no pathologically enlarged abdominal lymph nodes are seen.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.marked aortic calcifications and ___-iliac artery calcifications are seen.the takeoff and proximal portion of the superior mesenteric artery are heavily calcified (2:25).as before, there is anasarca.
summary: decreased locules of air adjacent to the sigmoid colon with associated small fluid collection which has mildly decreased in size (although this is difficult to quantify given larges ascites and lack of iv contrast) suggests abscess.given the presence of adjacent sigmoid diverticulosis, the possibility of a contained diverticular perforation should be considered.mild increase in large volume ascites.unchanged small to moderate bilateral pleural effusions.tiny non-obstructing left lower pole renal calculus.moderate hiatal hernia, as before.findings discussed with dr.___ on ___ @ 9:20 am.

text: visualized lung bases show patchy areas of dependent airspace opacity that is heterogeneous.there are a few areas of bronchiectasis in the lower lobes.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.cardiomegaly is unchanged.absence of intravenous contrast limits evaluation of the abdominal parenchymal organs and vasculature.liver is nodular and shrunken, unchanged from prior exam, and consistent with history of cirrhosis.no focal intrahepatic mass or biliary ductal dilatation.there is no ascites.gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and intra-abdominal loops of bowel demonstrate normal non-contrast appearance.there is no free air or free intraperitoneal fluid.there is no abnormal intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy.

text: there is a foley catheter in place within the urinary bladder.the rectum, uterus, and adnexa are within normal limits.bone windows show no evidence suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesion.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.left adrenal lesion.please note that the patient had a left adrenal adenoma described on an mri performed on ___.3.moderate sized pleural effusions (right greater than left).

text: the rectum, bladder are within normal limits.there is diverticulosis, predominantly through the sigmoid colon.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis and mild stranding in the surrounding fat.the endometrial cavity of the uterus appears thickened and heterogeneous, measuring up to 1.5 cm.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is a 2.2 x 1.6 cm simple fluid density structure in the right labial region, which may represent a bartholin cyst.
summary: multiple large right renal/parapelvic cysts causing parenchymal thinning and distortion of the collecting system; however, not significantly changed in appearance since ultrasound of ___, given different modality.findings were also partially imaged on prior chest ct.dilated common bile duct measuring up to 1.2 cm.however, no evidence of cholelithiasis, choledocholithiasis, or mass within the pancreatic head.minimal central intrahepatic biliary dilatation and prominent pancreatic duct within the head measuring up to 4 mm.further evaluation with mrcp/ercp is recommended.distended gallbladder could correspond to early cholecystitis or fasting state.recommend clinical correlation and ultrasound as indicated.heterogeneous endometrium measuring up to 1.5 cm, abnormal in a post-menopausal patient.further evaluation with pelvic ultrasound should be done on a non-emergent basis.sigmoid colon diverticulosis with a small amount of pelvic free fluid and mild surrounding fat stranding, findings whic are concerning for early/mild sigmoid diverticulitis.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 11:30 pm on ___.

text: the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.cholecystectomy clips are noted.there is a subtle 6-mm hypodensity in the interpolar region of the right kidney (2, 37) which appears essentially unchanged when compared to the previous study.it remains too small to characterize.there is moderate-to-severe atheromatous calcification of the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries, without aneurysm.scattered retroperitoneal clips are noted.there is no bowel dilatation, ascites or pathologic lymph node enlargement.in the periumbilical region, at the site of hernia repair, there is a 7.2 x 3.0 cm collection of slightly high attenuation fluid with scattered locules of air which lies predominantly anterior to surgical mesh, although a small portion is identified posterior to the mesh.there is moderate-to-severe stranding of the surrounding subcutaneous fat.this stranding has a slightly rounded appearance along the inferior right aspect of the complex fluid collection.abutting the collection superiorly, there is an approximately 2 x 2 cm collection of high-attenuation fluid and air.it is difficult to determine if this communicates with the larger collection.there is no evidence of intraperitoneal fluid collection.
summary: abscess at the site of ventral hernia repair, with components both anterior and posterior to the surgical mesh.3-mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule, for which no followup is needed in a patient without a known malignancy or increased risk for lung cancer.otherwise, a followup ct is recommended in 12 months.subcentimeter right renal cortical hypodensity, too small to characterize, but possibly representing a small cyst.

text: there is linear scarring at the lung bases.the inflammatory changes in the posterior segment of the right hepatic lobe are improved.there is no drainable collection remaining.there is persistent mild dilatation of the intrahepatic bile ducts, as on the prior study.however, air is no longer present in the superior bile ducts, and the extrahepatic bile duct is now distended up to 13 mm in diameter.these findings suggest dysfunction of the biliary stent.the pancreatic duct is stable in size.the small hypodense lesion in the spleen is without change.a horseshoe kidney is again noted.the ivc filter appears in stable position.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.several colonic diverticula are noted.
summary: continued improvement of inflammatory changes in the right hepatic lobe.increased diameter of cbd and resolution of pneumobilia, suggestion occlusion of the biliary stent which may be the source of the patient's symptoms.

text: lung bases are clear.no pleural or pericardial effusion is seen.staples around the ivc are seen indicating orthotopic liver transplant.the gallbladder is surgically absent.a tube from the gallbladder fossa to the ampulla is identified.a small amount of air in the porta hepatis is identified probably representing air in the cystic duct remnant.small amount of nodularity and stranding along both pericolic gutters is seen.within the limits of this non-iv contrast study, pancreas, stomach and small bowel loops, adrenals, and kidneys are normal.the left kidney has a 5 mm hypodense region in its lower pole corresponding to a low- density region in the previous study; this may represent a hyperdense cyst.a small amount of omental stranding is seen in the anterior abdomen which is stable.no free fluid or free air is identified.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: nodularity in both pericolic gutters is unusual and in an immunocompromised patient, is concerning for processes such as lymphoma or other hematologic process.other possibilities like extramedullary hematopoiesis, or graft vs host disease is less likely.short term follow is recommended.no kidney stone, hydronephrosis, or hydroureter.no bowel obstruction.evidence of liver transplant, with biliary stent in place.the previously seen hypodensity in the region of gallbladder fossa is not well identified on today's study, due to lack of iv contrast.calcified fibroid uterus.dr ___ discussed findings with dr ___ by telephone at time of interpretation.

text: a foley catheter is seen within a partially distended bladder.a large amount of ascites is seen within the abdomen.distal ureters, rectum, sigmoid colon, seminal vesicles are normal.no free air is seen within the pelvis.there are no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.interval development of new ascites throughout the abdomen.trace free intraperitoneal air.bilateral nephrolithiasis.nonspecific wall thickening involving a short segment of distal ileum.cannot entirely exclude underlying bowel ischemia.coronary artery calcifications.

text: a small-caliber rectal probe is in place.in the mid-transverse colon, near the hepatic flexure (2:28), there is focal hyperdensity of the posterior wall, protruding into the lumen, extending approximately 2 cm.this could represent focal thickening related to peristalsis, particularly as this was not seen on the prior ct.loops of bowel are otherwise unremarkable.the urinary bladder is relatively collapsed around a foley catheter.the uterus is globular and contains multiple low- density regions consistent with fibroids, as previously.the uterine cavity again contains a small amount of fluid, suggesting cervical stenosis.adnexa are unremarkable.in the posterior left hemipelvis (2:49), there is a 14 x 9 mm, somewhat irregular, low-density structure adjacent to the bifurcation of the left common iliac artery, corresponding to the lobulated high-intensity structure seen on the recent lumbar spine mr.this likely represents lymphangioma or retroperitoneal cyst.this does not represent abscess.
summary: no acute abnormalities in the abdomen or pelvis.moderate amount of uterine cavity fluid within fibroid uterus, suggesting cervical stenosis.this can be further evaluated with pelvic ultrasound.focal thickening of the posterior wall of the transverse colon, spanning approximately 2 cm.this could be related to peristalsis, as this was not seen on the prior ct.recommend correlation with prior colonoscopy.multilobulated cystic lesion noted on recent l-spine mr corresponds to an irregular, low-density, 14-mm lesion in the posterior left hemipelvis, likely representing tiny lymphangioma or retroperitoneal cyst.no evidence of abscess.fatty liver.enteric tube coiled in the duodenum, looping back upon itself to terminate near the pylorus.stable 13 mm right adrenal nodule, again most likely adenoma.

text: there is a moderate amount of free fluid layering within the pelvis.the bladder, distal ureters, prostate and seminal vesicles appear unremarkable.the sigmoid colon is distended with gas and a small amount of stool.
summary: diffuse dilation of the colon containing gas and fecal material, and prominence of the distal small bowel which is fecalized.the findings are nonspecific and are not felt to indicate small-bowel obstruction.patency of the vessels is not evaluated due to lack of intravenous contrast.venoocclusive disease in a patient with history of gvhd should be considered.new moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites.hyperdensity of the liver and spleen likely correlating with hemosiderosis previously demonstrated at mri.stable appearance of 2-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule from ___ ___.results called to the ed resident caring for the patient at the time of interpretation (3:40 p.m.).

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, intrapelvic loops of small bowel, bladder, distal ureters, and prostate are normal.a foley catheter is seen within a decompressed bladder.trace intrapelvic free fluid is evident.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are identified.
summary: moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions unchanged.diffuse bilateral nodular opacities are seen within the lungs; given history of endocarditis this finding is concerning for septic emboli.the cecum demonstrates mild bowel wall thickening concerning for an infectious or inflammatory process.low-density retroperitoneal lymph node as described above is unchanged from ___.

text: the lung bases are clear.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the liver, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is extensive mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy again identified, similar in appearance.for example, there is a left paraaortic lymph node measuring 1.6 x 2.7 cm (2, 43).a 3.1 x 1.2 cm porta hepatis node is also identified (2, 30).the right kidney is unremarkable.the left kidney demonstrates lower pole renal calculi, although this is difficult to evaluate given presence of contrast.there is likely one or two left upj stones with mild to moderate hydronephrosis on the left and left perinephric fat stranding.patient's left- sided ureteral stent has been removed.there is left sided ureteral thickening.small bowel loops are normal in caliber and without focal wall thickening.there is no free fluid or free air.
