text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions, worse when compared to prior exam.bilateral lower lobe areas of atelectasis or consolidation are identified.hazy ground-glass opacity within the right middle lobe is unchanged.there is no pericardial effusion noted.a post-pyloric feeding tube is identified terminating within the third portion of the duodenum.the spleen, liver, gallbladder, adrenal glands, pancreas, and kidneys are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.there is no free air identified.there is diffuse anasarca in the subcutaneous soft tissues.an open midline abdominal wall defect is again noted (2, 39).there has been interval removal of the intra-abdominal drain.multiple areas of small amount of loculated fluid are identified throughout the abdomen and pelvis, with avidly enhancing surrounding peritoneum which is increased when compared to prior exam.this is concerning for worsening peritenonitis.the amount of fluid is not significantly changed.there is no evidence of obstruction.contrast is seen within the small and large bowel.however, multiple loops of small and large bowel appear to demonstrate bowel wall edema and thickening with adjacent fat stranding likely due to secondary inflammation from peritonitis.for example, there is a small bowel loop (2, 53) which demonstrates marked asymmetric wall edema.diffuse mesenteric fat stranding is worse when compared to prior exam.multiple mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes have increased in size, likely reactive.for example, there is a left paraaortic lymph node measuring 1.2 cm (2, 37).
summary: worsening appearance of peritonitis with increased enhancement of peritoneal lining.no significant change in the amount of intra-abdominal and intra-pelvic fluid collections, none of which appear to be drainable.multiple loops of small and large bowel which appear to be inflamed likely secondary to the intra-abdominal process.multiple mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes, likely reactive.no evidence of bowel obstruction.cystic left adnexal lesion.pelvic ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation.bilateral lower lobe opacities, which may represent atelectasis versus consolidation.interval increase in small bilateral pleural effusions.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ via telephone at time of review.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis, right slightly greater than left.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.a nodular contour to the liver is consistent with patient's known cirrhosis.the left lobe of the liver remains atrophic.extensive varices and splenomegaly remain unchanged and are consistent with portal hypertension.a small amount of ascites is present, decreased in amount since the ___ study.two gastric tubes are noted ending within the stomach.the stomach, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, and gallbladder are within normal limits.oral contrast has progressed to the sigmoid colon and rectum.there are areas of mild thickening and hyperenhancement of the peritoneum, most prominent in the right paracolic gutter, although this is similar in appearance to the ___ study.however, there is a fluid collection with rim enhancement anterior to and interposed among the anterior left-sided loops of small bowel.the fluid within this collection is higher in density, measuring up to 31 hounsfield units, than the surrounding ascites.it is in continuity with the incision overlying the left abdomen and small portions of it may still be in continuity with low density ascites.accurate measurements are difficult as this is a thin, curvilinear structure.the largest dimensions are 6.1 cm (cc) x 0.8 cm (ap) x 12.3 cm (transverse) (602b:69 and 2:44).there is no air or high-density oral contrast within this collection to suggest leakage from bowel injury.there is no free air within the abdomen.there is no oral contrast outside of the bowel to suggest bowel leak.multiple small calcified gallstones are noted within the gallbladder.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes are unchanged since the prior study and likely reactive in nature.
summary: progressive loculation of thin, curvilinear rim-enhancing fluid collection in continuity with the incision site which is located anterior to small bowel loops in the left abdomen, unlikely large enough for drain placement at this point.there is no air or high-density oral contrast within this collection to suggest that the source is definitely bowel in origin although the possibility is not entirely excluded.portions of this collection still appear to be in continuity with the simple fluid density ascites but there is apparently developing loculation.likely also progressive loculation of fluid at the inferior tip of the liver with peritoneal enhancement, unchanged in size.portions of this collection are also probably in continuity with the surrounding ascites.cirrhosis and extensive varices and splenomegaly consistent with portal hypertension, unchanged since the prior study.moderate ascites with peritoneal enhancement which may suggest widespread inflammation, although ascites appears decreased slightly.right-sided inguinal hernia containing small bowel with no evidence of obstruction.large right-sided hydrocele and a tiny left-sided hydrocele.mild wedge compression fracture of vertebral bodies t9 and t12, unchanged since the prior study.

text: the rectum is unremarkable.moderate sigmoid diverticulosis is unchanged, without evidence of diverticulitis.pelvic loops of bowel show some dilated loops of small bowel as described above.there is a fluid collection within the soft tissues of the left hip deep to surgical staples, measuring roughly 3.5 x 1.9 x 8 cm.there is no free pelvic fluid or abnormal pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: bilateral airspace opacities, particularly prominent in the dependent portions of the lower lobes bilaterally, likely representing pneumonia.alternatively, some of these areas may represent evolution of pulmonary contusion given the patient's recent extensive trauma.likely small-bowel obstruction, with transition point identified in the left lower quadrant.continued evidence of small perisplenic hematoma, without evidence of splenic parenchymal injury.fluid collection overlying the left hip, with a thin enhancing rim.although this most likely represents postoperative seroma, superinfection cannot be excluded by ct.diverticulosis, without evidence of diverticulitis.status post repair of complex left acetabular fracture with long malleable plate and screws.unchanged appearance of multiple other fractures.above findings called to dr.___ ___ at approximately 3:00 p.m.on ___.

text: bilateral small simple pleural effusions are larger since the prior study.associated bibasal dependent atelectasis is seen.no suspicious pulmonary nodules are seen.there is no pericardial effusion.the liver enhances homogeneously, without focal lesions.again seen is portal vein thrombosis extending from the main portal vein into the left main portal vein and the branches of the left main portal vein, similar in extent to the prior study.the right anterior and posterior portal vein branches are patent.the hepatic veins are patent.multiple gallstones are seen within a contracted gallbladder.a diaphragmatic lymph node measuring 7 mm (2:12) is unchanged.the adrenal glands, spleen, and pancreas are normal.both kidneys enhance symmetrically with contrast.no hydronephrosis is seen.the stomach, small and large bowel are normal in appearance.again seen is a moderate amount of ascites throughout the abdomen, slightly increased since the prior study.multifocal areas of omental thickening and peritoneal enhancement is stable.a focal fluid collection is seen adjacent to the inferior margin of the liver.the abdominal aorta is normal in course and caliber.moderate calcification is seen at the celiac axis origin.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is seen.
summary: in comparison to the earlier study of ___, there is moderate increase in the intra-abdominal ascites.stable omental nodularity suggestive of omental metastasis.stable portal vein thrombosis involving the main and left portal veins.interval increase in bilateral small pleural effusions and dependent atelectasis.cholelithiasis and sigmoid diverticulosis.

text: in the non-contrast images thyroid gland demonstrates normal size.there is heavy atherosclerotic calcification of the thoracic aorta, coronary arteries and cardiac valves.evidence of prior cabg is noted.there are moderate-to-large size bilateral pleural effusions.atherosclerotic calcification is seen extending into the abdominal aorta, mesenteric vessels and iliac vessels.there is no evidence of high-attenuation fluid within the retroperitoneum or abdomen and pelvis to suggest hematoma.the liver is hyperattenuating compared to spleen, which may be related to transfusion or amiodarone administration.there is hyperattenuating fluid within the gallbladder, likely from vicarious excretion.non dependendt gas within the urinary bladder wall is seen, likely represents emphysematous cystitis.there are multiple clips along the pelvic wall, liekly post lymph node dissection.right femoral approach intraaortic baloon pump is seen with distal metal tip, approximately 10 cm from the origin of the subclabian arteries.postcontrast study: within the chest there is no evidence of axillary, supraclavicular or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the aorta is well opacified, with no gross evidence of dissection or aneurysmal dilatation.the main pulmonary artery and central branches are without evidence of filling defect, to suggest embolism.left ventricle wall is hypertrophied with no large pericardial effusion.there are large pleural effusions.within the lungs, again seen emphysematous changes, with no large focal nodularities, bibasilar passive atelectasis is noted.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma or gross evidence of aortic dissection, post- intra-aortic pump balloon placement.tip of the intraaortic balloon is approximately 10 cm distal to the left subclavian origin.large bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis and emphysematous changes, slightly larger than on the recent chest ct.gas within the nondependent portion of the urinary bladder which may represent emphysematous cystitis.healing right-sided rib fractures seen on the prior study as well.no evidence of inguinal hematoma.

text: the study is limited due to the absence of intravenous contrast material.the percutaneous drain located in the segment iii of the liver on the prior study has been removed in the interval.surgical clips are again seen in the hilum in this patient who is status post liver transplant.patient is status post splenectomy.a small right subphrenic fluid collection, likely hematoma is again seen.there is a small amount of air in the porta hepatis within this fluid collection, somewhat decreased from the prior study.note is again made of a bulky pancreas with prominent pancreatic duct and pancreatic parenchymal calcifications.these findings would be consistent with chronic pancreatitis.thickening of the antrum of the stomach is again noted.no new abdominal fluid collections are seen.small and large bowel appear normal in caliber.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions which have increased in size.continue to be patchy areas of consolidation at the bilateral lung bases.at the right lung base there are several nodular areas which demonstrate natural cavitation.there is now evidence of cavitations in several of the nodular densities previously thought to be septic emboli.again is noted a pericardial effusion which has not changed from the study.the heart is otherwise unremarkable.again are noted cysts within the left kidney which are unchanged in appearance.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenals and kidneys are otherwise unremarkable in appearance.small bowel is unremarkable in appearance.a percutaneous gastric tube is present.the large bowel is opacified with contrast and is not dilated.there is no free air within the abdomen.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes within the abdomen.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate slight interval increase in size of pulmonary metastases.a lesion of the lingula now measures 14 mm, previously 11 mm.a lesion of the right middle lobe now measures 15 mm, previously 12 mm.the overall number of pulmonary metastases at the bases is similar to the prior study.there remain bilateral pleural effusions, moderate on the left and small on the right, with associated compressive atelectasis of the base of both lower lobes.a nasogastric tube terminates in the duodenum.the stomach is not well distended limiting evaluation, but again demonstrated is irregular wall thickening consistent with neoplasm.there has been significant worsening in metastatic burden of the liver with now innumerable metastatic deposits present.the largest is of the dome and measures 5.2 cm.there is no biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is essentially unremarkable.there has been no change in a 5-mm hypodense focus of the distal pancreatic body.there are a few enlarged necrotic appearing lymph nodes of the gastrohepatic ligament measuring up to 17 mm.there is a new small to moderate amount of ascites throughout the abdomen which tracks into the pelvis.the spleen, left kidney, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.there is a small subcentimeter hypodense focus of the upper pole of the right kidney, which is likely a cyst.small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is free passage of oral contrast through to the rectum.
summary: 1 progression of disease evidenced by significant increase in metastatic burden of the liver, and slight increase in size of pulmonary nodules.evaluation of the stomach limited by lack of distention.2.nonocclusive thrombus extends from the right common femoral vein through the external and common iliac veins to the ivc filter.slight extension of thrombus above the filter is considered a risk for embolism.a small amount of nonocclusive thrombus is also present in the left common femoral vein.3.ascites.4.bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis of the lower lobes.

summary: bilateral pleural effusion and adjacent atelectasis/consolidation.right small bowel-containing spigelian hernia.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.diffuse atherosclerotic disease involving the aorta and branch vessels.again note is made of narrowing of the celiac artery origin, unchanged from ___.mild bladder wall thickening.while this finding may be related to underdistension, it would be difficult to exclude cystitis.small amount of gas is also noted in the bladder lumen, which may be related to recent catheterization.please correlate clinically.fracture of the sacral tip.new since prior ct from ___.small pericardial effusion.

text: the caliber and appearance of the intrapelvic loops of bowel has not changed.again, there is a high-grade obstruction noted, seen best on series 2, image 68.oral contrast has slightly progressed through the bowel, but has not passed the transition point.again, seen is the right-sided colostomy.additionally, the bilateral ureters appear to anastomose with a loop of bowel that is then diverted to the left anterior abdominal wall.contrast from the ureters is seen to opacify this neobladder.again, there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.gas and stool are seen within the distal bowel, however.the previously administered oral contrast has not yet advanced to this point.the patient is status post prostate, bladder and rectal resection.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.there is no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes identified.

text: again seen are moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.there are coronary artery and aortic calcifications.within the abdomen, the patient is status post right colectomy with ileocolic anastomosis.a gastric tube is in place.oral contrast is seen throughout the small bowel though is diluted within the colon.at the region of the blind end of the transverse colon, locules of air are seen (3:60), similar to the prior examination.additionally, locule of air is noted in the anterior abdominal wall.there is surrounding inflammation and fat stranding.no focal fluid collection is seen.there is diffuse anasarca.the bowel itself appears nondilated, and no evidence of obstruction is seen.no extraluminal oral contrast is identified, though the contrast is predominantly within small bowel.there is diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon.the non-iv contrast appearance of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands is unremarkable.there is fatty infiltration of the pancreas.the gallbladder is collapsed and contains several calcified stones.the right kidney contains a 4.3 x 3.9 cm hypodensity most compatible with a simple cyst.the left kidney is grossly unremarkable.there are extensive vascular calcifications.the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.no free air is seen.a trace amount of free fluid is present.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen.there are multilevel degenerative changes, including grade 1 anterolisthesis of l4 on l5, multilevel osteophyte formation and ossification of the anterior longitudinal ligament.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesion is seen.
summary: no extraluminal oral contrast identified though majority of contrast is still within small bowel and has not passed the anastomosis.if indicated, delayed examination may be performed to allow time for contrast to reach the large bowel.locules of air in the anterior abdomen with surrounding inflammatory stranding and fluid could indicate residual postoperative changes and inflammation.bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis as previously seen.findings discussed with dr.___ at 9:10am ___.

text: there is a moderate sized right-sided pleural effusion with moderate atelectasis.moderate left atelectasis is also noted.a dual chamber pacer is visualized.there is a large right sided retroperitoneal hematoma.it measures 15 x 16 cm in it's widest axial dimension.there is significant anterior displacement of the right kidney.hematocrit effect is present.the hematoma extends from the subhepatic region down into the pelvis with mass effect on the urinary bladder.also seen is hemorrhage into the right rectus muscle which measures 4 cm anterio- posteriorly.the adjacent left rectus muscle measures 1.4 cm at the same level.there is extensive subcutaneous soft tissue stranding.tiny gallstone is visualized.the gallbladder is otherwise unremarkable.the spleen, pancreas, adrenals are normal.the right kidney is displaced anteriorly due to the large right posterior pararenal hematoma.the left kidney is unremarkable.the abdominal loops of small and large bowel appears grossly normal.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.aortic calcification is noted.
summary: large right retroperitoneal hematoma extending from the right posterior pararenal space down into the pelvis.hemorrhage into the right rectus muscle is also noted.

text: there is stable post-surgical appearance of the right hepatic lobectomy and cholecystectomy.there is no evidence of local recurrence in the surgical bed.the remaining left hepatic lobe is normal in appearance without focal lesions.the portal vein remains widely patent.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys are normal.the stomach, duodenum, and the visualized loops of small bowels and colon are unremarkable.there is no free air or fluid in the intra- abdominal cavity.there is no lymphadenopathy.

text: there is new marked wall thickening of the sigmoid and descending and transverse colon.there is no evidence of obstruction.the bladder is unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: large anterior abdominal air and fluid collection, which demonstrates mild rim enhancement.this collection now extends inferiorly into the left inguinal region as well as across the midline into the fat-containing abdominal wall hernia.interval increase in abdominal and pelvic free fluid.transverse, descending, and sigmoid colonic wall thickening.while this could be seen in the setting of third spacing, given its distribution, colitis (infectious, inflammatory, or ischemic) is a strong possibility.density within the right lower lobe segmental bronchus.while this may represent mucus, in the absence of iv contrast, an underlying endobronchial lesion cannot be excluded.repeat followup examination to exclude underlying lesion is recommended.bilateral ground-glass opacities, which may represent atelectasis, infection, or aspiration.extensive vascular calcifications.diffuse anasarca.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 4:30 p.m.and 5:10 p.m.via telephone.

text: the bladder is unremarkable.multiple diverticula are noted in the sigmoid colon.the small bowel is normal.there is no free fluid and no pelvic lymphadenopathy is noted.on bone windows, there are multiple small sclerotic foci throughout the spine.these are not significantly changed.

text: there is no interval change in the appearance of a small, left pleural effusion.the lung bases are, othewise, clear.there is evidence of flow within the hepatic artery, and the portal vein and hepatic veins are patent.there is no evidence of biliary ductal dilatation.the liver enhances homogeneously as before.there is no significant intraabdominal fluid.in the interval since the prior study, the peripancreatic drain has been removed.there is no evidence of residual, peripancreatic fluid collection.multiple, wedge-shaped areas of low attenuation within the spleen are unchanged and consistent with infarcts.also, calcified granulomas are again noted in the spleen.the previously described small, walled-off collection in the left anterior abdomen appears smaller, and there is no high attenuation rim as seen previously.pancreatic ductal dilatation is again seen.the pancreas enhances uniformly, otherwise.both kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast symmetrically.multiple stones are again seen within the right kidney.there is no free air within the abdomen.the small bowel loops are not contrast opacified but are nondilated.there is a large amount of stool within the colon and rectum.ct pelvis w&w/o intraveneous contrast:
summary: no new fluid collections and interval decrease in size of a small, left anterior intraperitoneal fluid collection.unremarkable transplant liver.interval removal of peripancreatic drain with no fluid collections about the pancreas.stable left pleural effusion.stable pancreatic ductal dilatation in the tail of the pancreas and stable infarcts in the spleen.colon and rectum are noted to be full of stool.

text: ct of the abdomen with iv contrast: lung bases demonstrate minimal atelectasis.the heart size is normal.the spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, and stomach are within normal limits.the patient is status post cholecystectomy and roux-en-y hepaticojejunostomy.mild pneumobilia is again noted.otherwise, the liver is normal in appearance.no enhancing tissue is detected at the anastomosis.a 5-mm non-obstructing stone is noted within the left kidney as before.otherwise kidneys are normal in appearance with no evidence of hydronephrosis.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.ivc filter remains in place.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a small amount of fluid and fat stranding surrounding the afferent limb is unchanged since multiple prior studies.there is no free air.
summary: no ct evidence of cholangiocarcinoma recurrence.little change since the previous ct of ___.please note, however, that subtle anastomotic recurrence or ductal recurrence would be better evaluated with mrcp.

text: there is some slight interval increase in size of the right pleural effusion.the lung bases are otherwise unremarkable.there is no apparent change in the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, or kidneys since the prior study.minimal residual contrast is being excreted by the kidneys.there is a small amount of free abdominal fluid, unchanged in volume in the interval.dilatation of the small bowel loops in the region of the jejunum is again noted, although they appear less dilated than on the prior study.contrast is present within the colon and rectum.ng tube is noted within the stomach.
summary: findings consistent with ileus.overall there is slight improvement in small bowel dilatation, although multiple loops remain dilated.there is no transition point, oral contrast reaches the rectum.small amount of ascites, unchanged.

text: the liver appears shrunken with a slightly nodular contour suggesting underlying cirrhosis.clinical correlation is advised.no focal lesions are seen within the liver on this unenhanced ct scan.calcific density layering dependently in the gallbladder is compatible with stones.there is no biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen appears unremarkable.adrenal glands are normal in configuration bilaterally.the pancreas is somewhat atrophic.kidneys demonstrate no hydronephrosis or evidence of nephrolithiasis.linear calcific densities along the hilum bilaterally are compatible with atherosclerotic calcification along the renal arterial branches.there is an atrophic appearance of the left kidney.extensive atherosclerosis along the abdominal aorta and major branch vessels is noted with ectasia of the infrarenal abdominal aorta measuring up to 3.4 x 3.4 cm.the upper abdominal aorta is ectatic measuring 3.7 cm at the level of the diaphragm.there is no free air, free fluid, or lymphadenopathy.the stomach and duodenum appear unremarkable.
summary: no acute findings in the abdomen or pelvis to account for patient's acute abdominal pain.shrunken and nodular appearance of the liver.clinical correlation for underlying cirrhosis is advised.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.atrophic left kidney.ectatic segments of the abdominal aorta as described above measuring up to 3.4 cm in the infrarenal segment and 3.7 cm at the level of the diaphragm.normal appendix.cardiomegaly.l4 spondylolysis with grade 1 anterolisthesis and l4-5 vertebral body fusion.sesha

text: the imaged portions of the lung bases are notable for bilateral subsegmental atelectasis and the imaged portion of the heart is unremarkable.small surgical clip is seen adjacent to the distal esophagus, which is otherwise unremarkable.the stomach, duodenum, spleen, adrenal glands are unremarkable.note is made of cholelithiasis with equivocal, unchanged gallbladder wall thickening.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast in a symmetric fashion and are notable for numerous bilateral hypodensities, the majority of which are too small to characterize, likely cysts and unchanged from the previous studies.there is no evidence of nephrolithiasis.a tiny hypodensity in the right lobe of the liver is unchanged and too small to characterize.an isodense, 2.4 x 1.3 cm lesion in the tail of the pancreas appears to have increased slightly from the comparison study.as before, note is made of an aortobiiliac stent graft, which is patent.there is no evidence of vascular filling of the surrounding descending aortic aneurysm.there is no free gas or free fluid in the abdomen.there is a fat-containing umbilical hernia.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.small surgical clips are seen in the mesentery anteriorly.
summary: no evidence of urolithiasis.enlarged prostate.correlate with psa.mildly increased size of a pancreatic tail lesion, which is not further characterized.this could be further characterized via mrcp if clinically indicated.scattered renal hypodensities, some of which are too small to characterize, most likely cysts.cholelithiasis.minimal gallbladder wall thickening appears unchanged from previous studies.diverticulosis.

text: the visualized lung bases again demonstrate bilateral small-to-moderate pleural effusions with pleural thickening and adjacent airspace atelectasis.however, more focal opacities are again noted at the lung bases and suggestive of a consolidation.the heart is incompletely evaluated but there a prosthetic aortic valve is noted along with moderate cardiomegaly.known small anterior midline mediastinal collection is again noted and appears stable but incompletely assessed.evaluation of the abdominal structures is limited due to lack of intravenous contrast.again visualized is a moderate amount of free fluid consistent with ascites, stable to minimally increased in comparison to prior study.stable amount of bilateral perinephric stranding is again noted.there is mild prominence of the wall of the descending colon from the level of the splenic flexure to the sigmoid colon.while these findings are likely due to underdistention and ascites, colitis cannot be excluded.high density material is again noted at the gastric fundus.a subcentimeter right hepatic lobe hypodensity is again noted and stable but too small to characterize.otherwise, within the limitations of this noncontrast scan, the liver, gallbladder, stomach, spleen, pancreas, stomach, and remainder of the visualized loops of small and large bowel are normal.multiple prominent retroperitoneal lymph nodes are again visualized and likely reactive in nature.there is no free air in the abdomen.
summary: suboptimal study due to the lack of intravenous contrast.overall, little change is noted in comparison to the prior study from ___ with moderate amount of free fluid consistent with ascites, stable to minimally increased in comparison to prior study.bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent airspace atelectasis.however, more focal opacities are noted at bilateral lung bases and may represent pneumonia, though not significantly changed.there is mild prominence of the bowel wall of the descending colon.while these findings are likely due to underdistention and ascites, colitis must be excluded in the proper clinical setting.known anterior mediastinal fluid collection extending to the anterior hemithorax is partially imaged and appears stable.diffuse body anasarca is again noted.

text: there are bilateral moderate-to-large pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.a calcified pericardial lymph node is noted.there is a diffuse moderate amount of intraabdominal ascites, and there is diffuse mesenteric edema, as well as anasarca of the soft tissues.atherosclerotic disease of the abdominal aorta and its major branches is noted.the gallbladder contains a large amount of sludge but is otherwise unremarkable.the liver, spleen, and pancreas are unremarkable.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.the native kidneys are atrophic.there has been interval removal of a large majority of small bowel.several of the enlarged retroperitoneal and mesenteric enlarged lymph node masses are again appreciated.thickening of the stomach wall is again noted, which may be related to edema or invovlvement by lymphoma.the remaining small bowel and large bowel are unremarkable in appearance and there is no evidence of obstruction as contrast reaches the rectum.
summary: no evidence of obstruction or extraluminal leak of contrast at the anastomotic site.contrast reaches the level of the rectum, and bowel loops are normal without evidence of obstruction.interval appearance of peripheral hypodensities in the posterior spleen, which may be related to infarction, or involvement by lymphomatous disease.diffuse intraabdominal ascites and anasarca, increased in the interval.also, bilateral moderate- to- large pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.4.air in the bladder and renal collecting system, probably related to prior foley catheter insertion.however, cystitis is also a consideration.enlarged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.interval removal of pelvic mass.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: again noted is abnormal soft tissue density within the anterior pelvis which is inseparable from adjacent unopacified large bowel.architectural distortion of the bladder is likely postoperative.contrast is noted within the sigmoid colon from the prior ct.there is no free fluid or air within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes are identified.
summary: large left pleural effusion with compressive atelectasis of the visualized left lower lobe.multiple dilated loops of small bowel with distal decompressed loops concerning for high-grade small bowel obstruction.oral contrast passes through the proximal jejunum with no contrast seen entering the diverting ostomy.no evidence of free intraperitoneal air or pneumatosis.stable ct appearance of right-sided hydronephrosis and hyrdoureter.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.the heart size is normal and there is no pericardial effusion.a small hiatal hernia is noted.the liver contour is normal.a 1.5-cm hemangioma in segment vii is again noted.dense calcification seen in segment ivb is unchanged, likely a granuloma (2:16).the gallbladder is normal and there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.a large staghorn calculus is again seen within the left kidney with associated blunting of the upper pole minor calices.again seen are several cortically based hypodensities bilaterally, the largest measuring 2.4 cm on the left, likely cysts, some of which, however, are too small to fully characterize.marked hydronephrosis and proximal hydroureter is again seen on the right side, with a 7.2-mm obstructing stone again seen in the right mid ureter.12-mm and 6-mm calculi are also noted in the right renal collecting system.a moderate amount of right perinephric stranding still persists.there is no free air or free fluid.hyperdense material seen within the stomach is likely ingested material.the small bowel and colon are unremarkable, without signs of obstruction.a catheter is noted within the spinal canal, likely the patient's baclofen pump.
summary: unchanged marked right hydronephrosis and proximal hydroureter with a 9-mm obstructing stone in the right mid ureter.two other calculi noted within the right renal collecting system, the larger measuring 12 mm.unchanged staghorn calculus in the left renal collecting system with associated chronic obstruction of the upper pole.no abscess or focal fluid collection seen.dfddp

text: moderate bilateral pleural effusions are redemonstrated with associated bibasilar atelectasis.the included portion of the cardiac apex is unremarkable.an orogastric tube courses beyond the stomach into the proximal duodenum.the spleen, adrenal glands appear unremarkable.a stent is present in the distal common bile duct with consequent pneumobilia as well as gas within the gallbladder.apart from pneumobilia, the liver is unremarkable.note is made of a moderate amount of ascites.the kidneys redemonstrate a right renal hypodensity, characterized a cyst on a previous ultrasound.extensive peripancreatic inflammation consistent with known pancreatitis is redemonstrated.on this non-contrast study, tissue enhancement and thus necrosis is not assessed.in addition, no assessment is made regarding patency of the adjacent venous vasculature or the presence of pseudoaneurysms.there is no distinct pseudocyst formation and overall, the degree of peripancreatic and mesenteric fat stranding appears minimally progressed from the previous study.specifically, there is additional hypodense material just anterior to the pancreas.the abdominal aorta is notable for aortic stent graft.the included osseous structures reveal no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesion.
summary: redemonstration of pancreatitis, with slight progression of adjacent stranding and fluid without distinct loculated collection.note that absent intravenous contrast, potential pancreatic necrosis not assessed.persistent bilateral pleural effusions as well as pneumobilia.

text: in the imaged portion of the thorax, hypoventilatory changes are again noted at the lung bases.the visualized heart and great vessels appear normal.in the abdomen, the liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys appear normal.gastrostomy and jejunostomy tubes are noted both in standard position with no evidence for abscess and no significant fat stranding in the subcutaneous tissues at insertion sites.a small amount of air is seen in the ventral abdominal subcutaneous tissues likely secondary to subcutaneous injections.bowel appears unremarkable.in the right lower quadrant there is a normal appearance of small bowel in the region which concern was previously raised for a meckel's diverticulum (ct ___).there is no significant free fluid, no free air and no lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of abscess or complication related to gastrostomy or jejunostomy tubes.no evidence of bowel obstruction.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of this dictation.

text: the study is somewhat limited due to patient motion artifact and positioning.a pacemaker lead extends to the right ventricle.bibasilar pleural effusions and associated atelectasis.scattered small opacities at right lung base have the appearance of alveolitis, possibly aspiration.liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.gallbladder is present, there is no biliary dilatation.kidneys excrete contrast symmetrically.no hydronephrosis.there is a contour abnormality in the anterior cortex of the right lower pole representing scarring versus post-surgical changes.the aorta and major branch vessels are patent, with atherosclerotic calcifications but no significant dilation.the bowel loops are decompressed.colonic diverticulosis is seen.no abnormal mass or lymphadenopathy.no free air, free fluid, or drainable collection.there is a moderate amount of retained stool in the distal colon and rectum.fat-containing inguinal hernias are seen bilaterally.bladder is non-distended with a foley catheter in place.there is underdistension of the bladder, and apparent bladder wall thickening.prostate is markedly enlarged with peripheral calcifications, measuring 6.7 x 5.8 x approximately 7.4 cm.there is low density within the periurethral prostate posteriorly, with a focal collection measuring approximately 4.2 x 2.2 cm within the right lateral prostate, which does cross the midline near the prostatic apex.there is no enhancing rim to this collection, nor stranding within the periprostatic fat.
summary: 4 x 2 cm prostatic fluid collection within an enlarged prostate, compatible with prostatitis or possibly developing abscess.bibasilar effusions/atelectasis and right base alveolitis.colonic diverticulosis.inguinal hernias.findings discussed with ___ ___ at the time of initial interpretation.

text: again note is made of small bilateral axillary lymph nodes, measuring less than 1 cm in short axis, and small mediastinal nodes measuring less than 1 cm in short axis, unchanged compared to the prior study.coronary artery calcifications are noted.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.in the lung window, note is made of 3-mm nodule in the right upper lobe, unchanged compared to the prior study.no endobronchial lesion is noted.no suspicious mass or consolidation is noted.
summary: status post resection of pancreatic head, with stent in cbd.small amount of ascites.decreased fat stranding beneath the area of incision.post- surgical changes surrounding the stent.decrease in size of retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.unchanged appearance of the kidney, with renal cysts.previously noted pseudotumor has decreased with cleft-like appearance of the left renal contour.unchanged appearance of 3-mm nodule in the right upper lobe.please follow up in one year.small mediastinal and axillary lymph nodes, measuring less than 1 cm in short axis.pneumobilia in the left lobe of the liver, slightly increased compared to the prior study.

text: chest: there is a 5-mm left upper lobe pulmonary nodule laterally, image 15, series 2.this is stable.there is interval decrease in size of the patient's left upper lobe mass, measuring 2.8 x 2.1 cm in size as seen on image 18 of series 2.the mediastinum is free of adenopathy or mass.the previously seen saddle embolus within the pulmonary arteries is not visualized.there is limited evaluation of the pulmonary arteries beyond the central portion.a 4-mm nodule is seen within the lingula on image 30 of series 2, not definitively seen on the prior study.there are degenerative changes of the spine.extensive collateral vessels are noted within the subcutaneous tissues, particularly seen diffusely throughout the anterior chest.
summary: interval decrease in the patient's central left upper lobe mass, now measuring 2.8 cm in size.two subcentimeter pulmonary nodules as described, and continued short-term followup with ct is recommended.prominently cirrhotic liver with extensive ascites, with stable small lesion at the hepatic dome as described.focal bulge of the hepatic contour as described which may represent cirrhotic changes, with no definite mass seen, however continued attention to this area or further evaluation of the liver with dedicated mri can be performed.left upper quadrant splenosis.no definite evidence of residual or recurrent disease at the patient's left renal rfa site.

text: there is subsegmental atelectasis in the right lower lobe.heart size is normal.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys demonstrate normal non-contrast ct appearance.the retroperitoneal hematoma on the right is stable in size compared to the prior study.there has been some evolution of the blood products with progressive clot formation.again, this involves the right psoas muscle and right flank.no additional sites of hematoma are seen.scattered subcentimeter mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are noted.
summary: stable size of evolving right retroperitoneal hematoma.the lack of iv contrast limits evaluation for active bleeding but the stable size argues against this.

summary: no evidence for mesenteric ischemia.bilateral lower lobe consolidations, left more than right, consistent with multifocal pneumonia.small amount of ascites and gallbladder wall edema, consistent with third spacing, possibly related to vigorous fluid resuscitation.multiple calcified granulomas in the liver and spleen.left inguinal hernia containing ascites.air overlying the left groin, likely related to attempted line placement.please correlate clinically.a wet ___ was provided by dr.___ and discussed ___ ___ at 8:00 p.m.over the phone on ___.

text: the bladder appears unremarkable.as described, the rectum is fluid-filled and dilated, but there is no surrounding inflammation.the patient appears to be status post hysterectomy.the osseous structures demonstrate degenerative change, particularly at the l4-l5 level.there is mild disc protrusion at the l4-l5 and l5-s1 levels.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.
summary: dilated fluid-filled distal colon and rectum as described above without surrounding inflammation.normal small bowel and proximal colon.this finding likely relates to given history of "atonic" colon, perhaps related to h/o laxative abuse or, perhaps, an etiology like ___ syndrome (acute colonic pseudo-obstruction.) prominence of the common bile duct as well as the intrahepatic ducts, a stable finding over two months.multiple hypodensities in both kidneys are incompletely characterized but stable.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, and bladder appear unremarkable.foley catheter noted within the bladder.no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic intra-abdominal injury.severe degenerative changes noted throughout the spine.there is loss of vertebral body height at t10, possibly old compression fracture, although clinical correlation recommended.cystic lesion seen within the pancreas.very tortuous aorta with extensive calcifications.multiple hypodensities seen within the kidney, likely representing simple cysts but too small to characterize by ct.small rounded hypodensity within the right lobe of the liver, likely representing cyst, although not completely characterized on this study.

text: the lung bases are clear.the liver is unremarkable.there is a gallstone in the gallbladder lumen.the pancreas is markedly atrophic.the spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the native kidneys are markedly atrophic and there is a small cystic lesion in upper pole of the left kidney that is stable.there is severe atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and branch vessels.there is a large double-lumen catheter arising from the right groin now coursing into the right atrium.the small bowel loops are unremarkable.

text: there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.extensive vascular calcifications are present.evaluation of the solid abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.allowing for limitations, the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, and gallbladder are unremarkable.there is no ascites or pathological mesenteric or retroperitoneal nodal enlargement.there is no ascites.

text: there has been interval placement of a left sided percutaneous transgluteal drainage tube, which extends into the region where there was a fluid collection on the prior study, located between the rectum and sigmoid colon in the deep pelvis.there is no residual fluid in this area.however, there are small pockets of fluid extending superiorly along the right pelvic side wall, which presumably communicates with the drained fluid collection.the bladder, visualized portions of the ureters, and pelvic bowel appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.there appears to be a right sided bartholan's cyst, unchanged.there are no sclerotic or lytic osseous changes seen.

text: the appendix is identified and normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or masses.note is ___ made of thickening of the endometrial stripe for a patient of this age.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.diverticulosis of portions of the ascending and descending colon are noted without diverticulitis.calcified injection granulomas are seen in the buttock soft tissues.bone windows show a hemangioma within the t10 vertebral body.in addition, there is marked degenerative changes seen at the t10-11 left facet articulation causing moderate central canal narrowing.

text: ct chest: there is bilateral basilar pleural thickening with calcified pleural plaques seen primarily in the right lower lobe (2, 6).right lower lobe atelectasis is also noted.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.coronary artery calcifications are noted.within the limitations of a non- contrast scan, the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, pancreas and liver are unremarkable.incidental note is made of two splenules.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy identified.the gallbladder is distended with gallbladder wall thickening and stones seen within the gallbladder.there is no pericholecystic fluid.there is a suggestion of pericholecystic fat stranding.there is no free fluid or free air.___ bowel loops are normal in caliber and without focal wall thickening.the patient is status post ileostomy and colectomy.there are no abnormal fluid collections identified.there is no free fluid or free air.there is a hiatal hernia.

text: the appendix is visualized in the right lower quadrant (2:68) and appears unremarkable.there is no pelvic fluid collection.the rectum, sigmoid colon as well as the bladder are grossly unremarkable.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy by ct criteria is identified.in the uterus, there is an endometrial mass unchanged in size and appearance.the mass is heterogeneous and heterogeneously hyperdense consistent with enhancement.within the mass there is extensive vascularization in fluid filled areas.today, the mass measures 2.9 x 2.4 cm, unchanged from the prior study.foci of air within the bladder should be correlated with recent catheterization.

text: as noted previously, large amount of ascites fluid tracts into the pelvis.the bladder is decompressed with a foley catheter.scattered diverticula are seen, particularly within the sigmoid colon.in addition, there is suggestion of cecal wall thickening (series 2, image 52), although the remainder of the colon appears essentially unremarkable.contrast reaches the colon, without evidence of bowel obstruction.examination of osseous structures does not show lytic or sclerotic lesions suspicious for malignancy.marked vascular calcifications are seen, particularly involving the infrarenal aorta and iliac/femoral arteries, with a large calcified plaque seen within the right common femoral artery.coronal and sagittally reformatted images were reviewed at the time of interpretation, which support the findings above.

text: limited images of the lung bases show subsegmental atelectasis in both lower lobes.herniation of small and large bowel into large hernial sac at the anterior abdominal wall is again identified.nonspecific small bowel dilatation without a clear transition point is identified in the lower abdomen.no free intraperitoneal fluid or gas is seen.contrast passes into distal small bowel and large bowel.no definite pneumatosis is seen in the small bowel or large bowel.the gallbladder has become markedly distended and thick walled in comparison to the prior ct, ___, suggestive of acute cholecystitis.a calculus is identified at the gallbladder neck as on the prior ct.a moderate amount of pericholecystic fluid is also seen.no focal parenchymal abnormality is seen in the liver.there is no significant intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.perinephric stranding is unchanged since prior ct.no hydronephrosis of the right kidney or left kidney.no adrenal mass lesion is seen.the pancreas and spleen appear unchanged.
summary: non-specific dilatation of small bowel, with no evidence of mechanical small bowel obstruction.distention and mural thickening of the gallbladder, suggestive of acute cholecystitis.clinical correlation is advised.

text: there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.the lungs are otherwise clear without nodules or masses.there are no focal consolidations.there are no pleural or pericardial effusion.a small hypodense lesion in the right lobe of liver is again noted.this is too small to characterize but is likely a cyst.the liver is otherwise unremarkable with no new focal lesions identified.the gallbladder and bile ducts are unremarkable without biliary dilatation, wall thickening, or pericholecystic fluid.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is symmetric parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion bilaterally.there are no focal renal parenchymal abnormalities appreciated.the patient is status post total colectomy with ileoanal j pouch.suture line from ileostomy anastomosis is seen in the right lower quadrant.there is diffuse dilatation of the small bowel with numerous air-fluid levels.small bowel loops measure up to 4.5 cm.the distention extends from the duodenal bulb to the j pouch, with no transition point identified.there is no bowel wall thickening or pneumatosis.small pneumoperitoneum is not atypical given patient's postoperative status, but the moderate amount of free fluid within the abdomen is more than expected for pod #6.however, there are no loculated, rim- enhancing collections to suggest abscess formation, and no peritoneal enhancement to suggest peritonitis.free fluid is of simple fluid density.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the aorta is unremarkable.the major mesenteric vessels appear patent.subcutaneous emphysema seen at the surgical site.skin staples are also noted.
summary: moderate free intraperitoneal fluid, without evidence of abscess formation or peritonitis.diffuse small bowel distention extending from the duodenum to the ileoanal pouch.no contrast is seen exiting the stomach.this is consistent with postoperative ileus.status post total colectomy and ileostomy takedown.no definite evidence for anastomotic leak, although intraluminal contrast does not reach the site of anastamosis.minimal pneumoperitoneum consistent with postoperative status.subcutaneous emphysema at the surgical site.

text: there is atelectasis at the lung bases.the distal esophagus is dilated and fluid-filled.
summary: diffusely fatty liver with no focal intrahepatic lesions.borderline splenomegaly.there are diffuse mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes with rim enhancement and central areas of hypodensity.differential consideration includes infectious etiologies such as tb/___.lymphoma is also a possibility, but less likely given the areas of central necrosis within the lymph nodes.there are mildly dilated small bowel loops with areas of decompressed ileum and a focal change in bowel calibre in the left lower quadrant.while there is no obstructing mass lesion, this may represent an early low-grade small-bowel obstruction.clinical correlation is required.these findings were discussed with ___, ___ by telephone at 12:00pm.

text: again noted is expansion of the left psoas muscle.the expansion begins cranially at the level of the kidneys and extends caudally to the level of s2.again noted is mixed high and low attenuation within the psoas muscle which could be compatible with an intramuscular hematoma.the greatest extension in the axial plane at the level of the iliac bifurcation measures 5.2 x 4.2 cm.this is significantly smaller than on ___ where the dimensions were 6.9 x 6.1 cm in the same measurement plane.findings are therefore consistent with the natural evolution of a hematoma, although infection could cause a similar appearance.there is bilateral basilar atelectasis, left greater than right.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion.evaluation of intra-abdominal organs is very limited due to the lack of both po and iv contrast.within these limitations, the outline of the stomach, small and large bowel loops, kidneys and spleen and pancreas are unremarkable.there is an 11 mm hypoattenuating nodular density at the interface of the gallbladder fundus and the liver which could be located either within the gallbladder or the liver and is incompletely characterized on this study.there are marked atherosclerotic calcifications of the aorta and its branches.there is marked tortuosity of the abdominal aorta without evidence of aneurysm.
summary: marked interval decrease in size of mixed attenuation material within the left psoas muscle when compared to ___.the appearance and interval change is most consistent with the natural resolution of an intramuscular hematoma.11 mm hypoattenuating focus at the junction of gallbladder fundus and liver, incompletely characterized.further evaluation with ultrasound could be performed.small left pleural effusion and bilateral basilar atelectasis.marked atherosclerotic plaque burden.lumbar scoliosis with marked associated degenerative changes.

text: the rectum, prostate, distal ureters, and bladder appear unremarkable.there is evidence of diverticulosis within the sigmoid colon; however, there is no evidence of diverticulitis.a small 3.1 x 2.3 cm collection of fluid is seen within the pelvis.no enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: cholecystostomy tube seen in place with collapsed gallbladder around the tube.there is no evidence of abscess or biloma.there is no stranding or free fluid in the area of the right upper quadrant.small collection of fluid seen within the pelvis.this could possibly represent a seminal vesicle cyst, although ultrasound or mri would be helpful in further characterizing this area.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.small focus of patchy opacity seen in the left lung, likely representing inflammatory process.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ on ___.

text: there is extensive emphysema noted in the included lung bases.no consolidation is seen.no effusions noted.limited imaging through the base of the heart reveals no large pericardial effusion.the included distal descending thoracic aorta is approximately 2.2 cm in diameter.the celiac axis originates slightly above the aortic hiatus.there is heavy calcified and noncalcified plaque burden throughout the aorta.a large noncalcified mural thrombus is seen in the distal descending aorta on series 3, image #5.there is no evidence of penetrating ulcer or intramural hematoma.there is a large eccentric calcified plaque at the origin of the superior mesenteric artery.heavy plaque burden is seen at the origins of both renal arteries, left much worse than right.both kidneys enhance symmetrically.the infrarenal abdominal aorta measures approximately 1.6 cm in diameter.just proximal to the iliac bifurcation, the distal abdominal aorta measures approximately 1.2 cm in diameter.the iliac arteries are normal in course and caliber.the proximal extent of an indwelling stent is seen in the right superficial femoral artery.there is stranding adjacent to the right common femoral vein, the presumed groin access site for yesterday's cardiac catheterization.this is likely iatrogenic contusion with no evidence of underlying hematoma.there is no extension into the extraperitoneal or retroperitoneal soft tissues to suggest retroperitoneal hematoma.there is a 12-mm simple cyst again identified in the left hepatic lobe which is stable.there is a small ovoid hypoattenuating lesion in the dome of the right hepatic lobe which is too small to further characterize.otherwise, the liver is unremarkable.the gallbladder is incompletely distended.there is minimal hyperattenuation layering in the dependent aspects likely an element of vicarious excretion of contrast.there is a calcified splenic granuloma.otherwise, the spleen is unremarkable.the pancreas and adrenal glands image normally.as above, there are even and symmetric renal nephrograms.early excretion of contrast is seen in the proximal collecting system.there is no hydronephrosis or perinephric stranding or fluid.oral contrast was not administered per protocol.bowel loops are largely collapsed with no obvious bowel wall dilatation or wall edema seen.there is extensive sigmoid diverticulosis with no ct evidence of diverticulitis.no free intraperitoneal air or fluid noted.no pathologic lymphadenopathy is seen in the abdomen or pelvis.the bladder is incompletely distended.small locules of air are noted in the nondependent aspects likely related to the recent procedure and presumed foley catheterization.a small atrophic uterus is present.bilateral ovaries are identified and unremarkable.scattered phleboliths are seen.serpiginous sclerotic lines are seen in the subcapital region of the right femoral head.degenerative disc disease is identified at l5-s1 with mild associated facet arthropathy.spinal alignment otherwise is preserved.
summary: extensive atherosclerotic disease of the aorta as detailed above.no evidence of dissection or penetrating ulcer.there is no aneurysm.minimal stranding adjacent to right common femoral vein, likely contusion.no hematoma here or extending into the retroperitoneal space.enchondroma versus bony infarct in the right femoral neck.emphysema.indwelling superficial femoral artery stent incompletely imaged on this examination.

text: the rectum, and bladder appear unremarkable.again noted are diverticuli within the sigmoid colon, however there is no evidence of adjacent stranding to suggest acute diverticulitis.again seen are multiple enlarged pelvic and inguinal lymph nodes, slightly smaller compared to prior study.as with the abdominal lymph nodes there is evidence of decreased attenuation in several of the lymph nodes consistent with necrosis.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: again seen is diffuse lymphadenopathy throughout the abdomen and pelvis.some of these nodes appear smaller compared to prior study.there is also evidence of decreased attenuation in some of the lymph nodes consistent with interval necrosis.no evidence of abnormally dilated loops of small bowel or air-fluid levels to suggest small-bowel obstruction.no evidence of acute diverticulitis.unchanged rounded hypodensity seen within the left kidney.

text: large pleural effusions with associated atelectasis are noted bilaterally.the visualized portion of the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.anterior to the pericardium there is a small fluid collection which extends from a subxyphoid location inferiorly which, in the axial dimension, measures approximately 1.7 x 2.5 cm.this would be consistent with a post surgical seroma, however an abscess cannot be excluded (no iv contrast is present to delineate wall enhancement).imaging of the organs of the upper abdomen is suboptimal without intravenous contrast; however, no gross abnormalities are identified in the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, or kidneys.the gallbladder is partially decompressed and a percutaneous gastrostomy tube is well positioned.a small amount of free fluid is outlining the anterior surface of the liver and extending in the right paracolic gutter.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the bowel loops are well opacified with oral contrast.in the proximal-to-mid ileum, there is a single loop of bowel with apparent mild wall thickening and possible faint adjacent fat stranding.otherwise the small bowel and visualized portions of the large bowel are unremarkable.no free air and no abscess cavities are identified.minimal calcification of the abdominal aorta is noted.stranding in the subcutaneous fat is consistent with fluid overload.density in the pre-sacral retroperitoneum likely represents dependent fluid in patient with volume overload.there is not associated free air.
summary: small subxyphoid fluid collection consistent with a post surgical seroma, however without intravenous contrast it is difficult to exclude the possibility of an abscess.single loop of small bowel in the proximal-to-mid ileum with apparent mild wall thickening and faint adjacent fat stranding, a nonspecific finding.moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.small amount of free abdominal fluid.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.a cystic mass located in the left hemipelvis measures 14 x 12 mm, previously 17 x 17 mm.there are no adnexal lesions.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: ct evidence of subtle, new and increased meseteric and omental disease with a few new discrete mesenteric nodules, worrisome of progression of disease.slight increase in prominence of subcentimeter retroperitoneal (periaortic/paracaval) lymph nodes as well.essentially stable left pelvic cystic lesion allowing for slight differences in slice selection and measurements.large ventral hernia with nonobstructed loops of bowel.unchanged colostomy with associated parastomal hernia.

text: direct comparison is made to prior examination dated ___.as on a prior examination, there is evidence of diffuse interstitial abnormality with interlobular septal thickening and areas of honeycombing.overall, the degree of superimposed pulmonary edema as evidenced by areas of ground-glass opacity, appear improved since the prior exam.also, there has been resolution of previously lung disease, however, infectious etiology cannot be definitively excluded based on these imaging appearances.there is evidence of intra- and extra-hepatic biliary dilatation as previously described catheter in place.significant diffuse atherosclerotic calcification is noted.again, there is evidence of thrombosis of the right-sided iliac arteries.bilateral common iliac artery stents are noted.the summary: findings of pulmonary edema superimposed on interstitial lung disease.pulmonary edema appears improved since the aforementioned prior examination.more confluent opacity is noted and infection within the right upper lobe cannot be definitively excluded.interval resolution of bilateral pleural effusions.intra- and extra-hepatic biliary dilatation is again identified as detailed above.there is suggestion of a possible stricture within the distal common bile duct.significant vascular pathology as noted.mediastinal lymphadenopathy as noted above.swana

text: peritoneal dialysis catheter is unchanged in position, with tip coiled in the right lower pelvis.the rectum, sigmoid colon, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there has been prior hysterectomy.there has been interval appearance of several discrete fluid collections within the pelvis, that lie adjacent to but are not clearly communicating with loops of bowel.dominant collection in the left lower pelvis is best visualized on coronal imaging (301b:25) and may lie adjacent to the left ovary.this collection measures roughly 3 x 3 cm, contains small foci of air, as well as what appears to represent fluid-sedimentlevels.there also appears to be slight enhancement of the wall of this collection, but evaluation is difficult due to timing of contrast bolus.more cephalad in the pelvis and adjacent to the peritoneal dialysis catheter are several other areas of more ill- defined fluid, which also contain small foci of air.it is unclear if these represent evolving phlegmon, or possibly inflammatory pseudotumor developing adjacent to the peritoneal dialysis catheter.there is no associated bowel wall thickening, and there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.scattered pelvic and inguinal lymph nodes are seen, none meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: interval appearance of fluid collection within the left lower pelvis that contains small foci of air and fluid-sedimentation level.collection may lie adjacent to the left ovary or left adnexa, and is concerning for developing abscess.additional small areas of ill-defined fluid are seen higher in the pelvis, adjacent to peritoneal dialysis catheter, and may represent evolving phlegmon versus inflammatory pseudotumor.

text: a normal appendix is identified.pelvic small bowel loops, sigmoid colon and rectum appear unremarkable.there is no free fluid and no pelvic lymphadenopathy seen.the prostate and bladder appear unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of bowel obstruction.within the limitations of absence of intravenous contrast, no evidence of other acute pathology.

text: a ct of the abdomen and pelvis was performed with axial images taken from the lung bases to the symphysis pubis.non-contrast images were obtained and reconstructions in the coronal and sagittal planes were performed.
