text: there is diffuse peribronchial wall thickening in the lower lobes, compatible with small airways disease.prominent infrahilar lymph nodes are also present.bibasilar atelectasis, without pleural effusions.heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion or right heart strain.note is made of mediastinal lipomatosis.there is a small sliding hiatal hernia.mild wall thickening of the distal esophagus suggests reflux esophagitis.
summary: diffuse colonic distention (with risk of perforation) and mesenteric/portal venous gas.the differential includes shock/dehydration-induced ischemia, hypercoagulability secondary to multiple myeloma, immunotherapy/chemotherapy drug effects, less likely inflammatory/infectious syndrome following stem cell transplant.possible median arcuate ligament syndrome; please correlate clinically.normal appendix.small hiatal hernia and reflux esophagitis.small airways disease.

text: lung bases demonstrate atelectatic change.heart is not enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.the unenhanced liver, spleen appear unremarkable.there is a small hiatal hernia.pancreas is atrophic, otherwise unremarkable.there is a 1.3-cm left adrenal nodule, stable since ___ ___.there is 1.8 cm right adrenal nodule which demonstrates hounsfield units of 8.these are stable since ___.both kidneys are in normal anatomic location.there is no hydronephrosis.lobulated contour of both kidneys are unchanged since prior exam.a gallstone is present.abdominal aorta and iliac vessels demonstrate atherosclerotic calcifications with no aneurysmal dilatation.surgical clips in the retroperitoneum are noted.there is no lymphadenopathy.multiple mesenteric lymph nodes, which are not enlarged by size criteria are noted.evaluation of the gi tract demonstrates multiple dilated loops of small bowel measuring up to 4.5 cm with a transition point likely within the left pelvis (2:56) with collapsed distal loops lateral with bowel obstruction.there are extensive adhesions at this location.there is an anterior abdominal wall hernia versus rectus abdominis diastasis containing loops of small and large bowel.a right-sided colostomy with parostomal hernia is noted, stable in appearance since prior exam.surgical sutures in the colon are noted.multiple soft tissue attenuating nodules in the mesentery can represent foci of peritoneal deposits which are smaller and have some new calcification compatible with treatment response.there is no gross progression of peritoneal carcinomatosis.there is no free intra-abdominal fluid.left sub-cm pelvic cyst has decreased in size (2:59).
summary: small-bowel obstruction likely secondary to adhesions with transition point in the left pelvis.multiple peritoneal deposits in the mesentery are smaller and have some new calcification compatible with treatment response.stable bilateral adrenal nodules.cholelithiasis.large ventral hernia; stable right colostomy and associated parastomal hernia.

text: sigmoid colon and rectal thickening have decreased from prior exams, though there remains stranding within the perirectal fat.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: interval improvement in colitis involving the transverse colon, with unchanged colitis of the cecum and proximal ascending colon.increase in pelvic and intra-abdominal ascites as well as anasarca.unchanged multiple renal cysts, some of which have calcified septations.continued follow-up is recommended.

text: no focal consolidations or pleural effusions are seen at the visualized lung bases.allowing for limitations in a non-contrast study, the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear unremarkable.again seen is evidence of common duct prominence, not significantly changed from prior study.clinical correlation is recommended.evaluation of the bowel is limited by patient not tolerating oral contrast.contrast is not seen beyond the stomach.there is evidence of dilated loops of distal small bowel and some air-fluid levels, consistent with obstruction.no definite transition point is identified.ostomy site is seen without evidence of air or contrast within.no parastomal hernia is seen.patient is status post colectomy.
summary: distal small bowel obstruction.no definite transition point identified.no parastomal hernia with decomrpessed stomal limb.unchanged prominence of the common duct.

text: the heart is normal in size.the lung bases are clear with minimal left basilar atelectasis.the spleen is mildly enlarged, but unchanged compared to the prior study.the liver, pancreas, gallbladder, adrenal glands, and small bowel are unremarkable in appearance.there is no evidence of bowel wall thickening or bowel obstruction.no free air is identified.there are multiple low-density lesions within the kidneys bilaterally, which are unchanged from the prior study and likely represent small renal cysts.again noted are numerous scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes measuring up to 1.6 x 1.8 cm in the left periaortic region, which are not significantly changed in size and number compared to the prior study.within the left lower abdomen within the mesentery (2:41) is a focal area of soft tissue density measuring 1.7 x 1.9 cm with surrounding mesenteric inflammation which is new compared to the prior study.the adjacent bowel is normal in appearance.
summary: new focal area mesenteric low density with surrounding mesenteric stranding, which is concerning for phlegmon versus early abscess.this is too small for aspiration or drainage, and the location posterior to small bowel loops currently also not amenable to radiology guidance.multiple enlarged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes unchanged since the prior study.again, the differential diagnosis includes infection versus hiv related lymphadenopathy versus lymphoma.no evidence of colitis.these findings were discussed with dr.___ on ___ at 8pm.

text: there has been improvement in the previously described bibasilar atelectasis when compared to prior imaging.there is resolution of the previously described left side pneumobilia since prior imaging.again gallstones are demonstrated within the gallbladder, without evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.new splenic infarct is identified (series 2, image 13), however the splenic vein and portal vein are patent.both adrenals and kidneys are unremarkable.the pancreas enhances normally, with decreasing in size of the pseudocyst at the head of the pancreas and now measures 1.2 x 1.6 cm, previously 3.2 x 2.8 cm (series 2, image 22).there is left peripancreatic stranding and no peripancreatic adenopathy.findings are consistent with resolving pancreatitis.the collection identified in the left flank has resolved since prior imaging.the left anterior abdominal wall collection, however, has increased in size and now measures 7.5 x 2.0 cm, previously 5.8 x 0.8 cm (series 2, image 42) and has an enhancing rim and this may represent a focal abscess.right anterior wall collection has substantially decreased in size and is nearly completely resolved.today it measures 2.2 x 3.2 cm (previously 3.2 x 6.1 cm).no further retroperitoneal masses or adenopathy.
summary: significant improvement in the multiple areas of fluid collections within the pelvis with an enlarging left anterior abdominal wall collection measuring 7.5 x 2.0 cm with rim enhancement may suggest focal anterior abdominal wall abscess.interval improvement in the appearance of the pancreas since prior imaging with decreasing size of the pseudocyst and peripancreatic stranding suggesting resolving pancreatitis.cholelithiasis.new splenic infarct.portal vein and splenic vein, however, are patent.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, rectum, and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there is free pelvic fluid.pelvic lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.intra-abdominal vasculature appears unremarkable with the exception of atherosclerotic calcifications within the abdominal aorta extending into the iliacs.retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: free air likely consistent with recent surgery.free fluid within the abdomen.peripancreatic fluid collections and stranding adjacent to the surgical site may represent post-operative fluid; however, pseudocyst and leak cannot be completely excluded.minimal dilation of proximal loops of small bowel measuring up to 4 cm, with transition point not clearly identified may represent post-operative ileus; however, cannot rule out small bowel obstruction.small segment of small bowel appears thickened within the left upper quadrant and may represent underdistension or may be secondary to post-operative changes.wall thickening at the gastrojejunal anastomosis likely represents post-operative edema.additionally, an area of lobulated thickened gastric fold at the ge junction is noted.recommend attention on follow up ct.if this persists then endoscopy is recommended.surgical drain is noted within the right upper quadrant.the j-tube is not clearly visualized.an ng tube is in place.findings were conveyed to dr.___ at 3 p.m.on ___.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, prostate and seminal vesicles, sigmoid colon and rectum appear unremarkable.there is no fluid collection or free air within the pelvis.there is no pathologic appearing pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: status post partial right hepatectomy, with fluid collection at the hepatectomy site most consistent with hematoma .a j-p drain is located within this region.no intra-abdominal abscess.extensive atheromatous disease of the abdominal aorta.right common iliac to sma graft is patent and there is no evidence of bowel ischemia.

text: respiratory motion limits evaluation of the lung bases.minimal bibasilar atelectasis noted.there is no pericardial effusion.no focal liver lesions are identified.no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation is noted believed of clinical significance.minimal fluid is noted about the spleen.the pancreas is within normal limits without focal mass lesion identified.no dissection flap is present within the abdominal aorta.celiac axis, sma, and ___ are patent.there is an infrarenal ivc filter in expected position.kidneys enhance and excrete symmetrically.no hydronephrosis.a 1.4-cm cyst within the upper pole of the right kidney is noted.several small hypoattenuating foci within the right kidney are too small to adequately characterize, likely representing cysts.within the right lower quadrant are multiple loops of abnormally appearing small bowel with a loop in midline pelvic region demonstrating significant wall thickening consistent with edema and/or hemorrhage.interloop fluid is notable as well as small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.there is a suggestion of thrombosis within the smv on multiple axial images (series 2:image 48, 2:51, 301b:28).
summary: several loops of abnormally appearing bowel within the pelvis and right lower quadrant with surrounding interloop fluid and small amount of free pelvic fluid.possible clot detected within the smv including ileocolic branch suggesting venous ischemic etiology.degenerative changes within the spine.findings relayed to the emergency room dashboard at the time of study completion.

text: rectal wall appears thickened.prostate and urinary bladder appear unremarkable.no free fluid or pathologically enlarged pelvic/inguinal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: no ct signs of pancreatitis or pancreatic necrosis.pancreatic and intra-hepatic/extra-hepatic ductal dilatation.distended gallbladder without surrounding inflammatory changes is likely related to npo status, please correlate clinically.three-cm infrarenal aortic aneurysm with moderate amount of atherosclerotic aortic disease and mural thrombus.there is suggestion of interstitial lung disease.if indicated clinically, hrct could better differentiate dependent changes from peripheral/basilar interstitial lung disease.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, uterus and adnexae, and rectum appear unremarkable.there is minimal stool within the rectum, and oral contrast has not reached the colon.no definite pathologic appearing pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.there is extensive edema within the subcutaneous soft tissues of the flanks and dependent tissues within the pelvis.
summary: small bowel obstruction vs.ileus.no evidence of bowel perforation.extensive ascites, unchanged from previous examination.bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis in the lower lobes, as well as patchy consolidation suggestive of pneumonia.heterogeneous enhancement within the spleen, a finding which could be consistent with heterogeneous splenic perfusion.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder and adnexa are within normal limits.there is no evidence of free fluid in the pelvis.there are several enlarged lymph nodes noted in the left inguinal and peri-iliac area.the largest of these lymph nodes measures 2.4 x 1.7 cm.these lymph nodes do meet criteria for pathology and are considered suspicious.
summary: suspicious inguinal/iliac left lymphadenopathy.elevated left hemidiaphragm as described above.dilated intra and extrahepatic biliary system.ivc filter noted.l2 compression fracture.the patient noted to be status post cholecystectomy and billroth ii procedure.

text: there is a small right-sided pleural effusion, with mild bibasilar and lingular atelectasis.there is trace coronary artery and valvular calcification.the atria are slightly enlarged.the liver demonstrates a nodular contour with atrophy of the lateral segments of the left lobe, consistent with chronic liver disease.there is persistent and unchanged intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation within segment iii.several punctate hepatic calcified granulomas are seen.without iv contrast, we cannot evaluate for focal hepatic masses.the spleen is enlarged.the gallbladder is markedly distended with layering stones without wall edema or inflammatory changes to suggest acute cholecystitis.the pancreas is severely atrophic with a dilated beaded pancreatic duct consistent with chronic pancreatic disease.there is no inflammatory changes in the anterior pararenal space to suggest acute pancreatitis.the spleen is enlarged.kidneys demonstrate no abnormalities on this noncontrast study and have some residual contrast within the collecting system from the prior pe study.
summary: moderately atherosclerotic but normal calibered abdominal aorta.without iv contrast, this study cannot evaluate for aortic dissection.distended gallbladder with layering stones without specific ct findings to suggest acute cholecystitis.if this is suspected, ultrasound can be performed.probable bullet fragment within the body of the sacrum, present on multiple prior studies.nodular liver with volume redistribution suggestive of cirrhosis.stable intrahepatic biliary dilitation.splenomegaly.small right pleural effusion with bibasilar atelectasis.atrophic pancreas with dilated pancreatic duct suggestive of chronic pancreatitis.

text: the liver remains fatty, without evidence of focal lesion.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenals, pancreas, kidneys are unremarkable.haziness of the mesentery has resolved since ___.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal nodes are not enlarged by ct size criteria.the intra- abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable without evidence of pneumatosis, free air or obstruction.fat containing umbilical hernia is unchanged since ___.
summary: resolution of borderline mesenteric adenopapthy and mesenteric haziness.there is no evidence of recurrence.

text: imaged bowel loops are unremarkable.no free fluid is seen in the pelvis.the bladder has a foley within it, and distal ureters are unremarkable.focal calcifications are seen within the prostate.bowel loops are unremarkable.no lymphadenopathy is seen.osseous structures are unremarkable.there are minor degenerative changes of the spine.coronal and sagittal reconfigurations were essential in delineating the anatomy and pathology.mpr value 5.
summary: findings of acute pancreatitis, i.e.pancreatic edema and peripancreatic amorphous fluid, in patient with evidence of chronic pancreatitis.hemangioma in liver.several too-small-to characterize kidney cysts.atelectasis of the left lung base.preliminary findings were relayed to the ed dashboard at time of interpretation.

text: the appendix is normal.the prostate demonstrates coarse calcifications.the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable except to note sigmoid diverticula.there is no evidence of acute diverticulitis.
summary: interval decrease in bilateral hydronephrosis but persistant bilateral dilation of the ureters, right greater than left.new right periureteric fat stranding with air seen in the right ureter and right renal collecting system.given persistant stone in the distal right ureter, these constellation of findings are concerning for emphysematous pyelitis.alternatively, since a small foci of air is also seen in the left kidney, perhaps the finding of bilateral air could be due to recent instrumentation.clinical correlation is recommended.normal appendix.findings were posted to the ed dashboard and findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 12:40 a.m.

text: there are bilateral basilar atelectases at the lung bases.there is no pleural effusion.there are minimal bilateral pleural effusions at the lung bases.there is gap in the wall of the gallbladder, (2:27), with a lobulated collection with minimal enhancement in the right lobe of the liver, and surrounding fat stranding, concerning for perforated loculated gallbladder.there is a biliary stent in place with tip at the right biliary duct, (2:19).air is seen within the intrahepatic biliary ducts, likely from a recent ercp procedure.gallstones are seen again, (2:28).spleen appears normal.pancreas appears atrophic.the kidneys enhance symmetrically, and excrete contrast symmetrically.there is nonspecific stranding and minimal perinephric fluid around the right kidney.left kidney appears smaller than the right kidney, and there is some central hypoattenuation, which could be due to atrophy.there are aterosclerotic vascular changes seen on the left renal artery, not well assessed on this non-angiographic study.several hypodensities are seen in the right kidney, too small to characterize.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the retroperitoneum or mesentery.there are significant atherosclerotic changes in the vessels of the abdomen.
summary: contained gallbladder perforation into the right lobe of the liver.cholelithiasis.atrophy of the interpolar left kidney.atherosclerotic changes of the left renal artery, not well assessed on this non-angiographic study.fibroid uterus.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 6:20 p.m.on ___, by dr.___ ___.

text: foley catheter courses into bladder.uterus and rectum are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvic cul-de-sac, likely from distribution from the overall ascites.no adenopathy is identified.
summary: consolidation within the right lower lobe, not significantly changed from the prior study.bilateral pleural effusions, with the right pleural effusion slightly increased in size.high attenuating material within the pleural effusions may reflect fibrin/blood products.moderate ascites, slightly increased in extent.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.renal cysts.hypodensities in the spleen, uncertain etiology, but unchanged.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions are noted.there is associated compressive atelectasis at the lung bases, and underlying consolidation cannot be excluded.
summary: residual fluid collections in mesentery and abdominal wall, without evidence of superinfection.distended stomach with retained oral contrast with no definite anatomic etiology identified.bibasilar atelectasis or consolidation.

text: the rectum, prostate, seminal vesicles, and distal ureters are unremarkable.there is a small amount of air within the bladder, which is likely related to foley catheter.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is seen.the normal appendix is seen.
summary: right posterior-lateral acetabular fracture as described above with associated posterior dislocation of the right femoral head.intramuscular and intra-articular hematoma at the right hip.multiple left minimally displaced left anterior rib fractures.two 4 mm nodules within the right upper lobe.according to the ___ society guidance in a low risk patient, no further followup is necessary.focal ground-glass opacity within the right middle lobe may represent lung contusion.extensive atherosclerotic changes of the aorta without evidence of aneurysm.findings were discussed with the trauma team immediately after the images were acquired.

text: there is no pleural effusion in the visualized lung bases.there is moderate amount of ascites in the abdomen, simple in attenuation.the liver appears shrunken and nodular in contour, compatible with the known end-stage liver disease.there is recanalization of the umbilical vein, compatible with expected portal hypertension.in the gallbladder, there is hyperdense material, compatible with partially calcified stone.the gallbladder wall is thickened, likely secondary to the underlying end-stage liver disease.the portal vein remains patent.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 14 cm.the pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.there are perisplenic and perigastric varices.there is no excretion of iv contrast likely secondary to bolus timing.the stomach, duodenum and loops of small bowel are patent with oral contrast.
summary: cirrhotic liver with evidence of portal hypertension.moderate amount of ascites in the abdomen.edematous colonic wall likely secondary to portal colonopathy.however penumatosis raises concern for ischemia and clinical correlation is recommened.there is no portal venous air or evidence of perforation.cholelithiasis in a gallbladder with edematous wall, also likely secondary to the patient's cirrhotic status.no bowel obstruction.no free air.

text: there is trace right pleural effusion.the lung bases are otherwise clear.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.multivessel coronary arterial calcifications are noted.the gallbladder remains somewhat distended with circumferential mural thickening and significant surrounding inflammatory changes, consistent with known acute cholecystitis under conservative treatment, status post percutaneous drainage in ___.there remains to be a 2-cm stone impacted in the neck.there are multiple sites of mucosal disruption anteriorly and posteriorly (for example 2, 28), consistent with perforated cholecystitis.also noted is a new 1.7 x 1.2 cm liver hypodensity abutting the gallbladder anteriorly (2, 24), not present on ct dated ___, highly concerning for a hepatic abscess.the hepatic veins, left, right, and main portal veins remain patent.however there is subtle nonenhancement of some of the peripheral portal venous branches about the gallbladder, which are concerning for possible peripheral portal venous branch thrombosis.this is associated mildly heterogeneous liver perfusion.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are within normal limits.bilateral nephrograms are symmetric without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.small and large bowel loops demonstrate normal contrast opacification and remain normal in caliber.the appendix is air-containing and appears within normal limits.there is no free air.great vessels are patent.
summary: findings consistent with perforated cholecystitis with a new 1.7 x 1.2 cm liver abscess.impacted cholelithiasis.suggestion of small peripheral portal venous branch thrombosis in peripheral left and right anterior branches.widely patent main, left, and right portal veins.findings reported to dr.___ by phone at 11:30 p.m.on ___.

text: the bladder and rectosigmoid colon are unremarkable.again seen is ascites extending into the pelvis.
summary: right distal ureteral partially obstructing 5 mm stone with a dilated proximal ureter and moderate hydronephrosis.there is a small amount of right perinephric fat stranding.full evaluation is limited on this non iv contrast study.there is a 3 mm stone in the upper pole of the left kidney.no left ureteral dilatation.no left hydronephrosis.large amount of ascites.pneumobilia unchanged.

text: foley catheter and rectal tube are in place.rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are seen.
summary: no evidence of traumatic injury in the abdomen or pelvis.small bibasilar consolidations, which may represent atelectasis and/or aspiration.extensive thoracolumbar degenerative changes and vertebral body height loss at t12, likely old.

text: visualized lung bases are clear without nodule, mass, or consolidation.there is no pericardial effusion.the liver is normal in size and attenuation.there are no focal liver lesions identified.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation.the gallbladder is decompressed.the hepatic and portal veins are patent.the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.there is no hydronephrosis and no renal mass lesion.the stomach and duodenum are unremarkable.however, the small bowel in the abdomen is diffusely distended, with loops seen measuring up to 3.6 cm.there is no distinct transition point identified to definitively suggest obstruction, and there are no collapsed distal small bowel loops either.however, there are some fecalized loops in the right upper quadrant.the colon is unremarkable, with air and stool seen extending throughout.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.there is a small amount of free fluid in the abdomen, both in the perihepatic region and tracking into the pelvis.there is no free air.there is no adenopathy.the aorta is normal in caliber.the mesenteric vessels are patent.
summary: diffusely dilated, fluid-filled small bowel loops, with some fecalized loops in the right mid abdomen.however, there is no distinct transition point identified, and stool and air is seen throughout the colon, extending to the rectum.findings are most consistent with ileus or gastroenteritis, especially given small free abdominal fluid, though partial or early obstruction cannot be excluded.close followup is recommended.these findings were discussed with surgery team at the time of interpretation.

text: distal ureters, bladder, prostate gland are unchanged.there is no free fluid in the pelvis or pathological inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is a penile prosthesis.osseous structures are unchanged.
summary: progression of areas of colonic wall thickening, now extending into base of the cecum and proximal third of transverse colon.the distribution is less likely for ischemia although there is history of prior diabetes.also on the differential include lymphoma, but this is considered much less likely than an infectious process.cecal thickening now extends to the base of the appendix, which is no longer filled with air and oral contrast.small amount of stranding about the appendix is unchanged since one day earlier.results were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 7:30 pm on ___.

text: there is right basilar dependent atelectasis.study is limited for evaluation of solid organs due to lack of iv contrast.in the right lobe of the liver, there is a hypodense lesion, 2:8, which appears stable in size, though cannot be characterized.gallbladder, pancreas appear normal.kidneys contain hypoattenuating lesions, which are too small to be characterized on the current scan.the bowel appears grossly normal.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes within the retroperitoneum or mesentery.the adrenal glands appear normal.no free fluid.no free air.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there are small scattered diverticula in the colon; however, there is no evidence of diverticulitis.
summary: no acute findings in abdomen and pelvis.hypodense lesion in the abdominal to liver, incompletely evaluated due to lack of iv contrast.hypodense renal lesions, not fully characterized.bony changes compatible with renal osteodystrophy.

text: the liver and gallbladder are unremarkable.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation.the spleen is unremarkable measuring 11 cm.the pancreas and both adrenals are unremarkable.both kidneys enhance and excrete symmetrically.no evidence of hydronephrosis, stones, or masses is seen.no evidence of mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the small and large bowels are within normal limits.the aorta and its branches are patent and of normal caliber.portal vein and its branches, the splenic vein and smv are of normal caliber and patent.normal appearance of the ivc and its branches.
summary: stable appearance of the patient's known pulmonary nodules.no evidence of lymphadenopathy.no evidence of abdominal or pelvic processes to explain the patient's symptoms.

text: the large bowel, bladder, and uterus appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.examination of osseous structures show no suspicious lytic or blastic abnormalities.marked degenerative changes are seen at the lumbar spine.focal sclerosis along the right sacroiliac joint probably represents a small bone island.examination of coronally and sagittally reformatted images show the left renal stone, without evidence of small bowel obstruction.
summary: punctate left renal stone without evidence of small bowel obstruction.

text: a foley catheter is contained within the bladder.contrast has reached the rectum.there is no bowel wall thickening.there are no osseous abnormalities.
summary: unremarkable ct of the abdomen and pelvis.lung findings are described on chest ct from the same date.

text: there is no evidence of pneumoperitoneum.stomach, small bowel and colon appear normal in course and caliber with no obvious defects along their course.there is no adjacent fat stranding identified.there is no free fluid within the abdomen.there are scattered, non-pathologically enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes.a prominent non-pathologically enlarged aortocaval node is noted (2:35).the liver contains a single 1.3-cm diameter hypodensity within segment viii, likely representing hepatic cyst; there are no other focal abnormalities identified.there is no evidence of intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is normal with trace pericholecystic fluid seen.there is no adjacent enhancement of the liver parenchyma.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance homogeneously and symmetrically with no evidence of obstruction.there is no hydronephrosis.no focal dilatation of the ureters is observed.there are two subcentimeter fluid-density cysts seen in the upper pole of the right kidney, most likely representing simple renal cysts.the course and caliber of the aorta is normal with mild calcification of the distal aorta and iliac vessels.the appendix is distended with air with no adjacent fat stranding; there is no evidence of perforation of this appendage.
summary: no evidence of pneumoperitoneum.previously seen right lung nodule is not within the field of view of the study.the lungs are clear with resolution of previously seen consolidation and atelectasis.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder are unremarkable.brachytherapy seeds are again noted within the prostate.no free pelvic fluid or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified.
summary: no evidence of obstruction.bilateral renal cystic hypodensities, most of which are too small to characterize but not significantly changed compared to ___.no evidence of metastatic disease in the abdomen or pelvis.

text: the visualized lung bases show mild dependent atelectasis unchanged since ___.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.mediastinal, axillary and hilar lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargment.coronary calcifications are noted, otherwise the heart appears unremarkable.the liver again demonstrates a shrunken nodular contour consistent with known cirrhosis.three peripheral hypodense lesions are noted in segment ii, segment iv a and segment viii/vii of the liver, unchanged from the prior study (9; 16 -20).a subcentimeter hypodensity in the dome of the liver is too small to characterize (9, 12), but likely represents hepatic cyst.there is no evidence of arterial enhancement of these lesions or any new lesions to suggest recurrence.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 16 cm.gallstones are again noted within the gallbladder with no evidence of cholelithiasis.the pancreas, bilateral adrenal glands, and both kidneys appear unremarkable.the main portal vein is patent.the right portal vein is patent.the left portal vein is not well visualized, but many small vessels are noted, which may represent cavernous transformation of the portal vein within limitation of suboptimal contrast bolus which may limit evaluation.unchanged large gastric and splenic varices and splenorenal shunt are present.intraabdominal aorta and branches are unremarkable.there is conventional hepatic arterial anatomy.porta hepatic lymph nodes are again noted (6,192).
summary: stable lesions in the liver with no arterial enhancement to suggest recurrence.small hypodensity at dome of liver is too small to characterize.cirrhotic liver with stigmata of portal hypertension including varices, splenorenal shunt and splenomegaly.conventional hepatic arterial anatomy.the left portal vein is not well visualized, but many small vessels are noted, which may represent cavernous transformation of the portal vein within limitation of suboptimal contrast bolus which may limit evaluation.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.

text: the lung bases are clear.a 5- mm focus of decreased enhancement is seen within the liver dome, unchanged since ___.calcifications within the left lobe are consistent with prior granulomatous infection.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the pancreas, spleen, bilateral adrenals glands are unremarkable.multiple calcified and noncalcified cysts are seen in bilateral kidneys.these are stable in size, number and appearance compared with prior exam.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically and there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.the abdominal loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and contour, and there is no evidence of small-bowel obstruction.the cecum is almost completely replaced by a large peripherally enhancing soft tissue density mass that appears more prominent than on prior exam, and measures 53 x 29 mm on series 2, image 47.two associated lymph nodes have also increased in size.the larger of the two measures 14 x 11 mm (previously 9 x 7 mm).there is a slight interval increase in the amount of surrounding soft tissue stranding.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free air and no free fluid.dense vascular calcifications are seen within the aorta, and mesenteric vessels.
summary: no intraabdominal free air or evidence of small-bowel obstruction.large distended bladder.interval increase in size of known cecal mass, with associated lymphadenopathy.stable interval appearance of bilateral calcified and noncalcified renal cysts.stable low density lesion in liver dome.calcifications in the liver consistent with prior granulomatous infection.

text: bibasilar atelectasis in the dependent portions of the lungs.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.previously seen right paravertebral cystic structure is incompletely visualized.evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is slightly limited due to lack of iv contrast.within the limitation, the liver, spleen, pancreas, kidneys and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the gallbladder is slightly enlarged and the common bile duct is dilated, however, this is unchanged compared to ___.the bladder is decompressed.patient is status post sigmoidectomy with colostomy placed in the left lower quadrant.the remaining colon has diffuse cicumerferential wall thickening, in some areas with some hyperdensty (601b image 64) involving the cecum located in the cul-de-sac.there is a parastomal hernia which contains decompressed segment of colon but demonstrates surrounding fat stranding.there is also a focus of air in the adjacent soft tissues seen best on series 2, image 71 that is not definitively intra or extraluminal.there are scattered aortic artery calcifications, splenic artery calcification and ___-iliac arterial calcifications.there are scattered prominent lymph nodes in the pelvis, for example a lymph node measures 1.2 cm, best seen on series 6, image 69.there are also multiple prominent mesenteric lymph nodes.there is no free fluid in the pelvis or ascites.there is no free air nor drainable collection.there are multilevel degenerative changes mainly in the thoracic spine with disc space narrowing.there are no suspicious osseous lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: diffuse colonic wall thickening of the remaining colon.differential considerations include changes from patients known crohn's disease, infectious or inflammatory causes, or even hemorrhage given elevated inr and possible high density of the wall in certain areas.parastomal hernia with a focus of air within the soft tissues which is not clearly intraluminal and may be may be extraluminal.close clinical followup suggested and repeat can be performed if desired.

text: pleural effusions are noted bilaterally with the right side greater than the left.ground-glass opacities are noted throughout the right middle and right lower lobes.a small pericardial effusion is noted.
summary: fluid throughout the mesentery, likely representing edema/third spacing; cannot rule out vascular compromise or primary bowel pathology.bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than the left; right lower lobe and right middle lobe ground-glass opacity.splenomegaly.retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, difficult to visualize without contrast.

text: the partially visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis with a stable right basilar bulla and right middle focus of scarring.the overall appearance of the lungs, however, appears improved since examination one year prior.there are dense coronary arterial and aortic calcifications.lack of intravenous contrast limits solid organ evaluation.there is a stable millimeter-sized high density focus within the spleen (2:23) consistent with a granuloma otherwise the splenic parenchyma appears normal.there is a stable to slightly decreased intermediate density 4 x 3 cm left adrenal mass containing calcifications.the right adrenal gland appears normal.the pancreas is unremarkable.at the base of the gallbladder is a punctate hyperdensity, which may be a gallstone.liver parenchyma appears normal without lesions.there is no hydronephrosis of the right or left kidney and no mass is evident on this non-contrast enhanced scan.the stomach and abdominal loops of small bowel appear normal.there is no free air, or free fluid.there is no appreciable lymphadenopathy.there is dense atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta and its branches.
summary: improved appearance to bibasilar lung consolidations now likely reflecting atelectasis.no acute pathology identified in the abdomen or pelvis to explain the patient's symptoms.dense coronary, and vascular calcifications.patient is status post aortobifem and right ax-fem bypass.stable bilateral aneurysms at the site of bypass anastomoses.unchanged appearance of apparent prior ligation of axillary-femoral graft.stable appearance to high density left adrenal mass, incompletely evaluated on this study.dedicated ct or mr adrenal protocol again recommended for further characterization.

text: the nasogastric tube terminates in the stomach.in the left upper quadrant there is a persistent rim-enhancing abscess.the collection is approximately stable in size since prior exam with interval placement of ct-guided drain.there is an increased area of fluid tracking into the left paracolic gutter.in the right upper quadrant along the anterior abdominal wall just inferior to the liver margin is a 7.3 x 3.6 cm fluid collection with mild rim enhancement.the fluid collection was seen on prior exam and essentially stable in size with a mild increase in rim enhancement.there is a mild degree of ascites in the right paracolic gutter.a surgically placed drain in the left lower quadrant has been removed since prior exam.the subcutaneous fluid collection in the left abdominal wall at the site of surgical drain has since been debrided with an open wound now present in the left abdominal wall.a midline abdominal suture line has been opened inferiorly with interval debridement of a 2.6 x 1.8-cm soft tissue defect with heterogeneous material which was seen on ___.no focal liver lesions.the gallbladder has multiple stones but is not dilated.no evidence of cholecystitis.the patient is status post splenectomy with a small spenule visible.mild fat stranding in the region of the tail of the pancreas is unchanged and most likely reactive in the setting.the kidneys are normal in appearance and enhancement pattern.there is no intra-abdominal free air.there is stable atherosclerotic disease of the aorta and its branches.
summary: similar size of left upper quadrant abscess, now with drain in place.persistent appearance of fluid collection in right upper quadrant with subtle rim enhancement.this fluid collection is not grossly changed since ___ but is amenable for percutaneous drainage/drain placement as discussed with dr.___ at 4 p.m.midline inferior open wound and left lateral open wounds had been debrided since study on ___.stable-appearing right greater than left pleural effusions with right lower lobe collapse and left lower lobe subsegmental atelectasis.ascites tracking along the pericolic gutters, right greater than left.persistent atherosclerotic disease.

text: the study is suboptimal due to delayed phase of post-contrast imaging.the visualized lung bases demonstrate dependent atelectasis at the left base, without effusion or definite focal consolidation.the liver is normal in size and appearance.there is trace perihepatic fluid.there is no biliary ductal dilation.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen, kidneys, and adrenal glands are normal in appearance.the duodenum and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no bowel distension or bowel wall thickening.contrast is seen within the colon.there is no free air in the abdomen.the pancreas is again abnormal, with a large fluid collection, largely replacing the body and tail of the pancreas, though suboptimally evaluated given delayed phase of imaging.at maximal dimensions, this measures 11.1 x 6.6 x 6.8 cm.this is similar in size to prior study dated ___.findings are consistent with necrotizing pancreatitis with possible developing pseudocyst although superimposed infectious process can not be excluded.areas of non-enhancement involving the pancreas are again consistent with necrotizing pancreatitis.however, new since ___, there is a second fluid collection identified anteriorly and inferiorly measuring 8.8 x 5.3 x 7.6 cm, abutting the anterior abdominal wall anterior to the transverse colon.
summary: suboptimal study due to delayed phase of post-contrast imaging.necrotizing pancreatitis.redemonstration of large fluid collection adjacent to the body and tail of the pancreas, largely replacing the pancreatic parenchyma, though suboptimally evaluated given delayed scan timing.a new second fluid collection identified subadjacent to the left anterior abdominal wall is new.superinfection of these developing collections cannot be excluded, and clinical correlation is advised.status post cholecystectomy.left basilar atelectasis.

text: foley catheter is present in the bladder.the uterus is normal in appearance.the sigmoid colon is collapsed.
summary: large, approximately 9-cm liver laceration with small central areas of vascularity.however, this has slightly decreased in size since ___.smaller linear parenchymal abnormalities in the posterior right lobe are unchanged and other parenchymal injury cannot be excluded.stable adrenal laceration.

text: the rectum is within normal limits.the sigmoid colon shows diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.a foley catheter is identified within the collapsed bladder.moderate amount of pelvic ascites is present.patient is status post hysterectomy.a right fat-containing inguinal hernia is present.postsurgical changes are seen within the left groin as well as area of high attenuation in the left proximal thigh most consistent with hematoma.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions left greater than right with adjacent atelectasis.diffuse body wall anasarca and moderate intra-abdominal and pelvic ascites slightly increased since prior exam.slight nodular contour of the liver and relative hypertrophy of the left lobe, which is suggestive of cirrhosis.diffuse atherosclerotic disease involving the aorta and branch vessels.patient is status post aortobifemoral bypass.post- surgical changes are noted in the left groin, not significantly changed from ___.stable left thigh intramuscular hematoma stable l5 vertebral body compression fracture.ill defined area of hypoattenuation within the spleen, which may be related to infarction, unchanged from prior exam.

text: there are bibasilar opacifications, right greater than left, and new small pleural effusions.coronary artery calcifications are unchanged.there is a small pericarial effusion that has increased from prior ct.there is hyperdense material in the first and second portions of the duodenum (601:33).there is no retroperitoneal hematoma.the left psoas abscess has markedly decreased in size from ___.the pigtail catheter is seen in stable position.left hydronephrosis has improved from prior ct.based on limited evaluation from unenhanced exam and beam hardening artifacts from the patient's upper extremities, there is no gross abnormality in the liver, pancreas, spleen, gallbladder, or adrenals.small amount of fluid seen around the liver capsule.the stomach and small bowel distal to the ligament of treitz is grossly unremarkable.the patient is status post sigmoid colectomy with end colostomy.a small amount of enteric contrast is seen in the distal colon.the hartmann's pouch contains much less stool than on ___.there is some excreted contrast in the collapsed bladder which also contains a foley catheter.there are extensive atherosclerotic changes in the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries, with ectasia of the distal aorta up to and bilateral common iliac artery aneurysms, up 3.2 cm on the left and 2.0 cm on the right.
summary: hyperdense material in the duodenum, potentially hemorrhage given clinical history.no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed or other source of patient's blood loss identified.marked interval decrease in size of left psoas abscess with pigtail catherter in place and improvement of left hydronephrosis.bibasilar pneumonia, likely aspiration, progessed since prior at the left lung base.trace pericardial effusion, new from ___.bilateral iliac artery aneurysms.findings were discussed by dr.___ ___ with dr.___ ___ by phone at 12:37 p.m.on ___.mjmgb

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon is normal.no diverticula or diverticulitis is seen.there are no pelvic masses or enlarged pelvic lymph nodes.the bladder is within normal limits without wall thickening.minor degenerative changes are seen within the thoracic spine but no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are seen within the visualized osseous structures.severe degenereative changes are present at the presumptive l5/s1 disc level.coronal reconstructions confirm the above findings.
summary: abnormal appearance to the uncinate process of the pancreas, consistent with dilated pancreatic radicles or, much less likley, small cysts.there is no surrounding soft tissue stranding to suggest more extensive inflammation and the stranding seen on the ___ ct has resolved.in retrospect, the appearance of the uncinate process is probably unchanged compared with ___ ___.appearance is most suggestive of focal chronic pancreatitis.because the abnormality is centered in the uncinate process, it may be useful to evaluate this area by mri cholangiogram, to assess for possible aberrant pancreatic ductal anatomy.1cm soft tissue structure along cranial border of gallbladder.this is of unknown etiology, but may represent a lymph node at upper limits of normal in size.appendix is well seen and is normal.no evidence of diverticulitis is identified.abdominal aorta with mild mural irregularity and scattered calficiation.partially duplicated left renal collecting system noted.

text: the distal ureters, urinary bladder, prostate, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.the transplant kidney demonstrates interval resolution of the previously identified perinephric collection.mild bowel wall thickening and mucosal enhancement is also appreciated in the sigmoid colon and rectum.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: interval development of inflammatory changes in the left upper quadrant, separate from the bowel, although adjacent to the splenic flexure of the colon.the differential consideration includes omental infarct versus epiploic appendagitis.given the location, central fat and tubular configuration, epiploic appendagitis is favored.mild distal bowel wall thickening of unclear etiology.differential could also include infectious or inflammatory etiology.clinical correlation is recommended.resolution of previously identified focal perinephric collection.enlarged periportal lymph node.follow up is recommeded.

text: a foley catheter is seen within a non-distended bladder.the unopacified rectum, sigmoid colon, and uterus appear unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: limited study.dilated loops of small bowel and collapsed colon reflecting distal obstruction.no evidence of free intraperitoneal air.short term follow up abdominal ct utilizing oral contrast is recommended for further characterization.area of calcification adjacent to the distal ileum may represent a lymphnode, suture granuloma or possible carcinoid tumor.attention to this region on follow up studies is recommended.small bibasilar pleural effusions and adjacent atelectasis.multiple subcentimeter hyperdense lesions in both kidneys which are too small to characterize.further characterization with dedicated renal ultrasound is recommended when the patient is stable.fat density in the region of the terminal ileum is concerning for possible intrasusseption.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 9 am on ___.

text: there are multiple dilated loops of small bowel extending into the pelvis.ascites tracks into the pelvis.there is no lymphadenopathy.a foley catheter and air is present within the bladder.a dynamic compression screw traverses the left femoral neck and there is cortical irregularity related to an old fracture.otherwise, osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: multiple dilated loops of small bowel with multiple air fluid levels suggest an evolving obstruction with no definite transition point identified.however, the transition point probably is present within the distal third of the small bowel in the right abdomen.moderate ascites.prominent pancreatic and intrahepatic biliary ducts.

text: extensive pelvic fractures will be addressed in the next section.adjacent to comminuted right pelvic fractures, there is enlargement of the right iliac muscle, with adjacent stranding and fluid consistent with hematoma.fluid tracks cranially through the posterior pararenal space, and may be the source of fluid seen around the liver and spleen.fluid also tracks into the pelvis.a smaller left pelvic sidewall hematoma lies adjacent to pubic rami fractures, indenting the urinary bladder wall.multiple loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.the urinary bladder contains a foley catheter and a small amount of excreted contrast material.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.the abdominal aorta and major branches, and vascular structures in the pelvis are intact and unremarkable.there is no evidence of active extravasation associated with the right pelvic hematoma.
summary: extensive pelvic fractures, with right acetabular two column fracture comminuting the right iliac ___.associated large hematoma of the right gluteus musculature, and moderate hematoma of the right iliac muscle.free fluid in the pelvis and around the liver.no definite evidence of contrast extravasation.additional fractures of bilateral inferior and superior pubic rami.no pubic symphysis diastasis.small right anterior pelvic hematoma adjacent to pubic rami fractures.minimally displaced fracture of the transverse process of the l4 vertebral body, likely extending into the lamina.type 2 fracture of left sacrum.multiple right-sided rib fractures, without evidence of flail chest.small right pleural effusion.sequelae of aspiration at the right lung base.no solid organ injury.fluid around the liver and spleen likely originates from the pelvic hematoma.

text: diffuse nonspecific mesenteric stranding throughout the pelvis with the small pelvic collections smaller than the prior study.distal ureters and bladder are unremarkable.distal bowel is normal.no free fluid in the deep pelvis.no focal osseous abnormalities are detected.
summary: two drains remain inplace with one collection resolved and the other smaller.the hepatic parenchyma otherwise enhances normally without new focal fluid collection.stable moderate ascites.splenomegaly.

text: there is a foley catheter within a nearly collapsed urinary bladder.the rectum, visualized loops of bowel, seminal vesicles and prostate gland are unremarkable.there is no free fluid, free fluid or lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.incidentally noted are multiple sigmoid diverticulae.bone windows show a minimally displaced fracture of the right femoral neck.no additional fractures are identified.
summary: minimally displaced fracture of the right femoral neck.simple appearing cysts of the liver and right kidney.no evidence of acute visceral organ injury within the visualized abdomen/pelvis.

text: small trace of free fluid is noted in the pelvis.urinary catheter is noted in the bladder.the prostate, rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.no pelvic adenopathy.

text: ct of the abdomen with oral contrast.there is minimal atelectasis at the bilateral lung bases.there are no pleural effusions or focal consolidations.the liver is unremarkable in appearance.pneumobilia visualized on the prior ct scan is no longer present.the central intrahepatic bile ducts are somewhat prominent but unchanged in appearance compared to the prior study.the common bile duct measures approximately 8 mm, and is unchanged from the prior study.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there are tiny foci of calcification within the liver likely representing granuloma, and unchanged from the prior study.there are no masses within the liver.the spleen, adrenals, kidneys, pancreas, large and small bowel, and intraabdominal vessels are otherwise unremarkable in appearance.the stomach is opacified with oral contrast and is unremarkable in appearance.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is no significant mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: the study is extremely limited due to a lack of iv contrast.however, there is no significant change in appearance of the common bile duct and central intrahepatic biliary duct compared to the prior study.otherwise unremarkable ct of the abdomen and pelvis with oral contrast.

text: lung bases are clear without consolidation or pleural effusion.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.dense calcification of the coronary arteries is noted.in the abdomen, assessment of solid organs is limited in the absence of iv contrast.however, the liver is grossly unremarkable.a focal hypodensity anteriorly is unchanged and likely represents focal fatty infiltration.a small gallstone is present in a decompressed gallbladder.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.there is no hydronephrosis in either kidney.perinephric stranding size is unchanged.the stomach and duodenum are distended with fluid and small amount of ingested material.the esophagus also contains fluid.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.the abdominal aorta demonstrates atherosclerotic calcification, but is normal in caliber.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: high-grade small-bowel obstruction, with dilatation of proximal loops up to 4 cm, and complete decompression of the distal and terminal ileum.obstruction may be early, as there is residual oral contrast and stool within the colon, which is minimally decompressed.no evidence of perforation.obstruction occurs adjacent to the mouth of the large ventral hernia.however, both dilated and decompressed loops pass into and out of the hernia sac.obstruction may be related to adhesions.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.no evidence of obstruction at the rectosigmoid anastomosis.atherosclerotic disease.

text: the bladder is fluid-filled and contains a small amount of air.correlation for recent catheterization is recommended.there is no focal drainable pelvic fluid collection.no lytic or blastic destructive osseous lesions.
summary: tiny pockets of fluid are seen just posterior to the patient's open abdominal incision and within the peritoneal cavity.the largest of these measures 3 cm in greatest transverse dimension, but only 1 cm in depth.there is no focal drainable fluid collection seen within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: there are also no filling defects within the bladder.the uterus appears within normal limits.there is a probable cystic structure in the left adnexa measuring up to 35 x 24 mm but unchanged since the earlier examinations.there are no enlarged lymph nodes or ascites.there is mixed soft tissue and calcified plaque throughout the aorta which is mildly ectatic, measuring up to 28 mm in diameter.the right common iliac artery measures up to 21 mm in diameter, the left 11 mm.over a 5 cm segment, extensive plaque appears similar in the right superior femoral artery immediately upstream of a stent.this appearance was better characterized on the prior study.however, as before, there is probable opacification with the stent itself.
summary: resolution of large filling defect in the left renal collecting system and proximal ureter with no evidence for a solid mass, although it is difficult to entirely exclude subtle mucosal lesions.most likely, despite the suggestion of enhancement on the prior study, noting resolution, the filling defects were likely associated with hemorrhage.particularly if hematuria were to persist, however, then mr urography could be given consideration.stable left adnexal lesion for which ultrasound evaluation for characterization and as a baseline for follow-up are recommended, if not performed in the past; it is not significantly changed since the fairly recent prior ct studies, however.widespread vascular disease including aortic and iliac ectasia for which surveillance by ultrasound or ct is suggested.

text: there is minimal atelectasis at the lung bases.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, gallbladder, and visualized small and large bowel loops are unremarkable.there is no evidence of intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.there is no lymphadenopathy or free fluid.the stomach appears distended but no obstructive lesion is identified.
summary: unremarkable ct of the abdomen and pelvis.specifically, no abnormalities are detected in the liver.

text: there is no change in the amount of portal venous air.no air is seen within the smv or cecum wall.the entire colon is now filled with oral contrast.the appendix does not fill with contrast, but is not dilated.there is diffuse thickening of the ascending colonic wall.appearance of the abdomen is otherwise unchanged.
