text: bilateral effusions have improved since the prior exam.moderate bilateral effusions remain, with adjacent atelectasis.two mediastinal drains are new since the prior examination.both enter through the upper abdomen; and the right catheter terminates in the pericardium and the left catheter terminates in left epicardial region.there is high-density pericardial fluid, which may indicate pericardial hematoma, which may be within normal limits given recent surgery.the liver is unremarkable without focal lesion.there is borderline diffuse hepatic steatosis.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.right percutaneous nephrostomy tube has been repositioned and now terminates within the collecting system.duplicated right collecting system with two ureters is again seen with mild hydroureter.the left kidney is unremarkable.the esophagus is normal.ng tube terminates in the stomach.the stomach is filled with fluid.the small bowel is distended with air and fluid, and several segments within the right abdomen are dilated, measuring up to 4 cm in diameter.fecalization is seen within these segments.the large bowel is not decompressed.a particularly abnormal small bowel loop in the right abdomen (4:41) exhibits wall thickening and fecalization, worrisome for mesenteric ischemia in the setting of hypotension.however, no mesenteric stranding is seen and evaluation is limited secondary to lack of iv contrast.an incidental note is made of a duodenal lipoma in the third part of the duodenum.no free abdominal air or portal venous air.no free abdominal fluid.diffuse calcifications are present of the abdominal aorta without evidence of aneurysm or dissection.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: new diffuse distention and segmental dilatation of fluid- and air-filled small bowel, with normal caliber large bowel is compatible with ileus.a loop of thickening small bowel in the right abdomen is concerning for mesenteric ischemia in the setting of recent hypotension.however, no mesenteric reaction is present and evaluation is limited by lack of iv contrast.please correlate with clinical symptoms.new mediastinal drains terminate in the pericardium and the epicardium.a high-density pericardial effusion is compatible with pericardial hematoma.exam is limited for evaluation of tamponade.moderate pleural effusions, improved since prior, with adjacent compressive atelectasis.right percutaneous nephrostomy tube has been repositioned to an appropriate location.hydroureter remains within the duplicated right collecting system.findings were discussed via phone call on ___ at 16:10 by ___ ___ to ___ ___.

text: the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenals and loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is vicarious excretion of contrast in the gallbladder.there are no retroperitoneal collections.there are multiple calcificaitons in the right kidney and a calcification in the upper pole of the left kidney.these are unchanged compared with the prior study.the caliber of the aorta is unchanged.there are multiple diverticula, no evidence of inflammatory changes.
summary: no change in the appearance of the ascending and descending aorta, limited study due to lack of contrast.slight improvement in bibasilar consolidations.slight increase in the size of the left pleural effusion.no evidence of retroperitoneal collections.

text: a small amount of rectal contrast is present.there are scattered diverticula of the sigmoid colon without evidence of diverticulitis.there are marked inflammatory changes posteriorly along the sacrum and right gluteal muscles.a small pocket of fluid is identified to the right of the distal sacrum and coccyx, consistent with known sacral decubitus ulcer.marked inflammation in the right gluteal muscle has not significantly changed since the previous exam.there is a segment of soft tissue density extending from the posterior aspect of the rectum through the sacral region posteriorly and encasing the coccyx.no extravasation of contrast from the bowel lumen is present to suggest a fistulous tract at this level.there is free fluid in the pelvis.the uterus and adnexal regions are stable in appearance.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the deep pelvic or inguinal regions.a central venous catheter is identified entering the right femoral vein.there is diffuse increased attenuation in the soft tissues consistent with anasarca.examination of the osseous structures reveals a pathalogic fracture through the left sacral ___.the sacrum is sclerotic and expanded, most consistent with underlying paget's disease.the overall appearance has not changed significantly since the prior exam, though there is increased distraction of fracture fragments.there are degenerative changes in the lower lumbar spine.
summary: small decubitus ulcer with extensive inflammatory changes in the right buttock and sacral region around the coccyx.while the abscess collection is new, the overall appearance of the inflammation has not changed significantly since the prior exam.pathologic fracture through the left sacral ala with probable underlying paget's disease.although the predominance of inflammation is not immediately adjacent to the sacral ala, the presence of superimposed osteomyelitis cannot be excluded with certainty.free fluid in the abdomen consistent with peritoneal dialysis.no ct evidence for organized abscess collection within the peritoneum.

text: the lung bases are clear.two internal biliary drainage catheters are again identified, and unchanged in appearance from the prior study.there has been placement of right and left hepatic percutaneous biliary drainage catheters.a small amount of air is seen within the intrahepatic bile ducts related to the recent procedure.in addition, there is a small amount of contrast seen within the right and left intrahepatic bile ducts related to contrast injection during the catheter insertion procedure.a small amount of increased density is seen in the region of the porta-hepatis and may correspond to the possible extravasation seen on the prior angiographic study.in the left lobe of the liver there is a rounded hypodensity which appears similar to the prior study, but evaluation is somewhat limited due to lack of iv contrast.the previously seen collection adjacent to the ivc is not appreciated on this study.there is no focal fluid collection identified.the spleen is enlarged measuring approximately 16 cm.the pancreas, adrenals, and kidneys are unremarkable.the patient is post cholecystectomy.there are numerous splenorenal and gastrosplenic varices and collateral vessels.the intra- abdominal large and small bowel are unremarkable in appearance.an ivc filter is again identified and unchanged in appearance.no free air within the abdomen.
summary: interval placement of right and left percutaneous biliary drainage catheters.no evidence of bile leak or large fluid collection.small hypodensity in the left lobe of the liver appears unchanged and may represent a small organized biloma.unchanged appearance of ivc filter.splenomegaly with splenorenal and gastrosplenic collaterals.this likely is due to portal hypertension.these findings were communicated to dr.___ ___ at the completion of the study.

text: the uterus, bladder, and intrapelvic loops of small bowel are unremarkable.no free fluid, lymphadenopathy is appreciated.
summary: status post total colectomy and a right lower quadrant ileostomy.there is no evidence of obstruction.

text: there are multiple enhancing fibroids seen again.there are scattered diverticuli of the sigmoid colon, without evidence of acute diverticulitis.there is no free fluid, and no enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphatic nodes seen.
summary: decrease in size of large multiloculated retroperitoneal fluid collection, with interval placement of pigtail drain catheter.mild hydronephrosis without dilatation of the ureter, not changed from the previous examination.

text: the rectum and sigmoid appear unremarkable.air is seen within the bladder, likely secondary to foley catheterization.there is no evidence of free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: findings concerning for left basilar empyema, which appears contiguos with stable appearing fluid collection surrounding aortic graft.large right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis again seen.new herniation of bowel into the ventral wall and upwards into the area of the sternal dehiscence.no evidence of bowel obstruction.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ at 10:30am ___.

text: aside from minimal bibasilar dependent atelectasis, the visualized portions of the lungs are clear.the liver is grossly unremarkable.there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.the portal vein is patent.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen is normal in appearance.the adrenal glands are unremarkable bilaterally.the kidneys are unremarkable aside from small right renal hypodensities that are too small to characterize.multiple punctate calcifications are seen throughout the pancreas, consistent with known diagnosis of chronic pancreatitis.the pancreaticojejunostomy is unremarkable.there is no peripancreatic fat stranding to suggest acute pancreatitis.an ng tube is seen extending into the stomach, ending near the antrum.the stomach is otherwise unremarkable.the patient is status post a roux-en-y procedure.mild dilatation of a loop of small bowel adjacent to the jejunojejunal anastomosis was seen on prior ct from ___, and likely reflects postoperative change.the small bowel and colon are otherwise normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.no pathologically enlarged abdominal lymph nodes are seen.the aorta is normal in caliber and its main abdominal branches are widely patent.along the anterior abdominal wall in the region of the ventral incision, are three rim-enhancing fluid collections that appear discrete, although subtle communication cannot be excluded.the largest collection, measuring 6.6 x 2.8 x 5.0 cm, is deep to the hernia repair mesh and has a focal protrusion into the anterior abdominal wall subcutaneous fat (2:42).this collection contains two foci of air (2:32,34).the second collection within the subcutaneous fat to the right of the mesh measures 1.3 x 7.7 cm (2:44).the third collection measures 4.0 x 1.8 cm and is intraperitoneal and to the left of the mesh (2:36).there is extensive fat stranding within the anterior abdominal wall adjacent to these collections.
summary: three likely discrete rim-enhancing fluid collections within the anterior abdominal wall, in close vicinity to the ventral incision/mesh, are concerning for abscesses.no additional acute intra-abdominal or pelvic pathology, otherwise.

text: there is extensive soft tissue edema in the pelvis, scrotum and thighs.the scrotum demonstrates marked enlargement with extensive subcutaneous edema involving the scrotal wall and also the subcutaneous tissues of the penis.there is a urinary catheter in situ.there is no evidence of abnormal soft tissue gas.there is also extensive edema involving both thighs symmetrically, tracking circumferentially around the thighs with more confluent fluid in the region of the iliotibial bands and also in the adductor compartments.there is no soft tissue gas in the thigh.there is no pelvic fluid collection.there is some residual contrast in the sigmoid colon and rectum related to recent ct examination.some apparent thickening of the wall of the rectosigmoid junction is seen as previously demonstrated on prior ct.there is no focal bone lesion.there is degenerative discogenic disease in the lower lumbar spine with disc space narrowing and vacuum phenomenon in the disc spaces between l4 and l5 and between l5 and s1.
summary: extensive soft tissue edema involving the subcutaneous tissues of the scrotum and penis and involving both thighs.there is no evidence of soft tissue gas.

text: mild atelectasis is noted at the lung bases.there are no pleural effusions.note is made of a left fat-containing bochdalek hernia.the heart is normal in size, with trace pericardial effusion.right atrial pacemaker lead courses in expected position.calcifications are noted in the mitral annulus and descending thoracic aorta.note is made of a small hiatal hernia.
summary: new partial small-bowel obstruction with transition point in left lower quadrant, presumably due to post-operative adhesions.trace ascites, without evidence of bowel perforation.l4-5 discitis, with extensive endplate destruction and stable 2.6 x 1.6 cm left psoas fluid collection.changes of infrarenal abdominal aortic and common iliac artery resection, with residual post-surgical inflammatory changes.patent right axillary-bifemoral graft, with retrograde opacification of bilateral external and internal iliac arteries.minimally decreased right inguinal fluid collection.1.8 cm left adrenal adenoma.cholelithiasis, without acute cholecystitis.

text: there is a foley balloon within the urinary bladder as well as air, presumably resultant from placement of the foley.the prostate gland, rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.there are calcification of the seminal vessicles, a finding which can be seen with diabetes.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there are minor degenerative changes of the osseous structures with anterior osteophyte formation.no acute fractures are identified.
summary: no ct evidence of acute traumatic injury to the abdomen or pelvis.patchy density at the left base is nonspecific and may reflect atelectasis vs aspiration.fatty infiltration of the liver with periportal lymph nodes.

text: again seen is rounded collection adjacent to the uterus (series 2, image 73), measuring 4 cm in greatest dimensions.this does not appear significantly changed compared to prior studies, again demonstrating an enhancing wall.rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there is slightly increased amount of free fluid seen within the pelvis.multiple inguinal lymph nodes are again seen.
summary: persistent multiple loculated fluid collections within the abdomen and left flank.pigtail catheter again seen in flank collection, which appears slightly smaller compared to prior.loculated collection again seen in pelvis, not significantly changed from prior.unchanged appearance of bilateral lower lobe consolidations.similar appearance of multiple large aortocaval lymph nodes.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear without nodules, masses, consolidations or effusion.the heart and visualized lower mediastinum appear normal.there is no lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.there is a small 6-mm hypodense lesion in the dome of the liver, too small to characterize but likely benign.the liver is otherwise unremarkable, without focal lesions.the common bile duct measures up to 9 mm, without evidence for gallstones or obstructing masses.the gallbladder is unremarkable, without wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal.there is normal parenchymal enhancement of the kidneys bilaterally, and normal contrast excretion.no renal lesions are identified.the stomach, duodenum and small bowel are normal.there is moderate amount of retained fecal material within the colon.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence for diverticulitis.there is no soft tissue stranding, free fluid or free air.there is no lymphadenopathy appreciated.a ventriculoperitoneal shunt is situated over the lateral margin of the liver.there is no associated fluid collection or soft tissue stranding.there is mild diastasis of the midline abdominal wall, superior to the umbilicus, at the laparoscopic port site.slight outpouching of underlying bowel is noted, but there is no frank herniation.there is associated no soft tissue stranding, fluid collection, or bowel thickening.the aorta and mesenteric vessels are unremarkable.
summary: status post vp shunt placement.common bile duct measuring up to 9 mm, without evidence for stones, cholecystitis, or mass lesions.isolated low-density lesion in the dome of the liver, too small to characterize, but likely benign.mild diastasis at the supraumbilical laparoscopic port site, without frank herniation.degenerative change in the lumbar spine as described above.similar findings seen on chest x-ray dated ___.these findings were communicated to the referring physician, ___.___ ___ at 12:30 hours on ___ by dr.___ ___.

text: the small and large bowel loops are normal in caliber, without evidence for obstruction.the aorta is diffusely calcified and atherosclerotic.there is a infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3 cm.no suspicious osseous lesions are seen.
summary: findings consistent with multifocal pneumonia as well as chf.small bilateral pleural effusions.cholelithiasis.bilateral pulmonary emboli.findings discussed with dr.___ on ___.

text: the liver is normal and unenhanced appearance, with a stable 2.5 cm low-attenuation lesion previously characterized as a cyst within the left lobe.there are no new focal liver lesions.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal and unenhanced appearance.there are no adrenal nodules or masses.incidental note is made of a horseshoe kidney.there is no hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis.the intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are normal in caliber and configuration.there is no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.the aorta is normal in caliber.vessel patency is not assessed without contrast.there are no foreign bodies identified in the abdomen, either within the gi tract or elsewhere.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process.specifically, as questioned, there is no radiopaque foreign body identified.incidental note of horseshoe kidney.

text: the study is significantly limited by non-iv and non-oral contrast.allowing these limitations, there is interval development of small pleural effusion.the visualized portion of the heart is grossly unremarkable.in the abdomen, there is again large amount of simple ascites, with evidence of mild-to-moderate interval increase in the total amount.the liver is essentially unchanged, with severe nodularity and shrunken in size.there are unchanged numerous small hyperdense gallstones in the gallbladder.there is no evidence of acute cholecystitis.the tip of the ng tube is seen terminating in the antrum of the stomach.the stomach is otherwise unremarkable.the duodenum, the rest of the small bowel, and the visualized portion of the colon are unremarkable.the pancreas is unchanged.the enlarged spleen is seen again without focal abnormality.there are unchanged varices in the perigastric and perisplenic region as well as a splenorenal shunt.the adrenal glands and kidneys are also unremarkable.there is no evidence of free air in the intra-abdominal cavity.there is limited assessment of lymphadenopathy.
summary: mild-to-moderate interval increase of significant abdominal and pelvic ascites.no evidence of acute intra-abdominal changes.unchanged severe cirrhotic liver.unchanged significant cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.unchanged splenomegaly with prominent perisplenic and perigastric varices.

text: residual contrast is seen within both kidneys, in the collecting systems and within the parenchyma.contrast is also seen within the gallbladder.this is likely secondary from prior cardiac catheterization, but is persisting over several hours, which is concerning for contrast induced nephropathy.there is no evidence of free air.there is high attenuation fluid consistent with hemorrhage layering within both paracolic gutters and in the retroperitoneum extending superiorly to the level of the left perirenal space.this is seen extending into the pelvis.there is calcification of the descending aorta.there is definitely a stent in the left common iliac artery and there also may be a stent in the right.the unopacified loops of bowel are unremarkable.there are calcifications within the uterus, consistent with calcified fibroids.there is also contrast and a foley catheter within the bladder.there is a small amount of stranding in the right groin consistent with the recent procedure.nonpathologically enlarged bilateral inguinal lymph nodes.the bones are unremarkable.
summary: retroperitoneal hemorrhage worse on the left, consistent with the history of iliac artery perforation, although the exact origin of this hemorrhage is not identified on this ct.persistent nephrogram raises concern for contrast induced nephropathy.

text: there is atelectasis at both lung bases.a punctate calcification in the right lower lobe in the region of atelectasis probably represents a calcified granuloma.no pericardial effusion is present.there is a oro/nasogastric tube coursing below the diaphragm.the liver, spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, adrenals, and kidneys are unremarkable.round soft tissue densities, one in the superior aspect of the left renal fossa, and three in the hilum of the spleen, probably represent splenules.the stomach and small bowel loops are within normal limits.no free fluid is seen in the abdomen.there is no definite lymphadenopathy on this non-iv contrast examination.
summary: splenules in splenic hilum and superior aspect of left renal fossa.no evidence of visceral injury on this non-iv contrast examination.preliminary findings were relayed to the ed dashboard at approximately 12:30 p.m., ___.

text: in the limited images obtained throughout the bases of the lungs, there is right pleural thickening, left pleural effusion, and left posterolateral non-well-defined parenquimal opacity/consolidation.there is a tiny calcified granuloma in the lateral basal segment of the right lower lobe.in segment iii of the liver, there is a hypodense subcentimeter focal lesion, too small to be characterized.there are no other focal intraparenchymal lesions.there is no biliary duct dilatation.the spleen, pancreas, adrenals, and left kidney are unremarkable.multiple stones are seen within the gallbladder.in the upper pole of the right kidney, there is an exophytic, round, well-defined cystic nonenhancing lesion measuring 49 x 44 mm.normal excretion is seen from both kidneys.there is no free fluid or free air within the abdomen.the small bowel loops are unremarkable.there is a feeding tube in the left upper quadrant.there is no lymphadenopathy.the aorta is normal in caliber.there is a filter in the ivc.there is contrast in the ivc above the renal veins and ivc filter, there is no contrast seen below the ivc filter in the ivc, iliac or femoral veins.note is made that the study was done in late arterial phase, and there are no delayed images as this is a single monophasic study.the hepatic veins, the portal and splenic veins are patent.there is a fat-containing small umbilical hernia.
summary: the liver is normal in size with a subcentimeter non-characterized hypodense round lesion in the segment iii; otherwise the density of the liver is unremarkable.left pleural effusion.left basal consolidation.right simple renal cyst.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there is a filter in the ivc.contrast is seen above the filter, contrast is not seen in the veins located below the filter in the ivc.note is made that this is a single monophasic study.

text: limited images of the lung bases demonstrate trace pleural fluid bilaterally, slightly decreased from the prior exam.there is a small hiatal hernia.coronary artery calcifications are noted.there is linear hyperdensity along the dependent wall of the gallbladder which may represent layering stones/sludge, or prior contrast administration.there is mild prominence of the intra- and extra-hepatic bile ducts, not significantly changed.there is a stable hypodense lesion at the hepatic dome, consistent with a cyst.no suspicious hepatic lesions are identified.again noted are numerous bilateral renal hypodensities, some of which are too small to characterize, and others of which represent cysts.there is a stable low-density left adrenal lesion compatible with adenoma.the right adrenal gland, spleen, and pancreas are unremarkable.the stomach, small bowel, and colon are unremarkable.there is diffuse mesenteric stranding and subcutaneous edema, but there is no ascites or focal fluid collection.
summary: interval development of heterogeneous high density enlargement of the left gluteus maximus muscle, consistent with hematoma.the previously seen fluid collection surrounding the right limb of the femoral bypass has resolved, at least in its superior extent (the entire site was not included for comparison of the more inferior extent).no new focal fluid collections are identified within the abdomen or pelvis.otherwise, stable exam.findings were entered into the critical results dashboard.

text: the bladder and uterus are normal in appearance with a small amount of free fluid adjacent to the uterus, which is likely physiologic.the rectum and colon are normal in thickness.there is predominantly within the distal colon.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.
summary: no evidence of bowel wall abnormalities.the distal colon is contains primarily fluid, consistent with a history of diarrhea, and correlation to stool cultures should be considered.the liver demonstrates a slightly heterogeneous pattern of enhancement.this may reflect changes from underlying abnormal hepatic perfusion, such as ___-occlusive disease or gvhh, given the patient's history of bmt, and correlation with lfts is recommended.the intrahepatic veins are not clearly seen-and budd-chiari is also a differential.follow- up evaluation of the hepatic vasculature with doppler us should be obtained.this was discussed with dr.___ ___ at 9:45 pm on ___/6.bilateral pars intra-articular defects at l5.

text: a foley catheter is seen within the bladder lumen.the patient is status post hysterectomy and oophorectomy.the rectum appears unremarkable.there is a small small-to-moderate amount of free fluid in the pelvis, with attenuation values of approximately 30 hounsfield units.no pathologic pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.the osseous structures again demonstrate a hemangioma in the l1 vertebral body.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.
summary: atherosclerosis of the abdominal aorta and its major branches, all of which demonstrate patency.no secondary evidence of mesenteric ischemia.small-to-moderate amount of free fluid in the pelvis and small amount of ascites.the slightly heterogenous appearance of the liver raises the possibility of hepatitis.the gallbladder wall edema is likely secondary to the hepatic process.small-to- moderate right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.the known nodule in the right lower lobe is not identified on the current study.hypodensity in the left kidney is stable since ___.hemangioma in l1 vertebral body is unchanged.findings conveyed to the emergency department dashboard.

text: the lung bases demonstrate dependent atelectasis.the liver, gallbladder, and spleen are unremarkable given the limits of the evaluation without iv contrast.the pancreas is poorly visualized.the native kidneys are atrophic.there are extensive calcifications of the abdominal vasculature.the stomach and abdominal loops of small and large bowel are within normal limits.
summary: limited examination without iv contrast.the appendix is not visualized and the examination is technically limited in the evaluation of appendicitis.1.6 cm left adnexal cyst for which follow-up ultrasound in six weeks is recommended.

text: the lung bases demonstrate interval resolution of the previously seen right pleural effusion.however, the large left pleural effusion persists and is unchanged.there is collapse of the left lower lobe as well.there is pneumobilia which has increased in the interval.there are two abdominal drains present.there are two biliary draining internally as well.the previously seen fluid collection along the greater curvature of the stomach and lesser sac has decreased in size and now measures 8.4 x 8.9 cm compared to 9.5 x 10.5 cm on the prior study.it measures approximately 24 hounsfield units, not significantly changed from the prior study.the previously seen subcapsular splenic collection has also increased in size in the interval and now measures 3.8 x 1.4 cm compared to 5 x 2 cm on the prior study.the small collection adjacent to the caudate lobe measures 3.8 x 1.6 cm, not significantly changed from the prior study where it measured 4.0 x 1.6 cm.no new collections are identified.with the exception of the pneumobilia and biliary drains, the remainder of the liver is unremarkable.again seen are small renal cysts, not significantly changed from the prior study.there is thickening of the gerota's fascia bilaterally.again seen a numerous retroperitoneal lymph nodes, left of the aorta.the largest of these measures 1.7 x 1.9 cm, seen on series 2, image 34, not significantly changed from the prior study.
summary: no new fluid collections identified.the previously seen fluid collection along the greater curvature of the stomach, as well as the splenic subcapsular collection, has decreased in size.the smaller fluid collection adjacent to the caudate lobe of the liver is stable.increased pneumobilia.left pleural effusion unchanged, resolution of the right pleural effusion.retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy unchanged.

text: the urinary bladder is catheterized with air- fluid level, likely secondary to catheterization.the rectum contains air and fluid as described above.the prostate is unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged nodes within the pelvis.
summary: air and fluid-filled colon extending to the rectum with no evidence of free intraperitoneal air or fluid.no evidence of traumatic injury within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate bilateral dependent change with pleural fatty deposition, but no pleural or pericardial effusion.atherosclerotic and aortic valvular calcifications are noted.please note assessment of solid and visceral organs in the abdomen and pelvis is limited in the absence of intravenous contrast.the liver is normal in attenuation without focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the pancreas, spleen and bilateral adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the kidneys are without hydronephrosis with small bilateral exophytic simple cysts in the upper pole.left-sided percutaneous nephrostomy tube is unchanged in position.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.the appendix is seen and is normal.sigmoid diverticula are seen without surrounding inflammation to suggest diverticulitis.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.minimal atherosclerotic calcification is seen in the aorta.retroperitoneal soft tissue density at the level of the aortic bifurcation at the site of known left ureteral obstruction is not significantly changed in appearance though less well assessed in the absence of intravenous contrast.the appendix is seen and filled with oral contrast.

text: pleural effusions are unchanged in size as compared to ___, moderate on the right, small on the left.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.a moderate abdominal ascites with extension into the pelvis appears increased in size as compared to ___.the liver now demonstrates diffuse decrease in attenuation as compared to ___, measuring approximately 30 hus, likely related to treatment effect.two biliary stents are similar in position as compared to prior exam.a 2.7 x 1.9 cm left hepatic hypoattenuating lesion is stable.a smaller hypoattenuating right hepatic lobe lesion is difficult to discern on current exam due to drastic decrease in background hepatic parenchymal attenuation.there is no evidence of biliary obstruction.marked attenuation of the left portal vein is unchanged.the right portal vein and main portal vein remain patent.hepatic veins appear patent.patient is status post whipple procedure.there are multiple fiducial markers in the region of the pancreatic head.no definite discrete mass is identified.the pancreatic body and tail appear atrophic, but enhance relatively normally.the spleen appears within normal limits.previously seen splenic infarct is much improved.the adrenal glands appear unremarkable.bilateral kidneys demonstrate symmetric enhancement without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.multiple small parapelvic cysts are likely present.there is diffuse mural thickening of the colon, with significant pericolic stranding, new since ___, consistent with colitis.there are no dilated loops of colon.there is no free air.small scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen without pathologic enlargement by ct size criteria.great vessels are patent.

text: imaged lung bases demonstrate moderate left and small right pleural effusion, unchanged.persistent mild atelectasis is seen in the left lower lobe.a 1.4 x 1.3 cm pericardial lymph node is stable.there are mild coronary calcifications.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.a nasogastric tube is in place with the tip ending in the proximal duodenum.again noted is the liver atrophy with irregular contours consistent with cirrhosis, otherwise it enhances homogeneously without focal lesion.there is a 10 mm stone within the gallbladder without signs of acute cholecystitis.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the spleen, adrenals are unremarkable.the stomach appears unremarkable without signs of obstructions.there are few sub-5-mm hypodensities in the left kidney which are too small to characterize likely represent simple cysts.otherwise, the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without hydronephrosis, stones or masses.stable 1.9 cm cystic lesion is in the pancreatic neck and a 1.5 cm at the junction of the uncinate process and pancreatic head, which may represent ipmn.there are large amount of ascites extending to the pelvis inferiorly without significant change when compared to prior study.there are multiple intraperitoneal varices, including gastroesophageal, periumbilical and periportal, with recanalization of the umbilical vein.again noted are several mildly dilated loops of small bowel most prominent at the jejunal bowel loops, without any transition point or signs of ischemia.the descending colon is decompressed.few diverticula are seen throughout descending and sigmoid colon, without signs of diverticulitis.there is no free air or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.

text: the common bile duct is dilated to 15 mm.the main pancreatic duct is dilated up to 5 mm in the pancreatic head.mild central and intrahepatic ductal dilatation is present, without significant peripheral dilatation.no definite mass is seen in the pancreatic head.the left adrenal gland is mildly thickened.a 1.5 cm fluid attenuation lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney may represent a cyst or caliceal diverticulum.a tiny 4-mm low- attenuation lesion in the superior pole of the right kidney is too small to further characterize.no hydronephrosis is present.retroperitoneal lymph nodes are not enlarged.small and large bowel have normal caliber.the anterior abdominal wall has mild diastasis.the left adrenal gland is slightly thickened withot focal mass.
summary: small subcutaneous fluid and gas collection at the surgical site in the lower back.dilatation of the common bile duct and pancreatic duct.further evaluation with mrcp would be helpful.

text: there are patchy opacities at the left base.there are no pleural effusions or lung nodules.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenals, and both kidneys are unremarkable.there is a small gallstone without evidence of pericholecystic fluid.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the aorta is heavily calcified, however, its maximum diameter is 2.6 cm.the evaluation of the bowel is incomplete due to lack of oral contrast, however, it grossly appears unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of triple a or retroperitoneal hemorrhage.small gallstone without evidence of cholecystitis.left lower lobe pneumonia.right ovary appears prominant and a follow-up with an ultrasound is recommended.

text: the urinary bladder contains a foley catheter and is collapsed thus limiting its evaluation.there is trace amount of free pelvic fluid.there are no pelvic masses or adenopathy.there is diffuse streaking in the soft tissues of the abdominal and pelvic wall suggestive of anasarca.
summary: multiple intra-abdominal fluid collections most of which appear to be slightly smaller when compared with the prior study..

text: the rectum, bladder, distal ureters are unremarkable.post-hysterectomy changes are stable.there is no free air, free fluid or pathologic lymphadenopathy.there is moderate fecal loading again seen.
summary: small bowel dilation without definite transition point and with stool and air seen in the large bowel, most consistent with an early small bowel obstruction.persistent tubing within the small bowel appears redundant and may be a remnant of a gj tube.this may also be a focus for fibrosis and inflammation and given that more distal loops are decompressed may play a role in the intermittent obstructive process characteristic of this patient.

text: the lung bases are clear and there are no pleural effusions.in the right lobe of the liver near the dome, there is a 1 cm low attenuation region, which is too small to characterize with accuracy, but which may represent a small hepatic cyst or hemangioma.the liver is otherwise within normal limits.there is a gallstone within the gallbladder, but there is no evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.the adrenal glands, pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.both right and left kidneys demonstrate prompt symmetric excretion of contrast.several small low attenuation foci are present in the right kidney, most consistent with simple renal cysts.there are surgical clips throughout the left upper and right upper abdomen in this patient s/p partial colectomy.oral contrast has passed freely through the small bowel to the level of the ileum.the loops of small bowel in the abdomen are unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.there is diastasis of the rectus abdominus muscles with at least three ventral hearnias present.a right-sided ventral hernia contains a knuckle of colon with a small amount of surrounding fat stranding.the other two hernias contain small segments of small bowel, which are unremarkable in appearance.no free air or free fluid is identified in the abdomen.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are detected in the mesentery or retroperitoneum.
summary: mild wall thickening and inflammatory stranding surrounding the sigmoid and upper rectum, in keeping with clinical suspicion of ibd flare.less likely, this appearance could reflect an infectious process.no abscesses or free air identified.three prominent venral hernias, the right-most one of which contains a knuckle of colon with some mild associated fat stranding.

text: the visualized portion of the lung bases demonstrates bilateral moderate-to-large pleural effusions, right greater than left that are simple in nature.there is associated atelectasis as well.an endogastric tube courses from the ge junction into a markedly narrowed stomach lumen and terminates in a post-pyloric position (2;56).additionally an internal-external biliary drain is in place.within the limits of a non-contrast study, the liver appears unremarkable.calcified gallstones are seen within the gallbladder.spleen is normal in size.the adrenal glands are normal appearing bilaterally.neither kidney demonstrates evidence of hydronephrosis or perinephric fluid collection.the small and large bowel show no evidence of obstruction or wall edema.the pancreas is not well visualized as it is encapsulated by a large fluid collection measuring 26 x 15 cm in the axial plane (2; 37).areas of fat necrosis are noted in the expected region of the pancreas.the hemorrhagic componenets within this collection are less prominent than on prior study.no gas is seen within the peripancreatic fluid collection.this fluid collection exerts marked mass effect on the stomach, markedly narrowing its lumen.additionally more mild mass effect is demonstrated on the nearby splenic flexure and transverse colon, however oral contrast has progressed down to the level of the rectum.there is no free air and scattered locules of free fluid are seen throughout the mesentery in the paracolic gutters.
summary: large peripancreatic fluid collection, increased in size from prior study.while it contains no gas locules and there is no surrounding fat-stranding, superinfection cannot be entirely excluded.this fluid collection demonstrates marked mass effect on the stomach and to a lesser extent the splenic flexure and transverse colon, but the nasointestinal tube sits in a post-pyloric position and is functional.moderate to large bilateral simple pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.no evidence of hydronephrosis or hydroureter; gas locules in the bladder likely represents prior catheterization although if clinical concern for gas-producing infection exists, correlate with results of ua.

text: there is a moderate-sized hiatal hernia.the stomach and duodenum are collapsed, limiting evaluation.evaluation of abdominal structures is limited by lack of contrast administration.however, the liver, pancreas, adrenal glands, and spleen appear normal.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.a percutaneous nephrostomy tube can be seen entering from the left flank.the pigtail is coiled within the lateral perinephric fat (3:44).there is moderate-to-severe hydroureteronephrosis, similar to the prior studies prior to the nephrostomy placement.there is now extensive perinephric fat stranding and thickening of the pararenal fascia.there is no large retroperitoneal fluid collection.the bilateral kidneys have small exophytic posterior structures, are incompletely characterized on this unenhanced study, but demonstrate stability from ___ and have the density of simple cysts.the intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel appear normal.there is a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.there is no intra-abdominal free fluid or air.again noted is a soft tissue density, unchanged from the prior examination, which likely represents the obstructing soft tissue mass previously characterized (3:56).the abdominal aorta contains sparse atherosclerotic calcification, and is of normal caliber.no new lymphadenopathy is identified on this limited non-contrast study.
summary: misplaced left percutaneous nephrostomy catheter with the pigtail coiled in the lateral perinephric fat.moderate-to-severe left hydroureteronephrosis with extensive perinephric fat stranding and pararenal fascial thickening.this could represent pyelonephritis in a closed urinary collecting system, or post-surgical changes from the recent procedure and displacement of the catheter; although a small amount of extravasated urine cannot be excluded as contributing to this appearance there is not substantial fluid collection.stable thickening of the soft tissues adjacent to the prostate, likely representing prostate cancer, with unchanged paraaortic mass causing left ureteric malignant obstruction.sclerotic appearance of right posterior 10th rib, and adjacent pedicle of the t10 vertebra, with increased uptake seen on bone scan in ___, which may represent an old traumatic injury, however, raises concern for unusual appearance of bony metastatic disease given the patient's history of metastatic prostate cancer.a bone scan would be helpful to evaluate further if clinically indicated and attention to the site in imaging follow-up is also recommended.similar findings are noted in the left eighth rib.

text: the heart is enlarged.a pfo occlusion device is present.scattered coronary artery calcifications are seen.no pericardial effusion.bilateral small-sized pleural effusions are present with adjacent compressive atelectasis, with right lower lobe subtotal atelectasis.evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is limited by lack of iv contrast.diffuse edematous changes of subcutaneous tissues as well as intra-abdominal fat is compatible with a volume overloaded state.the liver appears normal on this non-contrast exam.cholelithiasis is seen without evidence of cholecystitis.the pancreas is within normal limits.the spleen, bilateral adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.the esophagus and stomach appear normal.an ng tube terminates in the stomach.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber.a rectal tube is present.the appendix is distended and edematous (2:39-40), compatible with known acute appendicitis.no adjacent loculated fluid collection to suggest abscess.no extraluminal foci of air to suggest perforation.a small amount of non-hemorrhagic perihepatic and left paracolic gutter ascitic fluid is present.no pneumoperitoneum.radiopaque mesh from a prior ventral hernia repair is intact.small seroma in the lower abdomen (2:52) likely represents a site of medication injection.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
summary: distended and fluid filled appendix, compatible with known acute appendicitis.no abscess or perforation.volume overloaded state with cardiomegaly, diffuse soft tissue edema, small pleural effusions, and small ascites.pleural effusions are associated with adjacent compressive atelectasis.t10, l3, and l4 wedge compression deformities.

text: there is bowel wall thickening involving the rectum, sigmoid and the distal descending colon, which given occlusion of the infrarenal aorta and ___, is worrisome for ischemic colitis.the bladder contains a foley catheter and has a thick wall.the pelvic loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there is a small amount of pelvic free fluid.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: bowel wall thickening involving the rectum, sigmoid, and the distal descending colon.given complete occlusion of the infrarenal aorta and ___, ischemic colitis should be considered.other differential consideration include infectious or inflammatory process.chronic occlusion of the infrarenal aorta, common iliac, internal/external iliac.the common femoral vessels are reconstituted bilaterally via anterior abdominal wall collateral vessels.patchy opacity in the right lung base may represent pneumonia or aspiration.

text: ct abdomen and pelvis the lungs are clear.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is normal in size.the distal esophagus and stomach are unremarkable.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenals are normal.there are several small hypodensities seen in the right kidney that are too small to characterize, the largest measuring 6 mm (2, 45) in the right mid pole.there is a wide-mouthed midline ventral herniation, containing multiple loops of small bowel, without any evidence of obstruction.there are innumerable mesenteric subcentimeter lymph nodes that do not meet ct criteria for lymphadenopathy.contrast can be seen at the neoterminal ileum, the cecum, ascending colon, transverse colon, and exiting at the end colostomy in the left lower quadrant.the intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel appear unremarkable without any signs of bowel wall thickening to suggest an underlying inflammatory process.there is no sign of small or large bowel obstruction.th ileocolic anastomosis appears widely patent with contrast flowing from the ileum into the colonic segment.the end colostomy appears unremarkable with no evidence of obstruction and with contrast seen emptying outside the body.
summary: no evidence of acute crohn's.no evidence to suggest small or large bowel obstruction.the ileocolic anastomosis appears widely patent with contrast flowing through and no evidence of obstruction.there is a large wide-mouthed ventral hernia containing multiple loops of small bowel without any evidence to suggest obstruction.contrast is seen flowing out the end colostomy without any evidence to suggest obstruction.the rectal stump is well opacified with contrast.there is no evidence of any extraluminal contrast.

text: the pigtail catheter is identified in the left lower quadrant.there has been resolution of the fluid collections anterior and posterior to the pancreatic transplant.a tiny collection of fluid is seen posterior to the transplant.the fluid collection in the midline containing a small amount of gas is again identified and unchanged in appearance and size, measuring 3.8 x 4.7 cm.transplanted kidney is noted in the right lower quadrant.the visualized loops of bowel are unremarkable.no free fluid is seen deep in the pelvis.there is no lymphadenopathy.the osseous structures are unremarkable.an open midline incision is again identified with some inflammatory stranding of the surrounding fat.
summary: near-complete resolution of the fluid collections anterior and posterior to the pancreatic transplant.the fluid collection near the midline is unchanged and likely does not communicate with the other two collections that were successfully drained.single low-attenuation gallstone is again identified without evidence of cholecystitis.

text: the liver, spleen, pancreas, and left adrenal gland are normal.there is a right adrenal mass measuring 8 mm in diameter, too small to characterize but most likely represents a benign adenoma.there are several large gallstones seen in the gallbladder, the largest of which measures 2.5 cm in diameter.there is no gallbladder wall thickening or evidence of cholecystitis.the kidneys enhance homogeneously and symmetrically.there is no hydronephrosis.there is a small 7-mm hypodensity seen in the mid pole of the left kidney, too small to characterize but most likely represents a simple cyst.extrarenal pelvis is seen in the right kidney.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is noted.the stomach, small bowel, and colon are of normal course and caliber.there is no free fluid or air within the abdomen.
summary: multiple pulmonary nodules.the largest of these are seen in the left upper lobe (3:28) , has sattelite nodules and may represent the primary lesion.there are multiple smaller nodules seen throughout the lungs.there is extensive hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy with central necrosis seen of the lymph nodes.in the right setting, the findings could also be infectious in origin (ex tb).there is left axillary lymphadenopathy with a 1.7 cm in diameter lymph node with central necrosis, which is amenable to ct or ultrasound-guided biopsy.there is 8-mm left breast nodule seen in image 3:25.there are multiple intermediate to solid density nodules seen within the thyroid lobes bilaterally.there is a right adrenal mass measuring, likely benign.

text: there has been interval development of small pleural effusions with increased atelectasis.pleural plaques are again identified along the lung bases.there has been interval placement of a metallic common bile duct stent with associated pneumobilia and air within the gallbladder.a gallstone is again identified.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal or duodenal hematoma.the large pancreatic head mass is again identified.there are scattered atherosclerotic aortic calcifications.the kidneys again have multiple hypoattenuating areas, which are better characterized on the previous ct.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal or retroperitoneal hematoma.interval development of small, bilateral pleural effusions with reactive atelectasis.interval placement of a metallic biliary stent with persistent biliary dilatation and new pneumobilia.stable appearance of large pancreatic head mass.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions.bibasilar atelectasis is present.there is a large retroperitoneal fluid collection which extends along the right psoas muscle and into the pelvis.this was not seen on prior study and is likely consistent with hemorrhage.this collection measures 10.4 x 8.1 cm in greatest cross-sectional diameter.extensive retroperitoneal fat stranding is present.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unchanged in appearance.there is a faint low-attenuation lesion within the lateral spleen which measures 1.5 x 1.8 cm.this was not seen on the prior studies.there are several catheters which are entering the abdomen from a large soft tissue defect in the anterior abdomen.these appear to be located within bowel loops.there are no dilated loops of bowel.no intraperitoneal free air is present.there is contrast within several bowel loops in the right mid- abdomen, possibly from fistulogram procedure done one day prior.
summary: large retroperitoneal hemorrhage.bilateral small pleural effusions.open anterior abdominal wound with several catheters likely within enterocutaneous fistulas.rounded low-attenuation lesion within the spleen, not seen on the prior ct.this is of uncertain clinical significance and may represent a focal area of hemorrhage.

text: a foley catheter is within the bladder lumen.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of large infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm rupture or leak.higher density within its lumen may represent thrombus.evaluation for dissection is quite limited given the lack of intravenous contrast.inflammatory stranding surrounding the pancreas.laboratory values demonstrate a lipase of 98.development of small bilateral pleural effusions and lower lobe atelectasis since the previous study.right renal exophytic cyst which is not clearly simple fluid.

text: a left femoral vein catheter is in place.there is a foley catheter in the bladder, which contains excreted contrast.there is no evidence of contrast extravasation.there is no evidence of vascular injury.

text: the imaged lung bases are clear.no pulmonary nodules.no pleural effusions.the imaged portion of the heart and pericardium are normal.the liver is shrunken and nodular in contour, consistent with known history of cirrhosis.a tips shunt is patent and is in optimal position.a stable 14-mm hypodense lesion within the left lobe, likely represents a simple hepatic cyst.the main portal vein is patent.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.prominent mesenteric adenopathy at the level of the celiac axis, porta-hepatis and gastrohepatic ligament are unchanged.the adrenal glands and pancreas are normal.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 17.1 cm.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically, without evidence of hydroureteronephrosis or concerning renal masses.the stomach, small and large bowel loops are normal, without evidence of bowel wall thickening, obstruction or active inflammation.the appendix is normal.apparent wall thickening of the terminal ileum is likely due to peristalsis.the abdominal aorta has minimal atherosclerotic calcification without aneurysmal dilation.prominent retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for significant adenopathy.there is no intra-abdominal free fluid or air.
summary: no acute abdominal or pelvic pathology.cirrhotic liver, with a patent tips shunt.splenomegaly.no ascites.

text: there is bronchiectasis present in the right middle lobe and bilateral lower lobes, consistent with the patient's history.moderate atelectasis is seen at the left lower lobe.included views of the heart are unremarkable.there is a partially-imaged right breast implant.there is a moderately-sized hiatal hernia with thickened appearing wall.non-contrast enhanced images of the abdomen demonstrate a normal-appearing liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands.there is vicarious excretion of contrast in the gallbladder, which can be seen in renal failure.the aorta, celiac trunk, and sma appear normal in caliber.no bowel obstruction is seen.again, there is residual oral contrast from the prior outside hospital ct exam.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no free fluid or free air within the abdomen.small fat containing umbiliac hernia is noted.
summary: likely 4-mm obstructing calculus within the left distal ureter with subsequent more proximal moderate-to-severe left hydronephrosis and hydroureter.apparent filling defect in the left mid ureter;underlying lesion can not be excluded.urology consultation advised and pending.significant contrast enhancement of the left kidney, from distant outside hospital examination, concerning for renal failure.the failure can be secondary to obstruction and or iv contrast nephropathy.mild superior right perinephric fat stranding is nonspecific in the setting of obstruction.early sepsis cannot be ruled out, as ct has poor specificity for urosepsis.moderately-sized hiatal hernia with thickened wall.recommend correlation with endoscopy.dr.___ to dr.___ at 9:50 a.m.on ___.

text: there is stable herniation of colon through the right inguinal canal and new herniation of colon at the ostium of the left inguinal canal.the colon is filled with stool without evidence of obstruction.the bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.no free fluid or free air is detected within the pelvis.
summary: slight increased overlap of the osseous structures at the sternotomy site suggests the posibility of movement.large left pleural effusion with complete left lower lobe collapse, which is stable.there may be a loculated component to the left pleural effusion and there is suggestion that the effusion may be entirely simple.there is increased size of a now moderate right pleural effusion.no fluid collection in the mediastinum surrounding the tracheostomy site.dense three-vessel coronary artery calcification and abdominal atherosclerotic plaque.stable right nonobstructing colonic inguinal hernia and new left colonic inguinal hernia.neither bowel loop protrudes significantly into the respective inguinal canals and there is no sign of obstruction or entrapment.correlate with clinical exam.stable right thyroid nodule.interval development of tiny stones in the gallbladder.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate a 1-cm nodule in the left lung base (series 2, image 10), which should be further evaluated with dedicated chest ct on a non-emergent basis.bibasilar atelectasis is noted.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, bilateral adrenal glands appear unremarkable.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or renal calculi.intra-abdominal vasculature appears unremarkable.retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no definite evidence of free air, however, free fluid is noted within the abdomen.dilated fluid-filled loops of small bowel with a relative transition point at the level of the sigmoid colon (series 2, 60) is noted.the large bowel is distended.a segment of the descending colon (series 2, image 51 and series 601b, 36) appears thickened and irregular, unclear whether this is related to recent colonoscopy.no free air is seen.the visualized portions of the bladder and uterus appear unremarkable.no focal lytic osseous lesions are identified suspicious for malignancy.
summary: 1-cm nodule in the left lung base should be further evaluated with a dedicated chest ct on a non-emergent basis.dilated fluid-filled loops of small bowel with relative transition point at the level of the sigmoid colon.distended large bowel.segment of the descending colon appears thickened and irregular which may be related to recent colonoscopy.no free air seen.ascites.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right with associated bibasilar atelectasis.moderate sized pericardial effusion.optimal evaluation of the intra-abdominal organs is limited secondary to lack of iv contrast.from what can be visualized of the liver, again noted are multiple low attenuation lesions within the liver some of which appear to be cystic.evaluation or distinction of abscess collection is limited secondary to lack of iv contrast.the gallbladder, pancreas, and spleen are unremarkable.previously seen cyst at the tail of the pancreas is again identified and unchanged.multiple cysts are seen within enlarged kidneys bilaterally consistent with polycystic kidney disease.no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.the small bowel and large bowel are normal in caliber and wall thickness.there appears to be mesenteric fluid with minimal stranding.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen within the retroperitoneum or mesentery.
summary: no evidence of pancreatitis.multiple low attenuation lesions of the liver, many of which represent cysts, however cannot exclude abscess without iv contrast.polycystic kidneys, unchanged.pericardial and pleural effusions, subcutaneous stranding, free fluid consistent with anasarca.new air pockets with surrounding soft tissue density anterior to the bladder.___ represent catheterization sequalae.clinically correlate.

text: there are dependent changes in both lower lobes.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.assessment of the solid abdominal organs is limited without iv contrast.allowing for the limitations, the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and pancreas are unremarkable.a gj tube is present.the pigtail appears coiled within the gastric antrum.the tip is beyond the ligament of treitz.the gallbladder is unremarkable.there is no free air/fluid or pathological abdominal lymphadenopathy.

text: there are moderate sized pleural effusions at both lung bases.there is either atelectasis or inflammatory change within the adjacent lung parenchyma.although limited by the lack of intravenous contrast, there are no hypodense lesions within the liver, pancreas, adrenals, or kidneys.the spleen is not visualized.it is probably surgicall absent.there is infiltration of the abdominal mesentery with multiple small pockets of fluid.the largest pocket is seen in the upper aspect of the pelvis/lower abdomen measuring 7.5 x 6.7 cm and is located to the left of mid-line.a small area of fluid is seen to the right of the larger measuring 5.9 x 3.0 cm.
summary: successful ct guided drainage and catheter placement in a left lower abdominal fluid collection.

text: bladder is collapsed.the pelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.pelvic ascites is also present.inguinal nodes measuring up to 1 cm are present.there is no pelvic adenopathy.generalized anasarca is present in the soft tissues.
summary: tense ascites significantly larger than the prior study.no other acute intra-abdominal processes identified.however the study is limited due to non-contrast setting and streak artifacts from folded arms.a small pericardial effusion, larger than the prior study.lll opacity configuration favors atelectasis, can not exclude infection.

text: the bladder, rectum, sigmoid colon, and uterus are unremarkable.there is trace free fluid in the pelvis, within the physiological range.bone windows reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: no evidence of appendicitis.no evidence of bowel obstruction.high inferior vena cava filter.no previous studies are available to determine whether or not this position is different compared to the previous exams.numerous probable injection sites (anticoagulantion medication?) in the anterior abdominal subcutaneous tissues.

text: the study is limited due to lack of iv contrast.there are bilateral consolidations at the lung bases.the left ventricle is enlarged.there is a filling defect at the ge junction, which is concerning for a soft tissue mass extending in the gastric fundus.there is an aneurysm of the abdominal aorta, with placement of endovascular stent graft extending from the origin of sma.there is a heterogeneous content surrounding the stent, consistent with thrombus within the anuerismal wall, but external to the stent.there is a small air bubble within the thrombus, 2a:34, postsurgical.there is fluid in the left retroperitoneal space, mostly in the left pararenal space, consistent with postoperative hematoma.there is no evidence of abscess.the liver appears within normal limits.the pancreas and spleen are within normal limits.the small bowel is within normal limits.the portion of the sigmoid was removed, and there is an evidence of colostomy, 2a:52.the rest of the colon is grossly within normal limits.there is a cystic lesion in the left kidney, measuring 32 x 39 mm, 2a:34.the right kidney has a tiny cystic lesion on 2a:23, too small to characterize.there is a placement of a gj tube.there is a placement of foley catheter in the bladder.small air bubbles in the bladder due to catheter placement.otherwise, the bladder appears unremarkable.there are degenerative changes in the lumbar spine.
summary: postoperative changes in the abdominal aortic aneurysm, with endovascular stent graft placement, and thrombus external to the stent.retroperitoneal hematoma on the left.no evidence of abscess.status post sigmoid resection, and colostomy.soft tissue mass at the ge junction extending in the gastric fundus.endoscopy is warranted after patient is clinically stable.appearance is suggestive or a mesenchymal lesion.bilateral consolidation at the lung bases.enlarged heart.results were discussed with dr.___.

text: the liver is normal appearing.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the spleen is normal in appearance.fatty replacement of the pancreas is noted.the adrenal glands are normal in appearance.the left kidney is unremarkable.extending from the posterior aspect of the right upper renal pole, there is a partially exophytic 2-cm hyperdense lesion with areas of thick amorphous calcification.no additional right renal lesions are seen.the stomach, small bowel, and colon are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.no retroperitoneal hematoma is seen.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the abdomen.the aorta is normal in caliber.scattered aortic calcifications are seen.
summary: bilateral groin hematomas involving the obturator internus muscles, larger on the left.closely associated with the right groin hematoma, is a 9-mm round focus of enhancement which may represent a pseudoaneurysm, possibly involving a branch of the superficial femoral artery.no definite active extravasation is seen.asymmetric enlargement of the left lower extremity with loss of normal fat planes could be due to fluid tracking into the thigh musculature.hyperdense right renal lesion with amorphous calcifications should be further evaluated with ultrasound.

text: the distal ureters, urinary bladder, uterus, adnexa, and rectum are unremarkable.there are numerous nondistended and fluid-filled loops of small bowel.there are no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.no free pelvic fluid or air is present.
summary: interval worsening of subcutaneous inflammatory stranding and gas within the subcutaneous tissues overlying the anterior abdominal wall.finding could represent infection at the site of intradermal medicine injections.clinical correlation is recommended.unchanged appearance of the pancreas with mildly dilated duct and no evidence of surrounding inflammation or fluid collections.findings consistent with medullary nephrocalcinosis.no evidence of hydronephrosis.please note that this patient has received 13 abdominal ct's at this institution during the last six months .if symptoms persist, future imaging studies should employ non- ionizing radiation such as mri or ultasound.

text: the visualized portion of the heart is enlarged.there are sternotomy wires.there are multiple pleural plaques and focal areas of pleural thickening in the visualized portion of the lung bases.these are unchanged compared to prior study.the liver is normal, with no masses or biliary dilatation.the spleen, splenules, pancreas and gallbladder and right adrenal are normal.the left adrenal mass is unchanged in size and characteristics.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.they have no masses or hydronephrosis.the periportal lymphadenopathy is unchanged.there is no ascites.
summary: left adrenal mass, unchanged compared to prior study.if clinically indicated, this could be further evaluated with non-contrast ct or mr.2) multiple unchanged pleural plaques, consistent with prior asbestos exposure.3) no new masses or abdominal lymphadenopathy.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate subsegmental atelectasis.there are no pleural effusions or suspicious pulmonary nodules in the visualized portion of the lungs.the visualized portion of the heart and pericardium appears unremarkable except for moderate atherosclerotic calcification of the coronary arteries.there is massive distention of the entire large bowel and rectum, filled with air, fecal material and fluid.the administered rectal contrast gets diluted and is not seen beyond the level of the rectosigmoid junction.no obstructing masses or large bowel volvulus is detected.there is mild dilation of the distal small bowel loops, secondary to back pressure.the proximal small bowel loops and the stomach are decompressed.there is no free air or pneumatosis to suggest acute complications.there is a small amount of free fluid in the left inguinal hernia.the distended bowel exerts mass effect on all the intraperitoneal organs.the liver and spleen are compressed secondary to the distended bowel.the liver otherwise appears unremarkable without focal lesions or biliary dilatation.the gallbladder appears unremarkable.both kidneys show symmetric opacification and excretion of contrast without hydronephrosis or concerning renal masses.the adrenals are not definitely visualized.the abdominal aorta demonstrates mild atherosclerotic calcification without aneurysmal dilation.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is detected.the urinary bladder is decompressed.the distal ureters appear unremarkable.the prostate is moderately enlarged.no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy is detected.
summary: massive distention of the large bowel without evidence of obstructing mass or volvulus, suggests the possibility of ___ syndrome.the anus is not included in the study and anal lesion cannot be excluded in this study.mild secondary dilation of the distal small bowel.multiple sclerotic osseous lesions, concerning for metastatic disease.recommened further evaluation with bone scintigraphy, and correlation with any history of malignancy.moderately enlarged prostate gland.

text: there is massive cardiomegaly.there are bilaterally small pleural effusions.there is a dual-chamber pacemaker with the leads in the right atrium and right ventricle.there is an ng tube with the tip in the stomach.there is a tiny area of calcification in segment 8 of the liver that is unchanged when compared to the prior study and most likely represents granulomatous disease.there are no new focal lesions in the liver with the limitations of this non-contrast scan.there are multiple gallstones without evidence of cholecystitis within the limitations of this non-contrast study.the spleen, kidneys, pancreas, and small bowel are unchanged when compared to the prior study.there is no evidence of renal stones or hydronephrosis.there are vascular calcifications in the kidneys bilaterally.there is no free air.there is a moderate amount of ascites.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.

text: dense consolidations with air bronchograms are noted in the lung bases bilaterally, consistent with aspiration vs.bilateral pneumonia.small, associated pleural effusions are present.an approximately 6 mm calcification is noted at the right lung base consistent with a granuloma.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the gallbladder is distended.in the interval since the prior study, a right nephrostomy tube has been placed, as well as ivc and bilateral iliac vein stents.the patient has also undergone gastrojejunostomy and a nasogastric tube is coiled in the stomach.other than the right nephrostomy, the right kidney is unchanged.the left kidney is again identified as atrophic, but functioning as there is contrast within the renal pelvis and upper two-thirds of the ureter, and there is hydronephrosis and hydroureter to a moderate degree.as no intravenous contrast was used in the present study, this contrast in the left ureter and renal pelvis is the result of delayed excretion of contrast from recent stent placement.the small bowel loops and large bowel loops are distended and some demonstrate air/fluid levels.contrast extends through to the transverse ileum and, therefore, there is no small bowel obstruction.the colon is air and stool-filled and noncollapsed.there is a small amount of ascites.there is no free air.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: uniformally distended small and large bowel suggestive of ileus.new ascites in the interval since the prior study, which may represent peritoneal involvement of metastatic disease.anasarca.thickened bladder wall suggestive of tumor infiltration vs.chronic obstruction.status post right nephrostomy tube placement.delayed excretion from atrophied left kidney with moderate hydronephrosis and hydroureter.bibasalar aspiration vs.pneumonia.status post gastrojejunostomy and stent placement in the iliac veins and ivc.

summary: large left renal mass, not significantly changed in size compared to prior mri, with evidence of left renal vein invasion.moderate left hydronephrosis with likely tumor invasion into the collecting system.mildly distended gallbladder, with gallbladder wall edema, and mild prominence of the intrahepatic ducts.correlation with lfts and right upper quadrant symptoms is suggested.if clinical concern for acute cholecystitis, consider ultrasound for further evaluation.pulmonary metastasis, slightly increased in size from prior study.

text: no pulmonary nodules, parenchymal consolidation, or pleural effusions are seen at the lung bases.the patient is status post choledochoduodenostomy.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.air can be seen within the hepatic bile ducts near the porta hepatis and is stable compared to the prior study.the spleen, pancreas, kidneys, and adrenal glands are normal on this non-intravenous contrast enhanced ct.scattered mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen, which are not pathologically enlarged by ct criteria.the patient appears to be status post resection of the ascending, transverse, and descending colon, and likely, most of the sigmoid colon.an ileocolic anastomosis can be seen within the pelvis.additionally, and ileoileal anastomosis can be seen within the left side of the abdomen.proximally, there are several prominent loops of small bowel, the largest of which measures 5 cm immediately proximal to the ileoileal anastomosis.these appear similar to the prior study and may represent chronic post-surgical changes.contrast can be seen passing through all of the small bowel.multiple air fluid levels can be seen within the small intestine.immediately distal to the ileocolic anastomosis within the pelvis, there appears to be some bowel wall thickening, which may be due to mixing artifact.oral contrast does extend into the rectum, and there is no definite obstruction.no free fluid or free intraperitoneal air is seen.the bladder is normal.no free fluid or pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: the patient is status post cholecystectomy and choledochoduodenostomy, with intrahepatic biliary air that was seen on the prior study and is stable.the patient is status post resection of the ascending, transverse, descending, and likely the proximal sigmoid colon.an ileoileal anastomosis can be seen within the left side of the abdomen and an ileocolic anastomosis can be seen within the pelvis.there is mixing artifact within the rectum which gives the appearance of localized bowel wall thickening.there are several prominent loops of small bowel with air fluid levels seen which are stable in appearance,and oral contrast does extend through the small bowel into the rectum - no definite obstruction is seen .

text: sigmoid diverticulosis is identified without evidence of diverticulitis.foley is present within the bladder which contains nondependent air.fluid collections extend into the pelvis as described above.no pathologically enlarged pelvic lymph nodes are identified.a focal dilatation of the left superficial femoral vein (2:87) may contain thrombus.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.there is diffuse anasarca.

text: 3.9-cm round fluid collection in the midline of the pelvis is again seen, and probably represents a post-operative fluid collection or an adnexal cyst.the bladder, uterus, ureters, and bowel loops are unremarkable.the patient has apparently undergone subtotal colectomy.bone windows show degenerative changes, with near complete loss of disc height at l4-5 and grade 1 retrolisthesis of l4 on l5.no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions are seen.
