text: bilateral pleural effusions are noted, moderate to large on the left, small on the right.there is adjacent compressive atelectasis; however, underlying infection cannot be completely excluded.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there is some fluid surrounding the falciform ligament within the liver.an 18 x 17 mm hypodensity in segment v of the liver (3, 21) likely represents a simple hepatic cyst.the gallbladder shows multiple gallstones.the gallbladder wall is thickened.there is surrounding pericholecystic fluid which may represent third spacing.bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.both kidneys show multiple renal cysts.the largest is in the upper pole of the right kidney and measures 70 x 70 mm.high-density calcification is noted within the cyst wall.the largest cyst on the left measures 14 x 10 mm.thinning of the cortex is noted along the lower pole of the left kidney which may represent old pyelonephritis versus atrophy of a duplex lower pole moiety.there is a large fusiform abdominal aortic aneurysm.it starts just at or below the renal vessels and extends to the bifurcation measuring 7.4 x 7.2 x 14.7 cm.iv contrast was not given and therefore the true lumen of the abdominal aorta was not assessed.there is a focal aneurysm of the left common iliac artery.there is extensive free fluid intraperitoneally with largest pocket seen along the left side of the abdomen.additionally, a rounded pocket of fluid is noted within the pelvis.the large abdominal aortic aneurysm exerts mass effect on the third portion of the duodenum with a consequent dilation of the second part of the duodenum.there are multiple diverticula within the cecum.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are otherwise unremarkable.there is generalized anasarca.the bladder, distal ureters, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.as mentioned above, there is a rounded configuration of pelvic fluid, infection cannot be completely excluded.similarly, there is a large amount of free fluid within the abdomen, with an asymmetrically larger pocket of free fluid noted within the left part of the abdomen.however, no nodules or implants are noted.the large rounded pocket of fluid within the pelvis causes mass effect on the adjacent rectum.extensive degenerative changes are noted including anterolisthesis of l3 on l4.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions, large on the left, small on the right with adjacent compressive atelectasis; however, underlying infectious process cannot be completely excluded.hepatic hypodensity in segment v of the liver likely represents a hepatic cyst.gallbladder wall is thickened with stones and appearance complicated by third spacing.if there is continued clinical concern for cholecystitis, a hida scan can be performed.thinning of the cortex along the lower pole of the left kidney may represent old pyelonephritis versus atrophy of a duplex lower pole moiety.extensive free fluid within the abdomen and pelvis, with rounded configuration of pelvic fluid, infection cannot be excluded.extensive fluid concentrated along the left side of the abdomen with no implants or nodularity.however, infectious process cannot be completely excluded.big fusiform aneurysm is seen just at or below the renal arteries and extends up to the bifurcation with focal aneurysm of the left common iliac artery.no definite evidence for leak or enteric fistula.generalized anasarca.anterolisthesis of l3 on l4.bilateral large cysts with calcification within the right upper pole cyst wall.

text: the study is somewhat limited due to lack of intravenous contrast ___, which was not administered in this patient with elevated creatinine.the patient is post-midline ventral hernia repair, with mesh and fluid and soft tissue surrounding the postoperative bed, and subcutaneous fat stranding and fluid.there is no evidence of recurrent hernia or loculated fluid collection at the operative site.the small and large bowel is mildly distended throughout the abdomen; however, oral contrast is seen down to the rectum.there is no evidence of free air.there is no significant lymphadenopathy.the liver is unremarkable without evidence of focal liver lesion on this noncontrast study.there is hyperdense material within the gallbladder, unchanged since prior study most likely representing milk of calcium.spleen is unchanged.adrenal glands are unremarkable.note is made of multiple hypodense nodular lesions in both kidneys, as seen on the prior study.there is no hydronephrosis or calcification of the kidney.the patient is status post-placement of the ivc filter.again note is made of 8 mm small hypodensity in the uncinate process of the pancreas.

summary: acute thrombus within a right lower lobe pulmonary artery.however, this study cannot evaluate for pe in the remainder of the chest.if clinically indicated and if renal function permits a repeat study can be performed of the chest to evaluate for additional clots.normal appearance to the heart without evidence for strain.no acute findings in the abdomen or pelvis to explain patient's discomfort.air within non-dependent portion of the bladder which may be due to foley instrumentation, correlate clinically.small hiatal hernia.bilateral prominent extrarenal pelvis is stable.chronic fracture of the right inferior pubic ramus.chronic wedge deformity of l1.these findings were discussed via telephone with dr.___ at approximately 8:20 p.m.on ___.

text: mildly enlarged prostate is stable and intrapelvic bowel displays unchanged appearance to diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.urinary bladder appears unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: small simple fluid collection within the surgical bed and adjacent small right pleural effusion with mild pleural enhancement likely represent residual postoperative biloma.a few air bubbles noted within the collection may be postoperative in nature; however, underlying superinfection cannot be excluded.these findings were discussed with dr.___ shortly after exam acquisition and plan to withdraw the jp drain by approximately 5 cm and reassess in a.m.for possible percutaneous drainage was decided.mild intrahepatic ductal dilatation with biliary drain noted to be in place and coursing through fluid collection.unchanged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.stable prostatic hypertrophy and colonic diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

text: the small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is residual contrast within the cecum and ascending colon.the bladder is decompressed due to a foley catheter.there is no free fluid within the cul- de-sac.there is a small amount of fluid surrounding the distal descending colon.the osseous structures are unremarkable.there is subcutaneous edema.
summary: there is a persistent stable heterogeneous enhancing low-density mass within the liver at the level of the porta hepatis consistent with a non-liquified liver abscess.there are persistent trace amounts of free fluid surrounding the distal descending colon.there is bilateral pleural effusion and consolidations, that are unchanged.

text: the visualized portion of the lung bases does not demonstrate any pulmonary nodule, parenchymal opacification, or pleural effusion.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, pancreas, and gallbladder have normal appearance.duodenal diverticulum is unchanged.the loops of small bowel have normal appearance.there is apparent wall thickening of the ascending colon which is associated with adjacent fatty stranding.the remainder of the colon demonstrates diverticulosis with no evidence of diverticulitis.no free air or pneumatosis is visualized.
summary: new circumferential wall thickening of the ascending colon is associated with adjacent fatty stranding.findings are concerning for ischemic colitis.infectious/inflammatory colitis are less likely.colonic diverticulosis with no evidence of diverticulitis.unchanged tiny fat-containing umbilical hernia and bilateral inguinal hernias.

text: unfortunately, there is poor opacification of the venous structures, however there is no expansion to suggest presence of acute thrombus.contrast is seen excreted in the ureters into the bladder.the urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid or pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the pelvic small bowel loops are non- dilated.there is no mass in the pelvis.the aorta and proximal common iliac arteries contain atherosclerotic calcifications without aneurysmal dilatation.prominent bilateral inguinal lymph nodes are noted; however, do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: no definite evidence of deep venous thrombosis.no pelvic mass or obstructing lesion.no small-bowel obstruction.

text: colonic mural thickening depicted on the previous study is no longer present and a moderate amount of stool is seen throughout the otherwise unremarkable colon.free fluid fills dependently in the pelvis.subtle details obscuring the pelvis secondary to beam hardening artifact from a right hip prosthetic.the urinary bladder contains a foley catheter and a moderate amount of gas is presumably related to instrumentation.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.there is no inguinal or pelvic sidewall lymphadenopathy.
summary: overall, similar appearance to ___ with dilation throughout of the small bowel without evidence of complete obstruction or pneumatosis.colonic mural thickening and hyperenhancement is no longer present.ascites and decreased pleural effusions.left lateral pulmonary opacity, likely atelectatic and unchanged.unchanged pancreatic hypodensities and cholelithiasis.

text: the lung bases are clear.a small right pleural effusion is noted.there has been interval removal of a hepatic drainage catheter.there is interval continued decrease in the fluid collections seen within the previously noted bilobed hepatic abscess.specifically, the size of the cavity has decreased from 3.8 to 2.2 cm in maximum short axis diameter.in addition, there has been progressive development of granulation tissue on the periphery of the noted hepatic fluid collection.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation and the portal vein is patent.the pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal.the spleen is enlarged.there is no ascites or free air.the intra-abdominal bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: interval removal of hepatic drainge tube with reduction in abscess size and interval development of granulation tissue.as such, no drainage tube is to be re-introduced at this time.recommendation is for follow up ct in several weeks prior to the discontinuation of antibiotic treatment.

text: there are dependent areas of airspace opacity at the visualized lung bases.given the proximity of the airways that course through these opacities, they more likely represent atelectasis.there is a small right pleural effusion and a minimal left pleural effusion.evaluation of the solid abdominal organs is somewhat limited by the non- contrast technique.multiple circumscribed hypodense foci are scattered throughout the liver measuring up to 2.5 cm.the larger measure simple fluid density and are consistent with cysts.several are too small to definitively characterize.the spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is free passage of oral contrast through to the rectum.there is no evidence of obstruction or inflammatory change of the bowel.the appendix fills with contrast and is normal.there is no free intra-abdominal gas or fluid.the patient is status post prior ventral hernia repair with mesh noted inferior to the xiphoid process.
summary: airspace opacity of the dependent bilateral lower lobes is thought more likely to represent atelectasis; however, underlying infection cannot be definitively excluded.small right pleural effusion and minimal left pleural effusion.multiple well-defined hypodense foci scattered throughout the liver, the larger of which are consistent with cysts.several smaller lesions are too small to definitively characterize.numerous sigmoid diverticula without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

text: again noted within the left kidney is a small perinephric fluid collection (measuring 24 x 17 mm) with a percutaneous drain appropriately positioned within it.this is decreased in size compared to the prior exam (30 x 46 mm).a double-j stent is noted in appropriate position with a decrease in interval hydronephrosis.there is a single 10-mm stone within the hilum of the left kidney.other multiple stones seen on the prior exam are not seen on the current exam.the right kidney, pancreas and both adrenals are normal.there is a 14-mm retroperitoneal left-sided node (2:35) which is decreased in size from the prior exam (18 mm).multiple other scattered lymph nodes are seen within the retroperitoneum.no mesenteric or abdominal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria is present.the small and large bowel is normal.the appendix is normal.no abdominal free fluid or free air is present.
summary: interval decrease in left hydronephrosis and left perinephric fluid collection with a double-j stent and left percutaneous catheter in appropriate position.left 10-mm renal stone.

text: there is partial dependent collapse of both lower lobes with a small amount of associated pleural effusion.the liver is fatty (hounsfield units of 20).there is hyperdense material within the gallbladder which in the context of melena could represent pneumobilia, but could also be attributed to the adjacent hypodense appearance of the fatty liver.the pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is mild, bilateral, perinephric stranding.the kidneys are normal on this noncontrast study.no renal calculi are seen.there is no hydronephrosis.large and small bowel are adequately visualized and show no areas of wall thickening or dilatation.there are no focal areas of mesenteric stranding.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.fatty liver with high intensity material in the gallbladder.this likely represents sludge.however, if the patient is known to have gi bleed, this could represent hemobilia.no evidence of deep venous thrombosis on noncontrast study.please note that a noncontrast ct scan is sensitive for the the detection of venous thrombosis.

text: foley catheter is present within the urinary bladder.both ureters opacify well and are normal in caliber.again seen is presacral inflammatory change, which has improved compared to the prior study.a focal low-density presacral fluid collection has decreased in size, now measuring 19 x 14 x 10 mm, previously 26 x 21 x 15 mm on ___.
summary: no acute change in appearance of the abdomen and pelvis compared to ___.no obstruction.improvement in presacral inflammation with interval decrease in size of fluid collection at this site.please note that the patient has had a total of 40 ct examinations since ___ and efforts to minimize radiation exposure are recommended.pelvic mri could be considered for future diagnostic evaluation if possible.er dashboard wet read placed at 22:40 on ___.

text: the bladder is collapsed, containing a foley catheter.calcifications are again noted within the prostate gland.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.there is extensive, diffuse edema of the subcutaneous soft tissues.degenerative changes are again noted throughout the spine.
summary: bilateral peribronchial opacities at the visualized lung bases, consistent wity pulmonary edema.this may be secondary to congestive heart failure, varicella pneumonia, or ards.bilateral pleural effusions.slight interval decrease in the size of peripancreatic fluid collections.nonobstructing left renal stone.

text: there are multiple amorphous calcifications throughout the uterus in particular (2:66) measuring 2.5 x 1.6 cm, likely calcified degenerative fibroids.off the anterior aspect of the uterus is a heterogeneous mass measuring 9.5 x 7.7 cm, which may be a necrotic exophytic fibroid; however, maligancy cannot be excluded.there is stranding of fat adjacent to this mass with normal appearing adjacent bowel.along the right lateral border of the uterus is a heterogeneously enhancing 5.6 x 4.2 cm mass which appears to arise off the uterus and again may represent a large uterine fibroid; however, its etiology is not completely characterized.in the possible area of the right adnexa is a multilobulated mass with fat density component measuring 4.4 x 2.6 cm (2:65) with the punctate area of calcification in its wall and enhancing solid components.apparently contiguous with this fat density mass is a heterogeneous mass measuring 4.9 x 3.2 cm (2:61).the uterine veins (2:55) are seen to drain this structure and therefore may represent a complex right adnexal dermoid.the left adnexa is not clearly identified from adjacent loops of bowel.there is soft tissue thickening (2:82), along the posterior wall of the rectum, may represent hemorrhoids.there is severe sigmoid and descending colonic diverticulosis with sigmoid diverticulitis.no free air, no free fluid is seen in the abdomen or pelvis.no significant inguinal adenopathy is identified.there are scattered pelvic nodes, not pathologically enlarged.there is a fat- containing abdominal ventral hernia (2:54).
summary: severe sigmoid and descending colonic diverticulosis with mild diverticulitis.recent colonoscopy showed no masses.multiple fibroids with several degenerating fibroids with large right complex exophytic fibroid.anterior fiborid appears necrotic, however, maligancy cannot be excluded and gynecologic evaluation for surgical management is recommended.if no surgery is performed, short-term follow-up in ___ weeks is recommended with mri or ct.right adnexal mass which has features consistent with a complex dermoid.gynecologic evaluation for surgical management is recommended.heterogeneous mass adjacent to the right border of the uterus, is likely a uterine fibroid.the left adnexa is not clearly identified.no evidence for ischemic colitis.no bowel obstruction or dilation.fat- containing ventral hernia.bilateral adrenal calcifications, which may be due to granulomatous disease or remote hemorrhage.findings were discussed with ___ ___ at 5pm on ___.

text: there is a large amount of stool within the sigmoid colon and rectum.the urinary bladder, distal ureters, and adnexa are unremarkable.an iud is noted in the otherwise unremarkable uterus.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement is noted.
summary: mildly distended loops of distal ileum just proximal to the ileosigmoid anastomosis without definite transition point and contrast passes to the sigmoid colon.findings are nonspecific and may be related to post-surgical change.large amount of fecal material within the sigmoid and rectum.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 10:30 p.m.on ___.

text: a large calcified fibroid uterus is noted.there are also adnexal vascular calcifications.the ureters are not visualized in their entire course, however, there is no indirect evidence of obstructive ureteric calculus.the bladder is displaced leftward by the enlarged uterus and grossly unremarkable.rectum, sigmoid colon, and pelvic bowel loops are normal.there is no evidence of diverticulosis or diverticulitis.there is no inguinal or iliac chain adenopathy.
summary: no evidence of diverticulosis or urinary tract calculi.unchanged large calcified fibroid uterus.2.9-cm low-attenuation left renal lesion larger than prior study.further evaluation with mr would be optimal.however, given the patient's renal failure, us as an initial study is recommended.

text: there has been no significant change in the appearance of the pelvis.there is subcutaneous inflammatory change and edema in the region of the right groin.the rectum and interpelvic bowel loops are unremarkable.a foley catheter is within a collapsed urinary bladder.there is no free air or free fluid within the pelvis.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no change in appearance of the spleen.no change in appearance of right groin.no evidence of intra abdominal abscess.

text: linear density in both lung bases is most suggestive of atelectasis.pacemaker leads are incompletely imaged.calcification lies in the region of the interatrial septum.the right atrial chamber appears enlarged.the attenuation of the liver appears diffusely increased.the gallbladder is absent.the spleen, pancreas and left adrenal gland are unremarkable.there is no evidence of pancreatitis or pancreatic pseudocyst.a 2.4 x 2.9 cm right adrenal nodule is similar in size dating back to ___ and compatible with an adenoma.numerous bilateral renal cortical lesions are seen, some of which are suggestive of simple cysts, and others of which appear slightly complicated by either high attenuation, or fine mural calcification.the kidneys themselves appear to be atrophic.there is no bowel dilatation, or free fluid or pathologic lymph node enlargement within the abdomen or pelvis.calcification of the abdominal aorta and common iliac arteries is moderate.
summary: no evidence of pancreatitis or pancreatic pseudocyst.stable mild increased attenuation of the liver may be related to amiodarone or _____.clinical correlation is recommended.

text: diffuse hypodense metastases are seen throughout the liver, with the most significant involvement in segments v and viii, though all segments are involved.a tubular hypodensities in the region of the left portal vein might represent thrombosis (301b: 21-22), which would be better evaluated with ultrasound, though intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is not excluded.the gallbladder contains hyperdense material within the superior aspect of its lumen, possibly adherent sludge or stones.there is no extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the pancreas and spleen are normal.the adrenals are normal bilaterally.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast enhancement and brisk bilateral excretion without masses, hydronephrosis, or stone.the stomach is collapsed and therefore not well evaluated.loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and enhancement.the small bowel mesentery is normal.there is a mild to moderate amount of intra-abdominal free fluid.there is no free air.the aorta is normal in caliber along its course, there is no pathologic retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: widespread metastases to the lung and liver of unclear primary.tubular hypodense structures in the left lobe of the liver could represent either possible left portal vein thrombosis or mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation and may be better assessed with ultrasound if indicated.sclerotic foci within the pelvis are noted.while these may represent bone islands, given the concern for metastatic disease, a bone scan could be used to further evaluate these findings.moderate ascites.

text: an enlarged transplanted kidney is seen within the right pelvis.on delayed contrast-enhanced images of approximately five minutes, there is no excretion of the iv contrast by the transplanted kidney.there is a mild amount of perinephric stranding.infero-medial to the transplanted kidney, there is an approximately 2.2 x 2.0 cm rounded fluid collection with enhancing walls.this collection is adjacent to surgical clips and does not appear to communicate with the surrounding bowel.the transplanted kidney demonstrates no evidence of enhancing masses or calculi.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.the remaining pelvic structures are unremarkable in appearance.the bladder does not fill with iv contrast.the visualized soft tissues and osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: 2 cm contained fluid collection located infero-medial to the transplanted kidney, as described above.this could represent a seroma, urinoma, lymphocele or small abscess in the proper setting.these findings were immediately telephoned to the vascular surgery resident caring for the patient at beeper #___.

text: the bladder, sigmoid, prostate, and seminal vesicles appear normal.there is a central venous catheter passing into the left common iliac vein.on the few most inferior images of the study, there is a hematoma in the left inferior iliopsoas muscle of approximately 9 x 4 cm in axial dimensions, adjacent to the iliac vein.no other hematomas is identified.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid.
summary: open anterior abdominal wound, with mesenteric edema, probably from postsurgical changes.bibasilar atelectasis and effusions.hematoma of the left iliopsoas muscles in the groin.unremarkable appearance of transplanted kidneys on these noncontrast views.the presence of the hematoma was discussed with surgery at the time of interpretation.

text: there is diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.fluid is seen in the deep pelvis.there is air throughout the colon.the uterus and urinary bladder are within normal limits.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis at the lung bases.two low density foci within the liver that are too small to characterize by ct.intraabdominal ascites and a significant amount of fat stranding and fluid within the mid mesentery.adjacent to this is a angulated loop of small bowel.these are non-specific findings and could be due to developing pancreatitis, recent procedure or developing small bowel obstruction.this should be followed closely.intraabdominal ascites.diverticulosis.

text: there is interval development of infiltrative hypodensity within hepatic segment viii/___, new from the prior study.these findings are best seen on images 46 and 48 of series 3.there are tiny left hepatic hypodensities (3:52 and 3:57), too small to characterize.right renal cysts are stable.the abdominal viscera are otherwise normal in appearance.mildly prominent left paraaortic lymph nodes are seen (3:59).there is no free fluid.mild nodularity in the anterior omentum is likely vascular (3:72).there are mild degenerative changes of the spine.
summary: interval development of infiltrative hypodensity within the high right hepatic lobe (junction of segment viii and ___), highly suspicious for metastatic disease.two very small hypodense left hepatic lesions are too small to characterize.mildly prominent left paraaortic lymph node.soft tissue density in the posterior mediastinum is stable and likely reflects post-esophagectomy changes.

text: the bladder, rectum, and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.
summary: subcutaneous air and several tiny hyperdense foci consistent with shrapnel in the soft tissues of the right flank.consolidation in the right lower lobe consistent with developing contusion.there is a small area of lucency within consistent with a small laceration.over-distended endotracheal tube cuff.

text: the liver is normal in shape and contour.there are no focal hepatic lesions.the portal veins are patent.there is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilation.the patient is status post a cholecystectomy with clips in the gallbladder fossa.the common bile duct is unremarkable without evidence of dilation.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.in the left kidney, a cyst in the mid pole (2, 71) has collapsed in comparison to the prior exam.there is mild amount of surrounding stranding.this is likely a subacute finding.there is no surrounding hematoma or evidence of a renal laceration.multiple other stable simple-appearing cysts are unchanged in appearance.no new renal masses are identified.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast appropriately.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable, other than a stable duodenal diverticulum.there is no evidence of obstruction.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.there is no abdominal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the descending aorta.overlying the flank of the left mid abdomen, there is a subcutaneous hematoma which measures approximately 6.3 x 2.1 cm (2, 91).there is hyperdense material within the hematoma suggesting active extravasation.
summary: left flank subcutaneous hematoma with evidence of active extravasation.consolidation in the right upper lobe is new from ___ and has the appearance of a mass.recommend evaluation with pet-ct to exclude a malignancy.stable pulmonary nodules in the left upper and left lower lobes.these also can be further evaluated on pet-ct.collapsed left renal cyst, likely subacute.severe bullous emphysema.no solid organs injury.no acute fracture.results were communicated with the surgery resident, dr.___, at the time of the wet read was updated at 2:30 p.m.on ___ via telephone by dr.___.

text: the partially visualized lung bases demonstrate bibasilar dependent atelectasis with minimal left pleural effusion.the heart appears unremarkable.the spleen, adrenals appear normal.there is a hyperdense sludge in the gallbladder (2:33) but no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid to suggest cholecystitis.the liver parenchyma appears unremarkable; however, there is intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation which appears similar to study performed on ___.there is dilation of the cbd to 15 mm (2:24), which also appears similar to prior study.the pancreas and stomach appear unremarkable.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without hydronephrosis.there is a hypodensity in the interpolar region of the left kidney (2:29), too small to characterize but is stable in appearance.along the patient's left flank, at the level of the pancreas, is an area of scar extending from the skin to the tail of the pancreas.there are locules of gas in this area of soft tissue and this corresponds to a site of prior abscess and drainage.the drainage catheter has been removed in the interval between ___ and the current study.traces of hyperdense material in this prior collection are likely due to loculated barium from prior fistula formation.there are multiple areas of anastomotic bowel suture.the patient is status post total colectomy.
summary: fluid collection in the subcutaneous tissue in the left flank at the site of prior catheter drainage insertion site.a fisula communication is not clearly demonstrated.fluid collection adjacent to the left psoas at the site of prior collection, which has now begun to reexpand, but does not appear drainable.the previous collection adjacent to the pancreas contains a few locules of air, but is otherwise unremarkable and no longer contains a drainage catheter.sludge within the gallbladder, but no evidence for cholecystitis.persistent and unchanged intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation and cbd dilation.status post total colectomy with j-pouch ileoanal anastomosis without evidence for bowel obstruction.these findings were discussed in detail in person with the surgical resident, dr.___ on the morning of ___.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions, with bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.there is a trace pericardial fluid.the lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of the abdominal viscera for focal lesions.the liver is unremarkable.the gallbladder is nondistended.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 14 cm in craniocaudal dimension.a rim-calcified lesion closely associated with the posterior lateral aspect of the spleen measures 2 cm in diameter.the pancreas is unremarkable.the adrenals appear normally.within the left kidney, an upper pole renal cyst measures 16 mm in diameter.the right kidney is unremarkable.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber, with dense vascular calcifications distally extending into the iliac arteries.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.the stomach, small bowel, and colon are normal in caliber.there are numerous colonic diverticula, without evidence of diverticulitis.calcified leiomyomas in the uterus are noted.there is a foley catheter non-dependently in the urinary bladder, which may be due to instrumentation.there is a fat-containing left inguinal hernia.there are degenerative changes of the lumbar spine, greatest at l3-4 and l4-5, where there is loss of disc height, endplate sclerosis and vacuum disc phenomenon.
summary: no evidence of bowel obstruction or other acute abnormality of the abdomen or pelvis.bilateral lower lobe atelectasis and small bilateral effusions.small pericardial effusion.splenomegaly.diverticulosis, with no evidence of diverticulitis.

text: there is a large amount of free fluid within the pelvis.there are extensive calcifications within the vas deferens and pelvic vasculature.
summary: no definite evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.ascites, some of which is higher than simple fluid attenuation, suggesting possible exduate.extensive calcifications within the coronary vessels.significant calcifications are also seen within the aorta and all of its branches.probably chf with bilateral small effusions.

text: there is minimal basilar atelectasis.the liver and adrenals are unremarkable.the gallbladder and spleen have been removed.there is a small splenule.a small cyst in an otherwise normal left kidney is stable.there is a 9 mm obstructing stone in the proximal right ureter.there is resultant mild right hydronephrosis.this stone was seen within the kidney on the prior study.stomach and bowel are normal.there is no free abdominal fluid or free air.there is no significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: 9 mm proximal right ureteral stone with resultant mild right hydronephrosis.

text: the ___ pouch is visualized in its entirety to the suture line and is within normal limits.the bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is no pelvic free fluid or free air.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic changes within the visualized skeleton.coronal reformats redemonstrate the above findings.
summary: interval improvement in left upper quadrant inflammatory process.small residual fluid collection as described above.this is too small to drain.

text: the included portions of the lung bases demonstrate pleural effusions, right greater than left with bibasilar atelectasis.leads from a pacemaker are seen entering the right atrium and the right ventricle.the patient is status post median sternotomy.within the abdomen, free air is seen tracking beneath the right hemidiaphragm as well as locules of air adjacent to the duodenum.no significant amount of free fluid is seen.a small focal round fluid collection along the pancreatic head measures 2.0 x 1.4 cm in axial dimensions (2c:28).there is pneumobilia and a biliary stent is in place, from recent ercp.an abdominal drain is seen with tip in the post-surgical bed from cholecystectomy and courses external to the abdomen.aside from pneumobilia, the liver appears normal.the spleen, adrenal glands, and left kidney appear normal.the right kidney contains a hypodensity in the upper pole incompletely characterized (2c:20).several fluid and air-filled loops of small and large bowel appear slightly distended; however, not obstructed.no lymphadenopathy is seen.within the pelvis, a small amount of free fluid is seen within the pelvis.the bladder contains a foley catheter.there is diverticulosis, however, no evidence of diverticulitis.the soft tissues demonstrate diffuse anasarca.there are significant degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine with dextroscoliosis and multilevel loss of disc space height and marginal osteophyte formation.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.
summary: inflammatory changes and free air but no drainable collection.free air of uncertain significance in the setting of recent surgery although bowel perforation cannot be excluded.small focal fluid collection adjacent to the pancreas.distended fluid-filled loops of bowel suggest an ileus.bibasilar atelectasis and effusions.biliary stent and pneumobilia consistent with recent ercp.abdominal drain with tip in the surgical bed.

text: small pelvic free fluid has decreased.the uterus, ovaries and bladder are unremarkable.the iliac vessels are symmetric, without evidence of thrombus.no abscess is detected.
summary: overall progression of disease, as above.most notably, there has been interval growth of a large heterogeneous mass in the left iliopsoas muscle, probably representing metastatic growth as well as hemorrhage.

text: there has been interval thickening of the sigmoid bowel wall in the left pelvis with associated increase in soft tissue attenuation and fluid adjacent to this area with an area of higher attenuation in the center suggesting extravasation of dilute contrast.also there is new small extraluminal air bubbles concerning for perforation.again an abscess cavity with a drainage catheter in place is present in the right deep pelvis with associated fluid and gas.a portion of this abscess tracks across the midline and a small fluid collection measuring 2.0 x 1.4 cm is seen in the midpelvis just anterior to the bifurcation of the aorta into the iliac arteries.this collection has not changed from the prior exam.
summary: new thickening of the sigmoid colon wall with associated increase in soft tissue density of the adjacent pericolonic fat.overall this appearance is concerning for an inflammatory infectious process involving the colon including pseudomembranous colitis, infectious etiologies or ischemia.the associated soft tissue density adjacent to this and small small bubbles of gas are concerning for perforation.close monitoring is warranted.persistent abscess in the right pelvis that has not changed significantly from the prior study.the pigtail catheter is still in place.the clinicians caring for the patient were notified immediately of these findings via telephone and then the images were reviewed in-person with both the attending surgeon and medicine attending caring for the patient.

text: the bladder and uterus are stable in appearance.again seen are fibroids within the uterus, which are unchanged in comparison to the prior exam.no free fluid is noted.
summary: again seen are changes related to the patient's prior pancreaticoduodenectomy, right hepatic lobectomy, and cholecystectomy.no evidence of disease recurrence.no abnormalities to explain the patient's current symptoms.fibroid uterus.

text: a foley catheter is in place with small amount of air within the bladder.a rectal tube is noted.rectum and sigmoid colon also demonstrate bowel wall thickening and edema.moderate amount of free fluid is seen within the pelvis.there is no free air.the uterus demonstrates duplicated endometrial cavity, compatible with a septate uterus.there is possible duplication of the cervix as well, which would signify uterus didelphys.there is a 3.3 x 3.9 cm fibroid involving the left wall of the uterus (300b:40).there is no free air within the pelvis.moderate amount of ascites noted.
summary: marked bowel wall thickening, edema and mural stratification involving entire large bowel and terminal ileum.the above findings are most compatible with an infectious, or inflammatory etiology.moderate amount of ascites.small nonhemorrhagic right pleural effusion with adjacent small consolidation, which may represent atelectasis or infection in the appropriate clinical setting.moderate pericardial effusion.a focal hepatic hypodensity, incompletely characterized on this single phase exam, may represent a cyst, hemangioma or hamartoma.uterine fibroid and a septated uterus.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, uterus, bilateral adnexa are unremarkable.redemonstrated is a presacral fluid collection decreased in size, now measuring 2.8 x 1.9 cm (series 2: image 68).
summary: interval decrease in size of multiple fluid collections as detailed above including bilateral retroperitoneal fluid collections with drains in place and a small presacral fluid collection.no new fluid collections demonstrated.the patient is status post ptbd in standard position with extensive pneumobilia.perfusion anomaly of the liver, unchanged.stable attenuation of the portal vein at the confluence with the smv and obliteration of the splenic vein.

text: although, the urinary bladder is not optimally distended, there is a suggestion of mild bladder wall thickening.there is no pelvic free fluid or adenopathy.multiple phleboliths are seen.
summary: proctocolitis from the rectum to the level of the sigmoid colon, with associated inflammatory stranding and fibrofatty proliferation.these findings are consistent with ulcerative colitis flare.no abscess or free air.while bladder wall thickening may be due to underdistention.cystitis cannot be excluded.correlate with urinalysis.findings entered into the emergency dashboard at the time of interpretation.

text: there is a persistent low attenuation right pleural effusion, with adjacent compressive atelectasis.the left pleural effusion is slightly smaller.there is also atelectasis at the left base.again noted is a fluid collection surrounding the distal part of the aorto-aortic graft, which communicates with a fluid collection within the left basilar pleural space.this appearance has not significantly changed.an enhancing rim about the fluid collection is again noted.the fluid collection is again noted to contain a intermediate density fluid, without gas.it measures overall approximately 11 x 7 mm in axial dimensions.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys appear normal.there is a gastrostomy tube in a similar position in the right upper quadrant.the antrum is herniated into a midline ventral hernia with a similar appearance.the small and large bowel are unremarkable without dilatation or wall thickening.there is a small-to-moderate amount of low- density ascites, somewhat increased since the prior study.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air.
summary: unchanged appearance of fluid collection surrounding the distal portion of the aorto-aortic graft, again contiguous with a pleural fluid collection.persistent right effusion.unchanged ventral hernia.increased ascites.

text: the lung bases are clear.visualized lung bases demonstrate minimal atelectatic changes.no pericardial or pleural effusions are seen.within the limitations of a non-contrast study, the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands are normal.hypoattenuating lesions in the interpolar region of the right kidney and exophytically arising from the lower pole of the left kidney, incompletely characterized on this study, but fulfilling criteria for cysts on the prior enhanced study.the patient is status post repair of an incarcerated hernia.at the repair site in the midline, there is expected post-surgical stranding.at the level of the repair site and more cranially, there are multiple dilated small bowel loops with air-fluid levels.virtually all ingested p.o.contrast is located in the gastric fundus and has not progressed into even the proximal small bowel.therefore, further characterization of a possible small-bowel obstruction is difficult to make; however, given collapsed distal small bowel loops, high-grade distal obstruction is very likely.engorged mesenteric vessels are noted in the segments supplying these normal bowel loops, more pronounced than on the prior study.there is no ascites.
summary: multiple dilated small bowel loops with air-fluid levels in the mid- abdomen centered around the surgical site.given decompressed distal small bowel loops, these findings are consistent with high-grade distal small-bowel obstruction.evaluation is limited as p.o.contrast has not passed beyond the stomach, which may also relate to the degree of obstruction.serial plain film radiographs are recommended to assess for p.o.contrast progression, as discussed with the general surgery team at time of interpretation.bilateral renal cysts, characterized previously.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.degenerative changes in the spine, most pronounced at the l3/l4 level.

text: again noted are multiple loculated fluid collections with rim enhancement, mostly in the right lower quadrant.there is a stable appearance of soft tissue density surrounding the aorta, unchanged the prior exam.the distal ureters and urinary bladder appear unremarkable.the rectum is within normal limits.bone windows demonstrate no evidence of suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: there is moderate intra-hepatic biliary ductal diltation, with multiple tiny foci of gas noted within the biliary tree.the above findings most likely related to recent ercp.slight improvement in the degree of multiple fluid collections with rim enhancement, mostly in the right lower quadrant.also noted is interval removal of one of the two pigtail drains in the right lower quadrant.

text: two dominant and large pelvic masses are seen.the larger of these is on the right, measuring 11.7 cm ap oblique x 18.5 cm tv oblique x 22.0 cm si oblique in size.there is a 3.3-cm cystic component at the mid to inferior aspect of this mass.this mass appears immediately adjacent to the ventral aspect of the uterine body.the left ovary measures 8.8 transverse oblique x 6.8 cm ap oblique x 10.6 cm si in size.this has similar enhancement characteristics as the larger lesion.both of these lesions show enhancement with a somewhat radial- appearing pattern of low and high density.the uterus itself appears unremarkable.a massive amount of pelvic free fluid is present, associated with the abdominal free fluid.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.the large bowel, bladder, and distal ureters appear unremarkable.of note, no definite peritoneal studding is seen.examination of osseous structures does not show lytic or sclerotic lesions suspicious for malignancy.coronally and sagittally reformatted images were also reviewed, and these images were utilized for better characterization of the location and size of the pelvic masses.
summary: bilateral ovarian masses which have apparently increased in size since the correlative ultrasound examination from ___ and extensive ascites and small bilateral pleural effusions.differential diagnosis includes malignant entities such as krukenberg tumors (see comments on the gastric wall above) or ovarian carcinoma.benign processes such as ___ syndrome, bilateral ovarian torsion or massive ovarian edema have to be considered as well as no definite peritoneal implants are seen.these findings were discussed on ___ at 16.00 with ___, the practice assistant for dr.___, who will contact dr.___ with these findings.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions with adjacent atelectasis.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, kidneys and right adrenal gland are unremarkable.there is a small left adrenal mass, with houndsfield units less than 10, likely representing a simple adenoma.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is diffuse prominence of the small bowel, measuring up to a maximum of 3 cm in diameter, and likely representing a post-operative ileus.on delayed images, however, the oral contrast is seen passing distal to the small bowel and into the colon.there are bilateral ureteral stents, both ureters promptly excreting the iv contrast.there is no hydronephrosis.
summary: s/p radical cystoprotatectomy with a small area of contrast extravasation anterior to the neobladder well distal to the ureteral implants, as described above.most likely location for leak is the anterior portion of the loop to expanded resevoir anastamosis.2) probable post-operative ileus.these findings were discussed with the house staff at pager ___ on ___.

text: the uterus again shows irregular appearance of the endometrial cavity with suggestion of heterogeneous enhancement (300b:24) that is nonspecific but may be further evaluated with pelvic ultrasound.probable ovarian follicular activity seen bilaterally.there are no pelvic hernias.unchanged sebaceous cyst at the lower anterior chest wall (series 2, image 2).
summary: diffuse mesenteric edema, new from ___, of uncertain etiology or significance.ddx includes hypervolemia, infectious or inflammatory change of the bowel or mesentery, mesenteric stranding due to ischemic bowel, or other less likely entities such as lymphoma or chronic mesenteritis.no history of peritoneal dialysis per clinical team.no evidence of vascular compromise in this limited study, but clinical correlation (including lactate level) and mesenteric cta might be considered to rule out mesenteric ischemia.distended gallbladder.no specific ct evidence of cholecystitis but ultrasound or hida could be obtained for further evaluation if clinical symptoms warrant.atrophic kidneys and renal osteodystrophy.findings discussed with dr.___ at 8:30 p.m.by dr.___.additional finding #2 paged to ___ ___ at 10:45 am on ___.

text: the ng tube is seen with its tip in the stomach.there are gallstones seen in the gallbladder.in addition, there are calcifications of the gallbladder wall seen on series 2, images 48-50.the liver is unremarkable.there is a 3 mm stone in the mid pole of the left kidney.there is an exophytic lesion off the mid pole of the left kidney as well which cannot be characterized fully on this non-iv contrast study.there is a large retroperitoneal hematoma extending from the right iliacus muscle into the right psoas and extending superiorly with displacement of the right kidney anteriorly.its largest cross-sectional measuring is approximately 11 x 11 cm with a fluid-fluid level.there is no free air in the abdomen.
summary: large retroperitoneal hematoma extending through the right psoas and right iliacus muscles as described above.

text: the foley catheter is inflatted in the penile urethra.the appearance of the bladder is relatively unchanged from ___, containing a left double-j ureter stent coiled in the bladder.the bladder is mildly distended.there is thickening of the bladder wall posteriorly with high attenuating areas which likely represent hemorrhage.intraperitoneal air is slightly improved.the prostate is enlarged.there is a partially visualized aortoiliac graft.there is persistent free inra-peritoneal and sub cutaneous air - unchnaged from the prior study.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear with no evidence of nodules, consolidations, or effusions.within the limitations of non-contrast scan, the liver, gallbladder, spleen, stomach, pancreas, and visualized loops of small and large bowel are within normal limits.bilateral adrenal glands are within normal limits.the kidneys appear normal with no evidence of hyperdense foci to suggest nephrolithiasis.there is no hydroureter or hydronephrosis.no free fluid or free air throughout the abdomen.mildly prominent retroaortic and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are visualized; however, none of which meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: limited study due to lack of iv contrast, however, no evidence of acute abdominal or pelvic pathology.no evidence of nephrolithiasis.

text: as previously described, there is a pelvic abscess.the measurements are given above.there are surgical clips in the left iliac region.as described above, there is a small amount of free air in the abdominal wall anteriorly.there is stranding of the mesentery of the pelvis.there is diverticular disease without evidence of diverticulitis.the pelvic vessels are patent.
summary: large pelvic abscess as described above.this inflammation around the abscess is probably causing obstruction of the right ureter, leading to moderate hydronephrosis.small amount of extraluminal air in the pelvis as described aboce.dilated loops of small bowel, without evidence of transition point.this finding most likely represent ileus.air fluid level in fluid collection in the subcutaneous tissues just below the underneath the incision could represent a postoperative seroma versus infection.multiple small low attenuation areas in the liver, unchanged when compared to the most recent study and likely represent metastasis.bilateral small pleural effusions.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureters, uterus and adnexa, and rectum and sigmoid colon have normal appearance.
summary: no acute pathology is identified within the abdomen and pelvis.the appendix is normal.status post left nephrostomy tube placement with no complication.

text: the lung bases are clear.there is extensive free air in the abdomen.faint septal lines are appreciated within the air pocket above the liver.this presence of these septal line could indicate that the pneumoperitoneum is subacute vs chronic.passage of contrast is seen down into the sigmoid colon.there is no contrast leak and no free fluid.there is no abnormal bowel wall thickening.multiple surgical staple lines are seen in the mid abdomen bowel loops.a left mid- abdominal jejunostomy tube is seen with tip properly positioned within the bowel lumen.the liver, pancreas, spleen and adrenal glands are unremarkable.a 3.5 x 4.5 cm left renal exophytic cyst is present.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.
summary: free air within the abdomen.presence of septations in the air pocket above the liver and lack of free fluid and lack of extravasation of contrast could indicate subacute vs.chronic pneumoperitoneum.however, an acute perforation cannot be excluded.

text: small effusions and associated atelectasis in the bilateral lung bases.there is no focal consolidation.there is no pneumothorax.incidentally noted are large rounded soft tissue densities in the epicardial/anterior peridiaphragmatic region on the right, measuring up to 2.7 x 3.8 cm.this most likely represent enlarged lymph nodes.the liver is grossly unremarkable.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.there are no focal lesions, within the limits of a non-contrast study.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.there are no adrenal nodules or masses.the kidneys demonstrate perinephric stranding bilaterally, nonspecific, with no hydronephrosis or contour-altering renal mass lesions.the stomach and duodenum are normal.however, there are numerous omental soft tissue nodules scattered throughout the abdomen and pelvis, with a larger mesenteric/small bowel soft tissue mass identified in the mid abdomen.this is spiculated and tethers multiple adjacent bowel loops, and contains a punctate focus of calcifications.the large bowel is unremarkable.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is no evidence for retroperitoneal hematoma.psoas muscle and paraspinal muscles are symmetric.intra-aortic balloon pump is identified.the tip is visualized at the upper margins of the study, approximately 9 cm above the crus of the left hemidiaphragm.of note, the inferior aspect of the balloon is located approximately 3 cm above the aortic bifurcation, with the inflated balloon appearing to occlude the bilateral renal arteries.
summary: no evidence for retroperitoneal hematoma.intra-aortic balloon pump is low in position, with the distal balloon located approximately 3 cm above the aortic bifurcation, and the balloon, when inflated, appearing to occlude the bilateral renal arteries.repeat chest x- ray, with comparison of position relative to chest x-ray performed on ___, is recommended.spiculated mesenteric soft tissue mass with a punctate foci of calcification, and numerous omental/peritoneal soft tissue implants.markedly enlarged diaphragmatic lymph nodes are also seen in the chest.findings are highly concerning for malignancy.differential includes lymphoma, metastatic adenocarcinoma with primary not definitely known (small bowel adenocarcinoma would be unlikely without obstruction evident), carcinoid tumor (though the pattern of spread would be very unusual).no definit eliver lesions on limited non-contrast evaluation.if biopsy is desired prior to cabg, several of these lesions would be accessible from a percutaneous approach.these findings were communicated to ___ ___, np for the cardiothoracic surgery service, at 1:50 p.m.by dr.___ ___ on ___.additional finding not included in the initial wet ___ were communicated at 5:00 pm on ___.

text: lung bases demonstrate a large right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.there is a small left pleural effusion.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.pacemaker leads terminate in the right atrium and right ventricle.coronary artery and aortic valve annulus calcifications are noted.in the abdomen, a large defect in the left posterior hemidiaphragm is again associated with herniation of a large portion of the stomach into the left hemithorax.there is a moderate amount of ascites throughout the abdomen, also tracking into the herniated abdominal contents.the liver is shrunken and nodular in contour consistent with cirrhosis.the gallbladder again contains multiple gallstones, without acute cholecystitis.the pancreas remains atrophic, with small foci of calcification.the spleen, adrenal glands, and duodenum are unremarkable.the kidneys are atrophic.the abdominal aorta demonstrates dense atherosclerotic calcification, unchanged in contour with regions of ectasia, as previously.a saccular aneurysm extends from the right infrarenal aorta, with a maximal size of 4.4 cm, unchanged, and a fusiform infrarenal aneurysm of the aorta measures 3.5 cm, unchanged.there is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.there is no free air in the abdomen.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: no bowel obstruction or evidence of ileus.cirrhotic liver with moderate ascites.moderate right pleural effusion, unchanged.stable left diaphragmatic hernia, containing stomach without obstruction or other acute abnormality.stable saccular and fusiform aneurysms of the infrarenal aorta.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: a large-sized small bowel-containing hernia is seen in the left inguinal region.the bowel loops within it contain contrast both proximal and distal, however, the point of entry appears to be narrowed.the formerly distended cecum is now occupied by collapsed but markedly thickened and heterogenous bowel wall; this can be seen tracing back from the ostomy site to the midline of the abdomen near the point of narrowing into the closed-loop obstruction.there is vague suggestion of the proximal portion of this abnormal bowel telescoping into the distal ostomy.also seen is a hernia in the right inguinal canal, not significantly changed since the prior exam.rectal pouch seen terminating in the region of the right lower quadrant.bladder and distal ureters appear normal.prostate is normal, however, there is heterogeneity of the right seminal vesicle, unchanged since prior exam.bone windows are not significantly changed since the last exam.coronal and sagittal reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.
summary: distal right colon at ostomy concerning in appearance for ischemia vs inflammation, with markedly abnormal heterogeneous, thickened bowel wall; infection is less likely.small amount of air concerning for bowel perforation at the distal ostomy site.this was discussed with the surgical intern caring for the patient and subsequently dr.___ by telephone at 6:30 a.m., ___, ___.similar appearance to prior dilated loops of bowel in left lower quadrant concerning in appearance for closed-loop obstruction.after discussion with dr.___, this is apparently a reducible hernia.unchanged appearance of evidence of prior granulomatous infection including multiple calcified granulomata in liver, spleen, and left "putty" kidney.otherwise stable examination since ___.

text: there is bibasilar atelectasis, without effusions.within the limitations of a non-contrast study, the liver appears normal.there is density in the gallbladder which may be due to vicarious excretion of contrast or sludge.the pancreas is atrophic.the spleen is within normal limits.the kidneys were better evaluated on a recent ct.there are calcifications of the aorta.a stent graft is present, not well evaluated here.lipomatous hypertrophy of the interatrial septum is also noted.there are surgical clips in the left upper abdomen.visualized bowel is unremarkable.there is no free air or fluid, or lymphadenopathy.the right adrenal gland appears normal.there is focal thickening of the anterior limb of the left adrenal gland without a distinctive nodule.this study does not show a hypoattenuating nodule which can be characterized as an adenoma.at the patient arrived without intravenous access, and became somewhat agitated with the technologist when they attempted to place an iv, the study was stopped after the non-contrast study, although the non-contrast images cannot characterize the previously identified lesion as an adenoma on this study.
summary: similar thickened appearance of the left adrenal gland, without a definitive nodule as such.intravenous contrast was not administered, as the patient arrived without intravenous contrast and resisted placement of an intravenous catheter.however, as the thin reconstructed images here do not confirm a definite nodule, further imaging would probably not be helpful.sludge or contrast in the gallbladder.

summary: fractures of t11 and t12 with posterior fragments retropulsed into the anterior thecal sac.if not performed, recommend mri to assess cord injury.additional left rib and transverse process fractures.interval worsening of the bibasilar consolidation and atelectasis, concerning for aspiration versus pneumonia.rounded density in left lower lobe consistent with calcified granuloma.focal dilation of small bowel in left upper quadrant, of uncertain significance, although in setting of apparent trauma cannot entirely exclude bowel injury.no free air or free fluid.diffusely hypodense liver compatible with diffuse fatty infiltrate.no focal hepatic lesion detected, allowing the limits of non-contrast study.hyperdense gallbladder compatible with vicarious excretion of iv contrast into gallbladder.calcification in bladder wall of uncertain signficance.

text: evaluation is somewhat limited due to artifact from overlying arms and lack of iv contrast.the lung bases again demonstrate bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with adjacent bibasilar consolidations, which are improved and may represent compressive atelectasis although an underlying infectious process cannot be excluded.coronary artery and aortic calcifications are again noted.a small amount of fluid is noted within the subcutaneous tissues overlying the lower left ribs, likely dependent in nature.the non-contrast appearance of the adrenal glands, pancreas, stomach, gallbladder, liver, and kidneys are within normal limits.the spleen is mildy enlarged, but stable.intra-abdominal loops of bowel are also within normal limits.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.a small fat-containing umbilical hernia is unchanged.there is extensive calcification of the abdominal vasculature.again seen is an infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm which measures 4.1 x 3.4 cm in its greatest axial diameter (2:53).this is stable in size since the previous study.

text: with the exception of trace bibasilar dependent atelectasis, the lung bases are without pleural effusion.a focal lingular ground glass opacity is most likely infectious.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.a large abdominal ascites has increased in size since ___, layering along the liver, paracolic gutter, splenic bed and mesenteric root.the liver is small in size and nodular, compatible with cirrhosis.the gallbladder is mildly distended, containing dense material in the dependent portion, compatible with sludge or small stones.the spleen is borderline enlarged to 13 cm.small amount of perisplenic varices are evident.the pancreas is diffusely atrophic.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.a subcentimeter hypodensity within the left kidney is too small to fully characterize but likely a cyst.the stomach and small bowel appear unremarkable with the exception of terminal ileum, which appears to be thickened.again seen is diffuse colonic wall thickening and hyperemia most pronounced in the transverse and ascending colons, but also involving the descending colon with relative sparing of the sigmoid colon and rectum.overall appearance is compatible with infectious or inflammatory colitis.this has increased in severity as compared to ___ a year ago.this process extends into the terminal ileum.there are small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet size criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is non-occlusive thrombosis of the smv stemming from the portosplenic confluence extending distally.the splenic and portal veins are patent.moderate atherosclerotic calcifications are seen in the infrarenal aorta extending into iliac arteries.great branching arteries are patent.
summary: extensive wall thickening of the ascending, transverse, and descending colon.this is likely related to new smv thrombosis and underlying liver disease.no free air.cirrhosis, borderline splenomegaly, and ascites, compatible with portal hypertension.bilateral gynecomastia.cholelithiasis.smv thrombosis, non-occlusive.focal ground glass opacity in the lingula, likely infectious.recommend continued attention on follow-up to document stability or resolution.

text: there is a 3-mm pulmonary nodule at the left lung base, (2, 2) which is stable when compared to prior exam.coronary artery calcifications along the descending aorta are noted.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.within the limits of a non-contrast examination, the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands are unremarkable.the liver is normal in appearance.there is no evidence of biliary dilatation.the gallbladder is distended, new when compared to prior exam.again identified is a 5-mm calcified gallstone in the dependent portion of the fundus (2, 39).there is no pericholecystic fluid.the common bile duct is dilated measuring approximately 1.4 cm, similar in appearance.the kidneys appear to have a lobulated contour, unchanged and better evaluated on prior mri.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.small bowel loops appear dilated, measuring up to 3.3 cm.oral contrast is seen within the proximal ileum.in the left lower quadrant, (2, 63), there appears to be a transition point with distally collapsed small bowel loops.these findings are concerning for early small- bowel obstruction.there is no free fluid or free air.

summary: right pneumothorax.tiny left pneumothorax.the left chest tube is appropriately placed.there is no mediastinal shift.pneumomediastinum.subcutaneous emphysema.no evidence of aortic dissection.bilateral pulmonary contusions.fractures involving c7 and t1 as dictated above.please see the separately dictated cervical spine for more details.no other spine fractures are noted on this study.a fracture of the left scapula extending close to the left glenohumeral joint.no other spine fractures demonstrated on this study.free fluid in the abdomen raises the possibility of injury to the pancreas or duodenum.although no such injury is seen on this study there should be a low threshold for repeat ct evaluation of the abdomen if the patient's clinical condition deteriorates.there is no pneumoperitoneum.

summary: interval developement of large bilateral pleural effusions, with compressive atelectasis.interval enlargement of abdominal and pelvic ascites right abdominal subcutaneous air containing mass, concerning for gas forming infection or feces.evaluation of the bowel loops deep to this is limited due to abscence of iv contrast or enteric contrast at this level.however, there appear to be several foci of gas which are not definitely within bowel lumen, raising the concern for bowel perforation.no significant pneumoperitoneum is noted.severe right hydronephrosis appears worse in the interval.the left kidney is not obstructed.multiple intra-abdominal masses, some of which represent retroperitioneal lymph nodes.the 4.5cm liver lesion is unchanged in the interval.

text: direct comparison is made to prior examination dated ___.minimal bibasilar atelectasis is noted.a moderate free intraperitoneal fluid is seen on the current study.numerous gallstones are seen.also, there is evidence of vicarious excretion of iv contrast material.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas are grossly unremarkable.a right-sided percutaneous nephrostomy tube is noted.there has been interval resolution of the previously described hydronephrosis.small, hypoattenuating area seen within the left renal parenchyma, which is too small to characterize, but likely represents a simple cyst.as on the prior examination, there is distention of numerous loops of small- bowel measuring up to approximately 4.8 cm in diameter with a transition point identified within the pelvis, well seen on images 58-63 of series 2.overall, this finding does not appear to be significantly changed since the prior study.there has been near complete resolution of the previously described pelvic fluid collection, which contained air on the prior study.there has been interval removal of the ___ ___-___ drain.residual fluid collection measuring 1 x 4 cm is noted posterior to the bladder on image #75 of series 2.pelvic structures are otherwise grossly unremarkable.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.

summary: large-volume ascites, similar to that seen on ___, without evidence of bowel obstruction.bilateral pleural effusions with consequent atelectasis.extensive atherosclerotic disease involving the coronary arteries.small focus of intravesicular gas, correlate to history of recent instrumentation (ie.foley catheter).

text: at the lung bases, there is irregular bronchial wall thickening with areas of mucoid impaction.multiple centrilobular nodules are present, right greater than left, creating a "tree-in-___" pattern.there are no pleural effusions.the heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion.a small sliding hiatal hernia is present.
