text: the liver is again nodular and cirrhotic, and paraesophageal/perigastric varices are seen.hypodensity / cyst in dome of right lobe is unchanged.the overall degree of ascites is similar to the prior study.there is no focus of high- density fluid within the ascites to suggest active hemorrhage into the abdomen.the gallbladder remains somewhat distended, measuring up to 10.4 cm in longitudinal dimension, and 3.7 cm in maximal transverse dimension (2:56, 301b:41).the spleen is borderline enlarged, measuring 12.5 cm.for a non- contrast examination, the adrenal glands, large bowel, and small bowel are unremarkable.however, the kidneys demonstrate possible mild hyperdensity of the corticomedullary junction, without frank dense nephrograms.this was not seen on the non- contrast chest ct series performed ___ and is prior contrast related.
summary: increased right chest wall hematoma with active high density areas concerning for active hemorrhage within.increased right pleural effusion, with near collapse of right lower lobe, and interval development of small left pleural effusion.unchanged mild gallbladder distention.possible hyperdensity of renal corticomedullary junction, but due to prior iv contrast.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time scan was completed.

text: rim-enhancing presacral collection is unchanged as is the amount of free fluid within the pelvic cavity.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are present.
summary: interval decrease in size to organized peripancreatic and retroperitoneal collections extending into the anterior and posterior pararenal spaces with appropriate positioning to indwelling bilateral pigtail drainage catheters.interval increase in size to simple left pleural effusion with adjacent compression atelectasis.slight interval increase in amount of nonorganized intra-abdominal ascites.no other vascular or parenchymal complications of pancreatitis identified.

text: there is extensive emphysema bilaterally.in the left lower lobe, there are patchy opacities throughout.there is no evidence for free air.the liver is without focal lesions on this non-contrast-enhanced scan.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the spleen is unremarkable.the pancreas is normal.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.in the right kidney, there is a 1.5-cm parapelvic cyst.there is no hydronephrosis in either kidney.the patient is status post aortobi- iliac stent placement.there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.the small and large bowel are normal.
summary: malpositioning of the foley catheter.the tip of the foley catheter is seen outside of the urethra in the soft tissues of the left hemipelvis with surrounding subperitoneal fluid, representing a mixture of urine and hemorrhage.the balloon of the foley catheter is inflated in the prostatic portion of the urethra.trabeculated bladder with multiple large bladder diverticula as described above.no free intra-abdominal air.status post aorto-biiliac bypass.compression fracture of l1 of indeterminate age.

text: the visualized lung bases are clear without masses, nodules or pleural effusions.the partially visualized heart demonstrates coronary artery vascular calcifications.the lack of iv contrast limits evaluation of the solid intra-abdominal organs.the liver is diffusely fatty infiltrated.cholecystectomy clips are seen in the gallbladder fossa.the kidneys, adrenals, pancreas appear normal.stomach appears normal.abdominal loops of small bowel appear normal.no free air or no free fluid is seen.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric adenopathy is present.
summary: multiple ventral hernias containing non-obstructed, nondilated loops of contrast-filled small bowel.a portion of non obstructed transverse colon is also in this ventral hernia.no free air.diffusely fatty infiltrated liver.

text: the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.intrapelvic bowel loops are normal.there is no free fluid.no pelvic lymph node enlargement is seen.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: bibasilar areas of consolidation with associated small pleural effusions, consistent with pneumonia.multiple small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes, the largest measuring approximately 1 cm.these were seen on prior exam.no abnormal bowel loops to suggest crohn's flare.no intraabdominal abscesses/fluid collection seen.scattered air fluid levels in non- dilated large and small bowel may represent a gastrointestinal infection.

text: areas of basilar atelectasis are identified, left greater than right.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion identified.a rounded splenic hypodensity measuring 2 cm in diameter is unchanged in appearance.a 1.3-cm splenule is also identified.multiple hypodense lesions are seen within the liver parenchyma, the largest measuring 1.9 cm (2, 23), are unchanged in appearance.the adrenal glands are unremarkable.a 1.8-cm hypodense lesion is seen within the right kidney which likely represents a cyst.an exophytic 1.6-cm hypodense lesion is seen within the left kidney also likely represents a cyst and is stable in appearance.extensive peripancreatic fluid collections have decreased in size.mild amount of free air is identified within the abdominal cavity and is expected after recent open surgery.small bowel loops of ileum, ascending and transverse colon have extensive intramural edema within the wall.this is more extensive and prominent when compared to prior exam and may represent sequelae of pancreatitis versus an infectious process.patient is status post cholecystectomy with surgical sutures or clips seen in expected location of gallbladder.the portal vein, splenic vein, and smv are patent.the aorta and its branches are patent.a small-to-moderate amount of free fluid is identified within the dependent portions of the pelvis.
summary: interval development of extensive bowel wall edema within the ileum, ascending and transverse colon.this is concerning for sequelae of pancreatitis versus infection.underlying inflammatory bowel disease may also have this appearance given appropriate clinical setting.interval decrease in peripancreatic fluid collections.stable appearance of splenic and renal hypodense lesions consistent with cysts.multiple hypodense liver lesions, incompletely evaluated on this study, are stable in appearance.small-to-moderate amount of free fluid within the dependent portions of the pelvis.

text: foley catheter is seen within the bladder.the uterus and rectum are normal.no free pelvic fluid or pelvic lymphadenopathy is seen.clips are seen around the uterus from prior surgery.
summary: no free fluid, free air, or evidence of bowel wall injury.there are two focal areas of low attenuation in the liver, along the falciform ligament and adjacent to the gallbladder fossa.there is no evidence of perihepatic fluid.these findings likely represent areas of focal fatty infiltration, though given the history of trauma, tiny lacerations are not entirely excluded.multiple hypodensities are seen within both kidneys bilaterally.one of these demonstrates increase density.further non-emergent evaluation with us or mr should be considered to characterize these further.

text: limited images of the lung bases demonstrate a small right pleural effusion, decreased from the prior exam, and interval resolution of left pleural effusion.minimal dependent atelectasis is noted.
summary: interval enlargement of segment vi/vii fluid collection following drain removal and second focal fluid collection containing gas in the gallbladder fossa.marked interval improvement in ascites.small right pleural effusion, decreased in size from the prior exam and interval resolution of left effusion.otherwise, stable exam.

text: a foley balloon is noted within a collapsed bladder.assessment of the pelvis is somewhat limited secondary to streak artifact from the left hip prosthesis.there is evidence of a rectal stump.the patient is status post total colectomy.several loops of small bowel within the pelvis demonstrate pneumatosis as described above (2:68).there is no free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: significant small bowel dilation and fecalization just proximal to the right mid abdominal anastomosis concerning for massive impaction.stricture at the stoma cannot be excluded.small amount of free intra- abdominal air and pneumatosis of several loops of ileum deep within the pelvis are all concerning for an ischemic process.unchanged aneurysm (x2) of the infrarenal abdominal aorta.findings were discussed with the surgical staff at the time of initial review.

text: a small right pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis is noted.the lung bases are otherwise clear.suboptimal imaging of the solid organs of the upper abdomen due to lack of intravenous contrast.however, the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are grossly normal.there is re-demonstration of multiple bilateral cortical and exophytic renal cysts, which are unchanged.in addition, there is stable appearance of stranding in the pararenal fat.the visualized loops of large bowel in the upper abdomen are normal.small bowel loops are noted to be contrast filled and distended.no lymphadenopathy.trace free fluid.no free air.arterial calcifications are noted in the aorta, renal, splenic arteries.specifically, there are calcifications at the origin of the sma with no evidence of obstruction.
summary: inflamed and thickened distal ileum with adjacent extraluminal pockets of air and question of extraluminal contrast, concerning for perforation in the distal ileum.these findings were communicated to the surgical team.small right pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis.

text: the urinary bladder, distal ureters, seminal vesicles, and rectum are normal.there is sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.the prostate is enlarged.fat containing inguinal hernias are noted bilaterally.no free fluid in the pelvis.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: unchanged appearance of known infrarenal aortic aneurysm, which measures 3.5 cm in maximal dimension, compared to 3.9 cm previously.new moderate bilateral pleural effusions measuring simple fluid attenuation with associated compressive atelectasis.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

text: the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and spleen appear unremarkable.a new gastrostomy tube is present.there is no free fluid or free air.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.multiple hyperdense left renal cysts are redemonstrated and unchanged (2:62, 67), and likely reflective of small hemorrhagic cysts.multiple hypodense renal cysts are unchanged.the patient is status post aaa repair with a dacron graft.severe atherosclerotic calcifications are unchanged.a focal area of stranding inferiorly (2:86) may represent post-surgical changes, however a small omental infarct is also a possibility.
summary: patchy consolidations with diffuse ground-glass opacities occupying the entirety of both lungs, compatible with multifocal pneumonia in the setting of waxing and ___ pulmonary edema.reticular appearance may have some contribution from interstitial lung disease as well.reactive mediastinal lymphadenopathy is present.in this acute setting, underlying interestitial lung disease cannot be evaluated.assessment for interstitial lung disease via hrct could be performed after resolution of acute medical issues.status post gastrostomy tube placement.stable post-aaa repair.a focal area of fat stranding in the omentum deep to a subcutaneous and skin surgical change may represent postsurgical change inflammation or a small area of omental infarct.multiple hemorrhagic renal cysts, unchanged.

text: dependent subsegmental atelectasis is noted, but the lung bases are otherwise clear.liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.there are multiple stones in the bilateral kidneys.the left kidney is slightly larger in size compared to the right with mild pelvic fullness/hydronephrosis with mild perinephric stranding.the largest stone is at the ureteropelvic junction measuring 7 mm.multiple small stones are noted within the renal calices, the largest in the upper pole measuring 5 mm.there is mild left hydroureter meausuring up to 7 mm.a large right renal stone is noted in the renal pelvis measuring 7 mm.a right nephroureteral stent is noted in situ.there is mild hydroureter on the right.the non-opacified stomach and intra-abdominal loops of bowel are unremarkable.no free air or fluid in the abdomen.small retroperitoneal nodes are noted adjacent to the bilateral kidneys, likely reactive and not meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.no mesenteric lymphadenopathy.ct pelvis without iv contrast.there are two calcifications within the left hemipelvis, the smaller of which was seen on the ct dating back to ___ and probably represents a phlebolith.the second lobulated appearing hyperdensity measures 5 mm and could represent a distal ureter stone.the right nephroureteral stent is noted terminating within the bladder which is otherwise unremarkable.uterus and adnexa are normal.there may be a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis; however, this is not separable from the uterus.sigmoid colon and rectum are normal.
summary: multiple bilateral renal stones with mild left hydronephrosis and hydroureter.left upj and uvj stones.right nephroureteral stent noted in situ.

text: persistent bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis versus consolidation are again noted at the lung bases and not significantly changed compared to the previous examination.please note, assessment of the intra-abdominal organs is limited secondary to patient body habitus and lack of intravenous contrast administration.a nasogastric tube terminates within the stomach.oral contrast material is noted within the stomach, duodenum and jejunum.no oral contrast has progressed into the ileum or colon at this time.the liver, spleen, pancreas, left adrenal gland, and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.a right adrenal nodule measuring at least 22 x 17 mm is again noted and slightly smaller in size compared to the previous study.this likely relates to slice selection (2:39).several air-fluid levels are noted within the colon.no bowel wall thickening or pneumatosis is evident, however.the sacrum is mildly distended measuring up to 9 cm in diameter.a minimal amount of intra-abdominal ascites is noted.there is no free intra-abdominal air.scattered colonic diverticula are additionally noted.
summary: limited study secondary to lack of intravenous contrast and patient body habitus.1.mildly distended colon likely due to chronic supine status, no associated pathology 2.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.3.unchanged small amount of intra-abdominal ascites.4.unchanged bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis versus consolidation.` 5.persistent right adrenal nodule.as before, an adrenal ct washout study is advised.

text: the bladder and distal ureters appear normal.the uterus and adnexa are normal.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the rectum and sigmoid colon are normal.no pathologically enlarged inguinal lymph nodes.the previously noted left external iliac thrombus extending to the iliac vein is no longer visualized.there are no osteolytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: there is now complete occlusion of the portal vein, splenic vein, and proximal superior mesenteric vein with multiple collateral vessels as well as cavernous transformation of the portal vein.small residual thrombus is seen in the mid superior mesenteric vein.no free fluid or evidence of bowel ischemia on this study.no acute venous thrombosis.previously seen hepatic hematomas have completely resolved.

text: there is a foley catheter within the bladder.the distal ureters are unremarkable.multiple sigmoid diverticula are present without evidence of acute inflammatory change.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymph adenopathy.there is prominence of the musculature surrounding the right pelvis.bone windows: there is a burst fracture of l1 with one fracture fragment extending into the left pedicle.additionally, there is an apparent fracture through the right l1 transverse process.no free fragments are seen within the spinal cord, but the entire inferior aspect of the l1 body is slightly retropulsed.for complete details, please see thoracic and lumbar spine dedicated ct report to follow.additionally, there is an extensive right pelvic fracture extending from the superior margin of the right iliac bone, into the acetabulum.the superior and inferior pubic rami are fractured as well.additionally, there appears to be a fracture line extending through the anterior aspect of the right sacrum.
summary: l1 burst fracture.no fragments detected within the spinal canal.extensive right pelvic fractures.full report on this as well as the l1 fracture to follow.no evidence of solid organ injury.fatty liver with nodular contour; underlying chronic liver disease is likely.correlation with laboratory studies is recommended.mri may also be of use if clinically indicated.

text: the rectum, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is a foley catheter in the urinary bladder.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: small anterior right pneumothorax.small amount of high-density pleural fluid on the right may represent blood.single nondisplaced lateral right rib fracture.no intra-abdominal traumatic injury identified.a 2.4 cm cyst of the spleen and a few tiny bilateral hypodense foci of the kidneys are too small to definitively characterize but probably cysts.er dashboard wet read placed at 10:00 p.m.on ___, and it was discussed with dr.___ ___.

atelectatic changes.there is, however, a new 2.2 cm x 1.4 cm rounded nodule along the right pleural surface (2:3), new from ___.there is a stent present within the common bile duct, unchanged in the gall stone, gall bladder is difficult to define.there is marked intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, progressed from the prior study, with previously seen pneumobilia no longer evident.these unremarkable.the pancreatic body and tail are unremarkable, without evidence for pancreatic ductal dilatation.pancreatic head is poorly defined and appears slightly full and prominent, as noted with a the low density aortic lumen, possible due to anemia.
summary: irregular soft tissue mass filling the porta hepatis and surrounding the cbd stent, presumably at the site of patient's cholangiocarcinoma, but poorly defined without iv contrast.vague ill-defined low attenuation within segment v of the liver, which appears more pronounced and larger in size from ___, which may reflect an area of neoplastic extension.cbd stent in place, but new marked intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, suggestive of biliary obstruction.new 2 cm nodule in the right lower lobe of the lung, concerning for a metastatic lesion, though unusual given the rapid time course.cholelithiasis.stable multiple hyperdense lesions in bilateral kidneys, not meeting ct criteria as simple cysts, and incompletely characterized without iv contrast.extensive diverticulosis without diverticulitis.stable infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, with crescentic area of high attenuation along the right lateral aspect, but unchanged from ___.

text: bowel loops with contrast are seen in the pelvis, which are at upper limits of normal for size.bladder, prostate, distal ureters, and vascular structures are within normal limits.a small amount of ascitic fluid is seen in the pelvis.there is no lymphadenopathy or free air.subcutaneous tissues are notable for diffuse stranding, indicating edema.there is gynecomastia.bone windows show no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.

text: the urinary bladder contains a foley catheter and small amount of air.the uterus contains multiple cystic areas most likely representing degenerating fibroids.the right adnexa contains a simple cyst.the left adnexa is normal.the rectum is normal in appearance.the sigmoid colon contain multiple diverticula with no evidence of diverticulitis.a small amount of free fluid is noted within the pelvis.no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal nodes are noted.
summary: no pathologically enlarged mesenteric, retroperitoneal or pelvic or inguinal nodes are noted.moderate bilateral pleural effusion, right greater than left and moderate amount of ascites is noted in the peritoneal cavity.this appearance is mostly consistent with third spacing.apparent diffuse hypodense thickening of the stomach.although this appearance is mostly due to contraction and fluid overload, an underlying pathology such as gastric lymphoma can not be excluded.

text: new moderate right and small left pleural effusions are seen with passive atelectasis.the right pleural effusion may be loculated.a stable amount of subdiaphragmatic free air surrounding the liver capsule and small foci of ___ adjacent to the duodenum are again noted, consistent with patient's recent postoperative state.the amount of perihepatic free fluid is also unchanged.the liver enhances normally.there is stable mild nondependent left lobe pneumobilia.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the adrenal glands, spleen, and pancreas appear unremarkable and unchanged.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.again seen are tiny hypodensities bilaterally, which are incompletely characterized on this current study.a surgical drain coils along the posterior margin of the right liver lobe.abdominal loops of large and small bowel are normal in caliber and contour.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the vessels are patent.
summary: no evidence of drainable fluid collection or abscess.stable postoperative changes in the right upper quadrant including a moderate amount of free air around the liver and adjacent to the duodenum; pericapsular low- density fluid and postoperative drain.a small amount of left lobe pneumobilia is also stable.increased bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with associated passive atelectasis.the right pleural effusion may be loculated and right lateral decubitus film is recommended to evaluate.

text: there is pelvic free fluid.the large bowel, uterus, and urinary bladder are unchanged and within normal limits.within the right paracolic gutter there is a 16 mm x 8 mm focal collection with an enhancing wall consistent with a tiny abscess.no drainable collections are present.
summary: interval reduction in amount of fluid within the abdomen with mild amount of residual ascites.a tiny walled off collection measuring 1.5 x 0.8 cm is present in the right paracolic gutter.no drainable abscess collections are present.status post insertion of jp drains and pigtail catheters as described above.hypoattenuation of a large central portion of the right lobe of the liver as present on the prior exam with adjacent omental packing.this is of unknown etiology.

text: no comparisons are available.
summary: gallbladder fossa fluid collection after cholecystectomy; this could be an infected collection or biloma.multiple irregular hepatic lesions are suspicious for abscesses.unusual placement of t tube in the right upper quadrant with question of whether the one limb is within the common bile duct or outside it.t tube cholangiogram would be helpful to further evaluate.open abdominal wound with subtotal colectomy and small bowel resection with right lower quadrant ostomy.diffuse small bowel wall thickening may be post-surgical, however, ischemia is a consideration.multiple rim-enhancing fluid collections throughout the abdomen could be infected.thrombus within the infrarenal aorta at the origin of the ___ and distal to it raises concern for traumatic or coagulopathic cause.the ___ has contrast within it, however, it is uncertain whether this is retrograde or anterograde filling.bilateral hypodense renal lesions could represent pyelonephritis or perfusion abnormalities.renal arteries and veins are patent.findings were called to dr.___ ___ on the morning of ___.

text: a right femoral venous line is present.a large amount of stool is again noted in the colon.the distal ureters, urinary bladder and uterus are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: no abscess or fluid collection identified.large amount of stool present within the colon.post surgical changes and jejunostomy tube present in the left lower quadrant.

text: no free fluid in the deep pelvis.the distal ureters and bladder are unremarkable.the rectum and sigmoid are normal.no abnormal lymph nodes in the pelvis.
summary: s/p whipple procedure, with acute pancreatitis of the remnant pancreas.preserved parenchymal enhancement and no peripancreatic fluid collections.extensive periportal and peripancreatic lymphadenopathy, likely reactive.thickening of the adjacent blind-ending afferent loop, likely secondary from the pancreatitis; no significant dilatation or other specific ct findings to suggest afferent loop syndrome, though this is difficult to exclude.right renal cyst with a tiny left renal hypodensity likely a simple cyst but too small to characterize.

text: there no focal liver lesions.the gallbladder, pancreas, adrenals are unremarkable.the spleen is enlarged measuring 15 cm.the kidneys are atrophic and they contain multiple cysts.there are no enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes.there are a few prominent mesenteric lymph nodes.the bones are unremarkable.multiplanar reformattions confirm the above findings.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection.small bilateral pleural effusions and small pericardial effusion.splenomegaly.

text: the liver appears within normal limits.again seen are small gallstones with no evidence of acute cholecystitis.the pancreas is mostly fatty replaced.the spleen appears normal.there is a small hiatal hernia and otherwise normal stomach.the left adrenal gland is unchanged.the kidneys enhance symmetrically, with a stable subcentimeter cyst in the right kidney.there are no pathologically enlarged retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes.there is no free air.there is no free fluid.

text: there is a small pneumothorax at the right lung base.there is a chest tube in the lower right lung.this is not significantly changed in size compared to the prior study.there is a patchy air-space process in the right lower lung, more likely atelectasis.additionally, there is a moderate-sized pleural effusion at the left lung base with associated compressive atelectasis.two j-p drains are seen over the top of the liver.there is persistent pneumobilia, not significantly changed.the gross pathology of the liver is unchanged.the collection anterior to the liver in the right upper quadrant is slightly smaller in size and measures 10 x 3 cm.again, there is a small amount of air in this region.the spleen, adrenals, kidneys and pancreas are unchanged.there is an ng tube whose tip is in the stomach.there are dilated loops of small bowel extending from the duodenum to the conglomerate small bowel loops in the right lower quadrant that were seen previously.there appears to be a surgical anastomosis in this region.there is oral contrast distal to this; however, it cannot be ascertained if the oral contrast distal to this is from the prior ct scan versus past contrast from the current study.there is more free fluid in the abdomen.

text: there are stable left greater than right moderate pleural effusions with adjacent compressive atelectasis.a few additional scattered linear parenchymal opacities have improved from the most recent examination within the anterior bases.there is no significant pericardial effusion.the heart is normal in size.the liver, spleen, distended gallbladder and adrenal glands appear within normal limits.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric uptake of contrast; however, the right kidney demonstrates delayed excretion of contrast and mild fullness of the collecting system.on delayed images obtained during the procedure which followed the ct, the kidneys were excreting symmetrically.the portal confluence, distal aspect of the splenic vein and smv are severely attenuated but patent.the intrahepatic portal vein, splenic vein and smv are patent.redemonstrated are mostly communicating extensive rim-enhancing fluid collections, which contain heterogeneous material throughout the retroperitoneum surrounding the pancreas in the anterior/posterior pararenal spaces bilaterally and extending into the pelvis, even the right inguinal canal.the overall size of the fluid collections are little changed from the most recent reference ct.there are, however, new foci of air, particularly within the right retroperitoneal fluid collection (2:44-48).the pancreas appears to enhance homogeneously.there are additional rim-enhancing fluid collections within the upper thighs, predominantly intramuscular which are also not significantly changed in size or appearance from most recent examination.all of the fluid collections have decreased in size from the ___ examination.a gastrojejunostomy tube is in place.the stomach is collapsed.multiple fluid collections are present adjacent to the greater and lesser curvature of the stomach.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.

text: bilateral small-to-moderate pleural effusion is noted, loculated on the right with adjacent bilateral partial lower lobe collapse.stable cardiomegaly evident.no pericardial effusion identified.coronary artery calcifications are noted at the ostia of the left anterior descending and right coronary arteries.patient is status post ___ ___ patch of a perforated gastric ulcer.phlegmonous changes with pockets of air are again identified along the anterior aspect of the antrum of the stomach at the surgical site.given surrounding inflammatory change it is difficult to ascertain which pockets of air are intraluminal versus extraluminal as well as assess for the continuity of the anterior abdominal wall.however, given stable degree of those foci of gas which are definitely extraluminal, a persistent enteric leak is likely (2:25, 2:32).inflammatory changes extend in two main directions, towards the anteromedial aspect of the gallbladder as well as inferiorly towards the central mesentery.anterior to the fundus of the gallbladder there is a small pocket of air and nondrainable fluid measuring 1.7 x 5.3 cm.additionally there is a small pocket of air identified within the fundus of the gallbladder (2:31, 602b:37), ew since prior study.slightly inferior to this (2:35) there is a persistent sinus tract extending from the anterior abdominal wall to the peritoneum at the site of the prior abdominal drain (2:35).given reported bilious drainage from this site, findings are concerning for possible gallbladder perforation, though the gallbladder wall itself appears intact and largely unaffected by adjacent inflammation.given lack of gas within biliary tree, this is unlikely to extend from the gi tract and may be related to recent instrumentation.inflammatory changes extend inferiorly along the medial aspect of the gallbladder (2:32-36, 602b:31-8) and approximate the second portion of the duodenum, and overall appears minimally decreased in size.at this level, there is a wisp of extraluminal contrast, similar in morphology and possibly residual from prior study.the extraluminal contrast is proximal to the tip of the dobhoff tube which terminates at the proximal third portion of the duodenum and was used to administer contrast, likely bypassing enteric leak (2:34).the second pathway of inflammation terminates in the mesentery (2:40) with a more well defined inflammatory change with internal foci of gas measuring approximately 2.1 x 4.7 cm in the axial plane but again, no drainable fluid collection.the remaining small and large bowel are unremarkable.the rectum, seminal vesicles and prostate are unremarkable.the bladder is partially collapsed around a foley catheter.the bilateral native kidneys are atrophic with unchanged hypodense cyst in the left kidney.no hydroureter evident.nonopacified transplanted kidney is evident within the right lower quadrant likely reflecting an abandoned transplant.a second well perfused transplanted kidney is identified in the superficial tissues of the right lower quadrant.no hydronephrosis or edema evident.no lymphadenopathy identified.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications are noted throughout the abdominal vasculature without evidence of stenosis, aneurysmal dilatation or dissection.main portal vein and its major tributaries are unremarkable.there is no free fluid identified in the abdomen or pelvis.diffuse anasarca evident.there is a ___-type hernia noted in the right lower quadrant containing a short segment of small nonstrangulated bowel (2:44).no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions identified.no fracture is present.
summary: findings concerning for persistent enteric leak with extraluminal pockets of gas identified along the anterior aspect of the ___ patch and tracking between the anteromedial gallbladder and second portion of the duodenum and to a lesser degree down into the mesentery.persistent extraluminal contrast approximates second portion of the duodenum, unclear if residual from prior study or related to current oral contrsat administration.air identified within the fundus of the gallbladder at the site of anterior inflammatory change and proximal to the persistent anterior abdominal wall tract at site of prior drain.these findings in conjunction with report of biliary drainage through drain tract are concerning for communication with biliary system.secondarily, air in gallbladder alone (and not remainder of biliary tree) may be related to recent catheterization/interventional attempt.small pocket of fluid identified anteromedial to gallbladder, too small for drainage.no other loculated fluid collection identified.otherwise, unchanged exam with atrophic bilateral native kidneys, abandoned transplanted kidney in the right pelvis and a perfused, nonedematous transplanted kidney in the superficial tissues of the right lower quadrant.

text: there is persistent complete occlusion of the right common iliac artery.foley catheter and air are seen within the bladder.the sigmoid colon and rectum are unremarkable.the bones are osteopenic.there are no suspicious osseous lesions.
summary: status post removal of right upper quadrant drain with no evidence of biloma or drainable fluid collection.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of the exam, and it was decided that the patient would return for repeat imaging in one day to assess for fluid collection in the setting of a presumed biliary leak.otherwise unchanged appearance of the abdomen including small pocket of mesenteric fluid, thrombosis in the sma and right common iliac artery, extensive post-surgical changes following small bowel resection with an open anterior abdominal wall defect.continued evolution of extensive splenic infarcts.decreased size of bilateral pleural effusions, now small on the left and tiny on the right.

text: the visualized lung bases are unremarkable without suspicious pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions.mild dependent atelectasis is present.the heart is mildly enlarged.there are no pericardial effusions.the liver demonstrates a subcentimeter hypodensity within the left lobe of the liver (2:17), too small to characterize.the gallbladder demonstrates multiple layering stones without evidence of acute cholecystitis.both adrenal glands, spleen and pancreas are unremarkable.both kidneys have multiple subcentimeter hypodensities, too small to characterize.a 2.3 cm hypodense lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney is a simple cyst.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or concerning renal masses.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is detected.mild atherosclerotic disease of the aorta is present without aneurysmal dilation.there is significant dilation of the stomach and the proximal small bowel loops with oral contrast reaching up to the mid small bowel.the dilation of the proximal small bowel loops measures up to 4 cm, with a focal transition point at the level of the mid small bowel within the midline abdomen just before the small bowel loops enter a small, wide-mouthed ventral abdominal wall hernia.there is no evidence of ischemia, specifically, no pneumatosis or mesenteric fluid is seen.there is no intra-abdominal free air.small amount of free fluid is seen along the left paracolic gutter.a nasogastric tube ends at the level of the distal stomach.
summary: diffuse dilation of the stomach and the proximal small bowel loops with a focal transition point at the level of the mid abdomen, just before the small bowel enters wide-mouthed ventral hernia.findings are compatible with small-bowel obstruction.no evidence of bowel ischemia is present.1-cm left hepatic lobe hypodensity, too small to characterize in this single phase study.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.trace amount of free fluid in the left paracolic gutter.

text: the bladder contains a foley catheter.the seminal vesicles, prostate, rectum, and sigmoid are unremarkable.there is trace free pelvic fluid, adjacent to a loop of unremarkable small bowel, which is terminal ileum.there are no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymph nodes.calcified injection granuloma are noted within the buttocks bilaterally.
summary: 1 bibasilar consolidations versus atelectasis.this may represent the source of the patient's fever.there is no acute inflammatory pathology identified within the abdomen and pelvis to account for the patient's symptoms otherwise.2 trace amount of free fluid in the abdomen, greatest in the left upper quadrant surrounding the spleen and superior posteriorly.there is also trace free fluid in the pelvis adjacent to a loop of distal ileum that is unremarkable in appearance.3 sluggish enhancement of the kidneys, consistent with medical disease.4 ill-defined hypodensities within the liver, which may represent irregular fatty infiltration.5.schlerosis and thickening of the left ileum, which may represent paget's disease.

text: an intrauterine device is in place.the inferior (anterior) wall of the uterus shows enhancement.there is a foley in the bladder.bowel loops are unremarkable.no free fluid, lymphadenopathy, or free air.of note, the appendix is well visualized.bone windows show cortical destruction of the superior aspect of l3, but with preservation of vertebral body height.coronal and sagittal reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.
summary: heterogenous enhancement of anterior wall of uterus which may represent an infectious process.ultrasound recommended for further evaluation.cortical destruction of the l3 vertebral body consistent with patient's history of discitis/vertebral osteomyelitis.the right psoas abscess is not well identified on the study.fatty liver.revised findings were discussed with dr ___ by telephone at 9:12 a.m., ___.

text: the imaged lung bases demonstrate mild dependent atelectasis with linear right lower lobe atelectasis.trace right pleural effusion is present.there are no pericardial effusions.moderate coronary arterial calcification is seen.again seen is a intermediate density fluid collection in the right subhepatic region/gallbladder fossa, now measuring 6.7 x 6.4 x 4.7 cm, slightly smaller to stable, since the prior study where it measured 8.3 x 7.4 x 5.0 cm.the collection has a thin enhancing rim, and has multiple air pockets within.also seen are small fluid collections extending along the right perihepatic space, which also has multiple internal air pockets.these fluid collections likely communicate with one another.also seen is a faint enhancing tract extending from this fluid collection down to the right flank, at which level, there is an anterior abdominal wall fluid collection with an air pocket measuring 2.3 x 1.7 cm (300b:15).this likely represents the site of a previously seen drainage catheters.there has been interval removal of the drainage catheters.a second loculated fluid collection along the right paracolic gutter now measures 2.0 x 1.4 cm and is smaller since the prior study.the liver is normal in appearance, without focal lesions.minimal pneumobilia is seen.both adrenal glands, spleen and pancreas are normal.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically, without evidence of hydroureteronephrosis.multiple subcentimeter hypodense lesions in the left kidney, are stable since the prior study and not characterized in this single-phase imaging study.the stomach, small and large bowel are unremarkable.the hepatic flexure is in close proximity to this collection, without obvious fistula formation at this time.the abdominal aorta demonstrates moderate atherosclerotic calcification without aneurysmal dilation.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is seen.
summary: large intermediate density subhepatic/gallbladder fossa fluid collection with internal air pockets and a thin enhancing rim, consistent with an abscess.additional smaller fluid collections in the right perihepatic space, likely communicate with the larger abscess.a linear track extends down to the right flank, with a smaller right anterior abdominal wall fluid collection, at the site of the previously placed drains.

text: there is a large left groin hematoma, which extends into the left lateral abdominal wall muscles.the superior aspect is not fully imaged.inferiorly, the hematoma extends via the inguinal canal into the left scrotum.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at 9:40 p.m.by dr.___ ___ on ___.there are calcifications seen in the common iliac, and common iliac arteries bilaterally as well as the intrarenal abdominal aorta.partially imaged bowel loops are grossly normal.there are surgical clips in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen noted.images of the bladder demonstrate contrast material layering likely the sequela of a prior procedure.there is a small bladder diverticulum at the base of the bladder.the rectum, prostate, and visualized sigmoid loops are grossly normal.
summary: large left groin hematoma with extension into the left abdominal wall musculature, superior aspect is excluded from the image field of view.inferiorly, it extends via the inguinal canal into the left scrotum.

text: the bladder is markedly distended but normal appearing.there are bilateral fem-___ bypass grafts, with occlusion of one limb of the right femoral bypass graft.the sigmoid colon and rectum are normal.there is no pelvic free fluid or lymphadenopathy.the bones are osteopenic.there are schmorl's nodes within the l2 and l3 vertebral bodies.
summary: no primary or secondary signs of mesenteric ischemia.persistent occlusion of the proximal superior mesenteric artery with retroigrade filling presumably via collaterals.moderately extensive pneumatosis involving the ascending colon, likely benign and which may be related to the patient's steroid therapy.cholelithiasis.

text: the ileoanal anastomosis site remains unchanged.the pouch remains thick and enhancing but unchanged in comparison to prior study.small amount of fluids visualized throughout the pelvis is unchanged in comparison to prior study.the uterus, adnexa, and bladder appear unremarkable and unchanged.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: small amount of hyperdense material in the right lower quadrant suspicious for extraluminal contrast material within the ascites.large amount of intra-abdominal and intrapelvic fluid with enhancement of the peritoneum indicates peritonitis.the amount of fluid has decreased in comparison to prior study, likely having exited at the former ostomy site as suggested clinically.bilateral pleural effusions, moderate in size on the right and moderate-to-large on the left with adjacent atelectasis.heterogeneous mural enhancement with wall thickening of the small bowel distal to the ligament of treitz to the pouch, worse in the pelvis, consistent with nonspecific inflammation.pouch wall shows equivocal thickening.postoperative pneumoperitoneum remains.

text: the bladder and distal ureters are unchanged.the prostate and seminal vesicles are unchanged.there is increased pelvic free fluid.the rectum and sigmoid appear normal and there is no fat stranding in the perirectal connective adipose tissue.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: dramatic interval worsening of metastatic disease in the liver with associated increase in ascites and generalized anasarca.stability in size of splenic flexure lesion and slight increase in size of splenic and splenic hilar lesion.either cystic dilatation of the pancreatic duct or multiple cysts communicating with the duct.worsened pulmonary metastases.

text: the colon is diffusely filled with gas and/or fluid.of the portions where the wall can be seen, there is no evidence of wall thickening.there is no area suspicious for an abscess.there is no pelvic free fluid.on bone windows, there is a right hip prosthesis.no suspicious bony lesions are seen.
summary: no definite evidence of colitis or abscess on this non-contrast study.there is no area suspicious for infection of the abdomen or pelvis.innumerable hepatic masses, biliary stent, and low-density area in the spleen, all of which are unchanged from the prior exam.pancreatic head mass.cholelithiasis

text: at the lung bases, there are small bilateral pleural effusions, with associated atelectasis.the heart size is normal, and there are coronary artery calcifications.there is no pericardial effusion.in the abdomen, evaluation of solid abdominal organs is somewhat limited in the absence of iv contrast.however, there is a large amount of ascites throughout the abdomen.the liver is shrunken and nodular consistent with cirrhosis.no gross hepatic lesions are identified.the gallbladder is not distended, but does demonstrate mild wall thickening consistent with cirrhosis.a few small hyperdensities at the gallbladder neck are consistent with gallstones.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the pancreas, spleen, stomach and duodenum are unchanged.periesophageal and perisplenic varices are again noted, consistent with portal hypertension.an enteric tube extends through the distal esophagus into the jejunum.there is a small hiatal hernia.the abdominal aorta and its major branches are normal in caliber, with mild atherosclerotic calcification.there is no free air in the abdomen.adrenal glands, and kidneys are grossly normal.there is no hydronephrosis or renal stone.
summary: cirrhotic liver with large amount of ascites.sbp cannot be diagnosed via ct.esophageal, splenic and perirectal varices consistent with portal hypertension.patency of the portal vein not assessed on non-contrast study.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.left inguinal hernia containing small segment of large bowel, without evidence of obstruction.small bilateral pleural effusions.cholelithiasis without gallbladder distention to suggest acute cholecystitis.mild gallbladder wall thickening is secondary to cirrhosis.

text: limited imaging of the lung bases demonstrates tiny bilateral pleural effusions.there is bibasilar atelectasis.there is a small-to-moderate amount of ascites, predominantly in the perihepatic and perisplenic regions as well as along the pericolic gutters.no focal intrahepatic lesions are demonstrated.there is trace pericholecystic fluid.the gallbladder is not distended.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen is heterogeneous in enhancement which may be secondary to low flow due to portal hypertension.the pancreas is atrophic and unremarkable in appearance.a nasogastric tube is demonstrated with tip in the body of the stomach.the adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy or free intraperitoneal gas.the bowel is normal in caliber.
summary: tiny bilateral pleural effusions.ascites.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.diffuse anasarca, which is symmetric.no evidence of soft tissue or intramuscular gas.these findings were discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ on ___ after completion of examination.

text: the small bowel, ascending colon, transverse colon, and descending colon are not distended.the delayed images demonstrate oral contrast exiting the colostomy without evidence of obstruction.air is seen within a catheter inserted into the ostomy, which distends approximately 8 cm into the colon.several diverticula are noted within the descending colon.multiple surgical clips are present within the mesentery and the area of rectal stump.there is gas in the bladder, likely secondary to instrumentation.a stable small amount of intraoperitoneal fluid remains present.the fluid does not enhance.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: uninhibited passage of contrast through the colon, without evidence of bowel obstruction.stable small amount of simple intraperitoneal fluid.stable appearance of atrophic kidneys with multiple cysts.

text: again seen is a large right-sided simple pleural effusion with associated right lower lobe atelectasis.there is also increasing consolidation at the medial aspect of the right lower lobe concerning for pneumonia.tiny new left pleural effusion and atelectasis are seen.the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the liver is cirrhotic and shrunken and there are numerous signs of portal venous hypertension including splenomegaly, recanalization of the umbilical vein, and ascites.there is a new small amount of ascites in the right paracolic gutter and surrounding the liver, measuring simple fluid density.the gallbladder, adrenal glands, and pancreas are unremarkable.there is a delayed dense nephrogram bilaterally from contrast administered during renal artery embolization 12 hours prior.the left kidney has two new coils within it.the left perinephric hematoma is relatively unchanged in size measuring 10 x 6.8 cm in the axial plane (previously 9.3 x 6.1 cm).stranding in the left flank subcutaneous tissues likely relates to recent biopsy.no intraperitoneal free air is identified.
summary: unchanged large left perinephric hematoma, s/p left renal arterial embolization.persistent large right pleural effusion with increased ascites is suggestive of volume overloaded state.bibasilar atelectasis with a more confluent area of airspace opacity in the medial right lower lobe is concerning for infectious consolidation.results were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 5:30 p.m.on ___.

text: there are small bilateral pleural effusions greater on the right than on the left.associated to this is consolidation at the lung bases, likely related atelectasis.in the heart a replaced mitral and aortic valve is visualized.a moderate amount of intra-abdominal free air is seen below the diaphragm.additionally, a small amount of likely retroperitoneal air is seen near the ligament of treitz (300:15).a biliary stent is seen in good position and there is associated significant pneumobilia.at the lateral aspect of the liver there is a subcapsular air and fluid collection (300:26) which may represent a subcapsular hematoma with a component of subcapsular free air.no definite pancreatic mass is visualized on this non-contrast study and the tail of the pancreas is atrophic.the gallbladder is not visualized.the spleen, adrenal glands, stomach and proximal small bowel are normal.the kidneys are atrophic bilaterally with the right kidney smaller than the left.a small amount of ascites is present.there is no omental, mesenteric, or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is significant diffuse arterial calcification.
summary: intraperitoneal and retroperitoneal free air in a post-ercp patient.stent is in good position.likely subcapsular hematoma adjacent to the liver with a component of air within it.moderate amount of free fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.

text: the bladder contains a foley catheter and air consistent with foley insertion.a large right-sided hydrocele is approximately unchanged.there is a large amount of ascites in the pelvis.the rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.diffuse subcutaneous fat stranding is consistent with anasarca.an umbilical hernia containing fat and ascitic fluid is again noted.liver is again noted to be small and nodular in contour with splenomegaly consistent with cirrhosis and portal hypertension.
summary: small bowel distention, mural thickening, pneumatosis, and mesenteric venous gas, consistent with bowel ischemia.massive ascites, unchanged.right lower lobe consolidation consistent with pneumonia and atelectasis minimally improved.findings consistent with portal hypertension and cirrhosis, unchanged.calcified mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes consistent with prior granulomatous disease.large right-sided hydrocele unchanged.results were discussed with ___ ___ at 8:22 a.m.on ___.

text: there is a 4-mm hypodensity in segment viii (2, 13), which is too small to characterize.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the spleen and adrenal glands are within normal limits.there is a 7-mm left lower pole renal cortical hypodensity and a 4-mm right upper pole renal cortical hypodensity, both of which are too small to characterize, but statistically, most likely cysts.the kidneys are otherwise unremarkable.there is a hypodense 5.6 x 6.7 cm ill-defined mass centered in the gastric cardia and posterior fundus and body.the mass extends posteriorly into the pancreatic body and it appears to circumferentially narrow the cardia .there is an 18 mm in short axis retroperitoneal lymph node.there is low- attenuation ascites in the upper abdomen and diffuse infiltration of the omentum and the mesentery in the mid and lower abdomen, suggestive of carcinomatosis.the aorta demonstrates a normal caliber.the celiac axis and superior mesenteric artery arise at the same level, and the mass appears to abut a long segment of the celiac artery/common hepatic artery.the splenic artery is nearly completely obliterated by the tumor.the superior mesenteric vein and portal vein are patent.however, the splenic vein is obliterated.there is no bowel dilatation.
summary: large pathologically proven gastric cancer, extending into the pancreas and involving the splenic artery and splenic vein, as detailed above.evidence of diffuse peritoneal carcinomatosis.multiple pulmonary nodular densities, at least one of which has a discrete nodular appearance.attention is recommended on followup studies.

text: there is a small amount of mediastinal air as well as small foci of air within the upper abdomen, presumably post-operative.there are post- operative changes involving the heart, with a small amount of surrounding fluid.there are small bilateral pleural effusions with associated bibasilar atelectasis vs consolidation.patient appears to have undergone clipping of a previously evident vascular malformation within the liver.the liver is now unremarkable.the gallbladder is normal in appearance, but there is a small amount of pericholecystic fluid in the gallbladder fossa.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear grossly normal.previously described bilateral renal infarcts are again noted.stomach and visualized loops of small and large bowel appear grossly normal.no pathologically enlarged retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph nodes are identified.there is no free fluid.the aorta and its major intraabdominal branches appear patent.
summary: small amount of mediastinal and intraabdominal air as above.this is most likley a post operative finding given the recent surgery.small amount of pericholecystic fluid.interval clipping of previously evident hepatic vascular malformation.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis vs consolidation.stable appearance of bilateral renal infarcts.normal appearance of the bowel.

text: again noted is circumferential thickening of the bladder wall, possibly related to chronic obstruction.the prostate, sigmoid colon, and rectum are unremarkable.no pelvic free fluid or lymphadenopathy.small inguinal lymph nodes are noted which measure up to 8 mm in short axis.
summary: left renal cell carcinoma is stable in size.resolution of previously seen bilateral hydronephrosis.decreased size of multiple sclerotic lesions of unknown etiology.diverticulosis.slight decrease in the right lower lobe consolidation.

text: the kidneys excrete contrast in a normal fashion.there is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the intrapelvic small bowel is normal.there is no evidence of bowel wall thickening or pneumatosis.there is dense calcific atherosclerotic disease throughout the abdominal aorta and iliac vessels without aneurysmal dilatation.the bladder is non-distended.there is a foley catheter balloon, which is difficult to localize, however may reside outside the bladder within the vagina.bladder wall thickening is nonspecifix due to underdistention.large amount of stool in the distal colon.no free fluid in the dependent pelvis.no abnormal lymph nodes in the deep pelvis.very mild diffuse fat stranding, no focal process or focal collection/abscess.
summary: no ct findings to explain the patient's symptoms; no evidence of bowel ischemia or abscess.mild splenomegaly.tiny hypodensity in the hepatic dome likely a simple cyst but too small to characterize.compression fracture of l2, chronicity indeterminate.foley catheter balloon appears to be within the vagina (is it draining urine?).

text: the liver is homogeneous in attenuation, with no focal lesions identified.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is decompressed.there is no ct evidence for acute cholecystitis, although multiple gallstones are again noted and one appears to have migrated into the gallbladder neck.the spleen and pancreas are normal.there is unchanged thickening of the bilateral adrenal glands.the kidneys demonstrate multiple foci of calcification, some of which may also be located within the collecting systems, consistent with stones.there is no hydronephrosis.there are bilateral foci of cortical thinning, consistent with scarring.the previously vizualized hypodensities concerning for possible lymphomatous invovlement or not appreciated on the current study.there are no contour-altering renal mass lesions.the stomach, duodenum, and intra-abdominal loops of small bowel are normal.there is moderate fecal loading in the colon.the degree of wall thickening and associated stranding in the cecum has decreased compared to prior study.there is mild diffuse mesenteric stranding, consistent with anasarca.there is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric adenopathy or soft tissue mass.there is no free fluid.there is no abscess transformation.there is no free air.ivc filter is noted entering within the ivc.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta, with aneurysmal dilatation of the bilateral common iliac arteries.within the aneurysm on the right, there is significant intramural clot.
summary: new moderate bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.there is no new consolidation within the lung parenchyma to suggest presence of pneumonia.unchanged appearance of right upper lobe consolidation with central cavitation.previously identified left chest wall mass and cardiac masses are not visualized on the current study, consistent with continued interval improvement in lymphoma.resolution of wall thickening involving the cecum and ascending colon.cholelithiasis within the gallbladder neck, but no ct evidence of acute cholecystitis.bilateral renal cortical thinning, most consistent with scarring.unchanged adrenal fullness.extensive atherosclerotic disease of the distal aorta, with unchanged bilateral common iliac artery aneurysms and significant intramural clot on the right.

text: the bladder, distal ureters, and rectum appear unremarkable.there are numerous diverticula within the sigmoid colon without associated inflammatory changes.left-sided hydrocele is noted.
summary: no acute ct findings to account for patient's clinical presentation.small right nonhemorrhagic pleural effusion with adjacent areas of atelectasis.pleural calcifications, likely related to asbestos exposure.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.enlarged left adrenal gland measures 12 hounsfield units in attenuation, this finding most likely represents a lipid-poor adenoma; sigmoid colon diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: this study, again, reveals severe sigmoid diverticulitis with wall thickening, stranding and numerous diverticula.medial to the mid-sigmoid colon is an air, barium and stool-containing abscess.a fluid collection is also noted around the rectum and distal sigmoid colon.
summary: satisfactory ct-guided insertion of #8 french pigtail catheter into diverticular abscess with no complications.

text: the liver demonstrates slight diffuse decreased attenuation in comparison to the spleen.the gallbladder is contracted, similar in appearance in comparison to prior study (image 2:23).the spleen and pancreas demonstrate no focal lesions.a punctate calcification is located in the right adrenal gland (image 2:27).the 6-mm low-attenuation lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney (image 2:21) is unchanged.no hydronephrosis is present.a few left peri-aortic lymph nodes measure up to 7 mm in short axis.the thoracoabdominal aorta demonstrates a tortuous course.atherosclerotic calcifications are located at the origin of the celiac axis and the left renal artery.
summary: overall no significant change.mild sigmoid diverticulitis.fat-containing mass anterior to the right psoas muscle.this likely represents a teratoma originating from the right ovary.a retroperitoneal liposarcoma is also possible but less likely.two additional large mixed-attenuation pelvic masses, one exophytic from the uterus the other one likely an enlarged internal iliac lymph node.findings are concerning for malignancy such as leiomyoscarcoma with lymph node metastases.small fat-containing umbilical hernia.prominent right pulmonary artery, suggesting pulmonary arterial hypertension.revised interpretation of findings described under 4 were discussed with dr.___ at 3:20pm on ___ by dr.___

text: in the limited images obtained throughout the bases of the lungs, there is a small subsegmental atelectasis in the lingula.there is a triangular pleural based soft tissue density with peripheral calcification unchanged from prior studies.multiple hypodense subcentimeter lesions are seen throughout the liver too small to be characterized, likely cyst or hamartomas.there is no biliary duct dilatation.the spleen, gallbladder, adrenal glands, pancreas, and right kidney are unremarkable.in the interpolar region of the left kidney, there is a subcentimeter hypoenhancing cortical lesion too small to be characterized.there is no hydronephrosis.there has been interval decrease in size in the left subphrenic collection, now measuring 48 x 22 mm with a tiny pocket adjacent to it measuring 40 x 9 mm both with air-fluid level and located superior and medial to the spleen.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.there is no lymphadenopathy.the aorta is normal in caliber.
summary: interval decrease in size in the left subphrenic collection.status post nissen fundoplication without evidence of oral contrast extravasation in the current study.

text: visualized lung bases reveal atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications.visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.visualized lung bases reveal dependent atelectases.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.non-contrast images of the liver reveal a tiny punctate calcification near the dome, likely reflecting a calcified granuloma.the spleen is within normal limits.there is, however, extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the splenic artery.the pancreas contains a focus of calcification with the pancreatic body, similar in appearance to ___.both kidneys are not visualized, likely surgically absent.there is evidence of a right colostomy, with a parastomal hernia again noted, containing loops of small and large bowel, without evidence of obstruction.otherwise, the remainder of bowel is grossly unremarkable.there is no free air, free fluid, or pathologic adenopathy.
summary: parastomal hernia, containing loops of small and large bowel, without evidence of obstruction.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications.uterine fibroids.diffuse osseous changes of renal osseous osteodystrophy.findings were posted to the ed dashboard at the time of interpretation.

text: there are scattered sigmoid diverticula without evidence of diverticulitis.a foley is present within the collapsed bladder.a small amount of air is noted within the bladder consistent with recent manipulation.there is a fat-containing left inguinal hernia.there is no significant pelvic or inguinal lymph adenopathy.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: no peripancreatic fluid collections or abscesses.nonspecific gallbladder wall edema in a collapsed gallbladder.small amount of pneumobilia with note of the presence of a stent and no intrahepatic ductal dilatation.small bilateral pleural effusions and associated compressive atelectasis.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: just anterior to the left psoas muscle, there is a low density fluid collection measuring 4.0 x 6.2 cm, with adjacent surgical staples, which has the appearance of a postoperative seroma.there is a transplanted kidney within the right pelvis.the ileal conduit is seen with right-sided urostomy, and just inferior to the umbilicus, there appears to be a surgical suture line which is immediately adjacent and possibly adherent to the peritoneum at this location.just superficial to this, along the planes of the rectus sheath and in the subcutaneous soft tissues, there are small air bubbles, and probably a bowel loop adherent to the anterior abdominal wall.as a whole, this probably represents a fistula between the region of the ileal anastomosis and the anterior abdominal wall.there is mild inflammatory thickening of the anterior abdominal wall at the inferior aspect of the rectus muscles.there is a small left inguinal hernia.a small amount of loculated fluid appears to be along the inferior aspect of the anterior skin incision within the subcutaneous tissues.examination of the osseous structures shows a diffusely mottled appearance of the pelvis, sacrum, and vertebral bodies, which was not clearly demonstrated on the prior study.given the history of aggressive transitional cell carcinoma, this is concerning for the possibility of metastatic involvement.a bone scan should be useful in evaluation of this process.coronally reformatted images were obtained, which also show the abnormal appearance to the bone and the subcutaneous air extending through the region of the presumed fistula.
summary: probable ileal-cutaneous fistula.the fistula is not definitely seen, but there are small air bubbles along a path from a suture chain which is just subjacent to the midline through the subcutaneous tissues and extending to the skin surface.these bubbles of free air would not be normally expected in a patient who is three weeks postoperative.postoperative seroma just anterior to the left psoas muscle.mottled appearance of the bones.given the history of aggressive carcinoma, this is concerning for metastatic spread.a bone scan would be useful for further examination.

text: a suprapubic tube is unchanged.the prostate and seminal vesicles are within normal limits.there is post- operative rectal stump containing a tiny residual amount of air and some fluid.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: status post total colectomy with ileostomy.intermittent focal segments of mild dilatation of the small bowel without evidence of obstruction.the appearance is more suggestive of a mild ileus.no ct evidence of peripancreatic inflammation.post-operative changes including a small amount of ascites.

text: the bladder is unremarkable.the rectum and prostate appear unremarkable.no pelvic free fluid.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection or abdominal aortic aneurysm.trace fat-stranding about the tail of the pancreas.given the patient's elevated lipase, this finding is compatible with acute pancreatitis.no focal fluid collections.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.trace gallbladder wall edema is likely secondary to acute pancreatitis.small bilateral pleural effusion.

text: there is no evidence for obstruction.there is a small amount of fluid within the bowel within the exiting ostomy in the right lower quadrant.given that the remaining small bowel loops are well opacified with contrast, and this being the only portion of the bowel without contrast, this raises the possibility of trapped fluid and air in the bowel at this site.the differential also includes extraluminal circumferential fluid about exiting bowel loop.the stoma did not have this appearance on ___.however, there is no fat stranding to suggest incarceration.there is small amount of fat herniation into the stoma, but unchanged.the rectum appears normal.the uterus and adnexa are unremarkable.the distal ureters and bladder are normal.no free air, free fluid, or pathologic adenopathy is present in the pelvis.
summary: small amount of trapped fluid within or circumferentially surrounding the exiting ostomy in the bowel, 2cm from the orfice.direct examination may help differentiate this finding.there is no evidence for obstruction.small pericardial effusion, unchanged.7-mm cyst in the left hepatic lobe and a small hypodensity adjacent to the gallbladder that is too small to characterize but also likely a cyst, unchanged.these findings discussed with the surgical team led by dr.___ at the time of the study.
