text: right lower lobe consolidation is slightly increased.small adjacent pockets of right pleural fluid worrisome for empyema are little changed from previous day.peripheral reticular opacities are not significantly changed from previous exam.severe mitral annular calcification is unchanged.since previous exam, nasogastric tube has been removed.the stomach is distended, with a moderately large air-fluid level.intra-abdominal small bowel loops are also now mildly dilated, with multiple air-fluid levels.previously administered oral contrast is present in the distal small bowel loops and colon, moderately dense.a straight jejunostomy tube enters the abdomen through the mid abdomen, and terminates with its tip in the mid jejunum in the left lower abdomen.free intraperitoneal air near the site of the j-tube entry has increased slightly, but there is now pneumoperitoneum seen throughout the abdomen as well, and intra-abdominal free fluid has also moderately increased.there are areas of peritoneal enhancement adjacent to some of these pockets of free fluid and air in the anterior abdominal wall (2, 45), worrisome for peritonitis.appearance of the liver is unchanged.there is no biliary ductal dilatation.gallstones are unchanged.pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.there is no hydronephrosis.renal cysts on the right are unchanged, as is right renal cortical scarring.diffuse atherosclerotic calcification is unchanged, along with multiple areas of aortic dilatation.
summary: increased pneumoperitoneum, ascites, along with areas of peritoneal enhancement raises concern for evolving peritonitis.slight interval worsening of right lower lobe consolidation, reticular opacities, and pockets of loculated pleural fluid at the right lung base worrisome for empyema.focal dilatation of the small bowel, with multiple air-fluid levels, as well as gastric distention, could represent ileus.consider nasogastric tube decompression.cholelithiasis.unchanged appearance of multifocal areas of aortic ectasia.diffuse anasarca.

text: there is mild dependent atelectasis in the lung bases.no evidence of pleural effusion.a catheter appears to extend into the right atrium.
summary: colitis of the cecum, ascending colon, descending colon, and sigmoid colon.there is associated free fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.no evidence of pneumatosis, free air or portal venous gas.the cecum is distended to 11 cm.note is made of a catheter extending into the right atrium.a chest xray is recommended for further evaluation.

text: the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear grossly unremarkable.the gallbladder is present.a simple-appearing right upper pole renal cortical cyst remains.there is stable severe right-sided hydronephrosis to the level of the ureteropelvic junction and new moderate left-sided hydronephrosis, also to the level of the ureteropelvic junction.the previously described left renal cortical hypodensity is not visualized with certainty.there is new minimal low-attenuation ascites.partially calcified confluent retroperitoneal lymph nodes are again identified measuring up to 17 mm in short axis.this retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy appears grossly similar.there are multiple new soft tissue nodules in the splenic hilum, measuring up to 10 mm in short axis, and suspicious for progression of lymphadenopathy.additionally, there are multiple soft tissue nodules in the right pericolic gutter, which appear larger when compared to the previous study, measuring up to 11.0 mm in short axis.a right lower quadrant mesenteric lymph node has increased in size, 14 mm in short axis, compared to 6 mm on the previous study.there is no evidence of bowel dilatation.there is extensive atheromatous calcification of the aorta extending into the common iliac arteries, without aneurysm.
summary: stable severe right and moderate left sided hydronephrosis, most likely related to retroperitoneal lymph node enlargement.marked distention of the urinary bladder.interval progression of lymphoma, with increase in the number and size of the pulmonary metastases and intraperitoneal lymph nodes, as detailed above.stable osseous metastatic disease, with compression of the l1 vertebral body.new small right pleural effusion and new minimal ascites.

text: bibasilar atelectasis has decreased from ___.there are no apparent pleural effusions.there is no pericardial effusion.the patient is post whipple procedure.the gastrojejunostomy is patent.inflammatory change about the gastrojejunostomy with possible wall thickening is seen, which can be postoperative (2:31).inflammatory stranding about the pancreaticojejunostomy and choledochojejunostomy may also be postoperative.there is an ill-defined area of fluid, measuring up to 5 cm, medial to the spleen in the region of the lesser sac (2:32).the pancreas enhances homogeneously.the spleen is normal in size.pneumobilia is present in the left lobe of liver.the liver enhances homogeneously.the portal and splenic veins are patent.the superior mesenteric vein is patent, although attenuated in the region of the pancreaticojejunostomy.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and with prompt excretion of contrast.the adrenals are normal.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber.the small bowel is normal in caliber throughout.there is moderate amount throughout the colon.the appendix contains fecal material and air, and is prominent, measuring up to 8-9 mm.there is no periappendiceal stranding or fluid.
summary: interval whipple procedure.fat stranding about the gastrojejunostomy, pancreaticojejunostomy and choledochojejunostomy is most likely postoperative, although underlying infection can not be excluded.fluid in the region of the lesser sac which may be organizing fluid.subcutaneous fat stranding in the region of the incision.no focal drainable collection seen.prominent appendix, containing fecal material and air, measuring up to ___ mm in diameter.no periappendiceal or fat stranding or fluid.

text: visualized heart size is within normal limits.the lung bases are clear.there is fatty replacement of the liver parenchyma.no focal lesions are seen.gallbladder is present, and there is no biliary dilatation.the spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands remain normal in appearance.kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.there are several renal hypodensities, most of which are cysts, some of which are too small to thoroughly characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.
summary: no acute abnormality within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: there are bibasilar right greater than left airspace opacities which could represent pneumonia or aspiration, particularly on the right which is new.there are trace bilateral pleural effusions.the liver is unremarkable.there is cholelithiasis.the pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands appear normal.there is a cyst of the right kidney.again, mild hydroureteronephrosis is noted bilaterally, but this is perhaps mildly improved from the prior study.
summary: increasing large anterior abdominal fluid collection with foci of gas measuring 16 x 16 cm.this is amenable to ultrasound-guided drainage.no change in the presacral fluid collection measuring 2.7 x 2.4 cm.status post small bowel bypass with no evidence of oral contrast extravasation or small-bowel obstruction.the matted loops of small bowel, deep in the pelvis do not fill with oral contrast, consistent with a bypass.slightly improving bilateral hydroureteronephrosis.right lower lobe airspace disease, incompletely visualized on this study but findings are suspicious for pneumonia or aspiration.cholelithiasis.

text: the lung bases are normal.some minimal linear atelectasis is noted in the left base.below the diaphragm, the liver is visualized and is unremarkable given that this is a non-contrast ct.several calcified granulomas are noted in the spleen.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys are unremarkable.some calcification is noted in the pancreas.full evaluation of the peripancreatic area is not possible without iv contrast.the gallbladder is distended.no significant free fluid within the abdomen.no evidence of any collection and no free air.in the epigastric area, there is wound breakdown with bowel and stomach just underneath the anterior abdominal wall.this wound breakdown continues inferiorly as far as the iliac crest.the lesser sac is poorly defined and is obliterated by imflammatory soft tissue.a bubble of air containing contrast in the gastrocolic area is identified that is not clearly intraluminal: it may represent a focal walled off collectionagain note is made of a suprarenal aneurysm measuring 4.4 cm in transverse x 2.9 cm in ap diameter and this is unchanged.
summary: no evidence of any abscess.open wound from the epigastric area and midline inferiorly as far as the level of the iliac crest.suprarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm with left common iliac artery aneurysm.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.interval removal of jp drain and resolution of previously identified collection.lesser sac poorly evaluated due to no iv contrast and st inflammatory change.bubble air in gastrocolic area which may repreent focal collection: appearances overall improved.

text: large bowel and bladder appear unremarkable.there is no significant pelvic lymphadenopathy evident.pelvic free fluid tracks from the abdomen.examination of osseous structures did not show lytic or sclerotic lesions suspicious for malignancy.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal or intra-abdominal hemorrhage.the attenuation value of the ascites fluid appears simple, very similar to the prior examination.stable or possibly very slight worsening in the degree of ascites.cirrhotic liver.hypodense appearance of the blood, suggesting anemia.

text: there are bilateral moderate simple pleural effusions and a new large pericardial effusion which displays some tamponade effect on the right ventricle which appears compressed in addition to mass effect on the entire heart with abnormal leftward deviation/angulation of the intraventricular septum.bilateral compression atelectasis is noted with the remaining aerated lung parenchyma appearing otherwise unremarkable.the gallbladder displays some third spacing/wall edema but appears otherwise unremarkable as does the liver, spleen, stomach, small bowel, pancreas, adrenal glands, and atrophic appearing kidneys.no pathologically enlarged abdominal lymph nodes are identified and there is no free air.there has been interval development of a moderate to large amount of intra-abdominal ascites.
summary: interval development of a large amount of intra-abdominal/intrapelvic ascites and moderate-to-large pericardial effusion with ct findings suggesting a component of tamponade.cardiac echo recommended.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions.continued decrease in size to a small rim enhancing likely post-operative collection at site of prior right lower quadrant transplant kidney.no findings of colitis.please note during the examination the patient experienced a iv infiltration of intravenous contrast and saline.it is estimated that 70 ml of optiray contrast infiltrated at the patient's iv site.immediately after exam patient displayed no neurological deficits, intact distal pulses and brisk capillary refill.plastics consult was recommended to the er staff caring for the patient.above findings were discussed with dr.___ shortly after exam acquisition at 8:30 p.m.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon and bladder are unremarkable in appearance.there is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.osseous structures demonstrate severe degenerative change throughout the lower thoracic and lumbar spine.there are healing fractures of bilateral superior and inferior pubic rami and the left acetabulum (2:69).
summary: no evidence of obstruction or acute intra-abdominal pathology.right-sided renal lesion concerning for carcinoma and not completely characterized on this single phase of contrast study.mri is recommend for further evaluation.bilateral healing pelvic fractures, one of which involves the left acetabulum.9 mm partially calcified splenic artery aneurysm.these results were posted to the ed dashboard at time of dictation.

text: a right femoral intravenous line is seen coursing into the heart and terminating at the cavoatrial junction (scout image 1b, image 2).the visualized lungs demonstrate mild bibasilar atelectasis.there is no pleural effusion, pneumothorax, or pulmonary mass.the heart appears enlarged.there is a pericardial effusion with hounsfield unit measurements in the range averaging approximately 30.the right atrium does not appear collapsed.
summary: no retroperitoneal bleed.mild to moderate sized pericardial effusion with indeterminate density measurements suggesting proteinaceous fluid or blood.no obvious right atrial compression.recommend echocardiogram right femoral line with tip located at the cavoatrial junction.left lobe hepatic cyst; could consider outpatient ultrasound for further characterization.no large hematoma at right femoral entry site.stranding in mesentery, nonspecific finding.

text: the visualized lung bases show moderate amount of bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis of overlying lung.findings are new as compared to the recent ct study from ___.there is no evidence of pericardial effusion.liver shows a numerous cysts, which are consistent with known diagnosis of polycystic disease.there are number of calcifications in the parenchyma of the right lobe of the liver.one of the cyst in the anterior portion of the right lobe (series 2, image 13) measuring 3 x 6 cm, is now has slightly thickened enhancing wall, which was not seen on the previous post-contrast study on ___.the study in ___ was done as a non-contrast study, therefore enhancement cannot be evaluated, but there is an impression of more thickened wall currently than it was on the ___ scan.finding may be consistent with superinfected cyst.there is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile dilatation.gallbladder contains stones, but is not distended.pancreas is distorted by extensive ascites, but there is no focal lesion in the pancreas.spleen is unremarkable.adrenals are unremarkable bilaterally.extensive amount of ascites is noted.there is some thickening and enhancement of the peritoneum in the pelvis.in the right nephrectomy bed, in the retroperitoneum, there is a fluid collection with thick enhancing wall, measuring 2.9 x 2.6 x 5.8 cm.the finding was present on the previous scan in ___, and it was of the similar size.the enhancing wall could not be evaluated in the previous scan because the study was done without iv contrast.at this site in the ___ study, we can see post-surgical collection which then was of much larger size.the super-infection of this collection cannot be excluded on the current study.
summary: right anterior hepatic cyst, which is currently seen with newly thickened enhancing wall.superinfection of this cyst is a possibility.enhancing peritoneum with thickening in several spots is consistent with peritonitis, though this could be simply from multiple prior paracenteses.right nephrectomy bed collection measuring 2.6 x 5.8 cm.currently this collection has an enhancing wall which could not be evaluated on the previous study, though appeared thickened.the size of the collection is stable as compared to ___ study.again super-infection of this collection cannot be excluded.new bilateral moderate-sized pleural effusions.large amount of ascites similar to the previous studies.status post bilateral nephrectomy.polycystic liver disease.findings were communicated to the referring physician, ___ ___ ___ at 17.30 on ___.

text: in the visualized portion of the thorax, there are bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than the left.there are also multiple patchy opacities within both lung fields consistent with the patient's diagnosis of ards.the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.
summary: bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left and ards.two nonspecific hypodense liver lesions as described on previous study.ultrasound may be used to better characterize these lesions given the patient's tenuous clinical picture.large stable renal cysts without evidence of hydronephrosis or pyelonephritis.diffuse simple ascites without a focal fluid collection concerning for abscess.status post total colectomy and ileostomy without evidence of suture line leak or upstream obstruction.

text: the visualized portion of the lung bases demonstrate no abnormalities.the heart is normal in size.there is homogeneous attenuation in the liver.within the left lobe of the liver, is a 1.5 x 1 cm hypodense lesion (series 2, image 17), consistent with simple cysts and stable compared to prior studies.no other focal lesions are seen in the liver.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilation.the kidneys enhance symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis.there is normal excretion of contrast.a hypodensity is again demonstrated in the lower pole of the left kidney measuring approximately 8 cm, and consistent with a simple cyst.spleen is normal in size.the adrenal glands are normal.there are extensive inflammatory changes in the body of the pancreas.however, there has been interval resolution of the pancreatic pseudocyst, after drainage into the stomach.there is no evidence of fluid accumulation in the pseudocyst in the current exam.minimal inflammatory changes are also noted anterior to the tail of the pancreas.a small possible intrapancreatic pseudocyst measuring less than a centimeter in size is present as well in tail of the pancreas (series 2, image 31).the portal vein, smv, and splenic vein are patent.there is, however, mild extrinsic mass effect on the confluence of these vessels.there are no enlarged lymph nodes in the abdomen.there is no evidence of free fluid.
summary: resolution of pancreatic pseudocyst with residual abnormal appearance of the pancreatic body and peripancreatic tissues likely representing post-pancreatitis changes given the clinical history.please note that an underlying lesion cannot be excluded based on this ct examination.status post cholecystectomy.small foreign body in the cul-de-sac within the pelvis, probably representing dropped surgical clips during previous cholecystectomy.

text: few images through the lung bases demonstrate extensive coronary artery calcifications.there are no pericardial or pleural effusions.no lung nodules are seen.small right hilar lymph nodes are present measuring 9 mm.(series 3, image 1) on the right.within the upper pole of the left kidney, there is a 2-mm focus of low attenuation that is too small to characterize.within the interpolar region of the left kidney anteriorly (image 33), there is a 5-mm focus of low attenuation that is too small to fully characterize, similarly low density lesion is seen in the lower pole of the left kidney measuring 4 mm, that is too small to characterize.the spleen, liver, pancreas, loops of small and large bowel are normal in appearance.there is no ascites.small gallstones seen in the gallbladder.there are small mesenteric and portahepatus lymph nodes (series 3, image 27) and portahepatus lymph nodes measure up to 10 mm in short axis diameter.atherosclerotic calcifications are seen in the abdominal aorta at the origin of the celiac artery and in the infrarenal abdominal aorta and in the common iliac arteries bilaterally.
summary: normal appearing small and large bowel.no bowel obstruction.small gallstones.

text: the lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis.within the limits of a non-contrast study, the liver shows no obvious lesion or intraparenchymal fluid collection.the gallbladder is distended but shows no stones.the spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys demonstrate no evidence of hydronephrosis, perinephric stranding or perinephric fluid collections.the large and small intestines show no evidence of obstruction or pneumatosis.the colon is noted to be distended with gas.there is no free air, free fluid or lymphadenopathy.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process; specifically no fluid collections, hydronephrosis, or perinephric stranding; gas-distended colon, but no obstruction or pneumatosis.prominent inguinal lymph nodes of uncertain clinical significance.well-corticated bony irregularities of the bilateral iliac bones may represent post traumatic change, enthesopathy, osteochondromas, or heterotopic bone.

text: no free air or free fluid identified in the pelvis.there is no evidence for hematoma.there is suboptimal contrast opacification of the colon as the majority of contrast is in the small bowel.however, no focal abnormalities are identified.the bladder has an unremarkable appearance.there is a small fat containing left inguinal hernia.also noted are small bilateral inguinal nodes.bone windows demonstrate a small sclerotic focus in the right iliac bone which likely represents a bone island.no other suspicious lytic or sclerotic abnormalities are identified.
summary: no evidence for intraabdominal or intrapelvic hematoma.right lower lobe consolidation with a moderate right pleural effusion.a right lower lobe pneumonia cannot be excluded.correlation with pa and lateral chest views are recommended.splenomegaly.status post cholecystectomy.

text: the urinary bladder, uterus, adnexa, and rectum are within normal limits.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of small-bowel obstruction.mesenteric soft tissue density containing calcifications most likely to represent either treated lymphomatous disease or sclerosing mesenteritis.however there are no comparison studies the confirm this finding.the other less likely possibilty that can have this appearance is carcinoid.moderate free fluid within the pelvis of unclear etiology.

text: the bladder wall appears thickened.the rectum appears normal.again seen is evidence of sigmoid diverticulosis.the prostatic tissue appears normal in size measuring 3.6 x 3.0 cm.this appears relatively unchanged from the prior study where it measured 3.5 x 3.1 cm.there is no free fluid in the pelvis and no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: large lymph node at the level of the aortic bifurcation appears relatively unchanged in size and appearance.size and appearance of the innumerable sclerotic metastases within the bone also appears unchanged.no new lesions are identified.thickened bladder wall.has patient undergone xrt? if so, these findings would be consistent with post-radiation changes.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.unchanged hypodensities within the liver and kidneys.unchanged calcifications seen in the head of the pancreas.the oncology table for this patient was updated under imaging lab on careweb.

text: the partially distended bladder appears unremarkable.within the seminal vesicles and appearing to abut the prostate are ill-defined areas of hypodensity with peripheral enhancement, the largest of which is approximately 7 mm in diameter.again seen are bilateral inguinal hernias which contain loops of bowel.there is no evidence of bowel wall edema or obstruction.no pathologic pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified, although multiple small pelvic nodes are seen.the distal colon is decompressed and again seen to terminate proximally at the site of surgical suture material in the area of the transverse colon.the osseous structures demonstrate no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.

text: there is mild dilatation of the right ureter.the left ureter appears unremarkable.there is no contrast filling of the right ureter.the urinary bladder appears slightly distended, with air-fluid level noted, presumably secondary to patient's recent turp.also noted is high attenuation density within the urinary bladder, which could represent blood clot.a foley is identified, with the balloon noted within the urethra.there is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or pelvic free fluid.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.

text: the visualized portions of large and small bowel, the distal ureters, and bladder appears normal.there is no free fluid or lymphadenopathy.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal or intrapelvic abscess.improved appearance of the right colon, with slight residual mesenteric stranding.

text: enhancing atelectasis is again present within the lung bases, which is mild.heart size is within normal limits without pericardial effusion.hypoattenuating subcentimeter lesion within the right lobe is unchanged and too small to adequately characterize, possibly representing a cyst.no new liver lesions are identified.prominent periportal lymph node measures 9 mm in short axis (series 2: image 27).no focal lesions are detected within the pancreas.there is no intra- or extra- hepatic biliary ductal dilatation or pancreatic duct dilatation.the adrenal glands, spleen and stomach appear unremarkable.hypoattenuating foci within the kidneys bilaterally are not appreciably changed and too small to adequately characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.ivc filter remains intact without appreciable change.left anterior abdominal ileostomy with mesenteric fat herniation is not appreciably changed since prior study.majority of small bowel loops again noted to remain along the anterior peritoneal surface.appearance of post- surgical changes with stranding, surgical sutures and collections remain unchanged in appearance.small fluid collection tracking from rectal pouch to the anterior abdominal wall demonstrates decrease in size and is currently tiny measuring 1.1 cm in greatest craniocaudal dimension (series 301 b: image 18).
summary: little change to postoperative appearance of the abdomen and pelvis.majority of small bowel loops remain along the anterior peritoneal wall without evidence of bowel obstruction.

text: there are stable bilateral dependent atelectasis at the lung bases with stable small bilateral pleural effusion, left greater than right, cannot rule out superinfection.there is no new consolidation.the heart size is top normal with a trace of pericardial fluid.there is a percutaneous nephrostomy tube extending to the left flank and terminating in the collection system of the left kidney.there are multiple high-density foci within the left kidney and collecting system consistent with renal calculi, unchanged.there is increase in size of low-density perinephric fluid collection, with interval increase in number of air foci within the fluid following left percutaneous nephrostomy.compare series 300b, image 35 with series 300a, image 33 from ___, where there is increase in size, with multiple new interval foci of air within and enhancing rim in the fluid collection.there is stable hydronephrosis of the left kidney with stable superior subcapsular collection, which is concerning for calyceal rupture as described before, with mild interval decrease in size compared to prior scan (300b:35).again seen is a left 7-mm distal ureter obstructing stone (2:64).stable stones and atrophy of the right kidney, no hydronephrosis.the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, stomach, and duodenum are unremarkable.there is a small hypodensity at the right liver lobe, 2:17, too small to characterize.the gallbladder contains several layering gallstones without evidence of acute cholecystitis.the aorta is normal in caliber.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the retroperitoneum or mesentery.
summary: increase in size of low-density, perinephric fluid collection, with interval increase in number of air foci within the fluid collection following left percutaneous nephrostomy, while this may represent a urinoma, seroma or hematoma, superinfection cannot be excluded.stable hydronephrosis of the left kidney with mild decrease in size of superior subcapsular fluid collection, concerning for calyceal rupture, as described before.bilateral renal stones.atrophic right kidney.left 7 mm distal ureteral obstructing stone.stable bilateral small pleural effusion with bilateral dependent atelectasis; cannot rule out superinfection.cholelithiasis.fibroid uterus.

text: a large amount of stool distends the rectum.the urinary bladder is collapsed and contains a foley catheter bulb.the uterus and adnexa are normal in appearance.visible loops of large and small bowel are normal in appearance.there is no free fluid or lymph adenopathy involving the pelvis.bone windows: there is degenerative disc disease involving the thoracolumbar spine and a focal hyperdensity is noted near the body of the uterus, which may represent a calcified fibroid.
summary: there is a small non-occlusive thrombus involving the celiac axis in this patient with diffuse atherosclerotic disease.incidental note is made of a cross-fused renal ectopia, the right kidney is horizontal in position and fused to the inferior pole of the left kidney which is in the appropriate position.there is mild prominence of the common bile duct and intrahepatic bile ducts without focal mass or evidence of mechanical obstruction.

text: the rectum again contains a rectal tube.this sigmoid colon is unremarkable.the distal ureters and bladder are unremarkable.the intrapelvic loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis, but no free air.there is no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.
summary: hypodensity within the right extrarenal pelvis of the kidney, likely representing debris or blood.however, itis of high density on thepost contrast images and the possibility of an enhancing soft tissue mass cannot be entirely excluded.follow-up imaging to confirm resolution is therefore recommended.no evidence for hydronephrosis.five-mm stone within the distal common bile duct without evidence for intrahepatic or more proximal biliary ductal dilatation.gallstones within a collapsed gallbladder.liver cirrhosis with stigmata of portal hypertension, unchanged.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, and large bowel is unremarkable.the uterus and adnexa are within normal limits.the distal ureters and bladder are normal.
summary: heterogeneous liver consistent with hepatitis.no evidence for hydronephrosis or dilated gallbladder.

text: visualized heart is enlarged, without a pericardial effusion.visualized lung bases reveal atelectases, with nodular pleural thickening in the left lung base likely also reflecting atelectatic changes.there is no pleural effusion.assessment of the solid organs in the abdomen is technically limited without iv contrast.allowing for this, the liver, spleen, and right adrenal gland are normal.both kidneys contain rounded hypodensities, likely reflecting cysts; however, these are incompletely characterized without iv contrast.tiny punctate hyperdensity in the interpolar region of the left kidney likely reflects a nonobstructing stone.additionally, there is a left adrenal nodule measuring 2 cm, of indeterminate etiology.the pancreas is fatty infiltrated.however, within the pancreatic head, there is subtle focal area of low attenuation, which may represent a duodenal diverticulum or a prominent duct.the stomach, small bowel, and large bowel reveal colonic diverticulosis without diverticulitis.there is no free air, free fluid, or pathologic adenopathy.no retroperitoneal hematoma is identified.there is extensive atherosclerosis of the abdominal aorta and its major branches.
summary: no source for patient's hematocrit drop identified.left adrenal nodule, of indeterminate etiology.ill-defined low attenuation in the region of the pancreatic head.this could represent a duodenal diverticulum or a prominent duct.if further characterization of this is desired, an ultrasound may be obtained.multiple renal hypodensities likely reflect renal cysts.tiny non-obstructing calculus in the left kidney.cardiomegaly, with extensive atherosclerotic disease of the aorta.

text: the lung bases are clear.visualized portions of the heart and pericardium are within normal limits.the liver, spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach and abdominal bowel appear within normal limits.a 4 mm hypodensity within the mid portion of the left kidney is too small to characterize, but could represent a simple cyst.there is no abdominal lymphadenopathy or free fluid.

text: there are patchy bibasilar opacities, slightly improved from the prior study, which may represent recurrent or residual aspiration/pneumonia.the heart is mildly enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.non-contrast evaluation of the liver, adrenal glands, kidneys, abdominal loops of small bowel are unremarkable.the colon contains dense material, most likely from metal base medication.abdominal wall collaterals are again noted.the ivc filter is in place.the spleen is mildly enlarged, measuring 16.2 cm.there is a small hiatal hernia.there is no free air and no free fluid in the abdomen.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.

text: the liver and spleen appear unremarkable.gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear unremarkable.kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.abdominal aorta and major branch vessels are widely patent.there is no free intraperitoneal air or fluid.the stomach and duodenum appear normal.

text: the densely calcified right pleural plaque is unchanged.there is right basilar atelectasis.tiny right granuloma is seen at the lung base.the heart is enlarged.no pleural or pericardial effusion.median sternotomy wires and coronary artery calcifications are noted.hypodensities within the liver are probably cysts, unchanged from ___.the gallbladder is not visualized.the spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the pancreas is markedly atrophic with calcifications and the duct is not dilated.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber.diverticula are seen throughout the colon, predominantly in the sigmoid, without inflammatory changes.no free air and no free fluid.small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged by ct size criteria.atherosclerotic calcifications are seen throughout the aorta with mild aneurysmal dilatation of the infrarenal abdominal aorta to 3.0 cm with intraluminal thrombus, unchanged from ___.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly.non-contrast images demonstrate no stones in the kidneys or collecting system.there is no hydronephrosis or obstruction.multiple bilateral renal cysts, the largest measuring 4.6 cm on the right, are unchanged from ___.no new mass is seen.
summary: no hydronephrosis or obstruction.no renal mass.multiple bilateral simple cysts.markedly abnormal appearance of the trabeculated bladder, similar in appearance to ___.mild aneurysmal dilatation of the infrarenal abdominal aorta with intraluminal thrombus, unchanged from ___.

text: ct abdomen and pelvis with iv and oral contrast: the lung bases demonstrate mild atelectasis.otherwise, they are clear.the heart size is normal.the spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, and intra-abdominal loops of bowel are within normal limits.the gallbladder contains a small gallstone, unchanged.a biliary stent is noted which is new since prior ct study.the common bile duct remains markedly dilated measuring up to 20 mm, not significantly changed since the prior study.the pancreatic duct also remains markedly dilated measuring up to 8 mm in diameter, unchanged.the stomach contains food debris but is otherwise normal.the liver demonstrates intrahepatic biliary dilatation which appears slightly worse than on the previous ct.the hypodensity in segment iv measures up to 6 mm and is unchanged.no new hepatic lesions are identified.small retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes are seen, none meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no free air or free fluid.
summary: the patient had a reaction to the iv contrast in the form of diffuse hives and probable mild laryngeal edema.please see above note for further details.probable slight increase in the amount of intrahepatic biliary dilatation.otherwise, no significant change since the prior study.stable appearance of borderline size fluid-filled appendix.

text: nonhemorrhagic pericardial effusion is reidentified.unchanged from prior examination.small amount of right pleural effusion with secondary atelectasis is seen, again grossly unchanged from prior examination.
summary: thickening of small and large bowel, including the entire colon and much of the small bowel worrisome for a severe form of enterocolitis; to some extent bowel wall changes may reflect superimposed peritonitis associated with bowel perforation.discontinuity of enhancement along cecal mucosa with few extra luminal gas bubbles and enhancement of the peritoneum in proximity, as well as an extraluminal interloop fluid collection in the right mid abdomen and extravasation of enteric contrast consistent with recent or ongoing bowel perforation.these finding are worrisome for severe ischemia or necrosis of the cecal wall and perforation although the main site of perforation may be elsewhere.proximal small bowel dilation with tapering to smaller caliber distally and no definite transition point; although partial small bowel obstruction is not excluded, this appearance may reflect an ileus associated with a severe inflammatory process.multiple small subcentimeter splenic hypoattenuating lesions.given the patient's history that might represent opportunistic infection such as could be seen with fungal infections including candidiasis.uterus anomaly with unchanged fibroid.

text: imaged small bowel is unremarkable.proximal large bowel is normal with thickening of the lower portion of the sigmoid colon as it passes over the left adnexa.residual contrast is seen within the distal colon.though no active extravasation of intraluminal contrast is seen, there is a collection of air and fluid surrounding the uterus, both dependently between the uterus and bladder as well as wrapping around to the right and superior to the uterus.the dependent collection measures 6.4 x 1.9 cm and the likely contiguous superior collection measures 4.7 x 2.0.these collections do not appear at the current time to be matured abscesses but rather are simply the dependent pooling of expelled air and fluid from the sigmoid colon.there is no pathologic adenopathy seen with normal-appearing bladder and uterus otherwise.the rectum is normal.there is no inguinal adenopathy.soft tissues are unremarkable with the exception of air in the anterior abdominal wall soft tissues, likely from injection.
summary: air, fluid, and contrast collecting between the uterus and bladder and wrapping around superior to it, best seen on coronal images.this does not currently appeare to be a mature collection, and is thus likely not currently amenable to drainage.

text: pacemaker wires and coronary stents are noted.the ascending aorta is dilated measuring 4.5 cm.there are atherosclerotic calcifications and a tortuous descending aorta.lung windows demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis.a small nodule is seen in the right middle lobe in series 2, image 13 measuring 2 mm.the liver, spleen, and stomach are unremarkable.the adrenal glands are poorly visualized.there is a mild gallbladder wall edema.the gallbladder is not distended and no gallstones are visualized.multiple hypodense cysts are seen within both kidneys consistent with polycystic kidney disease.higher density lesions are seen within both kidneys, likely representing hyperdense cysts.a 2.0 cm (series 104b, image 35) hyperdense left upper pole cyst has coarse calcifications within its wall.there are calcifications of the abdominal aorta, which dilates distally and measures 3.7 cm just proximal to the common iliac bifurcation.the right and left iliac arteries are also mildly dilated measuring 2.2 cm on the right and 1.6 cm on the left.there is no evidence of hemorrhage surrounding the aorta, although evaluation is limited without iv contrast.there is no free fluid or free air within the abdomen.
summary: dilatation of the ascending aorta to 4.5 cm.2-mm right middle lobe pulmonary nodule, which can be followed if clinically indicated in one year.abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.7 cm extending to the common iliac arteries.polycystic kidney disease.hyperdense lesions within both kidneys likely represent hemorrhagic cysts, although these cannot be fully evaluated on this examination.a left upper pole cyst has coarse wall calcifications.

text: bilateral nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions, moderate on the left and small on the right, are not significantly changed compared to ___ ___.adjacent opacification in the left lung base likely reflects compressive atelectasis.the heart is incompletely visualized but significant mitral annulus calcification is detected.no pericardial effusion noted.the liver is homogeneous in attenuation without discrete masses or lesions.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the pancreas is atrophic but without obvious mass or pancreatic duct dilatation.the spleen is not enlarged.the bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the patient is status post left nephrectomy.the right kidney is unremarkable.the bladder is moderately distended and grossly normal.the stomach and small bowel are normal in appearance.the ascending and transverse large bowel are unremarkable.there is medialization of the descending large bowel, likely due to nephrectomy.the sigmoid colon and rectum are difficult to visualize given delayed transit of oral contrast and lack of intra-abdominal fat.there is extensive diverticula, but no definite bowel wall thickening to suggest underlying diverticulitis or colitis.fluid noted within the sigmoid colon and rectum in addition to more formed stool consistent with reported history of zealous response to constipation treatment.no inflammatory changes identified within the fat.the left, right, and main portal veins and their major tributaries are unremarkable.extensive arthrosclerotic disease is noted throughout the abdominal arterial system without dissection or aneurysm.no findings to suggest related bowel ischemia.small amount of free fluid is noted within the perihepatic space and layering within the pelvis, nonspecific finding.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions identified.multilevel degenerative changes noted in the lumbar spine with severe disc space narrowing at the l3-4 and l4-5 levels, with stable grade 1 anterolisthesis of l3 on l4, no associated spondylolysis evident.
summary: unchanged bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions, left greater than right, with adjacent atelectasis.stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.within the large bowel, there appears to be fluid mixed with formed stool, consistent with aggressive treatment of constipation and subsequent diarrhea.extensive sigmoid diverticula without diverticulitis.no colitis definitively identified.small amount of intra-abdominal fluid including perihepatic as well as fluid layering within the pelvis, nonspecific finding.multilevel degenerative changes in the lumbar spine as described above.significant arthrosclerotic calcification throughout including the mitral annulus.no evidence of ischemia, dissection, or aneurysm.

text: there is small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.urinary bladder, distal ureters and uterus are unremarkable.follicular activity is noted in the adnexa bilaterally.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.
summary: thickened septal lines at the lung bases with more focal ground-glass and pulmonary opacities predominately at the right lung base.this may represent developing ards or multifocal pneumonia with superimposed interstitial edema.mild periportal and pericholecystic edema.no evidence of acute appendicitis.

text: there is a moderate left-sided pleural effusion, stable.there is associated atelectasis.there is no pericardial effusion.there is minimal right basilar atelectasis.within the limitations of a non-contrast exam, the spleen, liver, gallbladder, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the right kidney contains a hypodense lesion arising from the mid pole measuring approximately 5.1 cm, stable and likely representing a simple cyst.the left kidney contains a hypodense lesion arising from the upper pole (2, 33), stable, as well as small lesions (2, 35), also stable and likely previously shown as a simple cyst.smaller hypodense lesions in the lower pole of the left kidney are stable but incompletely characterized (2, 48).an ng tube is identified within the stomach.small bowel loops are mildly dilated and demonstrates small amount of wall thickening likely secondary to the primary process.there is a pancreatic pseudocyst measuring approximately 5.4 x 5.6 cm in the mid body of the pancreas (2, 33) which is similar in size.an additional fluid collection along the lesser curvature of the stomach (2, 35) measures 7.7 x 4.6 cm is stable.an indwelling catheter is seen along the inferior margin of this collection (2, 38).fluid within the lower abdomen and pelvis appears similar in size and configuration.small amount of loculated fluid in the left lower quadrant (2, 75) contains an additional indwelling catheter which has moderately decreased in size in superior and inferior extent.no new fluid collections are identified.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.small amount of free fluid is seen surrounding the perihepatic space, stable.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
summary: pleural effusion and bibasilar atelectasis, stable.pancreatic pseudocysts as described above, unchanged to decreased in size.multiple indwelling catheters.loculated fluid in the left lower quadrant is slightly smaller in size.no new fluid collections identified.mildly loculated central ascites is extensive but fairly stable, not definitely communicating to the more peripheral collection which was recently drained.continued consultation with the abdominal interventional service is suggested.mild dilatation of the small bowel loops likely ileus or inflammatory reaction secondary to primary pancreatitis.partial or early obstruction seems less likely, but if suspected serial radiographs could be considered.renal hypodensities, incompletely characterized, but stable when compared to prior exams.diffuse anasarca.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, prostate, and seminal vesicles are within normal limits.small amount of free fluid is present.no lymphadenopathy is appreciated.
summary: no filling defect in the central and segmental pulmonary embolus.respiratory motion and poor bolus timing renders evaluation for subsegmental pe in the left lower lobe non-diagnositic.two-mm calcified granuloma within the right middle lobe.patchy opacity within the lung bases, which likely represents atelectasis.ill-defined wedge shaped area of low attenuation within the periphery of the right hepatic lobe, which is of doubtful clinical and may represent benign entity such as a hemangioma.although less likely, neoplastic process or infection cannot be entirely excluded.dedicated liver mri may be of benefit to further evaluate this lesion on a nonurgent basis.

text: the sigmoid colon and rectum are unremarkable.there is very little fluid in the pelvis.there are calcified seminal vesicles.the patient is status post colectomy.
summary: interval resolution of small-bowel obstruction with now unremarkable small and large bowel.new onset of ascites.more advanced liver disease such as cirrhosis cannot be excluded.

text: there is linear atelectasis within the visualized lung bases.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the native kidneys and pancreas are atrophic.a g-tube lies within the stomach.there are no enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.there is no free air or free fluid in the abdomen.
summary: 2-mm nonobstructing stone in the transplant kidney.no explaination for abnormal amylase and lipase identified (allowing for noncontrast technique).

text: lung bases demonstrate mild atelectatic change.no pleural fluid.imaged heart is not enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.lack of iv contrast limits the evaluation of the solid organs.the liver is fatty infiltrated.no intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile duct dilation.gallbladder is distended but unremarkable.the adrenals are normal.the kidneys demonstrate no hydronephrosis.urinary bladder and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.coarse calcifications within the prostate are noted.the small and large bowel are of normal caliber and nonobstructed.normal appendix is seen in the right lower quadrant.there is a tiny left fat-containing inguinal hernia.there is a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.mild atherosclerotic calcifications of the aorta and iliac vessels with no evidence of aneurysmal dilation are noted.the vessels appear patent.there is no evidence of lymphadenopathy.there is no retroperitoneal bleed.no free fluid.no free air.there are no aggressive osseous lesions.degenerative changes of the si joints and lumbar spine worst at l3-l4 with disc space narrowing and disc osteophyte complexes are noted.there is a tiny posterior disc herniation at l3-4 causing minimal narrowing of the spinal canal.
summary: no acute abnormality seen on this noncontrasted ct.no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, and sigmoid colon are normal.coarse calcifications in the prostate are again noted.
summary: continued improvement of multiple hepatic abscesses, with largest collection measuring 1.3 cm x 8 mm.continued improvement of left pericolic gutter fluid collection, now measuring 1.5 cm x 1.6 cm.chronic left portal vein thrombosis.left lower lobe atelectasis and small left pleural effusion.2-mm right middle lobe pulmonary nodule.chest ct followup in 12 months is recommended in the presence of known risk factors for intra- thoracic malignancy.otherwise, no further followup for this is necessary.findings were communicated to ___ ___ at the time of interpretation.

text: in the visualized thorax, there are small bilateral pleural effusions, new on the right with associated relaxation atelectasis.there is no pulmonary mass or pneumothorax.the heart is normal in size.there is a new small pericardial effusion.an orogastric tube is seen with its tip located in the gastric fundus.in the abdomen, evaluation of the solid organs is limited without intravenous contrast.there are areas of high-attenuation material at the dome of the liver (series 2, image 7) and a larger 3.8 x 1.6 cm focus posterior to the right lobe (series 2, image 12; series 300b, image 26) as well as numerous foci inferiorly (series 2, image 25).these are consistent with calcifications on the liver surface and within the liver.posterior to these foci is a fluid collection, apparently contained, in morison's pouch region abutting the right but not engulfing the right kidney.this extends anteriorly to where gas is seen in the porta hepatis region just inferior to a bilary stent and measures approximately 12.3 x 3.9 cm.a metallic density linear structure is seen in this gas-filled portion anteriorly (series 2, image 39) likely a clip.the collection is heterogenous with some porions measuring fluid density (18hu) and other being denser (38hu).no oral contrast is seen the fluid collection.oral contrast is only identified in the stomach.hepatic parenchyma is difficult to assess without intravenous contrast.there is moderate ascites.the pancreas appears normal.the spleen, adrenals, and kidneys appear normal.abdominal loops of bowel are not dilated.apart from gas in the possible abscess, there is no free air.there is no pathologic abdominal lymphadenopathy.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber and course.loops of small bowel in the left abdomen are noted to have wall thickening.
summary: large heterogeneous fluid collection posterior to the right lobe of the liver consistent with hematoma.gas within the fluid collection raises concern for infection.differential diagnosis would include surgicel, however the operative note does not mention that this was used.small bowel wall thickening likely due to hypoalbuminemia.moderate ascites.small bilateral pleural effusions, new on the right, and associated atelectasis.new small pericardial effusion

text: multiple tiny lung nodules are identified in the lung bases more predominantly on the right than the left, which measure approximately 1-2 mm.in the absence of a primary malignancy, followup is advised in one year.a calcified granuloma is noted in the right base.note is made of multiple paraesophageal varices.there is a trace pericardial effusion noted.below the diaphragm, the patient is status post olt.there is fluid around the liver posteriorly which contains some air bubbles.the appearances are most likely consistent with postoperative changes such as surgicel.the spleen is enlarged.note is made of splenic varices.there are subcentimeter retroperitoneal lymph nodes noted.an ivc filter is seen in the ivc.the pancreas demonstrates peripancreatic stranding.this may be secondary to postoperative change.correlation with amylase and clinical correlation advised.the adrenals and kidneys are unremarkable.the bowel, where visualized, is normal.
summary: multiple tiny lung nodules, which in the absence of primary malignancy, advise one year followup.status post olt with esophageal and splenic varices and splenomegaly.peripancreatic stranding, which may represent postoperative change.clinical correlation advised.ivc filter.fluid around the liver containing air, which may be secondary to surgical procedure involving surgicel.

text: there is contrast in the bladder.a foley catheter is also present in the bladder.pelvic bowel loops appear unremarkable, without evidence of high-density material.
summary: basilar consolidations concerning for aspiration.limited evaluation of the abdomen and pelvis without evidence of high- density material in the bowel.dfdkq

text: upon further review of the online medical record, and discussions with the surgical resident, the patient's recent surgical history was obtained.the patient is status post ileocecectomy secondary to a prior anastomotic leak performed on ___.a diverting ileostomy was created with an additional externalized loop of small bowel.the remainder of the colon from the mid transverse colon was re-anastomosed to the functional diverting ileostomy.
summary: patient is status post recent complex abdominal surgery with diverting ileostomy, externalized loop of small bowel, and re-anastomosed segment of colon.expected postoperative changes with slight increase in mesenteric inflammation.no evidence of associated abcess formation or obstruction with contrast flowing freely through the ileostomy and through to the rectum.

text: the patient was scanned with her arms at her side, with resultant limiting streak artifact.visualized lungs demonstrate dependent atelectasis, without consolidation, effusion or pneumothorax.the liver is normal in size and attenuation, without focal lesions.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder is unremarkable.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric parenchymal enhancement and contrast excretion, without hydronephrosis.there are scattered hypodense lesions in the kidneys, too small to characterize.the duodenum and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no bowel distention or bowel wall thickening.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.the aorta and major mesenteric vessels are normal in caliber, and widely patent.there is mild atherosclerosis.
summary: no evidence of acute visceral injury in the abdomen or pelvis.scattered hypodense renal lesions, too small to characterize.degenerative changes in the lumbar spine.soft tissue contusion/hematoma over the right gluteal region, incompletely visualized.

text: there is a moderate amount of stool in the rectum and sigmoid colon which are otherwise grossly normal in appearance as are the remaining pelvic loops of small and large bowel.a foley is in a decompressed bladder.the uterus appears normal.no free air, no free fluid is seen in the pelvis.there is no pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.the femoral veins and their more proximal branches extending up into the inferior vena cava show no evidence for thrombus.
summary: no evidence for ivc or other venous clot.trace pericholecystic fluid without evidence for cholecystitis.simple left renal cyst.bilateral transpedicular screws at l3, l4, l5 with laminectomy performed at the same level.no evidence for hardware failure or fracture.

text: there is a large wide mouth ventral abdominal wall hernia containing multiple loops of small bowel without evidence of bowel obstruction or bowel wall edema.more superiorly is a smaller ventral abdominal hernia, which contains a loop of transverse colon, also without evidence of obstruction or bowel compromise.surgical clips are noted adjacent to this hernia.all visualized bowel is normal in appearance.the appendix is visualized and unremarkable in appearance.post-surgical changes are noted in the sigmoid colon status post partial colectomy.within the left aspect of the anterior abdominal wall at the inferior aspect of the pannus is an area of soft tissue thickening and a tiny ill defined focus of fluid and a tiny locule of air located just superficial to the skin surface(2a:52).this area measures 3.7 cm transversely and is approximately 1.3 cm deep to the skin surface.no drainable fluid collection or abscess is identified.the remaining soft tissues are unremarkable.no sinus tracts or abscess formation is noted in the groin bilaterally.there is no free fluid in the pelvis.the bladder and prostate are normal in appearance.the visualized osseous structures are unremarkable with no focal lytic or sclerotic lesions identified.
summary: small superficial focus of soft tissue thickening and ill-defined fluid located within the soft tissues of the left anterior abdominal wall along the left inferior aspect of the pannus, which may represent a focal area of infection.correlation with clinical findings is recommended.no abscess or definable fluid collection is identified as clinically questioned.similarly, no abnormalities are noted within the soft tissues of the groin bilaterally.two ventral wall hernias containing non-dilated loops of small and large bowel without evidence of obstruction and unchanged from prior studies.

text: pelvic loops of small bowel are normal.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.there is wall thickening and pericolonic fat effacement involving the pelvic loops of large bowel.there is no free air, free fluid or pathologic lymphadenopathy.
summary: pancolitis: given history of cellulitis and presumed antibiotic use, pseudomembraous colitis is most likely etiology.correlate clinically.other etilogies such an infection, inflammatory or vascular are felt much less likely.

text: there is a large lytic lesion centered in the right upper sacral ala, with scattered small high density internal foci -- ? calcification vs hemorrhage.the lesion erodes into the right side of the s1 vertebral body and to a lesser extent s2.it also appears to cross the right si joint to erode into the adjoining portion of the right iliac bone.the lesion extends into the right s1 lateral recess and effaces the right s1 neural foramen, displacing and effacing the nerve root (series 2, image 12).the left sacrum and si joints are grossly unremarkable.the lesion extends from the upper portion of the s1 vertebral body inferiorly into the s2 vertebral body.the overlying anterior and posterior cortex is eroded and the soft tissue mass extends beyond the confines of the sacrum, anteriorly and posteriorly.the lesion abuts portions of the sacral plexus (series 300b, image 31) and also abuts the internal iliac vessels (series 2, images 16-18).on today's exam, lesion measures approximately 41 x 53 (axial) x 43 mm.on the prior study, it measured 38 x 45 (axial) x 45.however, the overall appearance is similar and i suspect that this reflects predominantly differences in measurement.also again seen is a relatively large lesion in the posterior aspect of the left femoral neck (2:38), which has a sclerotic rim, but which involves a large portion of the posterior cortex of the proximal femur.this lesion measures approximately 25 x 20 (axial) x 33 mm on today's exam.there is compared with the measurement of 23 x 13 (axial) x 18 mm and this lesion may now be larger than on the prior exam.an additional small area of cortical interruption (4.2-mm segment) is seen along the posterior aspect of the right femoral calcar, just above the lesser tuberosity (series 2, image 38 and series 300b, image 24), which is similar to the ___ torso ct.there is a small amount of material in the pouch of ___ on the right (series 2, image 29), slightly more prominent than on ___.this measures 5.5-16.3 ___ and most likely represents some free fluid in the pelvis.however, in the absence of intravenous contrast, the presence or absence of a subtle soft tissue component cannot be entirely excluded.hip joints are within normal limits, though small joint effusions cannot be excluded.the pubic symphysis is within normal limits.aside from the large right sacral lesion, no fracture or other focal lesion is detected about the pelvic girdle.clips noted in the lower abdomen.
summary: large lesion centered in the right sacral ala, with extensive bony destruction, effacement of the right s1 neural foramen, and abutment of portions of the sacral plexus and overlying vasculature.compared with ___, the measurements have changed, but the overall appearance is quite similar, without definite interval change in extent.a lytic lesion is compatible witha renal cell metastasis, but the presence of internal calcification is unusual -- has this lesion been treated? alternatively, these high density foci could represent areas of hemorrhage within the lesion.lesion in the posterior left femoral neck, which is slightly larger.this is associated with thinning of the cortex and increased risk for fracture.area of cortical interruption in the right subtrochanteric femur, suspicious for metastasis, grossly unchanged.probable free fluid in the pelvis.please see comment.

text: a foley catheter is seen within the bladder lumen, as well as non-dependent air.the uterus, adnexa, and rectum appear unremarkable.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is a small amount of stranding in the right groin.a pressure dressing appears to overlie the right groin.the osseous structures demonstrate no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, seminal vesicles, bladder, and intrapelvic loops of small bowel are within normal limits.no free fluid or lymphadenopathy is identified.note is made of a right fat-containing inguinal hernia.

text: minimal atelectatic changes are seen at both lung bases.the heart is markedly enlarged.there is a single-lead pacemaker seen within the right ventricle.a tiny gallstone is seen within the dependent portion of the gallbladder.the gallbladder is otherwise normal.allowing for the lack of iv contrast, the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenals are normal in appearance.both native kidneys are markedly atrophic.intra-abdominal large and small bowel appear unremarkable.there is a moderate amount of free fluid seen throughout the abdomen.there is no free air.numerous lymph nodes are seen scattered throughout the mesentery, the largest measuring approximately 15 mm.
summary: ascites within the abdomen.cardiomegaly.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.degenerative changes with cystic changes seen in the right femoral head.superior displacement of the femoral head.these findings may be post- traumatic or post- infectious in etiology.dedicated hip films are recommended.infiltration of iv contrast and saline into the patient's forearm was discussed with dr.___ ___ by dr.___ ___ at the time of the examination.

text: the sigmoid colon is markedly dilated, measuring up to 11 cm in diameter, and undergoes an abrupt caliber change and 'beaking' distally (series 2, image 56).there is associated swirling of mesenteric vessels and fat (series 2, image 55, 59; series 300b, images 29 through 40).the dilated sigmoid colon courses anterior to the stomach and the tranverse colonresidual stool is seen in the rectum.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.the prostate appears enlarged measuring 6.4 cm.trace dependent pelvic free fluid is noted.there is no pelvic free air or lymphadenopathy.
summary: findings are consistent with sigmoid volvulus.

text: the rectum and bladder are unremarkable.there are calcifications within the prostate gland which appear unchanged compared to prior.colonic diverticula are seen throughout the sigmoid colon without evidence of diverticulitis.there is no pelvic free fluid.no pathologic abdominal or pelvic lymphadenopathy is identified.there are bilateral direct uncomplicated inguinal hernias containing bowel.
summary: three high-density complex fluid collections along the anterior abdominal wall.the right and left lateral collections appear sub-fascial although outside of the abdominal wall musculature.the more medial collection to the left of midline appears to be within the rectus muscle.these most likely represent hematomas.the differential diagnosis also includes complex seromas.though no signs suggest it, superinfection can not be excluded.persistent right pleural effusion and findings suggestive of pulmonary edema.stable bilateral renal cysts.dense calcifications within the aorta and its branch vessels.stable prostate calcifications.bilateral uncomplicated direct inguinal hernias containing bowel.the above findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 3:30 p.m.on ___ via telephone by dr.___ ___.
