text: the visualized lung bases are clear.the liver demonstrates a portosystemic shunt.the portal vein appears patent; assessment of the shunt is limited by the phase of the contrast although it also appears patent.the liver demonstrates a nodular contour compatible with cirrhosis.the gallbladder is decompressed although it shows small amount of wall edema.the spleen is enlarged measuring 15.7 cm in its long axis (601b; 36).coil material is seen in the region of the duodenum, likely to occlude varices.the splenic vein and sma are patent.the adrenal glands and pancreas show no masses.subtle fluid-stranding is seen near the pancreatic tail and in the mesentery.the kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis.the small and large bowel show no evidence of obstruction or wall edema.there is no free air.small amount of ascites is seen.incidental note is made of a small fat-containing umbilical hernia.the appendix is normal.
summary: cirrhotic liver with portosystemic shunt in place.splenomegaly and small amount of ascites.gallbladder wall edema most likely reflects sequela of hepatic dysfunction.if there is clinical concern for pancreatitis, correlate with lipase.

text: ct of the abdomen without iv contrast.the lung bases are visualized.there are noncalcified pleural plaques at the bases.the liver, spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is extensive calcification of the main abdominal arteries.the native kidneys are atrophic bilaterally.there is subtle thickening of the antrum of the stomach as well as suggestion of hypersecretion within the small bowel.this can be seen in gastroenteritis.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction or focal bowel wall thickening.the transplanted kidney is seen within the right renal pelvis and appears unremarkable without evidence of perinephric fluid or definite abscess.ct of the pelvis without iv contrast.the urinary bladder is partially decompressed.the uterus is unremarkable with likely follicles within the right ovary.
summary: no evidence of an intra-abdominal or pelvic abscess.however this is limited as iv contrast was not administered.subtle thickening of the antrum as well as small bowel that may represent an element of gastroenteritis.evaluation of the transplanted kidney is limited secondary to lack of iv contrast.osseous changes as above.these results were discussed with ordering physician.

text: the bladder, rectum are unremarkable.the patient is status post sigmoid colectomy.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy or pelvic free fluid is present.the partially imaged hips and flank show nonspecific soft tissue stranding.
summary: no acute intra-abdominal process noted.nonspecific soft tissue stranding in the partially imaged hips.left adrenal adenoma.

text: a small pocket of intravesical air is noted in the anti-dependent portion of an otherwise normal urinary bladder, compatible with recent instrumentation.the colon is unremarkable and patent with contrast.trace amount of fluid tracks from the abdomen to the right deep pelvis.there is no gross lymphadenopathy or free air in the pelvis.
summary: overall unchanged size and configuration of the pancreatic head/neck/uncinate process collection but with interval development of interspersed gas pockets within the collection.differential diagnosis includes evolution of necrotic pancreatic tissue, superinfection of the pseudocyst, or development of enteric fistula.no definite evidence of vascular complications.interval placement of the percutaneous cholecystostomy tube.slightly prominent small bowel, but no evidence of bowel obstruction.interval development of trace ascites.interval development of bilateral small pleural effusions and atelectasis.dr.___ ___ has communicated the pertinent findings the primary team, dr.___ ___ promptly after the preliminary interpretation at 4:00 p.m.

text: there is a small left pleural effusion.there is a small pericardial effusion.both effusions demonstrate hounsfield unit attenuation of simple fluid.there is a focus of atelectasis at the right lung base.there is sludge within the gallbladder.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys are unremarkable on this noncontrast evaluation.there is diffuse edema within the mesentery, as well as within the superficial soft tissues.there are no focal intraabdominal fluid collections.
summary: small left pleural effusion and pericardial effusions.no abdominal, pelvic or groin hematoma.generalized edema consistent with anasarca.

text: there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.a small amount of stranding is seen adjacent to the right femoral vascular structures in the inguinal region, likely related to the reported prior catheterization.there is a tiny amount of gas within the subcutaneous tissues at this location.within the right lower quadrant, there is an oblong, rim-calcified structure with dense walls.this is contiguous with a tubular appearing soft tissue density superiorly.it measures 11 mm in transverse diameter.this could possibly represent a calcification within the fat within the right lower quadrant, such as a calcified lymph node, however, its proximity to an apparent tubular-appearing structure could potentially indicate an appendicolith although appendix is not clearly delineated in relation to this large calcification.there is no evidence of surrounding inflammation to suggest acute appendicitis.the bladder contains a foley catheter and air consistent with foley catheter insertion.the prostate and seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there is no pathologic appearing pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: mild amount of stranding in the right inguinal region consistent with recent catheterization.no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.11 mm peripherally calcified oblong structure in the right lower quadrant is nonspecific and could possibly indicate an appendicolith, versus a calcified lymph node.

text: direct comparison is made to the most recent prior ct dated ___.the lung bases are clear.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas appear unremarkable.the right kidney appears normal.left kidney contains a focal hypoattenuating area which likely represents a simple cyst but is incompletely characterized given its size.the patient is noted to be status post subtotal gastrectomy with roux-en-y gastrojejunostomy.there is no evidence of tumor recurrence.the bowel is otherwise grossly unremarkable.pelvic structures appear normal.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are seen.stable small fat- containing ventral hernia is identified.
summary: no evidence of recurrence of tumor identified.swana

text: there is a large nonhemorrhagic right-sided pleural effusion with adjacent compressive atelectasis.limited views of the chest demonstrate a calcified thoracic aorta without evidence of aneurysmal change.heart size is normal and without pericardial effusion.extensive coronary calcification evident.small hiatal hernia noted.evaluation of the abdominal viscera is limited due to lack of intravenous contrast.within this limitation, multiple fiducial seed markers are noted within the cirrhotic liver corresponding with previously treated lesions.there is a large heterogeneous lesion within the inferior aspect of the right hepatic lobe measuring approximately 7 cm in greatest diameter.the mixed density lesion has areas of higher density within it, which may correspond to hemorrhagic content.complex free fluid is identified within the abdomen with areas of higher density noted in the region of the large liver lesion, consistent with acute peritoneal hemorrhage.areas of mixed density are noted throughout the complex fluid, likely reflective of hemoperitoneum mixed with background ascites associated with liver disease.the stomach and small bowel are unremarkable.diverticulosis is evident without inflammatory change to suggest diverticulitis.the contours of the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.extensive calcifications noted throughout the abdominal vasculature without evidence of aneurysmal dilatation.no free air identified.no significant lymphadenopathy evident on this non-contrast scan.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions evident.
summary: cirrhotic liver with a large mass residing along the inferior right hepatic lobe, most likely representing hepatoma, although not fully characterized on non-contrast imaging.complex free fluid within the abdomen with the highest density noted in the region of the suspected liver mass is consistent with extensive peritoneal hemorrhage suspected to reflect bleeding from a large hepatoma.small hiatal hernia.final report discussed with dr.___ at 11:30 am on ___.

text: 2-3 mm, noncalcified nodules in the right lung base are unchanged, otherwise the lung bases are clear.there is no pleural effusion.calcification is noted along the coronary arteries.the patient is status post median sternotomy.soft tissue thickening anterior to the heart may represent small amount of fluid below the diaphragm anteriorly; this appearance is unchanged from prior.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands appear normal.the kidneys contain several cysts, which are unchanged.punctate calcifications along the neck of the pancreas are unchanged.the stomach and small bowel appear unremarkable.vascular calcifications are noted along the abdominal aorta, without aneurysmal dilatation.small mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for adenopathy.no free fluid or free air is noted within the abdomen.regions of inflammatory change within the abdomen along the left colon are unchanged, with a larger phlegmonous region measuring 4.7 x 3.4 cm at the junction of the descending colon and the sigmoid colon.more superiorly, a 1.7 x 1.4 cm flame-shaped region of fat stranding along the splenic flexure is slightly larger when compared to the most recent prior ct of ___.there is again a wide-based hernia along the ventral abdominal wall.stranding is noted along the adjacent fat along this hernia along its inferior aspect.again, there is a small pocket of fluid measuring 4 x 0.9 cm (2:60) containing a small bubble of gas; appearance of this small collection is little changed from the most recent prior study.
summary: likely left-sided colonic epiploic appendagitis, with stable inflammatory pseudomass along the inferior left colon and smaller area of inflammatory change along the splenic flexure, slightly worsened compared to most recent prior of ___.no new focal fluid collection seen.persistent anterior abdominal wall fat stranding with small fluid collection containing small air bubble which is similar in appearance.persistent fat stranding in the pelvis, both posteriorly and along the right iliac chain, without new fluid collection.

text: large ill-defined mass-like soft tissue density within the pelvis is seen concerning for recurrence, new since prior exam.the bladder and distal ureters are normal.the hartmann pouch demonstrates hyperdense material, which appears unchanged since prior exam.multiple surgical clips are again noted within the pelvis, and are likely related to prior lymphadenectomy.the reported rectovaginal fistula cannot be identified in this study.
summary: ill-defined mass-like soft tissue density in the pelvis concerning for tuumor recurrence.no evidence of small-bowel obstruction.persistent thickening of the bowel wall likely related to patient's liver disease/hypoproteinemia.cirrhosis and portal hypertension, as described above, with worsening ascites.

text: the rectum is normal.there is some diverticulosis in the sigmoid.there is no free fluid.the bladder is normal.
summary: interval improvement in the previously noted fluid collection anterior to the left lobe of the liver at the site of the surgical scar.no evidence of a new fluid collection or frank abscess.sigmoid diverticulosis.hyperdensities in the subcutaneous tissue of the abdominal wall, similar to prior study.

text: there has been an increase in the small bilateral pleural effusions but more marked progression of the bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.superimposed consolidation cannot be excluded.no suspicious pulmonary nodule is seen.the visualized heart, great vessels and pericardium are unremarkable in appearance on this non-contrast study.non-contrast examination of the liver, adrenal glands and pancreas is unremarkable.the gallbladder is surgically absent.the spleen is enlarged measuring approximately 15 cm.this is unchanged compared with previous imaging as far back as ___.the right kidney is normal in size measuring approximately 6.4 x 7.2 x 10 cm.there is a tiny 0.2cm calcific density seen in the lower pole of the right kidney.this is not causing any apparent obstruction and is unchanged in position compared with the previous study.no hydronephrosis.no perinephric fat stranding evident.there is a small hypoattenuating lesion in the lower pole of the right kidney which is incompletely characterized on ct but could represent a small aml.the left kidney is swollen, measuring 9 x 6.5 x 11.2 cm with mild perinephric fat stranding.the renal collecting system and ureter are not dilated on this side, so this appearance could be related to urosepsis rather than ureteric obstruction.the previously identified calculus in the proximal left ureter is now seen to lie within the pelvis at the approximate location of the left vesicoureteric junction.this calculus measures approximately 0.3 cm and is not causing any proximal hydronephrosis, although it has not yet passed into the bladder.
summary: 0.3cm calculus at the left vesicoureteric junction not causing proximal hydronephrosis.swelling of the left kidney, likely secondary to pyelonephritis.0.2-mm calculus in the lower pole of the right kidney, non-obstructing.stable compression fractures at t6, t8 and l2.

text: hematoma within the left hepatic lobe has decreased in size since prior ct, measuring 11.0 cm x 8.7 cm in comparison to 12.7 cm x 12.5 cm on ct ___.prominent foci of gas present within the hematoma which were not present on the prior ct.although these findings may represent resolution of the hematoma, the possibility of infection or communication with the gi tract cannot be excluded.the hematoma abuts the lesser curvature of the stomach (series 2, image 41) but no definite fistulous connection is identified, and no oral contrast is identified within the hematoma.a trace of ascites is present, decreased in extent since previous ct.no other focal abnormalities are seen in the right hepatic lobe.no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation is seen.the gallbladder, pancreas and spleen appear unremarkable.the left kidney is surgically absent and an atrophic right kidney with a stable 12 mm x 10 mm area of low attenuation at the cortex most likely represents a cortical cyst.the transplant kidney is present at the right lower quadrant, and appears unchanged from prior ct on this non-contrast study.a stent is visible at the anastomosis of the main renal artery to the right external iliac artery as before.minor areas of subsegmental atelectasis are seen in the dependent parts of both lower lobes.a central venous catheter is in situ with tip at distal svc.generalized sclerosis of the bony skeleton is unchanged since prior ct, and may be due to renal osteodystrophy.
summary: interval decrease in size of hematoma in the left hepatic lobe.new finding of foci of gas within the hematoma.this may be due to resolution of the hematoma, but the possibility of infection or communication with the gi tract cannot be excluded.

text: the rectum, prostate, seminal vesicles, and urinary bladder are unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid.
summary: no evidence of traumatic injury.er dashboard wet read placed at 6 p.m.on ___.

text: the urinary bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.a rectal tube is noted in situ.there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis which could be physiologic.adnexa are unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy meeting criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: no evidence of complications related to pancreatitis.dense consolidative and patchy opacity at the bilateral lung bases, right slightly greater than left, most likely represents aspiration but infection cannot be excluded.

text: there is mild atelectasis at bilateral lung bases.there is no evidence of pleural effusion.there are nonunited fracture deformities in the right lower thorax ribs, which were also seen on the prior examination from ___.interval development of moderate ascites.however, there is no evidence of focal lesion identified in the liver or spleen.there is no evidence of ivc, portal, or hepatic vein thrombosis.the gallbladder appears unremarkable.the pancreas is normal.the kidneys are normal without evidence of hydronephrosis or calculi.there is a left renal upper pole hypodensity measuring 5 mm, series 4, image 24, too small to further characterize.there is thickening of multiple loops of small bowel and large bowel, especially in the right hemi-abdomen.in the setting of ascites, the thickening can be related to ascites.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is no free air identified in the abdomen.
summary: no evidence of thrombosis in the ivc, hepatic veins, or portal vein.interval increase in ascites since prior study from ___, now moderate in quantity.thickening of multiple small and large bowel loops, especially in the right hemi-abdomen, which can be related to patient's coexisting ascites.

text: there are wall calcifications within the aorta and iliac vessels.there is a foley catheter with a small amount of iatrogenic air within the bladder.there is a small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.there is no free air or significant lymphadenopathy within the pelvis.
summary: atelectasis at the left lung base.no evidence of abnormal fluid collections or abscesses within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: the pelvis is somewhat limited by motion artifact; however, there is extensive lymphadenopathy along the external iliac vessels.again these are somewhat increased in size.a left external iliac lymph node measures 4.6 x 3.3 cm (previously 3.9 x 3.3 cm).there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.this is essentially unchanged.bilateral inguinal lymph nodes are seen.these are unchanged in size.on bone windows, there are no concerning osteolytic or osteosclerotic lesions.
summary: disease progression with increase in size of several liver lesions, splenic lesions and retroperitoneal lymph nodes as described above.overall, more heterogeneous appearance of the liver raises concern for significant disease progression in the liver.ultrasound examination is recommended to confirm the presence of multiple subcentimeter hypodense lesions as this is a new finding.findings were discussed with dr.___.

text: a foley catheter is demonstrated within the bladder which is filled with contrast.the distal ureters are within normal limits.the uterus, adnexae, rectum, and sigmoid colon are normal.there is no free fluid.there is no evidence of hemorrhage within the pelvis.there is a large right anterior thigh hematoma noted measuring approximately 9.1 x 2.5 cm in greatest transverse dimension.
summary: no evidence of retroperitoneal hemorrhage.hematoma within the right groin extending along the anterior aspect of the right thigh.two, subcentimeter hypodensities within the right kidney, too small to fully characterize, likely representing simple cysts.

text: the bladder, prostate, and rectum are unremarkable.no free pelvic fluid or pelvic or inguinal adenopathy is identified.
summary: status post cholecystectomy with resolution of hepatic dome collection, near total resolution of the subhepatic fluid, and decrease in size of a now 1.5-cm collection of fluid in the gallbladder fossa which most likely reflects the remnant gallbladder.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the patient is status post hysterectomy.a foley catheter is seen coiled within the collapsed bladder.the patient also has bladder diverticulum, unchanged from prior studies.no pelvic free fluid, pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy present.
summary: no new acute intra-abdominal process present.unchanged multiple liver metastases with hepatomegaly.

text: the lung bases are clear with no pleural effusions or pulmonary consolidation.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, ureters, stomach and loops of large and small bowel are within normal limits.there is prominant enhancement of the renal medulla bilaterally compared to the renal cortices, the significance is unknown.a nasogastric tube is seen with tip looped in the stomach.the aorta is intact throughout and appears unremarkable.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is identified.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic injury within the abdomen or pelvis.

text: the ureters are poorly visualized.the bladder contains a foley and is collapsed.no pelvic or retroperitoneal masses are seen.bone windows show a severe scoliosis convex to the right with associated degenerative changes.no acute fractures are seen.
summary: findings suggestive of global colonic ischemia without signs perforation.heavily calcified vessels suggest a global hypoensive state as the cause, but the focal infarction in the left kidney could indicate an embolic casue.associated ileus.these revised results were discussed with the micu team.

text: an enteric tube is in place with tip extending to the stomach.there is a small right pleural effusion with compressive atelectasis.mild dependent atelectasis is present on the left.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.multivessel coronary arterial disease is present.a 1-cm saccular enhancing structure at the gastroesophageal junction (300a, 27 and 2, 8) likely represents a paraesophageal varix.a small perihepatic ascites is present.the liver is shrunken and nodular, consistent with cirrhosis.the portal veins are attenuated but appear patent.the patient is status post tace with hyperdense ethiodol accumulating in known lesions in segments v, vi and vii.the remainder of the liver demonstrates no evidence of infarct.two subcentimeter hypodense lesions are seen within liver, segments ___ (2, 14) and ivb (2, 21), too small to fully characterize.additional lesions demonstrated on preceding mri are not evident on current single phase exam.the gallbladder demonstrates circumferential mural edema, likely reflecting underlying liver disease.the spleen is enlarged to 17 cm and associated with prominent splenorenal and gastrosplenic varices.the pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis or hydroureter.a 2-cm lower pole exophytic left renal cyst is present.additional subcentimeter renal hypodensities are too small to fully characterize.the small and large bowel loops are normal in caliber.scattered tiny retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet size criteria for adenopathy.moderate atherosclerotic calcifications are seen in the infrarenal aorta extending into common iliac arteries.
summary: no evidence of intra-abdominal or intrapelvic abscess.cirrhosis, splenomegaly, varices, and small ascites, consistent with portal hypertension.tace treated liver, without evidence of infarct.two subcentimeter hypoattenuating liver lesions within segments ___ and ivb, too small to fully characterize.additional known liver lesions are better depicted on preceding mri dated ___.small right pleural effusion with compressive atelectasis.bilateral renal cysts, some of which are too small to fully characterize.remote right ninth and tenth chronic appearing posterior rib fractures.

text: left moderate pleural effusion is noted accompanied by atelectasis in the left lower lobe and additional atelectasis seen in the right lower lobe.pneumobilia is noted in the left lobe of the liver due to anastomosis of the biliary tree to the bowel.there is a hypodense lesion in segment v of the liver measuring 1.5 cm, unchanged from prior studies.the adrenals are within normal limits.non-contrast views of the kidneys show no evidence of overt masses or hydronephrosis.atherosclerosis of the aorta is noted.status post whipple procedure.the pancreas is seen with pancreatic duct stent.adjacent to the pancreaticojejunostomy, there is oral contrast in the abdominal cavity as well as free air (2:33).findings are consistent with disruption of the pancreaticojejunostomy.there is a fluid collection surrounding the caudate lobe of the liver that has increased in size compared to the prior study and currently measures 7.5 x 8.5 cm.jejunal loops distal to gastrojejunostomy demonstrate fecal content and mildly dilated, while the distal bowel loops are collapsed.findings are consistent with small bowel obstruction.in the abdominal wall underneath the skin sutures, there is moderate amount of air and contrast in the incision.
summary: free oral contrast and air in the upper abdomen adjacent to the hepaticojejunostomy consistent with disruption of hepaticojejunostomy.fecalization of the small bowel loops distal to the gastrojejunostomy with collapse of more distal small bowel loops consistent with small bowel obstruction.air and particulate material underneath the incision in the subcutaneous tissue.increase in size of the fluid collection in and around the caudate lobe.bilateral lower lobes pulmonary atelectasis with moderate amount of pleural effusion on the left.findings were discussed in person by dr.___ with dr.___ on ___, at 6:00 p.m.

text: lung bases are clear without pleural effusion, focal consolidation, or pulmonary nodules.the visualized portion of the heart shows extensive coronary artery calcification.there is no pericardial effusion identified.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis or hydroureter.extensive calcification of multiple mesenteric vessels, most prominent within the celiac axis, splenic artery and common hepatic artery is seen.the aorta is normal in caliber with multiple atherosclerotic calcifications scattered throughout.no abdominal aortic aneurysm is observed.no intraperitoneal or retroperitoneal lymph nodes meeting size criteria for pathologic enlargement is noted.hepatic flexure of the large appears narrowed and thickened.this colonoscopy performed on ___ demonstrated a 5-cm segment of ulceration, erythema and friability at the hepatic flexure which is consistent with the ct findings.there is extensive sigmoid colon diverticulosis without underlying diverticulitis.the appendix is not visualized, however, there are no secondary signs of appendicitis.intravesical air is noted in the anterior part of the bladder without any underlying signs of fistula or instrumentation.the uterus and adnexa are not visualized.the distal ureters are normal.there is no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is no free pelvic air or fluid.a 2.6 x 5 cm collection consistent is again noted in the subcutaneous tissue overlying the right buttock at the level of pelvis, which appears to have reduced in size since the last ct examination performed on ___.
summary: area of narrowing and wall thickening in the hepatic flexure of the colon suspicious for neoplasm.considering the history of recent gi bleed and colonoscopy findings, this may be area responsible for the gi bleed.followup studies based on clinical indications are recommended.ischemic or inflammatory strictures are also considered intravesicular air is seen.however, there are no signs of instrumentation or fistula.please correlate clinically.extensive vascular calcification, especially in the mesenteric vessels.secondary to reduce renal function, the differential diagnosis also includes monckeberg sclerosis.extensive diverticulosis without underlying diverticulitis.persistent subcutaneous collection which now has reduced in size since the last examination 2 years previously.

text: appendix is not visualized, but there is no secondary signs to suggest appendicitis.the kidneys enhance normally and excrete contrast in a normal fashion.there is no hydronephrosis nor hydroureter.there is severe wall thickening and inflammatory changes around the rectum, and sigmoid colon, nonspecific, but likely infectious in this patient with known hiv.no extraluminal focal fluid collection/abscess in this region.
summary: wall thickening and inflammatory changes involving the rectum and possibly the sigmoid colon, nonspecific but likely infectious in nature given the patient's history of hiv.no extraluminal focal fluid collection/abscess.trace perihepatic ascites, with nodular contour of the liver.marked splenomegaly with multiple ill-defined hypoattenuating areas, nonspecific in nature and of unclear clinical significance.given the patient's hiv status, foci of infection is not excluded.sludge/stones within a nondistended gallbladder demonstrating no evidence of cholecystitis.multiple borderline enlarged (1 cm) mesenteric lymph nodes.

text: the bladder and distal ureters are normal.there is a very small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.no pelvic lymph node enlargement or masses.intrapelvic bowel loops are normal.the appendix is identified and normal.the prostate is unremarkable.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: multifocal ground-glass and patchy opacities within the lung bases.a focal area of right lower lobe consolidation measuring 1.6 x 1.0 cm likely represents a focal area of consolidation, although a lesion cannot be excluded.the findings likely represent atypical infection.normal appearing large bowel.collapsed descending and sigmoid colon shows no adjacent fat stranding or fluid collection.normal appendix.noncontrast filled small segment of likely normal loop of small bowel adjacent to the cecum.other less likely possibilities include a meckel's diverticulum.very small amount of free fluid within the pelvis.

text: there is a pericardial effusion.there is interval resolution of the small left pleural effusion and interval increase in the size of the right pleural effusion which is now moderate to large.there are patchy opacifications at the left lung base consistent with an infectious versus inflammatory process.there is atelectasis at the right base.evaluation of the organs of the abdomen is limited without intravenous contrast.there are no gross abnormalities identified in the liver, spleen, or adrenal glands.the kidneys are atrophic bilaterally and unchanged.the gallbladder wall is again noted to be edematous but the gallbladder is not collapsed and there are no gallstones.there is no stranding around the transplanted pancreas or around the transplanted kidney in the right hemipelvis.there are two non- obstructing stones in the transplanted kidney and stable renal cysts.there are no perirenal fluid collections or peripancreatic fluid collections.there is a midline small bowel herniation, extended from the upper abdomen towards the umbilicus with no evidence of wall thickening or stranding or obstruction.the large bowel is unremarkable.
summary: patchy opacification at the left lung base, consistent with pneumonia.resolution of the left pleural effusion.increase in the size of the right pleural effusion which is now moderate to large and there is associated atelectasis.gallbladder wall edema, unchanged.no evidence of intraabdominal or intrapelvic abscess.there is no stranding or collections around the transplanted pancreas or kidney.simple cysts and two small non-obstructing stones in the transplanted kidney.small bowel herniation in the upper abdomen midline with no evidence of strangulation of obstruction.vasculopathy.pericardial effusion.

text: multiple diverticuli are visualized in the sigmoid colon.there is surrounding fat stranding over some areas of the sigmoid diverticuli as well as in the large bowel upto the level of cecum.the pelvic loops of small bowel appear unremarkable.two large calcified fibroids are visualized.there is no free air or free fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.the osseous structures do not exhibit any suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: fat stranding around the large bowel upto the level of cecum representing colitis.multiple diverticuli in the sigmoid colon.large bilateral pleural effusions with bilateral atelectasis.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis, new compared to the previous study.there is ascites that is new compared to the study of ___, however ascites was present on the ultrasound exam of ___.cirrhotic-appearing liver is seen.there are multiple small gallstones.pancreas and spleen are grossly unremarkable on this non-contrast evaluation.the adrenal glands have a normal contour.no evidence of hydronephrosis.the stomach is distended.evaluation of the large and small bowel is severely limited with no evidence of bowel obstruction.there is no intraabdominal free air.there are vascular calcifications.there is diffuse soft tissue swelling and edema consistent with the patient's history of ___-___ reaction.no obvious focal intra-abdominal collection is seen with the majority of the ascites appearing to be free fluid.
summary: limited evaluation without contrast.bilateral layering pleural effusions with moderate ascites and diffuse anasarca.no obvious focal collection is seen within the abdomen.cholelithiasis.

text: there is a moderate amount of free high- density fluid within the pelvis.urinary bladder and left distal ureters unremarkable.the right distal ureter is not opacified with contrast.no contrast extravasation seen.the rectum, sigmoid colon, prostate, seminal vesicles are all unremarkable.
summary: grade 3 splenic laceration and hematoma.no active arterial extravasation.moderate-to-large hemoperitoneum, centered in the right paracolic gutter, probably tracking from the splenic injury.overall the appearance is unchanged from prior outside study of ___.normal appearance of the bowel in absence of oral contrast.no evidence of renal parenchymal injury.

text: intrapelvic bowel displays evidence of diverticulosis without acute diverticulitis and appears otherwise unremarkable.contrast is noted within the appendix.no free fluid is noted within the pelvic cavity and no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified.air is noted within a foley-containing urinary bladder.
summary: postoperative anterior subcutaneous fat inflammation along with subcutaneous emphysema and minimal simple fluid collection adjacent to the surgical drain site with a few pockets of air.these findings are all likely postoperative, however, superinfection of this small fluid cannot be excluded by ct exam.bilateral simple pleural effusions (left greater than right) with adjacent compression atelectasis of the lower lobes.no intraabdominal/intrapelvic fluid collections.likely postoperative inflammation involving the mesentery and anterior abdominal wall.minimal amount of residual pneumoperitoneum is noted.diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.unchanged fatty infiltration of the liver.

text: the patient is status post hysterectomy and salpingo-oophorectomy.there is mild thickening at the bladder base (series 2, image 72).there is nodular soft tissue density and perirectal nodearound the rectum, consistent with progressive metastatic disease.
summary: no evidence of colonic perforation or colitis.interval progression of metastatic disease from ovarian cancer with increase of retroperitoneal, mesenteric, and pelvic lymphadenopathy and soft tissue masses.slight interval increase of small to moderate amount of free fluid.

text: the prostate is enlarged, measuring 5.5 cm.the rectum, sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the urinary bladder is partially collapsed and contains a foley catheter, the wall appears thickened.there is no free pelvic fluid.multiple small pelvic lymph nodes are noted, largest measuring 10 mm in short axis diameter along the right common iliac vessels.
summary: ground-glass opacities and tree-in-___ pulmonary nodules in both lower lobes, which most likely represent infectious process.cholelithiasis, no evidence of acute cholecystitis.findings compatible with fluid third spacing.prominent mediastinal, retroperitoneal and pelvic lymph nodes, more prominent than on the prior study, most of which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.multiple compression fractures, some of which are new from ___.enlarged prostate.stable hypoattenuating liver lesions.

text: a foley catheter is present.the bladder is distended with contrast.there is gas within the anterior bladder, lying non-dependently.this is likely secondary to the contrast injection through the foley catheter.no extravasation of contrast is appreciated in the pelvis.the bladder wall does not appear to be thickened.there is free air within the pelvis as well as a small amount of free fluid, both likely secondary to the patient's recent splenectomy.a right femoral line is present.no other soft tissue abnormalities are appreciated.bone windows demonstrate no abnormalities within the visualized pelvis.please see the dedicated studies of the spine.
summary: no evidence for bladder rupture.

text: there is minimal atelectasis within the right lower lobe and unchanged appearance of a pulmonary cyst in the right lower lobe inferiorly.no nodules or masses are identified within the pulmonary parenchma.the visualized portions of the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.again seen within the liver is prominent intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, now with pneumobilia.the common bile duct remains dilated, measuring 1.9 cm in diameter, and contains air.the patient is status post cholecystectomy, and air is seen within the cystic duct remnant.the pancreas is atrophic.the spleen, adrenal glands appear unremarkable.again seen are unchanged large simple cysts within the right kidney, the largest measuring 4.7 cm.there are symmetric nephrograms bilaterally.tiny hypodense lesion within the left kidney, too small to accurately characterize.the ureters are not dilated.there is extensive atheromatous disease of the abdominal aorta, with prominent mural calcifications.the small bowel loops are normal in caliber and there is no abnormal small bowel wall thickening.on initial scan, there is prominent diverticulosus without evidence of marked fat stranding adjacent to the colon, and without definite intraperitoneal fluid collections or free air.at the time of initial scan, minimal contrast had reached the colon.for this reason, a second delayed scan was obtained, which demonstrates contrast passing through the colon to the rectum, and marked circumferential thickening of the colonic wall extending from the distal transverse colon to the distal descending colon.the sigmoid colon does not appear to demonstrate wall thickening.a large colonic diverticulum is seen containing air and contrast within the descending colon (series 2e, image 21).there are multiple mesenteric lymph nodes, which do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.no filling defects are seen within the proximal portions of the celiac trunk, superior mesenteric artery or inferior mesenteric artery on initial contrast-enhanced images.
summary: marked circumferential thickening of the colonic wall involving the distal transverse through descending colon.no evidence of bowel perforation or obstruction.these findings are most likely ischemic in nature.infectious etiology is less likely.intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation and pneumobilia, likely related to recent ercp with sphincterotomy and stone removal.unchanged appearance of large simple cyst within the right kidney and tiny lesion in the left kidney, too small to accurately characterize, most likely representing a simple cyst.minimal atelectasis in the right lower lobe of the lung.these findings were discussed with the clinical provider at the time of interpretation.

text: lung bases show extensive opacities which could represent atelectasis or an infectious process.left sided chest tube is present.right sided posterior pleural calcifications could be related to prior therapy for lymphoma.coronary calcifications are also seen.metal clips in the left upper quadrant of the abdomen and the absence of the spleen are suggestive of s/p splenectomy.g tube is seen with balloon in the stomach entering through the left upper abdominal wall.there is no free fluid, extraluminal enteric contrast, or free fluid in the abdomen.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, small and large bowel, intra-abdominal great vessels, and adrenals are unremarkable.left kidney exhibits mild hydronephrosis, in the absence of hydroureter.right kidney is unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy in the abdomen.
summary: bibasilar pulmonary opacities could represent atelectasis and/or infectious process.g tube in appropriate position.no free gas, free fluid, or extraluminal collection of enteric contrast in the abdomen or pelvis.s/p splenectomy and tah-bso.possible mild left sided hydronephrosis.no hydroureter.right pleural calcifications, possibly related to therapy for lymphoma.coronary calcifications.

text: the partially imaged lungs are clear.the partially imaged heart is unremarkable.
summary: distended gastric pouch with apparent narrowing of the gastrojejunostomy and a bezoar in the pouch likely representing retained food.recommend suctioning with ng tube and an upper gi study to rule out obstruction.

text: there is a small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.the urinary bladder is collapsed around a foley catheter.the distal ureters, sigmoid colon, and rectum are unremarkable.there has been interval removal of a right adnexal lesion.punctate calcification is again noted in the left adnexa and may be within the left ovary, but is unchanged.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.

text: mild intrahepatic extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation is likely related to cholecystectomy.the spleen is not enlarged.the pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are within normal limits.there is nodular thickening of the gastric folds which is greatest in the body.this process also involves the second and third portion of the duodenum, with multiple areas of mass-like wall thickening measuring up to 19 mm, significantly narrowing the duodenal lumen, but causing no proximal destruction.there is a large amount of homogeneous soft tissue in the splenic hilum, in the anterior pararenal space, anteriorly displacing the pancreas, in the gastrosplenic ligament, and in the para-aortic regions, most suggestive of confluent adenopathy.additional soft tissue masses are seen in the transverse mesocolon region and in the small bowel mesentery.

text: small bilateral pleural effusions (left greater than right) are simple in appearance, but larger than when compared to the prior study.right lower lobe opacity appears slightly less consolidative.there is new trace pericardial fluid.the liver, spleen, pancreas, and right adrenal gland appear unremarkable.the left adrenal gland is not identified with certainty.there are numerous nonobstructing right renal calculi, which measure up to 9 mm in size.gallbladder distension may be related to n.p.o.status.focal thickening and high attenuation in the gallbladder fundus is unchanged.a pancreatic duct stent is in stable position, terminating in the duodenum.there has been very slight interval decrease in a fluid and air collection which extends from the pancreatic tail into the posterior perisplenic region and along the left paracolic gutter.the cranial component measures 29 mm in diameter, compared to 33 mm on the prior study, and there has been interval placement of a left flank pigtail catheter into this cranial component.the caudal component also contains a pigtail catheter which is in stable appropriate position.it measures 25 mm in diameter, compared to 30 mm on the prior study.no new collections are seen.scattered non-pathologically enlarged mesenteric nodes are believed to be reactive in nature.there is no free fluid or bowel dilatation within the abdomen or pelvis.atheromatous calcification of the distal aorta and common iliac arteries is moderate.stranding in the anterior abdominal subcutaneous tissues is compatible with post-surgical scar.
summary: interval placement of a pigtail catheter into cranial component of a left flank fluid collection, with the caudal drain in appropriate position, and slight interval decrease in the size of the collection overall.interval improvement in right lower lobe consolidation, which could represent aspiration pneumonia.

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate linear atelectasis, new since the prior study.no pleural effusions or suspicious pulmonary nodules are seen.the heart and pericardium and the visualized portions are unremarkable.the liver demonstrates homogeneous enhancement without focal lesions or intrahepatic biliary dilatation.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.both adrenal glands, spleen are normal.both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydroureteronephrosis or concerning renal masses.the pancreas demonstrates calcifications in the head, secondary to chronic pancreatitis.no peripancreatic fluid collections or fat stranding is seen to suggest acute pancreatitis.the pancreatic duct is not dilated.the patient has had a recent revision of a gj tube, which is appropriately positioned with the tip in the proximal jejunum.no post-procedural complications or fluid collections are detected.the stomach and small bowel loops are normal.large bowel loops and the appendix is normal.there is no intra-abdominal free fluid or air.the abdominal aorta is normal in course and caliber.no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy is detected.tiny mesenteric lymph nodes on the right lower quadrant measuring 5 mm in the short axis are unchanged since prior study.

text: the bladder and rectum are unremarkable with a rectal tube and foley catheter in place.the prostate is unremarkable.there is no free pelvic fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal adenopathy.there is circumferential atherosclerotic plaque involving bilateral iliac arteries as well as their branches.the right external iliac artery demonstrates marked stenosis (4a:112) returning to normal caliber distally.the right superficial femoral artery is irregular and narrowed at its origin; subsequently it is occluded (4a:160) and reconstitution is not imaged due to the occlusion being at the extreme edge of the study.prior to the occlusion, a collateral branch is given off (4a:151), though there is stenosis at its origin as well.the circumflex femoral artery is prominent on the right than the left, likely contributing collateral flow.on the left, the patient is status post femoral bypass with likely saphenous vein graft seen (4a:148) with the superficial femoral artery occluded distal to this grafting (4a:62).there is likely an arteriovenous fistula at some level on the left given the presence of early venous filling (4a:156).
summary: hypoenhancement of portion of the splenic flexure as well as the distal descending/sigmoid colon with a focal area of sigmoid mural edema which is concerning for mild ischemia.no pneumatosis, adjacent colonic stranding or perforation.this seems unlikely to be the cause of the patient's lactic acidosis; however, it could be a contributing factor.these findings are accompanied by occlusion of the origin of the ___ with collateral retrograde flow seen, though the ___ is irregular and with diminutive left colic and sigmoid arterial branches.the large artery adjacent to the hypoperfused splenic flexure suggests there is also small vessel arterial disease.stenosis of the sfa origin with occlusion of the sfa at the lower edge of the images.collateral branch of the sfa is also noted to be stenotic at its origin.right external iliac artery focal high-grade stenosis.status post femoral bypass on the left with occlusion of the left sfa.left thigh av fistula in the profunda territory is not completely imaged with early filling of the left common femoral vein.hyperdense liver suggest hemochromatosis.hepatomegaly.no nodularity.esophageal varices strongly suggest portal hypertension.liver biopsy should be considered.hypoenhancing pancreas with atrophic tail suggests chronic pancreatic disease, though no evidence or sequela of chronic or acute pancreatitis are seen.in the setting of known diabetes, consider chronic autoimmune pathologies.these findings were discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ at 11:15 on ___.

text: compared to prior study, there is an increase in right pleural effusion, and there is a new left pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis.there is a small pericardial effusion, unchanged.patient is status post right hepatic lobectomy and there is fluid seen in the area of prior right hepatic lobectomy, increase in size compared to prior study, and there is a drain ending in this collection.there are small locules of air in this fluid collection, likely from drain.there are new pleomorphic ill-defined areas in segment ___ and segment ii and iii of the liver which may represent perfusion abnormality or retraction injury.there is a new heterogeneous fluid collection inferior to the liver which extends to the lesser curvature of the stomach and also extends to the pancreas.the hematoma has mass effect on the liver and stomach.this fluid measures high density consistent with hemorrhage and is new since prior study.this study is not optimized for evaluation of any active extravasation; however, its connection with the splenic vein is not well seen and this may either represent injury to this vessel or possibly compression of this vessel from the hematoma (601b,38).there is also some attenuation of the superior mesenteric vein at the level of pancreas (2, 42) which reconstitutes distally.the walled off infrapancreatic collections with hypodense material within it (2, 48 and 2, 33) is not significantly changed and likely represents walled off necrosis.again seen is ascitic fluid in the lower abdomen and pelvis that appears more simple and has slightly increased in size.again seen is diffuse anasarca.the spleen is unremarkable.the kidneys are normal bilaterally.the adrenal glands are normal.patient is status post whipple procedure with pancreaticojejunostomy.the small bowel and colon appear unremarkable.there are drains seen ending in the infrahepatic region as well as just anterior to the right kidney.
