text: ct chest with iv contrast: right pleural effusion appears unchanged in comparison to prior study.there is an area of atelectasis, with superimposed pneumonia possible, in the left lower lobe.otherwise, the remainder of aerated right and left lung is normal.7-mm nodule in the superior segment of the left lower lobe remains to be adjacent to the segmental pulmonary vein and unchanged.no new pulmonary nodules have developed.there is no pathologic enlargement of the axillary, mediastinal, or supraclavicular lymph nodes.ct of the abdomen with intravenous contrast: there is an area of hypo- and hyperattenuation consistent with a subdiaphragmatic hematoma superior to the margin of the liver and inferior to the liver.subcapsular hypoattenuation at the liver dome may representmay be consistent with areas of hematoma or clotting vs technical artifact.particularly at the hepatic hilum, there is an area of increased fullness which could be due to hematoma.furthermore, there is an area of low density in the inferior vena cava from the intrahepatic inferior vena cava to the base of the right atrium which could be representative of a possible clot when compared to the density of the adjacent aorta.however, the evaluation of vascular structures is very limited given the lack of iv contrast and techical factors including streak artifact from overlying hardware.staple line is visualized along the inferior margin of segment ivb, consistent with history of recent surgery.otherwise, the pancreas, spleen, bilateral kidneys, bilateral adrenal glands, ureters, large and small bowel, intraabdominal aorta remain unremarkable.there are two densities consistent with intra-abdominal drains in place.there is no free air or free fluid.no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is present.ct of the pelvis with intravenous contrast: rectal tube is in place.otherwise, the rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: this scan is limited in terms of evaluating vascular structures or looking for abscesses due to the lack of intravenous contrast as well as streak artifact from overlying hardware.however, there is a hypoattenuating region consistent with subdiaphragmatic hematoma superior to the liver as well as hypoattenuating regions consistent with foci of hemorrhage/clotting adjacent to the liver.these findings should be correlated clinically.hypoattenuation of the inferior vena cava is noted from the intrahepatic portion to the base of the right atrium.this might represent a vena caval clot , but given the limitations of the exam as noted previously, this could be a technical artifact.please correlate clinically; mri (either without or with contrast) could be performed to more definitively regions of subdiaphragmatic hematoma and vascular patency as indicated.presence of right pleural effusion remains unchanged.there is also atelectasis with possible overlying pneumonia in the proper clinical setting at the left lower lobe.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ of the patient's primary clinical team at approximately 3 p.m.on ___.

text: the rectum and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.the uterus and adenxa are not identified.a foley catheter is seen within a decompressed bladder.massive amount of ascites is present.
summary: limited exam secondary to lack of intravenous and oral contrast.massive amount of ascites as well as capsular hepatic fluid collection are stable.new nodular opacities within the left lung base, which may represent focal air space disease.the pancreas, spleen, kidneys, and intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are not well evaluated on this exam.status post pseudocyst-gastrostomy with stable appearance of pancreatic pseudocyst

text: numerous punctate foci of calcification within the liver are noted, as on prior study in ___.these may represent vascular calcifications versus sequelae of prior granulomatous disease.there are no additional focal hepatic lesions identified.the gallbladder is dilated, measuring up to 7 cm in diameter.innumerable small stones are seen layering dependently and there is gallbladder wall edema.there is no definite biliary ductal dilatation.no calcified stones are definitively seen within the common bile duct although this examination is limited for this evaluation.the spleen is enlarged at 14 cm.pancreas and adrenal glands appear normal allowing for noncontrast technique.the kidneys are atrophic, with extensive vascular calcifications and nonspecific perinephric stranding.the duodenum appears thickened and there is questionable thickening vs underdistention of the hepatic flexure of colon adjacent to the gallbladder.stomach, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel appear normal.there is no bowel distention.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.the aorta demonstrates marked atherosclerotic calcification, including involving the origins of the major mesenteric vessels and the mesenteric vessels themselves.patency is not assessed without intravenous contrast.trace ascites about the liver.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there are no organized fluid collections to suggest abscess formation.
summary: scattered ground-glass and tree-in-___ opacities within the lungs, most notable in the right upper and right lower lobes.these are concerning for infectious or inflammatory process including evolving bronchopneumonia.there is no associated effusion.distended and edematous gallbladder, with numerous small dependently positioned gallstones.clinical correlation and consideration of ultrasound imaging or nuclear medicine scan to exclude acute cholecystitis is recommended.thickened duodenal wall and questionable thickening of hepatic flexure - findings are nonspecific and could relate to underdistention, but duodenitis or possible also colitis cannot be excluded.if there is concern for gallbladder inflammation these changes could possibly be reactive.clinical correlation recommended.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications involving the coronary arteries, aorta and mesenteric arteries.vascular patency is not assessed without intravenous contrast.atrophy of the bilateral native kidneys.a right pelvic transplant kidney is noted, without obvious hydronephrosis or nephrolithiasis, although ultrasound is recommended for evaluation of the transplant kidney if evaluation of the kidney is needed.numerous small hepatic calcifications, possibly representing vascular calcifications versus sequelae of prior granulomatous disease.

text: a fluid collection with peripheral enhancement in the deep pelvis has been drained via a pigtail catheter entering via the right lower quadrant.the pigtail catheter tip is located along the right lateral aspect of the collection, and the collection has decreased in size now measuring 6.4 x 7.0 cm (previously 8.4 x 9.5 cm).the bladder contains foley catheter and air consistent with foley insertion.the prostate and seminal vesicles, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.pneumatosis within the subcutaneous tissues of the left chest about the site of chest tube insertion and near the site of prior chest tube removal is noted.
summary: near resolution of left-sided pneumothorax following removal of a left- sided chest tube and replacement of a more anterior left-sided chest tube.decreased size of a pelvic collection following placement of a pigtail catheter, now located in the right lateral aspect of the collection.slight improvement in intra-abdominal fluid since ___ status post repair of intra-abdominal lacerations.tiny amount of pneumoperitoneum is consistent with patient's multiple recent procedures.decreasing bilateral atelectasis and consolidation.

text: the patient is post proctectomy.the bladder, uterus, and adnexa are unremarkable.a small amount of free fluid is seen within the pelvis.no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy is identified.a region of non-malignant sclerosis is again identified in the right hemisacrum, unchanged.no new osseous lesion suspicious for malignancy is identified.
summary: high-grade small bowel obstruction with transition point as detailed above, likely due to adhesions.minimal air is seen in the distal small bowel, perhaps due to the early nature of the obstruction.no free air is seen, although small amount of free fluid is identified in the upper abdomen and in the pelvis.status post proctectomy, total colectomy, and right lower quadrant ileostomy.

text: foley catheter is present within a collapsed bladder.an enhancing mass lesion in the cervix and lower uterine segment is causing obstruction with resultant fluid-filled endometrial cavity.a soft tissue mass is present in the ischiorectal fossa on the right, measuring 4.1 x 2.2 cm (2:101).
summary: diffuse metastatic disease from malignant melanoma including lungs, mediastinum, gallbladder, liver, left ureter with moderate hydronephrosis, cervix with uterine obstruction and ischiorectal fossa.spinal metastasis includes thoracic and probable lumbar spine.recommend lumbar mri for further evaluation as this has not been obtained at that time of dictation.

text: lung bases show bilateral consolidations, right more than left with accompanying small amount of pleural effusion.nasogastric tube is seen in the lower esophagus with its tip in the stomach.no evidence of pericardial effusion.coronary artery calcifications are seen.non-contrast views of the spleen, kidneys, pancreas, and adrenals are within normal limits.fatty liver infiltration is noted.gallbladder is of normal size.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy seen.stomach, small and large bowel are within normal limits.
summary: bibasilar consolidations, right more than left.no evidence of intra-abdominal source of fever.fatty liver

text: a foley catheter and air is present within the bladder.there is no free air or fluid in the pelvis.
summary: right lower lobe pneumonia.

text: there is moderate-to-severe diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon, without diverticulitis.there is no free air.the uterus is surgically absent.the urinary bladder is low lying likely due to pelvic floor descent.
summary: cirrhosis with eosphageal varices, moderate ascites and splenomegaly.distended gallbladder with mural thickening and pericholecystic fluid likely secondary to liver disease.given that no gallstones were seen on the recent abdominal us, the likelihood of primary gb process is unlikely though clincial correlation is advised.sigmoid colon diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: the rectum, sigmoid, bladder, and prostate are normal.there is no free pelvic fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.on limited views of the right thigh there is a large hematoma in the posterior compartment and adductor canal.there is also some stranding surrounding the right femoral region with no clear connection to the previously noted hematoma.there is a right hydrocele.osseous structures demonstrate degenerative changes in the lower lumbar and the thoracic spine.
summary: a large hematoma in the right thigh.see the dictation on lower extremity ct scan done on the same day.fat stranding surrounding the right femoral region without clear connection to the hematoma.this could be related to any recent procedure in this area.irregularity of upper pole of right kidney.this cannot be accurately characterized by ct without contrast.if concern for a mass exists, recommend mr ___ ___, small liver this could represent cirrhosis or congenital variant.bilateral pleural effusions.

text: moderate cardiomegaly is stable.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no left pleural effusion.a small right pleural effusion is stable.there has been interval mild increase in the right lower lobe posterior and lateral consolidation.focal aneurysmal dilatation of the distal thoracic aorta measuring up to 4 cm is unchanged.in the abdomen, there is a new heterogenous collection centered in the left rectus anterior abdominal muscle measuring approximately 90 x 54 mm consistent with a hematoma.the liver, spleen, pancreas, left adrenal gland and gallbladder are unremarkable in these non- enhanced study.the patient is status post right nephrectomy.the right adrenal gland if is present, is not well seen.the left kidney shows an unchanged simple cyst medially.multiple diverticula are seen throughout the colon without stranding of the adjacent fat.multiple surgical clips are seen in the right pericolic gutter.an aneurysmal dilation of the aorta below the hiatus and extensive calcification throughout the aorta and iliac arteries are unchanged.there is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.
summary: new large hematoma centered in the left anterior rectus muscle.a small right pleural effusion.unchanged appearance of multiple aortic aneurysm with extensive atherosclerotic disease.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: again seen is an aorto- bifemoral bypass which arises from the abdominal aorta, just inferior to the renal arteries and extend bilaterally inferiorly to the level of the common femoral arteries.the previously identified fluid collection adjacent to the origin of the aorto-bifemoral bypass is not visualized on today's study.again seen is a large simple fluid collection surrounding a portion of the distal end of the right aorto-femoral bypass.this collection shows average hounsfield units of 15.5.on the left side, a conglomerate of collections is seen surrounding mostly the distal end of the left aorto-femoral bypass.when compared to the prior examination, both of these distal bilateral inguinal region collections are unchanged.the rectum, bladder and prostate gland appear within normal limits.
summary: successful aspiration of 55 cc of fluid from the left-sided collection and 35 cc of fluid from the right collection.

text: post-surgical changes from prior hepatic trisegmentectomy are seen, and the residual left liver is well opacified and free of enhancing lesion.residual portal vein is patent.pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are unchanged.the surgical drain has been removed.bowel loops are unremarkable.there is no residual fluid collection or abscess.
summary: post-hepatic trisegmentectomy changes without residual complication.no evidence for recurrent or residual disease within the liver/abdomen.non-pathologically enlarged biaxillary lymph nodes and known right lower pole thyroid nodule, unchanged.

text: bilateral pleural effusions are moderate in the visualized lung bases, with passive bibasilar atelectasis.a rounded focal consolidation in the lateral left lower lobe measures 2.1 cm in diameter (image 2:2), compatible with an evolving focus of infection.small cavitary lesions in the right base are similar in appearance.there is small amount of pericardial effusion.the absence of iv contrast significantly limits evaluation of the intra-abdominal parenchymal organs.in addition, the patient has minimal intraperitoneal fat to separate the visceral organs, limiting assessment of bowel and lymph nodes.allowing for the limitations, the liver is grossly unremarkable.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 15.4 cm craniocaudally.persistent hypodensity in the posterior aspect of the spleen, which wedge-shaped morphology most likely represent ongoing evolution of splenic infarct that was previously noted in the chest ct three days ago.the gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are grossly unremarkable.the stomach, loops of small bowel and duodenum are patent with oral contrast.there is no evidence of intra-abdominal fluid collection.no free air is noted.evaluation of intra-abdominal lymphadenopathy is limited, but there are several small celiac lymph nodes.
summary: persistent wedge-shaped hypodensity in the posterior aspect of the enlarged spleen, representing splenic infarction; differential considerations including sequelae of splenic enlargement or an embolic process.no evidence of intra-abdominal fluid collection to suggest abscess.moderate bilateral pleural effusions, with moderate bibasilar atelectasis.persistent evidence of multifocal pneumonia, with similar small cavitary lesions.fluid within the colon, which is non-specific.

text: there is marked progression of pelvic sidewall metastatic implants bilaterally (3:109).there is a moderate amount of free fluid.the rectum and bladder appear grossly unremarkable.a left inguinal lymph node measures 13 mm (previously 14 mm).
summary: progression of disease with multiple new metastatic lesions involving the liver and peritoneal implants laterally.also marked progression of pelvic sidewall metastatic implants.this progression is not reflected in the size of the target lesions which are approximately stable.slightly more mass effect on the renal veins bilaterally by the main conglomerate mass despite stable size.

text: there is opacity identified primarily at the right lung base, which appears slightly nodular.this may represent atelectasis or aspiration, followup evaluation following resolution of acute illness could be considered to exclude underlying lesion.heart is notable for coronary calcifications.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the liver is slightly nodular in contour, suggesting underlying cirrhosis.there are scattered hypodensities identified within the right dome, for example 2:8.these are nonspecific, though given questionable underlying sclerosis, could be further evaluated nonemergently with mri.there is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.there is no dilation of the common duct.however, there is air identified both in the common duct and at the gallbladder neck.there is also a small amount of air in the left hepatic duct.without history of prior sphincterotomy, these findings are concerning for biliary-enteric fistula.there is suggestion of a possible fistulous connection seen on coronal images, in the right upper quadrant with air seen tracking between a loop of bowel and the gallbladder neck (300b:22-23).there is a large gallstone identified within the fundus of the gallbladder.the gallbladder wall is not thickened, and there is no evidence gas in the gallbladder wall to suggest emphysematous cholecystitis.there is no fluid adjacent to the gallbladder.the spleen is normal in size.slight heterogeneity likely reflects perfusion.the pancreas is unremarkable, without pancreatic ductal dilation or focal pancreatic lesion.the adrenals appear normal.the kidneys demonstrate delayed enhancement and contrast excretion, compatible with acute renal failure.scattered hypodense lesions within the left kidney are noted, the larger of which are compatible with simple cysts, while the smaller are too small to characterize.there is no hydronephrosis.the aorta and mesenteric vessels are normal in caliber and configuration.they are widely patent.the superior mesenteric vein, portal vein, and hepatic veins are patent.ivc filter is identified in normal position infrarenally.there is distention of a fluid-filled small bowel in the upper and mid abdomen, with small bowel loops measuring up to 3.8 cm.there is no discrete transition point identified, however, the distal small bowel is relatively collapsed.there is some fluid seen throughout the colon, though the colon is also relatively collapsed.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy.
summary: somewhat nodular in contour liver, suggesting underlying cirrhosis.nonspecific hypodensities at the dome of the right lobe are noted.given possible underlying cirrhosis, these should be evaluated with mri nonemergently to exclude malignancy.large stone in the gallbladder, as well as air seen within the common duct and gallbladder neck.if there is no history of prior sphincterotomy, this is concerning for biliary-enteric fistula.possible fistulous connection is identified on coronal images (300b:22-23).diffuse dilation of fluid-filled proximal small bowel measuring nearly 4 cm, with relative collapse of the terminal ileum and distal ileum.this is suggestive of early versus partial small-bowel obstruction, though no definite transition point is identified.consolidation at the right lung base, likely atelectasis or aspiration.however, followup imaging following resolution of acute illness to exclude underlying lesion is recommended.ivc filter is identified in adequate position.delayed contrast excretion by the kidneys bilaterally, compatible with known renal failure.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ in the emergency department at the time of dictation by dr.___ ___.

text: the rectum, distal ureters, bladder, uterus, and adnexa are unremarkable.the intrapelvic loops of small bowel appear normal.there is no pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.there are small bilateral fat-containing femoral hernias.there is no free fluid within the pelvis.
summary: resolving diverticulitis with 4 x 1.5 cm collection remaining adjacent to the sigmoid colon containing a small amount of fluid and air.this collection is not amenable to drainage.minimal inflammatory stranding along the catheter tract within the abdomen.interval decrease in size of the right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis at the right lung base.near resolution of the left pleural effusion.

text: the transplant kidney is demonstrated in the left pelvic fossa.the transplant pancreas is demonstrated in the right pelvic fossa.the uterus, rectum, sigmoid colon, and bladder are grossly unremarkable on this noncontrast study.there is no pelvic free fluid.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic foci.
summary: no significant interval change compared to the exam of ___ on this noncontrast study.no fever source identified.

text: direct comparison is made to abdominal radiograph dated ___.moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions with areas of adjacent atelectasis are identified.also, patchy areas of airspace opacity are seen within the lingula and right middle lobe.differential considerations do include infectious etiologies, and clinical correlation is recommended.the main pulmonary artery measures 3.4 cm.this may reflect underlying portal hypertension.also, there is a filling defect within the mid portion of the superior vena cava.this may be artifactual secondary to mixing of unopacified blood.other considerations do include thrombosis, possibly from prior central line.recommend clinical correlation.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas and gallbladder appear grossly unremarkable.the kidneys appear somewhat atrophic.extrarenal pelvis noted on the right.there is a dependently lying stone within this extrarenal pelvis measuring approximately 12 x 7 mm.there is no evidence of hydronephrosis.lipomatous hypertrophy noted about the ileocecal valve.the sigmoid colon appears somewhat thickened without evidence of surrounding inflammation.this likely represents thickening of the wall secondary to diverticulosis.diverticulosis is noted throughout the entirety of the colon.the remainder of the bowel is grossly unremarkable.pelvic structures are grossly unremarkable.right-sided total hip arthroplasty is noted.no suspicious lytic or blastic bony lesions are identified.there is evidence of a compression deformity involving the t11 vertebral body.there is a small degree of ascites noted, predominantly about the spleen.also, diffuse anasarca is seen.
summary: no evidence of active inflammatory process in the abdomen.sigmoid wall thickening likely secondary to chronic diverticulosis.moderate bilateral pleural effusions and adjacent passive atelectasis as well as airspace opacities noted at the lung bases as detailed above.question of thrombus within the superior vena cava.recommend clinical correlation as to the presence of a prior line insertion.nonobstructing right renal stone.swana

text: the visualized lung bases demonstrate small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis, greater on the right side.there is also a small pericardial effusion.the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenals and kidneys are unchanged in appearance on this unenhanced scan.there is a small amount of ascites.there is no evidence of gallstones.the patient is status post a right colectomy.there is free intraperitoneal air seen in the right upper quadrant.there is also a large intraperitoneal fluid collection tracking along the anterior abdominal wall measuring 13.2 x 4.1 cm in its greatest dimension immediately inferior to the surgical anastomosis.there is note of a tiny amount of oral contrast seen collecting within this collection.there are multiple small mesenteric nodes.note is made of anasarca in the surrounding subcutaneous tissues.
summary: leak, likely from the surgical anastomosis with note of free intraperitoneal air and a small amount of oral contrast seen collecting within this collection.results were communicated to the clinical team immediately following completion of the study.

text: the liver is without focal lesions.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the adrenal glands, spleen, pancreas are unremarkable.there is a cyst in the right kidney at mid pole, which is unchanged.subcentimeter hypodense lesions are again noted in the left kidney.this is unchanged and these most likely represent simple cysts.the small and large bowels are unremarkable.on bone windows, there are old fractures of the fifth through eight left rib posteriorly.
summary: no evidence of metastatic disease or tumor recurrence.unchanged cluster of micronodules in the right upper lobe concerning for an infectious process.old fractures of the fifth through eighth left rib posteriorly.

text: there is a large left inguinal hernia with mild stranding of the fat within as well as a small right inguinal fat-containing hernia (2:76).otherwise, there is no evidence of loops of bowel within this hernia and no obstruction.the bladder and rectum are within normal limits.a small focal calcification is seen in the prostate.
summary: large fat-containing left inguinal hernia with mild haziness of the fat, can not exclude incarceration.no bowel within the left inguinal hernia.no bowel obsruction.small right fat-containing inguinal hernia.findings were discussed by dr.___ ___ with dr.___ ___ on ___ shortly after the completion of the study via telephone.

text: the rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and uterus are within normal limits.there is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: subcapsular splenic hematoma, measuring 13 x 6 x 10 cm in size.comparison to a prior outside study is not possible as the films are not available.encapsulated fluid collection at the anastomotic site of the hemicolectomy most likely representing a post-surgical lymphocele, less likely abscess multiple small bilateral renal lesions too small to characterize, likely representing cysts.

text: no nodules, opacities or pleural effusions are present at the lung bases.the patient is status post left hepatic lobectomy.there is a biliary stent in good position.the intrahepatic ducts do not appear dilated.there is a low attenuation region at the inferior tip of the liver which may be related to prior surgery.there is a trace amount of free fluid just inferior to the liver.the adrenal glands, pancreas and spleen are unremarkable as are the noncontrast enhanced kidneys.contrast has passed freely through the bowel at the level of the mid ileum.the visualized loops of large and small bowel in the abdomen are unremarkable.just deep to the region of the patient's jp drain tract, there is a small (approximately 2.8 x 2.0 cm) soft tissue collection which is most consistent with a small hematoma.there is no free air identified in the abdomen and no large fluid collections are present.
summary: patient's abdominal pain most likely corresponds to small hematoma located just deep to the tract from the jp drain.there is no evidence of free air or large fluid collection.

text: there is mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.in addition, the pancreatic duct is dilated to 4 mm with visualized dilated side branches.there is no significant pancreatic parenchymal atrophy.in the neck of the pancreas there is a 2.0 x 1.0 x 1.6 cm hypodense lesion.this is immediately adjacent to the pancreatic duct.this lesion does not abut the posteriorly located smv.a second hypodense lesion in the tail of the pancreas measures 9 mm.the common bile duct measures 8 mm.the gallbladder is within normal limits.there are no focal hepatic lesions.punctate calcifications in the spleen are likely the result of prior granulomatous disease.the spleen is otherwise unremarkable.there is focal nodularity in the body of the left adrenal gland measuring 6 mm.the right adrenal gland is within normal limits.a punctate subcapsular calcification in the mid left kidney is noted.scattered subcentimeter cortical hypodensities are present in bilateral kidneys, the largest in the superior pole of the right kidney measuring 6 mm.although these are too small to accurately characterize, statistically, they likely represent cysts.retroperitoneal lymph nodes which are prominent but not enlarged by ct size criteria are noted in the left periaortic location measuring up to 7 mm.there is no free fluid in the abdomen.the abdominal aorta is normal in caliber with significant atherosclerotic calcifications.there is conventional hepatic artery anatomy.the portal and hepatic veins are patent.
summary: enlarged, necrotic appearing right hilar lymph nodes measuring up to 2.6 mm.these appear accessible via transbronchial biopsy.no pulmonary mass or nodules.mild intrahepatic, extrahepatic and pancreatic ductal dilatation with hypoattenuating mass in the neck of the pancreas measuring 2 cm.second hypoattenuating lesion in the tail of the pancreas measures 9 mm.these are adjacent to the dilated pancreatic duct and may represent ipmt.alternatively, attenuation characteristics suggest possible serous or mucinous tumor, particularly in the pancreatic neck.the hypoattenuating lesions in the pancreas do not account for the degree of biliary dilatation and no discrete mass is identified in the ampullary region or duodenum.ercp with possible eus recommended for further assessment.enlarged thyroid gland with hypoattenuating 1.9-cm nodule in the left lobe.nodular contour of the enlarged isthmus.thyroid ultrasound would be beneficial for further characterization.scattered retroperitoneal lymph nodes and left axillary lymph nodes which are borderline enlarged.this study is not optimally timed for evaluation of the pulmonary arteries; questionable filling defect in left upper lobe segmental branch may represent volume averaging.if high clinical suspicion is present for pulmonary embolus, lower extremity doppler may prove beneficial.deep pelvic and common femoral veins appear patent.

text: there is a small amount of free pelvic fluid.there is extensive diverticulosis predominantly of the sigmoid colon, without evidence of diverticulitis.the urinary bladder is decompressed, with a foley catheter in place and air in the nondependent portion, likely due to instrumentation.the uterus is unremarkable, with dense vascular calcifications.bones are diffusely sclerotic consistent with renal osteodystrophy.there is a right shoulder effusion.no fractures or concerning osseous lesions are identified.
summary: unchanged right middle and left lower lobe small pulmonary nodules from ___, which do not require further followup.enlarged main pulmonary arteries suggestive of pulmonary arterial hypertension.small amount of ascites.right shoulder effusion.diverticulosis, no evidence for diverticulitis.renal osteodystrophy.

text: there is a segment of abnormal bowel extending from the distal descending colon to the proximal sigmoid colon.there is extensive surrounding fat stranding on the mesenteric side.no focal abscess collection is seen.there is no evidence of gross perforation.multiple diverticula of the sigmoid colon are seen.the rectum is unremarkable as are the urinary bladder, prostate gland and seminal vesicles.there is a small amount of free fluid layering dependently in the pelvis.the patient's fem-fem bypass graft appears well opacified.there is a small amount of fluid surrounding the bypass graft.evaluation of the osseous structures reveals mild degenerative changes.no destructive bone lesions are seen.
summary: short segment of abnormal bowel extending from the distal descending colon to the proximal sigmoid colon with mild wall thickening and surrounding inflammatory changes.given the fact that there are sigmoid diverticula noted and multiple diverticula present at this level on the patient's prior ct scan, the appearance is most consistent with diverticulitis.there is no evidence of abscess collection or perforation.differential diagnosis includes focal ischemia.multiple postsurgical changes including small bilateral pleural effusions with atelectasis, small amount of fluid in the abdomen and pelvis as well as the presence of a widely patent fem-fem bypass graft.enhancing lesion in the left atrophic kidney.while this could represent an island of preserved renal parenchyma a renal mass cannot be excluded and mri is recommended for further evaluation.

text: the bladder, prostate gland, seminal vesicles, and pelvic loops of bowel are unremarkable.there is no inguinal or pelvic lymphadenopathy.there is no free pelvic fluid.bone windows; there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic bony lesions.
summary: stable size and appearance of pancreatic pseudocyst.interval increase in pneumobilia.

text: there is linear atelectasis at the lung bases with small bilateral pleural effusions.no pericardial effusion.the heart is enlarged, as before.the superior most hepatic dome is excluded from view.the liver is normal without focal hepatic lesion.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic bile duct dilation.the gallbladder is surgically absent.numerous calcifications within the spleen suggest prior exposure to granulomatous disease.the pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.the kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly without hydronephrosis.again seen is a large right renal subcapsular collection with compression of the ivc.it measures 8.8 x 5.1 cm, previously 8.7 x 4.5 cm, slightly larger.it extends into a large retroperitoneal component, which measures 12.9 x 6.6 cm, previously 14 x 6.7 cm, unchanged.given that the biopsy tract extends into the collecting system, there may be a component may represent a urine leak, although there is no definite extravasation of exreted contrast- there is irregular contour of the calyx at the medial aspect of the renal defect.superinfection of the collection cannot be excluded on this study.no new collection is seen.the small and large bowel are normal in course and caliber without obstruction.there is no free air.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout.the main portal vein, splenic vein and smv are patent.no pathologically enlarged mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes are identified.
summary: slight increase in size of the right renal subcapsular collection.given that the biopsy tract extends into the collecting system and there is some irregularity of the calyx in this area, this is suspicious but not definitive for a urine leak.superinfection of the collection cannot be excluded on the basis of this study.the large retroperitoneal component is unchanged.diffuse anasarca.lytic proximal femoral lesion, incompletely imaged.consider dedicated femoral radiographs for further evaluation.

text: consolidation at the right lung base.there are bilateral pleural effusions and compressive atelectasis at the left base.the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable on this noncontrast enhanced study.there are a few dilated loops of jejunum, but contrast reaches the colon.there is no lymphadenopathy identified.the abdominal aorta becomes aneurysmal over a short segment distally in the abdomen reaching a maximum diameter of 29 mm.further assessment of this area is limited as there is no iv contrast on board.
summary: right lower lobe pneumonia with bilateral pleural effusions.colitis on the basis of colonic fluid.focal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3 cm.this is not adequately evaluated on this noncontrast study.subcutaneous edema in the back.

text: multiple well-circumscribed hypodense areas are seen throughout the liver.the largest of these areas measures 2.5 x 3 cm and is located in segment ___.there is no enhancing wall thickening or capsules around these lesions, arguing against the diagnosis of hepatic septic emboli/infarcts.more likely, these lesions are simple cysts.some of the hypodense areas are too small to characterize, however.the gallbladder is normal appearing with no evidence of wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.there is no biliary tree dilation.there is a peripheral, wedge-shaped area of relative hypodensity in the spleen along its anterolateral portion which is consistent with infarct likely secondary to septic emboli given the history of infective endocarditis.there is a peripheral, wedge-shaped hypodense area in the inferior pole of the left kidney which is also consistent with an infarct, likely secondary to septic emboli.the remainder of the kidneys are unremarkable.the adrenal glands are normal in size and contour.the pancreas appears normal, without evidence of ductal dilation or focal masses.there is no peripancreatic fat stranding or fluid.there is a small sliding hiatal hernia.the remainder of the stomach is normal in appearance.the small bowel and colon are unremarkable.there is no abdominal lymphadenopathy.there is no ascites or free air in the abdomen.there is a small, fat containing umbilical hernia.
summary: wedge-shaped, hypodense area in the spleen consistent with splenic infarct.wedge-shaped hypodensity in the inferior pole of the left kidney consistent with renal infarct.multiple hypodense well-circumscribed areas in the liver most consistent with simple cysts, consider ultrasound for confirmation.small sliding hiatal hernia.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: the urinary bladder, rectum, and prostate are normal.no pelvic lymphadenopathy.small pelvic lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for significant adenopathy.
summary: no retroperitoneal or intra-abdominal bleed.the above findings were discussed with dr.___ at 4:30 p.m.on ___ via telephone.slight hepatic steatosis.

text: a small left pleural effusion is seen.there is minimal atelectasis in the lung bases bilaterally.
summary: interval development of intra-abdominal and pelvic abscesses.the large intra-abdominal abscesses is very irregularly shaped and extends from the level of the hepatic flexure up to the lateral border of the right psoas muscle.smaller abscess is seen in the dependent pelvis.status post right lower quadrant ileostomy and reversal of the ileocolic anastomosis and blind ending colon in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen.significantly distended urinary bladder with secondary mild hydroureter.enlarged prostate gland.colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.cholelithiasis.bilateral renal simple cysts.findings of the intra-abdominal abscess and feasibility of percutaneous drainage was discussed with dr.___ ___ by radiology fellow over telephone on ___ at 4:10 p.m.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions which are small in addition to adjacent bibasilar atelectasis.there is marked periportal edema in addition to extension of the ivc and perihepatic free fluid, which could be secondary to aggressive volume resuscitation.the spleen and pancreas are normal in appearance.multiple low-density lesions are noted within the kidneys bilaterally, which are too small to characterize but likely represent small renal cyst.there is no hydronephrosis.there is atherosclerotic disease of the descending aorta and branch vessels.there is motion artifact which limits evaluation of the mesentery, which appears hazy in appearance.post-surgical changes are noted status post cholecystectomy and choledochojejunostomy.there is no evidence of bowel obstruction.no free air is identified.there is a fluid-filled structure in the right upper quadrant, which is thought to represent a loop of bowel.
summary: periportal edema and perihepatic free fluid in addition to extension of the ivc, all of which may be attributed to aggressive volume resuscitation.fluid-filled structure in the right upper quadrant is thought to represent a loop of bowel.no definite abscess identified.hazy appearance of the mesentery which may be attributed to motion and free fluid in the abdomen.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.compression fractures of the lumbar and thoracic spine of indeterminate acuity.correlation with point tenderness is recommended.small bilateral pleural effusions and adjacent atelectasis.

text: direct comparison is made to prior exam dated ___.small bilateral pleural effusions are again noted, right greater than left.the right-sided pleural effusion is slightly greater than the prior scan.areas of adjacent passive atelectasis are noted.on the current examination, there is evidence of a moderate to large pericardial effusion.additionally, the pericardium appears slightly thickened and questionably hyperenhancing to suggest inflammatory or possibly infectious etiology of this fluid.no ct signs of pericardial tamponade are identified, however, early tamponade cannot be excluded.these findings are discussed with dr.___ at the time of dictation.again ascites is identified within the peritoneal cavity.there are multiple collections of fluid which appear to be somewhat loculated anterior to the proximal transverse colon and the right lobe of the liver.overall, the quantity of ascites is not grossly changed since the prior exam.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas, and gallbladder appear unchanged.kidneys are again noted to be atrophic and unchanged in appearance.the previously noted colitis is nearly completely resolved.pelvic structures are grossly normal.diffuse sclerosis of the osseous structures is noted consistent with renal osteodystrophy.anasarca is incidentally noted.
summary: moderate to large pericardial effusion with thickened and questionably hyperenhancing pericardium as detailed above.findings are discussed with dr.___ at the time of dictation.slight increase in size in right-sided pleural effusion.stable volume of ascites with areas suggestive of loculation.significant improvement in the patient's previously described colitis.

text: the transplant kidney is located in the right lower quadrant and measures approximately 12 cm in length (stable compared to ultrasound from ___).there is no hydronephrosis.there is a double pigtail catheter along the course of the ureter, terminating in the bladder.the proximal pigtail has migrated out of the renal pelvis in the what presumably is the proximal ureter.there is no fluid collection immediately adjacent to the transplant kidney.more posteriorly, behind the right iliac artery/vein, there is a 3.4 x 2.5 x 4.0 cm (ap, transverse, and craniocaudal dimensions, respectively), well- defined fluid collection (hounsfield units approximately 10).this may represent a post- surgical seroma or lymphocele.on this non- contrast study, it cannot be excluded that this represents an abscess, although shape and density values make this possibility less likely.there are calcifications within the surgical scar.the groin areas are unremarkable bilaterally.there is no evidence of hernia.several normal- appearing lymph nodes are seen in the inguinal regions bilaterally.rectum, sigmoid colon, pelvic small bowel loops, and prostate appear unremarkable.
summary: unremarkable appearance of the transplant kidney without gross hydronephrosis.double pigtail catheter has migrated distally, with proximal pigtail out of the renal pelvis.well-defined tubular fluid collection posterior to the right iliac vessels, most likely representing a post-surgical seroma or lymphocele.superinfection cannot be excluded.no evidence of hernia.the pertinent findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at approximately 6 p.m.on ___.

text: the right pleural effusion has increased in the interim while the left pleural effusion has decreased.there is atelectasis versus consolidation at the right base, and atelectasis at the left base.there are aortic and coronary artery calcifications.the previously described pericardial effusion has increased in the interim.there is some free fluid around the liver especially beneath the diaphragm.the liver is otherwise unremarkable.the patient is post-cholecystectomy.there is a common bile duct stent in place.there is free air anterior to the liver that is somewhat increased since the ___ exam.there is also a small amount of free air posterior to the left lobe of the liver.the spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable.the kidneys are atrophic.there are vascular calcifications and an ivc filter.the stomach is unremarkable.the loops of small bowel are slightly distended with some air fluid levels.the distal small bowel is somewhat decompressed raising the possibility of ileus versus early obstruction.there is also some free fluid with air bubbles adjacent to the left lateral aspect of the stomach.there is relatively unchanged amount of subcutaneous emphysema within the anterior abdominal wall.there is subcutaneous edema of the abdominal wall and especially of the left lateral lower chest and superior abdominal subcutaneous tissue.
summary: slightly increased amount of intra-abdominal free air with stable amount of subcutaneous emphysema of the anterior abdominal wall.no definitive source of the intra-abdominal free air is identified.close interval follow up is recommended to evaluate the source of the leak.slightly increased amount of free fluid within the abdomen and pelvis, as described.slightly dilated small bowel loops proximally with air fluid levels.the findings are concerning for ileus versus early obstruction.bilateral pleural effusions, increased on the right and decreased on the left.increased pericardial effusion.increased subcutaneous edema.the findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of interpretation.

text: extensive streak artifact is seen related to total left hip arthroplasty, slightly limiting evaluation.however, the rectum, sigmoid colon, appear unremarkable except for a mild amount of fluid at the right aspect of the sigmoid colon (2:69).the prostate appears enlarged, measuring up to 5.4 cm in transverse dimension.the bladder appears unremarkable.there is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.the soft tissues demonstrate diffuse anasarca.osseous structures demonstrate moderate degenerative change, given the patient's age of the lumbosacral junction.
summary: post-cholecystostomy tube placement, with two subcapsular collections.these may represent most likely liquefactive hematoma versus biloma, superinfection cannot be excluded.the collections are stable compared to mri from ___.moderate amount of free fluid.multiple other incidental findings including bilateral renal cysts, tortuous, calcified aorta and its branches, and fluid-filled.anasarca of the soft tissues.
